40001001	These are the families through which Jesus Christ came. He came through David and Abraham.
40001002	Abraham was the father of Isaac. Isaac was the father of Jacob. Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers.
40001003	Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah. Their mother was Tamar. Perez was the father of Hezron. Hezron was the father of Aram.
40001004	Aram was the father of Amminadab. Amminadab was the father of Nahshon. Nahshon was the father of Salmon.
40001005	Salmon was the father of Boaz. The mother of Boaz was Rahab. Boaz was the father of Obed. The mother of Obed was Ruth. Obed was the father of Jesse.
40001006	Jesse was the father of David the king. King David was the father of Solomon. His mother had been the wife of Uriah.
40001007	Solomon was the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam was the father of Abijah. Abijah was the father of Asa.
40001008	Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat was the father of Joram. Joram was the father of Uzziah.
40001009	Uzziah was the father of Jotham. Jotham was the father of Ahaz. Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah.
40001010	Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh. Manasseh was the father of Amon. Amon was the father of Josiah.
40001011	Josiah was the father of Jeconiah and his brothers at the time the people were taken to Babylon.
40001012	After they were taken to the city of Babylon, Jeconiah was the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel.
40001013	Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud. Abiud was the father of Eliakim. Eliakim was the father of Azor.
40001014	Azor was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of Achim. Achim was the father of Eliud.
40001015	Eliud was the father of Eleazar. Eleazar was the father of Matthan. Matthan was the father of Jacob.
40001016	Jacob was the father of Joseph. Joseph was the husband of Mary. She was the mother of Jesus Who is called the Christ.
40001017	So the number of families from Abraham to David was fourteen. The number of families from David to the time the people were taken to Babylon was fourteen. The number of families after they were taken to Babylon to the birth of Jesus Christ was fourteen.
40001018	The birth of Jesus Christ was like this: Mary His mother had been promised in marriage to Joseph. Before they were married, it was learned that she was to have a baby by the Holy Spirit.
40001019	Joseph was her promised husband. He was a good man and did not want to make it hard for Mary in front of people. He thought it would be good to break the promised marriage without people knowing it.
40001020	While he was thinking about this, an angel of the Lord came to him in a dream. The angel said, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife. She is to become a mother by the Holy Spirit.
40001021	A Son will be born to her. You will give Him the name Jesus because He will save His people from the punishment of their sins.”
40001022	This happened as the Lord said it would happen through the early preacher.
40001023	He said, “The young woman, who has never had a man, will give birth to a Son. They will give Him the name Immanuel. This means God with us.” (Isaiah 7:14)
40001024	Joseph awoke from his sleep. He did what the angel of the Lord told him to do. He took Mary as his wife.
40001025	But he did not have her, as a husband has a wife, until she gave birth to a Son. Joseph gave Him the name Jesus.
40002001	Jesus was born in the town of Bethlehem in the country of Judea. It was the time when Herod was king of that part of the country. Soon after Jesus was born, some wise men who learned things from stars came to Jerusalem from the East.
40002002	They asked, “Where is the King of the Jews Who has been born? We have seen His star in the East. We have come to worship Him.”
40002003	King Herod heard this. He and all the people of Jerusalem were worried.
40002004	He called together all the religious leaders of the Jews and the teachers of the Law. Herod asked them where Christ was to be born.
40002005	They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea. The early preacher wrote,
40002006	‘You, Bethlehem of Judah, are not the least of the leaders of Judah. Out of you will come a King Who will lead My people the Jews.’” (Micah 5:2)
40002007	Then Herod had a secret meeting with the men who learned things from stars. He asked them about what time the star had been seen.
40002008	He sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and find the young Child. When you find Him, let me know. Then I can go and worship Him also.”
40002009	After the king had spoken, they went on their way. The star they had seen in the East went before them. It came and stopped over the place where the young Child was.
40002010	When they saw the star, they were filled with much joy.
40002011	They went into the house and found the young Child with Mary, His mother. Then they got down before Him and worshiped Him. They opened their bags of riches and gave Him gifts of gold and perfume and spices.
40002012	Then God spoke to them in a dream. He told them not to go back to Herod. So they went to their own country by another road.
40002013	When they had gone, an angel of the Lord came to Joseph in a dream. He said, “Get up. Take the young Child and His mother to the country of Egypt. Go as fast as you can! Stay there until you hear from Me. Herod is going to look for the young Child to kill Him.”
40002014	During the night he got up and left with the young Child and His mother for Egypt.
40002015	He stayed there until Herod died. This happened as the Lord had said through an early preacher, “I called My Son out of Egypt.” (Hosea 11:1)
40002016	Herod learned that the wise men had fooled him. He was very angry. He sent men to kill all the young boys two years old and under in Bethlehem and in all the country near by. He decided to do this from what he had heard from the wise men as to the time when the star was seen.
40002017	Then it happened as the early preacher Jeremiah said it would happen.
40002018	He said, “The sound of crying and much sorrow was heard in Ramah. Rachel was crying for her children. She would not be comforted because they were dead.” (Jeremiah 31: 15)
40002019	After Herod died, an angel of the Lord came to Joseph in a dream while he was in Egypt.
40002020	He said, “Get up. Take the young Child and His mother and go into the land of the Jews. Those who tried to kill the young Child are dead.”
40002021	Joseph got up. He took the young Child and His mother and came into the land of the Jews.
40002022	Joseph heard that Archelaus was the king of the country of Judea. Herod, the father of Archelaus, had died. Joseph was afraid to go there. God told him in a dream to go to the country of Galilee and he went.
40002023	Joseph stayed in a town called Nazareth. It happened as the early preachers said it would happen. They said, “Jesus will be called a Nazarene.”
40003001	In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the desert in the country of Judea.
40003002	He said, “Be sorry for your sins and turn from them! The holy nation of heaven is near.”
40003003	The early preacher Isaiah spoke of this man. He said, “Listen! His voice calls out in the desert! ‘Make the way ready for the Lord. Make the road straight for Him!’” (Isaiah 40: 3)
40003004	John wore clothes made of hair from camels. He had a leather belt around him. His food was locusts and wild honey.
40003005	Then the people of Jerusalem and of all the country of Judea and those from near the Jordan River went to him.
40003006	Those who told of their sins were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
40003007	He saw many proud religious law-keepers and other people of the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead. They were coming to him to be baptized. He said to them, “You family of snakes! Who told you how to keep from God’s anger that is coming?
40003008	Do something to show me that your hearts are changed.
40003009	Do not think you can say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’For I tell you, God can make children for Abraham out of these stones.
40003010	“Even now the ax is on the root of the trees. Every tree that does not give good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
40003011	For sure, I baptize with water those who are sorry for their sins and turn from them. The One Who comes after me will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire. He is greater than I. I am not good enough to take off His shoes.
40003012	He comes ready to clean the grain. He will gather the grain in and clean it all. The clean grain He will put into a building. He will burn that which is no good with a fire that cannot be put out.”
40003013	Jesus came from Galilee. He went to John at the Jordan River to be baptized by him.
40003014	John tried to stop Him. He said, “I need to be baptized by You. Do You come to me?”
40003015	Jesus said to him, “Let it be done now. We should do what is right.” John agreed and baptized Jesus.
40003016	When Jesus came up out of the water, the heavens opened. He saw the Spirit of God coming down and resting on Jesus like a dove.
40003017	A voice was heard from heaven. It said, “This is My much-loved Son. I am very happy with Him.”
40004001	Jesus was led by the Holy Spirit to a desert. There He was tempted by the devil.
40004002	Jesus went without food for forty days and forty nights. After that He was hungry.
40004003	The devil came tempting Him and said, “If You are the Son of God, tell these stones to be made into bread.”
40004004	But Jesus said, “It is written, ‘Man is not to live on bread only. Man is to live by every word that God speaks.’” (Deuteronomy 8:3)
40004005	Then the devil took Jesus up to Jerusalem, the holy city. He had Jesus stand on the highest part of the house of God.
40004006	The devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down. It is written, ‘He has told His angels to look after You. In their hands they will hold You up. Then Your foot will not hit against a stone.’ ” (Psalm 91:11–12)
40004007	Jesus said to the devil, “It is written also, ‘You must not tempt the Lord your God.’” (Deuteronomy 6:16)
40004008	Again the devil took Jesus to a very high mountain. He had Jesus look at all the nations of the world to see how great they were.
40004009	He said to Jesus, “I will give You all these nations if You will get down at my feet and worship me.”
40004010	Jesus said to the devil, “Get away, Satan. It is written, ‘You must worship the Lord your God. You must obey Him only.’” (Deuteronomy 6:13)
40004011	Then the devil went away from Jesus. Angels came and cared for Him.
40004012	When Jesus heard that John the Baptist had been put in prison, He went to the country of Galilee.
40004013	He left Nazareth and went to live in the city of Capernaum. It is by the lake in the land of Zebulun and Naphtali.
40004014	This happened as the early preacher Isaiah said it would happen. He said,
40004015	“The land of Zebulun and Naphtali is along the road to the lake. It is on the other side of the Jordan River in Galilee. These people are not Jews.
40004016	The people who sat in darkness saw a great light. Light did shine on those in the land who were near death.” (Isaiah 9:1–2)
40004017	From that time on, Jesus went about preaching. He said, “Be sorry for your sins and turn from them. The holy nation of heaven is near.”
40004018	Jesus was walking by the Sea of Galilee. He saw two brothers. They were Simon (his other name was Peter) and Andrew, his brother. They were putting a net into the sea for they were fishermen.
40004019	Jesus said to them, “Follow Me. I will make you fish for men!”
40004020	At once they left their nets and followed Him.
40004021	Going from there, Jesus saw two other brothers. They were James and John, the sons of Zebedee. They were sitting in a boat with their father, mending their nets. Jesus called them.
40004022	At once they left the boat and their father and followed Jesus.
40004023	Jesus went over all Galilee. He taught in their places of worship and preached the Good News of the holy nation. He healed all kinds of sickness and disease among the people.
40004024	The news about Him went over all the country of Syria. They brought all the sick people to Him with many kinds of diseases and pains. They brought to Him those who had demons. They brought those who at times lose the use of their minds. They brought those who could not use their hands and legs. He healed them.
40004025	Many people followed Him from Galilee and Judea. They followed Him from the cities of Decapolis and Jerusalem. They followed Him from Judea and from the other side of the Jordan River.
40005001	Jesus saw many people. He went up on the mountain and sat down. His followers came to Him.
40005002	He began to teach them, saying,
40005003	“Those who know there is nothing good in themselves are happy, because the holy nation of heaven is theirs.
40005004	Those who have sorrow are happy, because they will be comforted.
40005005	Those who have no pride in their hearts are happy, because the earth will be given to them.
40005006	Those who are hungry and thirsty to be right with God are happy, because they will be filled.
40005007	Those who show loving-kindness are happy, because they will have loving-kindness shown to them.
40005008	Those who have a pure heart are happy, because they will see God.
40005009	Those who make peace are happy, because they will be called the sons of God.
40005010	Those who have it very hard for doing right are happy, because the holy nation of heaven is theirs.
40005011	You are happy when people act and talk in a bad way to you and make it very hard for you and tell bad things and lies about you because you trust in Me.
40005012	Be glad and full of joy because your reward will be much in heaven. They made it very hard for the early preachers who lived a long time before you.
40005013	“You are the salt of the earth. If salt loses its taste, how can it be made to taste like salt again? It is no good. It is thrown away and people walk on it.
40005014	You are the light of the world. You cannot hide a city that is on a mountain.
40005015	Men do not light a lamp and put it under a basket. They put it on a table so it gives light to all in the house.
40005016	Let your light shine in front of men. Then they will see the good things you do and will honor your Father Who is in heaven.
40005017	“Do not think that I have come to do away with the Law of Moses or the writings of the early preachers. I have not come to do away with them but to complete them.
40005018	I tell you, as long as heaven and earth last, not one small mark or part of a word will pass away of the Law of Moses until it has all been done.
40005019	Anyone who breaks even the least of the Law of Moses and teaches people not to do what it says, will be called the least in the holy nation of heaven. He who obeys and teaches others to obey what the Law of Moses says, will be called great in the holy nation of heaven.
40005020	I tell you, unless you are more right with God than the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers, you will never get into the holy nation of heaven.
40005021	“You have heard that men were told long ago, ‘You must not kill another person. If someone does kill, he will be guilty and will be punished for his wrong-doing.’
40005022	But I tell you that whoever is angry with his brother will be guilty and have to suffer for his wrong-doing. Whoever says to his brother, ‘You have no brains,’ will have to stand in front of the court. Whoever says, ‘You fool,’ will be sent to the fire of hell.
40005023	If you take your gift to the altar and remember your brother has something against you,
40005024	leave your gift on the altar. Go and make right what is wrong between you and him. Then come back and give your gift.
40005025	Agree with the one who is against you while you are talking together, or he might take you to court. The court will hand you over to the police. You will be put in prison.
40005026	For sure, I tell you, you will not be let out of prison until you have paid every piece of money of the fine.
40005027	“You have heard that it was said long ago, ‘You must not do sex sins.’
40005028	But I tell you, anyone who even looks at a woman with a sinful desire of wanting her has already sinned in his heart.
40005029	If your right eye is the reason you sin, take it out and throw it away. It is better to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
40005030	If your right hand is the reason you sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to go to hell.
40005031	“It has been said, ‘Whoever wants to divorce his wife should have it put in writing, telling her he is leaving her.’
40005032	But I tell you, whoever divorces his wife except if she has not been faithful to him, makes her guilty of a sex sin. Whoever marries a woman who has been divorced is guilty of a sex sin.
40005033	“You have heard that it was said long ago, ‘You must not make a promise you cannot keep. You must carry out your promises to the Lord.’
40005034	I tell you, do not use strong words when you make a promise. Do not promise by heaven. It is the place where God is.
40005035	Do not promise by earth. It is where He rests His feet. Do not promise by Jerusalem. It is the city of the great King.
40005036	Do not promise by your head. You are not able to make one hair white or black.
40005037	Let your yes be YES. Let your no be NO. Anything more than this comes from the devil.
40005038	“You have heard that it has been said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
40005039	But I tell you, do not fight with the man who wants to fight. Whoever hits you on the right side of the face, turn so he can hit the other side also.
40005040	If any person takes you to court to get your shirt, give him your coat also.
40005041	Whoever makes you walk a short way, go with him twice as far.
40005042	Give to any person who asks you for something. Do not say no to the man who wants to use something of yours.
40005043	“You have heard that it has been said, ‘You must love your neighbor and hate those who hate you.’
40005044	But I tell you, love those who hate you. (Respect and give thanks for those who say bad things to you. Do good to those who hate you.) Pray for those who do bad things to you and who make it hard for you.
40005045	Then you may be the sons of your Father Who is in heaven. His sun shines on bad people and on good people. He sends rain on those who are right with God and on those who are not right with God.
40005046	If you love those who love you, what reward can you expect from that? Do not even the tax-gatherers do that?
40005047	If you say hello only to the people you like, are you doing any more than others? The people who do not know God do that much.
40005048	You must be perfect as your Father in heaven is perfect.
40006001	“Be sure you do not do good things in front of others just to be seen by them. If you do, you have no reward from your Father in heaven.
40006002	When you give to the poor, do not be as those who pretend to be someone they are not. They blow a horn in the places of worship and in the streets so people may respect them. For sure, I tell you, they have all the reward they are going to get.
40006003	When you give, do not let your left hand know what your right hand gives.
40006004	Your giving should be in secret. Then your Father Who sees in secret will reward you.
40006005	“When you pray, do not be as those who pretend to be someone they are not. They love to stand and pray in the places of worship or in the streets so people can see them. For sure, I tell you, they have all the reward they are going to get.
40006006	When you pray, go into a room by yourself. After you have shut the door, pray to your Father Who is in secret. Then your Father Who sees in secret will reward you.
40006007	When you pray, do not say the same thing over and over again making long prayers like the people who do not know God. They think they are heard because their prayers are long.
40006008	Do not be like them. Your Father knows what you need before you ask Him.
40006009	“Pray like this: ‘Our Father in heaven, Your name is holy.
40006010	May Your holy nation come. What You want done, may it be done on earth as it is in heaven.
40006011	Give us the bread we need today.
40006012	Forgive us our sins as we forgive those who sin against us.
40006013	‘Do not let us be tempted, but keep us from sin. Your nation is holy. You have power and shining-greatness forever. Let it be so.’
40006014	“If you forgive people their sins, your Father in heaven will forgive your sins also.
40006015	If you do not forgive people their sins, your Father will not forgive your sins.
40006016	“When you go without food so you can pray better, do not be as those who pretend to be someone they are not. They make themselves look sad so people will see they are going with out food. For sure, I tell you, they have all the reward they are going to get.
40006017	When you go without food so you can pray better, put oil on your head and wash your face.
40006018	Then nobody knows you are going without food. Then your Father Who sees in secret will reward you.
40006019	“Do not gather together for yourself riches of this earth. They will be eaten by bugs and become rusted. Men can break in and steal them.
40006020	Gather together riches in heaven where they will not be eaten by bugs or become rusted. Men cannot break in and steal them.
40006021	For wherever your riches are, your heart will be there also.
40006022	The eye is the light of the body. If your eye is good, your whole body will be full of light.
40006023	If your eye is bad, your whole body will be dark. If the light in you is dark, how dark it will be!
40006024	No one can have two bosses. He will hate the one and love the other. Or he will listen to the one and work against the other. You cannot have both God and riches as your boss at the same time.
40006025	“I tell you this: Do not worry about your life. Do not worry about what you are going to eat and drink. Do not worry about what you are going to wear. Is not life more important than food? Is not the body more important than clothes?
40006026	Look at the birds in the sky. They do not plant seeds. They do not gather grain. They do not put grain into a building to keep. Yet your Father in heaven feeds them! Are you not more important than the birds?
40006027	Which of you can make himself a little taller by worrying?
40006028	Why should you worry about clothes? Think how the flowers grow. They do not work or make cloth.
40006029	But I tell you that Solomon in all his greatness was not dressed as well as one of these flowers.
40006030	God clothes the grass of the field. It lives today and is burned in the stove tomorrow. How much more will He give you clothes? You have so little faith!
40006031	Do not worry. Do not keep saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or, ‘What will we drink?’ or, ‘What will we wear?’
40006032	The people who do not know God are looking for all these things. Your Father in heaven knows you need all these things.
40006033	First of all, look for the holy nation of God. Be right with Him. All these other things will be given to you also.
40006034	Do not worry about tomorrow. Tomorrow will have its own worries. The troubles we have in a day are enough for one day.
40007001	“Do not say what is wrong in other people’s lives. Then other people will not say what is wrong in your life.
40007002	You will be guilty of the same things you find in others. When you say what is wrong in others, your words will be used to say what is wrong in you.
40007003	Why do you look at the small piece of wood in your brother’s eye, and do not see the big piece of wood in your own eye?
40007004	How can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take that small piece of wood out of your eye,’ when there is a big piece of wood in your own eye?
40007005	You who pretend to be someone you are not, first take the big piece of wood out of your own eye. Then you can see better to take the small piece of wood out of your brother’s eye.
40007006	“Do not give that which belongs to God to dogs. Do not throw your pearls in front of pigs. They will break them under their feet. Then they will turn and tear you to pieces.
40007007	“Ask, and what you are asking for will be given to you. Look, and what you are looking for you will find. Knock, and the door you are knocking on will be opened to you.
40007008	Everyone who asks receives what he asks for. Everyone who looks finds what he is looking for. Everyone who knocks has the door opened to him.
40007009	What man among you would give his son a stone if he should ask for bread?
40007010	Or if he asks for a fish, would he give him a snake?
40007011	You are bad and you know how to give good things to your children. How much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask Him?
40007012	“Do for other people whatever you would like to have them do for you. This is what the Jewish Law and the early preachers said.
40007013	“Go in through the narrow door. The door is wide and the road is easy that leads to hell. Many people are going through that door.
40007014	But the door is narrow and the road is hard that leads to life that lasts forever. Few people are finding it.
40007015	“Watch out for false teachers. They come to you dressed as if they were sheep. On the inside they are hungry wolves.
40007016	You will know them by their fruit. Do men pick grapes from thorns? Do men pick figs from thistles?
40007017	It is true, every good tree has good fruit. Every bad tree has bad fruit.
40007018	A good tree cannot have bad fruit. A bad tree cannot have good fruit.
40007019	Every tree that does not have good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
40007020	So you will know them by their fruit.
40007021	Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will go into the holy nation of heaven. The one who does the things My Father in heaven wants him to do will go into the holy nation of heaven.
40007022	Many people will say to Me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not preach in Your Name? Did we not put out demons in Your Name? Did we not do many powerful works in Your Name?’
40007023	Then I will say to them in plain words, ‘I never knew you. Go away from Me, you who do wrong!’
40007024	“Whoever hears these words of Mine and does them, will be like a wise man who built his house on rock.
40007025	The rain came down. The water came up. The wind blew and hit the house. The house did not fall because it was built on rock.
40007026	Whoever hears these words of Mine and does not do them, will be like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
40007027	The rain came down. The water came up. The wind blew and hit the house. The house fell and broke apart.”
40007028	Then Jesus finished talking. The people were surprised and wondered about His teaching.
40007029	He was teaching them as One Who has the right and the power to teach. He did not teach as the teachers of the Law.
40008001	Jesus came down from the mountain. Many people followed Him.
40008002	A man with a bad skin disease came and got down before Him and worshiped Him. He said, “Lord, if You will, You can heal me!”
40008003	Then Jesus put His hand on him and said, “I will. You are healed!” At once the man was healed.
40008004	Jesus said to him, “Go now, but tell no one. Let the religious leader see you. Give the gift in worship that Moses told you to give. This will show them you have been healed.” (Leviticus 13:49)
40008005	Jesus came to the city of Capernaum. A captain of the army came to Him. He asked for help,
40008006	saying, “Lord, my servant is sick in bed. He is not able to move his body. He is in much pain.”
40008007	Jesus said to the captain, “I will come and heal him.”
40008008	The captain said, “Lord, I am not good enough for You to come to my house. Only speak the word, and my servant will be healed.
40008009	I am a man who works for someone else and I have men working under me. I say to this man, ‘Go!’ and he goes. I say to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
40008010	When Jesus heard this, He was surprised and wondered about it. He said to those who followed Him, “For sure, I tell you, I have not found so much faith in the Jewish nation.
40008011	I say to you, many people will come from the east and from the west. They will sit down with Abraham and with Isaac and with Jacob in the holy nation of heaven.
40008012	But those who should have belonged to the holy nation of heaven will be thrown out into outer darkness, where there will be crying and grinding of teeth.”
40008013	Jesus said to the captain, “Go your way. It is done for you even as you had faith to believe.” The servant was healed at that time.
40008014	Jesus came to Peter’s house. He saw Peter’s wife’s mother in bed. She was very sick.
40008015	He touched her hand and the sickness left her. She got up and cared for Jesus.
40008016	That evening they brought to Jesus many people who had demons in them. The demons were put out when Jesus spoke to them. All the sick people were healed.
40008017	It happened as the early preacher Isaiah said it would happen. He said, “He took on Himself our sickness and carried away our diseases.” (Isaiah 53:4)
40008018	Jesus saw many people and told them to go to the other side of the lake.
40008019	A teacher of the Law came to Jesus. He said, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”
40008020	Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes. Birds have nests. But the Son of Man has no place to lay His head.”
40008021	Another of His followers said to Him, “Lord, let me go first and bury my father.”
40008022	Jesus said to him, “Follow Me. Let the people who are dead bury their own dead.”
40008023	Jesus got into a boat. His followers followed Him.
40008024	At once a bad storm came over the lake. The waves were covering the boat. Jesus was sleeping.
40008025	His followers went to Him and called, “Help us, Lord, or we will die!”
40008026	He said to them, “Why are you afraid? You have so little faith!” Then He stood up. He spoke sharp words to the wind and the waves. Then the wind stopped blowing.
40008027	Then men were surprised and wondered about it. They said, “What kind of a man is He? Even the winds and the waves obey Him.”
40008028	Jesus came to the other side of the lake into the country of the Gadarenes. Two men came to Him from among the graves. They had demons in them and were very wild men. They were so bad that no one would go near them.
40008029	They called out, saying, “What do You want of us, You Son of God? Have You come here to make us suffer before it is our time to suffer?”
40008030	A long way from there many pigs were eating.
40008031	The demons begged Jesus, saying, “If You put us out, send us into the pigs.”
40008032	Jesus said to the demons, “Go!” They came out of the men and went into the pigs. At once the pigs ran down the mountain-side. They fell into the water and died.
40008033	The men who cared for the pigs ran fast into the city and told everything. They told what happened to the men who had the demons.
40008034	Every person in the city came to meet Jesus. When they saw Jesus, they asked Him to leave their country.
40009001	Jesus got into a boat. He crossed over to the other side and came into His own city.
40009002	They took a man to Him who was on his bed. This man was not able to move his body. Jesus saw their faith. He said, “Son, take hope. Your sins are forgiven.”
40009003	Some of the teachers of the Law said to themselves, “This man speaks as if He is God, but He is not!”
40009004	Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said, “Why do you think bad thoughts in your hearts?
40009005	Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk?’
40009006	But this is to show you that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins.” He said to the sick man, “Get up! Take your bed and go home.”
40009007	He got up and went to his home.
40009008	All the people saw this. They were surprised and wondered about it. Then they gave thanks to God because He had given such power to men.
40009009	As Jesus went from there, He saw a man called Matthew. Matthew was sitting at his work gathering taxes. Jesus said to him, “Follow Me.” Matthew got up and followed Jesus.
40009010	Jesus ate in Matthew’s house. Many men who gathered taxes and many who were sinners came to Matthew’s house and sat down with Jesus and His followers.
40009011	The proud religious law-keepers saw this. They said to the followers of Jesus, “Why does your Teacher eat with men who gather taxes and with sinners?”
40009012	Jesus heard them and said, “People who are well do not need a doctor.
40009013	But go and understand these words, ‘I want loving-kindness and not a gift to be given.’ (Hosea 6: 6) For I have not come to call good people. I have come to call those who are sinners.”
40009014	Then the followers of John the Baptist came to Jesus. They asked, “Why do we and the proud religious law-keepers many times go without food so we can pray better? But Your followers never go without food so they can pray better.”
40009015	Jesus said, “Can the friends at a wedding be sorry when the man just married is with them? But the days will come when the man just married will be taken from them. Then they will not eat food so they can pray better.
40009016	“No one sews a piece of new cloth on an old coat, because if the new piece pulls away, it makes the hole bigger.
40009017	Men do not put new wine into old skin bags. If they did, the skins would break and the wine would run out. The bags would be no good. They put new wine into new skin bags and both can be used.”
40009018	While Jesus talked to them, a leader of the people came and got down before Him, and worshiped Him. He said, “My daughter has just died. But come, lay Your hand on her and she will live.”
40009019	Jesus got up and followed him. His followers went also.
40009020	Just then a woman who had been sick with a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind. She touched the bottom of His coat.
40009021	She said to herself, “If I only touch the bottom of His coat, I will be healed.”
40009022	Then Jesus turned around. He saw her and said, “Daughter, take hope! Your faith has healed you.” At once the woman was healed.
40009023	Jesus came into the leader’s house. He saw the people playing music and making much noise.
40009024	He said to them, “Go now! For the girl is not dead, but is sleeping.” But they laughed at Him.
40009025	He sent the people outside. Then He went in and took the girl’s hand. She was raised up.
40009026	News of this went out into all the country.
40009027	Jesus went on from there. Two blind men followed Him. They called out, “Take pity on us, Son of David.”
40009028	Jesus went into the house. The blind men came to Him. Then Jesus said to them, “Do you have faith that I can do this?” They said to Him, “Yes, Sir!”
40009029	Then Jesus put His hands on their eyes and said, “You will have what you want because you have faith.”
40009030	Their eyes were opened. Jesus told them to tell no one.
40009031	But when they had gone, they told about Him everywhere in the country.
40009032	As they went on their way, a man who had a demon and could not talk was brought to Jesus.
40009033	When the demon was put out of him, the man was able to talk. Many people were surprised and wondered about it. They said, “We have never seen in the nation of the Jews like this.”
40009034	But the proud religious law-keepers said, “He puts out demons by the help of the leader of the demons.”
40009035	Jesus went on to all the towns and cities. He taught in their places of worship. He preached the Good News of the holy nation of God. He healed every sickness and disease the people had.
40009036	As He saw many people, He had loving-pity on them. They were troubled and were walking around everywhere. They were like sheep without a shepherd.
40009037	Then He said to His followers, “There is much grain ready to gather. But the workmen are few.
40009038	Pray then to the Lord Who is the Owner of the grain-fields that He will send workmen to gather His grain.”
40010001	Jesus called His twelve followers to Him. He gave them power to put out demons and to heal all kinds of sickness and disease.
40010002	These are the names of the twelve followers. There were Simon who was called Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John who were the sons of Zebedee.
40010003	There were Philip and Bartholomew and Thomas. There was Matthew, the man who gathered taxes. There were James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddeaus, and
40010004	Simon the Canaanite. There was Judas Iscariot who handed Jesus over to be killed.
40010005	Jesus sent out these twelve followers. He told them to go, saying, “Stay away from people who are not Jews. And do not go to any town in the country of Samaria.
40010006	But go to the Jewish people who are lost.
40010007	As you go, preach. Say, ‘The holy nation of heaven is near.’
40010008	Heal the sick and those with bad skin diseases. Raise the dead. Put out demons. You have received much, now give much.
40010009	Do not take gold or silver or brass money with you.
40010010	Do not take a bag of things for the trip. Do not take two coats or shoes or a walking stick. A workman should receive his food and what he needs.
40010011	“When you come to a city or town, find a home that is respected and stay there until you leave.
40010012	As you go into a house, tell them you hope good comes to them.
40010013	And if the house is respected, give them your good wishes. If it is not respected, let your good wishes come back to you.
40010014	Whoever does not receive you or does not listen to what you say, as you leave that house or city, shake off the dust from your feet.
40010015	For sure, I tell you, it will be easier for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day men stand before God and are told they are guilty, than for that city.
40010016	“I am sending you out like sheep with wolves all around you. Be wise like snakes and gentle like doves.
40010017	But look out for men. They will take you up to their courts and they will hurt you in their places of worship.
40010018	They will take you in front of the leaders of the people and of the kings because of Me. You will tell them and the people who do not know God about Me.
40010019	When you are put into their hands, do not worry what you will say or how you will say it. The words will be given you when the time comes.
40010020	It will not be you who will speak the words. The Spirit of your Father will speak through you.
40010021	“A brother will hand over a brother to be put to death. A father will hand over his child to be put to death. Children will hand over their parents to be put to death.
40010022	You will be hated by all people because of Me. But he who stays true to the end will be saved.
40010023	When they make it hard for you in one town, go to another. For sure, I tell you, before you have gone through the Jewish cities, the Son of Man will come.
40010024	“A follower is not greater than his teacher. A servant who is owned by someone is not greater than his owner.
40010025	A follower should be happy to be as his teacher, and a servant who is owned by someone should be happy to be as his owner. If they have called the head of the house Satan, how much more will they speak against those of the house.
40010026	Then do not be afraid of them. For nothing is covered up that will not be brought out into the light. There is nothing hid that will not be made known.
40010027	You tell in the light what I tell you in the dark. You must speak with a loud voice from the roofs of houses what you have heard.
40010028	Do not be afraid of them who kill the body. They are not able to kill the soul. But fear Him Who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
40010029	Are not two small birds sold for a very small piece of money? And yet not one of the birds falls to the earth without your Father knowing it.
40010030	God knows how many hairs you have on your head.
40010031	So do not be afraid. You are more important than many small birds.
40010032	“Whoever makes Me known in front of men, I will make him known to My Father in heaven.
40010033	But whoever does not make Me known in front of men and acts as if he does not know Me, I will not make him known to My Father in heaven.
40010034	“Do not think I came to bring peace on the earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.
40010035	I came to turn a man against his father. I came to turn a daughter against her mother. I came to turn a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
40010036	A man will be hated by his own family.
40010037	“He who loves his father and mother more than Me is not good enough for Me. He who loves son or daughter more than Me is not good enough for Me.
40010038	He who does not take his cross and follow Me is not good enough for Me.
40010039	He who wants to keep his life will have it taken away from him. He who loses his life because of Me will have it given back to him.
40010040	“Whoever receives you, receives Me. Whoever receives Me, receives Him Who sent Me.
40010041	Whoever receives a preacher who speaks for God because he is a preacher, will get the reward of a preacher who speaks for God. Whoever receives a man right with God, because he is a man right with God, will get the reward of a man right with God.
40010042	For sure, I tell you, anyone who gives a cup of cold water to one of these little ones because he follows Me, will not lose his reward.”
40011001	When Jesus finished telling His twelve followers what to do, He went away from there to teach and preach in their towns.
40011002	When John the Baptist was in prison, he heard what Jesus was doing. He sent his followers.
40011003	They asked, “Are You the One Who was to come, or should we look for another?”
40011004	Jesus said to them, “Go and tell John what you see and hear.
40011005	The blind are made to see. Those who could not walk are walking. Those who have had bad skin diseases are healed. Those who could not hear are hearing. The dead are raised up to life and the Good News is preached to poor people.
40011006	He is happy who is not ashamed of Me and does not turn away because of Me.”
40011007	As the followers of John the Baptist went away, Jesus began to tell the people about John. He said, “What did you go out to see in the desert? A small tree shaking in the wind?
40011008	But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in good clothes? Those who are dressed in good clothes are in the houses of kings.
40011009	What did you go out to see? One who speaks for God? Yes, I tell you, he is more than one who speaks for God.
40011010	This is the man the Holy Writings spoke of when they said, ‘See! I will send My helper to carry news ahead of You. He will make Your way ready for You!’ (Malachi 3: 1)
40011011	For sure, I tell you, of those born of women, there is no one greater than John the Baptist. The least in the holy nation of heaven is greater than he.
40011012	From the days of John the Baptist until now, the holy nation of heaven has suffered very much. Fighting men try to take it.
40011013	All the early preachers and the Law told about it until the time of John.
40011014	And if you will believe it, he is Elijah who was to come. (Malachi 4: 5)
40011015	You have ears, then listen!
40011016	“What are the people of this day like? They are like children playing in the center of town where people gather. They call to their friends.
40011017	They say, ‘We played music for you, but you did not dance. We showed sorrow in front of you, but you did not show sorrow.’
40011018	John came and did not eat or drink. They said, ‘He has a demon.’
40011019	Then the Son of Man came and ate and drank. They said, ‘See! He eats too much and likes wine. He is a friend of men who gather taxes and of sinners!’ But wisdom shows itself to be right by what it does.”
40011020	Then He began to say strong words against the cities where most of His powerful works were done. He spoke to them because they were not sorry for their sins and did not turn from them.
40011021	“It is bad for you, city of Chorazin! It is bad for you, town of Bethsaida! For if the powerful works which were done in you had been done in the cities of Tyre and Sidon, they would have turned from their sins long ago. They would have shown their sorrow by putting on clothes made from hair and would have sat in ashes.
40011022	I tell you, it will be better for Tyre and Sidon on the day men stand before God and are told they are guilty, than for you.
40011023	“And Capernaum, are you to be lifted up into heaven? You will be taken down to hell. If the powerful works which were done in you had been done in the city of Sodom, it would be here to this day.
40011024	But I say to you that it will be better for the land of Sodom on the day men stand before God and are told they are guilty, than for you.”
40011025	At that time Jesus said, “Thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because You hid these things from the wise and from those who have much learning. You have shown them to little children.
40011026	Yes, Father, it was good in Your sight.
40011027	“Everything has been given to Me by My Father. No one knows the Son but the Father. No one knows the Father but the Son, and those to whom the Son wants to make the Father known.
40011028	“Come to Me, all of you who work and have heavy loads. I will give you rest.
40011029	Follow My teachings and learn from Me. I am gentle and do not have pride. You will have rest for your souls.
40011030	For My way of carrying a load is easy and My load is not heavy.”
40012001	At that time Jesus walked through the grain-fields on the Day of Rest. His followers were hungry and began to pick off grain to eat.
40012002	The proud religious law-keepers saw this. They said to Jesus, “See! Your followers do what the Law says not to do on the Day of Rest.”
40012003	He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
40012004	He went into the house of God and ate the special bread used in worship which was against the Law for him or those with him to eat! Only the Jewish religious leaders were to eat that special bread.
40012005	Have you not read in the Law how the religious leaders do that which is not right to do on the Day of Rest, and yet they are not guilty?
40012006	I tell you that Someone greater than the house of God is here.
40012007	If you had understood what the words mean, ‘I want loving-kindness and not a gift to be given,’ (Hosea 6:6) you would not say a person is guilty who has done no wrong.
40012008	For the Son of Man is Lord of the Day of Rest.”
40012009	From there Jesus went into their place of worship.
40012010	A man was there with a dried-up hand. The proud religious law-keepers asked Jesus, “Does the Law say it is right to heal on the Day of Rest?” They wanted something to say against Him.
40012011	He said to them, “If one of you has a sheep which falls into a hole on the Day of Rest, will you not take hold of it and pull it out?
40012012	How much better is a man than a sheep! So it is right to do good on the Day of Rest.”
40012013	Then He said to the man, “Put out your hand.” He held it out and it was made as well as the other.
40012014	The proud religious law-keepers went out and made plans against Him. They planned how they might kill Him.
40012015	Jesus knew this and went away from there. Many people followed Him and He healed all of them.
40012016	He told them to tell no one of Him.
40012017	It happened as the early preacher Isaiah said it would happen, saying,
40012018	“See! My Servant Whom I have chosen! My much-Loved, in Whom My soul is well pleased! I will put My Spirit in Him. He will say to the nations what is right from wrong.
40012019	He will not fight or speak with a loud voice. No man will hear His voice in the streets.
40012020	He will not break a broken branch. He will not put out a little fire until He makes things right.
40012021	In His name the nations will have hope.” (Isaiah 42:1–4)
40012022	Then they brought to Him a man who had a demon. He was blind and could not speak. Jesus healed him and he could talk and see.
40012023	All the people were surprised and said, “Can this Man be the Son of David?”
40012024	But when the proud religious law-keepers heard it, they said, “This Man puts out demons only by Satan, the leader of demons.”
40012025	Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them, “Every nation divided into groups that fight each other is going to be destroyed. Every city or family divided into groups that fight each other will not stand.
40012026	If the devil puts out the devil, he is divided against himself. How will his nation stand?
40012027	If I put out demons by Satan, by whom do your followers put them out? So your followers will say if you are guilty.
40012028	But if I put out demons by the Spirit of God, then the holy nation of God is come to you.
40012029	How can anyone go into a strong man’s house and take away his things, unless he ties up the strong man first? Only then can he take things from his house.
40012030	“Whoever is not with Me is against Me. Whoever is not gathering with Me is sending everywhere.
40012031	I tell you, every sin and every bad word men speak against God will be forgiven, but bad words spoken against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
40012032	Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven in this life or in the life to come.
40012033	“A good tree gives good fruit. A bad tree gives bad fruit. A tree is known by its fruit.
40012034	You family of snakes! How can you say good things when you are sinful? The mouth speaks what the heart is full of.
40012035	A good man will speak good things because of the good in him. A bad man will speak bad things because of the sin in him.
40012036	I say to you, on the day men stand before God, they will have to give an answer for every word they have spoken that was not important.
40012037	For it is by your words that you will not be guilty and it is by your words that you will be guilty.”
40012038	Then some of the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers said to Jesus, “Teacher, we would like to have you do something special for us to see.”
40012039	He said to them, “The sinful people of this day look for something special to see. There will be nothing special to see but the powerful works of the early preacher Jonah.
40012040	Jonah was three days and three nights in the stomach of a big fish. The Son of Man will be three days and three nights in the grave also.
40012041	The men of the city of Nineveh will stand up with the people of this day on the day men stand before God. Those men will say these people are guilty because the men of Nineveh were sorry for their sins and turned from them when Jonah preached. And see, Someone greater than Jonah is here!
40012042	“The queen of the south will stand up with the people of this day on the day men stand before God. She will say that these people are guilty because she came from the ends of the earth to listen to the wise sayings of Solomon. And see, Someone greater than Solomon is here!
40012043	“When a demon is gone out of a man, it goes through dry places to find rest. It finds none.
40012044	Then it says, ‘I will go back into my house from which I came.’ When it goes back, it sees that it is empty. But it sees that the house has been cleaned and looks good.
40012045	Then it goes out and comes back bringing with it seven demons more sinful than itself. They go in and live there. In the end that man is worse than at first. It will be like this with the sinful people of this day.”
40012046	While Jesus was still talking to the people, His mother and His brothers came and stood outside. They wanted to talk to Him.
40012047	Someone said to Him, “Your mother and brothers are outside and want to talk to you.”
40012048	Jesus said, “Who is My mother? And who are My brothers?”
40012049	He put out His hand to His followers and said, “See, these are My mother and My brothers!
40012050	Whoever does what My father in heaven wants him to do is My brother and My sister and My mother.”
40013001	That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat down by the shore of the lake.
40013002	Then He got in a boat and sat down because so many people had gathered around Him. Many people were standing on the shore.
40013003	Jesus taught them many things by using picture-stories. He said, “A man went out to plant seeds.
40013004	As he planted the seeds, some fell by the side of the road. The birds came and ate the seeds.
40013005	Some seeds fell between rocks. The seeds came up at once because there was so little ground.
40013006	When the sun was high in the sky, they dried up and died because they had no root.
40013007	Some seeds fell among thorns. The thorns grew and did not give the seeds room to grow.
40013008	Some seeds fell on good ground and gave much grain. Some gave one hundred times as much grain. Some gave sixty times as much grain. Some gave thirty times as much grain.
40013009	You have ears, then listen.”
40013010	The followers of Jesus came to Him and said, “Why do You speak to them in picture-stories?”
40013011	He said to the followers, “You were given the secrets about the holy nation of heaven. The secrets were not given to the others.
40013012	He who has will have more given to him. He will have even more than enough. But he who has little will have even that taken away from him.
40013013	“This is why I speak to them in picture-stories. They have eyes but they do not see. They have ears but they do not hear and they do not understand.
40013014	It happened in their lives as Isaiah said it would happen. He said, ‘You hear and hear but do not understand. You look and look but do not see.
40013015	The hearts of these people have become fat. They hear very little with their ears. They have closed their eyes. If they did not do this, they would see with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their hearts. Then they would be changed in their ways, and I would heal them.’ (Isaiah 6:9–10)
40013016	But how great are your eyes because they see. How great are your ears because they hear.
40013017	For sure, I tell you, that many early preachers and men right with God have wanted to see the things you see, but they did not see them. They wanted to hear the things you hear, but they did not hear them.
40013018	“Listen to the picture-story of the man who planted seeds in the ground.
40013019	When anyone hears the Word about the holy nation and does not understand it, the devil comes and takes away what was put in his heart. He is like the seed that fell by the side of the road.
40013020	The seed which fell between rocks is like the person who receives the Word with joy as soon as he hears it.
40013021	Its root is not deep and it does not last long. When troubles and suffering come because of the Word, he gives up and falls away.
40013022	The seed which fell among thorns is like the person who hears the Word but the cares of this life, and the love for money let the thorns come up and do not give the seed room to grow and give grain.
40013023	The seed which fell on good ground is like the one who hears the Word and understands it. He gives much grain. Some seed gives one hundred times as much grain. Some gives sixty times as much grain. Some gives thirty times as much grain.”
40013024	Jesus told them another picture-story. He said, “The holy nation of heaven is like a man who planted good seed in his field.
40013025	During the night someone who hated him came and planted weed seed with the good seed in his field and went away.
40013026	When the good seed started to grow and give grain, weeds came up also.
40013027	“The servants of the man who planted the seed came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not plant good seed in your field? Why does it have weeds also?’
40013028	The man who planted the seed said, ‘Someone who hates me has done this.’The servants asked him, ‘Should we go and pull the weeds out from among the good grain?’
40013029	He said, ‘No, because if you pull out the weeds, the good grain will come up also.
40013030	Let them grow together until the time to gather the grain. Then I will say to the workmen, “Gather the weeds first and put them together to be burned. Then gather the good grain into my building.” ’”
40013031	Jesus told them another picture-story. He said, “The holy nation of heaven is like mustard seed which a man planted in his field.
40013032	It is the smallest of seeds. But when it is full-grown, it is larger than the grain of the fields and it becomes a tree. The birds of the sky come and stay in its branches.”
40013033	Jesus gave them another picture-story. He said, “The holy nation of heaven is like yeast that a woman put into three pails of flour until it had become much more than at first.”
40013034	Jesus told all these things using picture-stories to the many people. He did not speak to them without using picture-stories.
40013035	It happened as the early preacher said it would happen, “I will open My mouth in picture-stories. I will tell things which have been kept secret from the beginning of the world.” (Psalm 78:2)
40013036	After Jesus sent the people away, He went into the house. His followers came to Him and said, “Tell us what You mean by the picture-story of the weeds in the field.”
40013037	Jesus said, “He Who plants the good seed is the Son of Man.
40013038	The field is the world. The good seeds are the children of the holy nation. The weeds are the children of the devil.
40013039	The devil is the one who got in and planted the weeds. The time to gather is the end of the world. The men who gather are the angels.
40013040	As the weeds are gathered together and burned in the fire, so will it be in the end of the world.
40013041	The Son of Man will send His angels. They will gather out of His holy nation all things that cause people to sin and those who do sin.
40013042	They will put them into a stove of fire. There will be loud crying and grinding of teeth.
40013043	Then the ones right with God will shine as the sun in the holy nation of their Father. You have ears, then listen!”
40013044	“The holy nation of heaven is like a box of riches buried in a field. A man found it and then hid it again. In his joy he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
40013045	“Again, the holy nation of heaven is like a man who buys and sells. He is looking for good pearls.
40013046	When he finds one good pearl worth much money, he goes and sells all that he has and buys it.
40013047	“The holy nation of heaven is like a big net which was let down into the sea. It gathered fish of every kind.
40013048	When it was full, they took it to the shore. They sat down and put the good fish into pails. They threw the bad fish away.
40013049	It will be like this in the end of the world. Angels will come and take the sinful people from among those who are right with God.
40013050	They will put the sinful people into a stove of fire where there will be loud crying and grinding of teeth.”
40013051	Jesus asked them, “Have you understood all these picture-stories?” They said, “Yes, Lord!”
40013052	He said to them, “Every teacher of the Law who has become a follower of the holy nation of heaven is like a man who owns his house. He takes new and old riches from his house.”
40013053	When Jesus had finished these picture-stories, He went away from there.
40013054	He came to His own town and taught them in their places of worship. They were surprised and wondered, saying, “Where did this Man get this wisdom? How can He do these powerful works?
40013055	Is not this the son of the man who makes things from wood? Is not Mary His mother? Are not James and Joseph and Simon and Judas His brothers?
40013056	And are not all His sisters here? Then where did He get all these things?”
40013057	And they were ashamed of Him and turned away because of Him. Jesus said to them, “One who speaks for God is shown no respect in his own town and in his own house.”
40013058	He did not do many powerful works there because they did not put their trust in Him.
40014001	At that time King Herod heard much about Jesus.
40014002	He said to his helpers, “This must be John the Baptist. He has risen from the dead. That is why these powerful works are done by him.”
40014003	For Herod had taken John and put him in prison. It was because of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip.
40014004	For John had said to him, “It is against the Law for you to have her.”
40014005	He would have killed John but he was afraid of the people. The people thought John was one who spoke for God.
40014006	On Herod’s birthday the daughter of Herodias danced in front of them. Herod was made happy by her.
40014007	He promised he would give her anything she asked.
40014008	Because her mother told her to do it, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist on a plate.”
40014009	The king was sorry. But he said for it to be given because he had promised and because of those who were eating with him.
40014010	He sent to the prison and had John’s head cut off.
40014011	It was brought in on a plate and given to the girl. She brought it to her mother.
40014012	Then the followers of John came and took his body and buried it. They went and told Jesus.
40014013	When Jesus heard that John had been killed, He went from there by boat to a desert. He wanted to be alone. When the people knew it, they followed after Him by land from the cities.
40014014	When He got out of the boat, He saw many people. He had loving-pity for them and healed those who were sick.
40014015	When it was evening, His followers came to Him. They said, “This is a desert. The day is past. Send the people away so they may go into the towns and buy food for themselves.”
40014016	Jesus said to them, “They do not have to go away. Give them something to eat.”
40014017	They said to Him, “We have only five loaves of bread and two fish.”
40014018	Jesus said, “Bring them to Me.”
40014019	He told the people to sit down on the grass. Then He took the five loaves of bread and two fish. He looked up to heaven and gave thanks. He broke the loaves in pieces and gave them to His followers. The followers gave them to the people.
40014020	They all ate and were filled. They picked up twelve baskets full of pieces of bread and fish after the people were finished eating.
40014021	About five thousand men ate. Women and children ate also.
40014022	At once Jesus had His followers get into the boat. He told them to go ahead of Him to the other side while He sent the people away.
40014023	After He had sent them away, He went up the mountain by Himself to pray. When evening came, He was there alone.
40014024	By this time the boat was far from land and was being thrown around by the waves. The wind was strong against them.
40014025	Just before the light of day, Jesus went to them walking on the water.
40014026	When the followers saw Him walking on the water, they were afraid. They said, “It is a spirit.” They cried out with fear.
40014027	At once Jesus spoke to them and said, “Take hope. It is I. Do not be afraid!”
40014028	Peter said to Jesus, “If it is You, Lord, tell me to come to You on the water.”
40014029	Jesus said, “Come!” Peter got out of the boat and walked on the water to Jesus.
40014030	But when he saw the strong wind, he was afraid. He began to go down in the water. He cried out, “Lord, save me!”
40014031	At once Jesus put out His hand and took hold of him. Jesus said to Peter, “You have so little faith! Why did you doubt?”
40014032	When Jesus and Peter got into the boat, the wind stopped blowing.
40014033	Those in the boat worshiped Jesus. They said, “For sure, You are the Son of God!”
40014034	When they had gone over to the other side, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
40014035	When the men of that land saw it was Jesus, they sent word into all the country around. They brought all who were sick to Jesus.
40014036	They begged Him that they might touch the bottom of His coat. As many as touched the bottom of His coat were healed.
40015001	Some of the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law- keepers from Jerusalem came to Jesus. They asked,
40015002	“Why do Your followers not obey the teaching that was given to them by our fathers? They do not wash their hands before they eat.”
40015003	Jesus said to them, “Why do you break the Law of God by trying to keep their teaching?
40015004	For God said, ‘Show respect to your father and mother.’ (Exodus 20:12) And, ‘He who curses his father or mother will be put to death.’ (Exodus 21:17)
40015005	But you say that if a man says to his parents that anything he has, that might have been of help to them, is already given to God,
40015006	he does not have to show respect by helping his father and mother. You are putting aside the Word of God to keep their teaching.
40015007	You who pretend to be someone you are not, Isaiah told about you. He said,
40015008	’These people show respect to Me with their mouth, but their heart is far from Me.
40015009	Their worship of Me is worth nothing. They teach what men have made up.’ ” (Isaiah 29:13)
40015010	Jesus called the people to Him and said to them, “Listen and understand this!
40015011	It is not what goes into a man’s mouth that makes his mind and heart sinful. It is what comes out of a man’s mouth that makes him sinful.”
40015012	His followers came to Him. They said, “Did You know the proud religious law-keepers were ashamed and turned away because of You when they heard this?”
40015013	He said, “Every plant that My Father in heaven did not plant will be pulled up by the roots.
40015014	Let them alone. They are blind leaders of the blind. If one blind man leads another blind man, they will both fall into a hole.”
40015015	Then Peter said to Jesus, “Tell us this picture-story so we can understand it.”
40015016	Jesus said, “Do you not understand yet?
40015017	Do you not understand that whatever goes into the mouth goes into the stomach and then out of the body?
40015018	But whatever comes from the mouth has come out of the heart. These things make the man unclean inside.
40015019	For out of the heart come bad thoughts, killing other people, sex sins of a married person, sex sins of a person not married, stealing, lying, speaking against God.
40015020	These are the things that make the man unclean inside. It does not make a man sinful to eat with hands that have not been washed.”
40015021	Jesus went from there to the cities of Tyre and Sidon.
40015022	A woman came from the land of Canaan. She cried out to Jesus and said, “Take pity on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter has a demon and is much troubled.”
40015023	But Jesus did not speak a word to her. His followers kept asking, saying, “Send her away for she keeps calling us.”
40015024	He said, “I was sent only to the Jewish people who are lost.”
40015025	Then she came and got down before Jesus and worshiped Him. She said, “Lord, help me!”
40015026	But He said, “It is not right to take children’s food and throw it to the dogs.”
40015027	She said, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the pieces that fall from the table of their owners.”
40015028	Jesus said to her, “Woman, you have much faith. You will have what you asked for.” Her daughter was healed at that very time.
40015029	Jesus went from there and came to the Sea of Galilee. Then He went up the mountain and sat down.
40015030	Many people came to Him. They brought with them those who were not able to walk. They brought those who were not able to see. They brought those who were not able to hear or speak and many others. Then they put them at the feet of Jesus and He healed them.
40015031	All the people wondered. They saw how those who could not speak were now talking. They saw how those who could not walk were now walking. They saw how those who could not see were now seeing, and they gave thanks to the God of the Jews.
40015032	Then Jesus called His followers to Him. He said, “I pity these people because they have been with Me three days and they have no food. I do not want to send them home without food. They might get too weak as they go.”
40015033	The followers said to Jesus, “Where can we get enough bread to feed them all in this desert?”
40015034	Jesus said to them, “How many loaves of bread do you have?” They said, “Seven loaves and a few small fish.”
40015035	He told the people to sit down on the ground.
40015036	Then He took the seven loaves of bread and the fish and gave thanks. He broke them and gave them to His followers. The followers gave them to the people.
40015037	They all ate and were filled. They picked up seven baskets full of pieces of bread and fish after the people finished eating.
40015038	Four thousand men ate. Women and children ate also.
40015039	After this Jesus sent the people away. Then He got into a boat and came to a place called Magadan.
40016001	The proud religious law-keepers and a religious group of people who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Jesus. They asked Him to show something special from heaven. They wanted to trap Jesus.
40016002	(He said to them, “In the evening you say, ‘The weather will be good tomorrow because the sky is red.’
40016003	And in the morning you say, ‘We will have a storm today because the sky is red and the clouds are low.’You understand the things you see in the sky, but you cannot understand the special things you see these days!)
40016004	The sinful people of this day go after something special to see. There will be nothing special for them to see but the early preacher Jonah.” Then He went away from them.
40016005	The followers came to the other side of the lake. They remembered they had forgotten to bring bread.
40016006	Jesus said to them, “See! Have nothing to do with the yeast of the proud religious law-keepers and the religious group of people who believe no one will be raised from the dead.”
40016007	They started to think about it among themselves and said, “He said this because we forgot to bring bread.”
40016008	Jesus knew this and said, “You have very little faith! Why are you talking among yourselves about not bringing bread?
40016009	Do you not yet understand or remember the five loaves of bread that fed five thousand men? And how many baskets full were gathered up?
40016010	Or do you not even remember the seven loaves of bread that fed the four thousand men? And how many baskets full were gathered up?
40016011	Why is it that you do not see that I was not talking to you about bread? I was talking to you about keeping away from the yeast of the proud religious law-keepers and the religious group of people who believe no one will be raised from the dead.”
40016012	Then they understood that it was not the yeast of bread that He was talking about. But He was talking about the teaching of the proud religious law-keepers and of the other religious group of people.
40016013	Jesus came into the country of Caesarea Philippi. He asked His followers, “Who do people say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
40016014	They said, “Some say You are John the Baptist and some say Elijah and others say Jeremiah or one of the early preachers.”
40016015	He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
40016016	Simon Peter said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
40016017	Jesus said to him, “Simon, son of Jonah, you are happy because you did not learn this from man. My Father in heaven has shown you this.
40016018	“And I tell you that you are Peter. On this rock I will build My church. The powers of hell will not be able to have power over My church.
40016019	I will give you the keys of the holy nation of heaven. Whatever you do not allow on earth will not have been allowed in heaven. Whatever you allow on earth will have been allowed in heaven.”
40016020	Then with strong words He told His followers to tell no one that He was the Christ.
40016021	From that time on Jesus began to tell His followers that He had to go to Jerusalem and suffer many things. These hard things would come from the leaders and from the head religious leaders of the Jews and from the teachers of the Law. He told them He would be killed and three days later He would be raised from the dead.
40016022	Peter took Jesus away from the others and spoke sharp words to Him. He said, “Never, Lord! This must not happen to You!”
40016023	Then Jesus turned to Peter and said, “Get behind Me, Satan! You are standing in My way. You are not thinking how God thinks. You are thinking how man thinks.”
40016024	Jesus said to His followers, “If anyone wants to be My follower, he must forget about himself. He must take up his cross and follow Me.
40016025	If anyone wants to keep his life safe, he will lose it. If anyone gives up his life because of Me, he will save it.
40016026	For what does a man have if he gets all the world and loses his own soul? What can a man give to buy back his soul?
40016027	The Son of Man will come in the greatness of His Father with His angels. Then He will give to every man his pay as he has worked.
40016028	For sure, I tell you, there are some standing here that will not die until they see the Son of Man coming as King.”
40017001	Six days later Jesus took with Him Peter and James and his brother John. He led them up to a high mountain by themselves.
40017002	He was changed in looks before them. His face was as bright as the sun. His clothes looked as white as light.
40017003	Moses and Elijah were seen talking with Jesus.
40017004	Then Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If You will let us, we will build three altars here. One will be for You and one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
40017005	While Peter was speaking, a bright cloud came over them. A voice from the cloud said, “This is My much-loved Son, I am very happy with Him. Listen to Him!”
40017006	When the followers heard this, they got down on the ground on their faces and were very much afraid.
40017007	Jesus came and put His hand on them. He said, “Get up! Do not be afraid.”
40017008	When they looked up, they saw no one there but Jesus only.
40017009	As they came down from the mountain, Jesus told them in strong words, saying, “Do not tell anyone what you have seen until the Son of Man is raised from the dead.”
40017010	The followers asked Jesus, “Then why do the teachers of the Law say that Elijah must come first?”
40017011	He said, “For sure, Elijah will come first and get things ready.
40017012	But I tell you, Elijah has already come and they did not know him. They did to him whatever they wanted to do. In the same way the Son of Man will suffer from them also.”
40017013	Then the followers understood He was talking about John the Baptist.
40017014	When they came to many people, a man came up to Jesus and got on his knees. He said,
40017015	“Lord, have pity on my son. He is very sick and at times loses the use of his mind. Many times he falls into the fire or into the water.
40017016	I took him to Your followers but they were not able to heal him.”
40017017	Then Jesus said, “You people of this day have no faith and you are going the wrong way. How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him here to Me.”
40017018	Jesus spoke sharp words to the demon and the demon came out of him. At once the boy was healed.
40017019	The followers came to Jesus when He was alone. They said, “Why were we not able to put the demon out?”
40017020	Jesus said to them, “Because you have so little faith. For sure, I tell you, if you have faith as a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to over there,’ and it would move over. You will be able to do anything.
40017021	But this kind of demon does not go out but by prayer and by going without food so you can pray better.”
40017022	While they were still in Galilee, Jesus said to the followers, “The Son of Man will be handed over to men.
40017023	They will kill Him, but He will be raised from the dead three days later.” The followers were very sad.
40017024	They came to the city of Capernaum. Those who gathered the tax for the house of God came to Peter. They said, “Does not your Teacher pay tax money for the house of God?”
40017025	Peter said, “Yes.” When Peter came into the house, Jesus spoke to him first. He said, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of this earth get their money or taxes, from their own people or from those of another country?”
40017026	Peter said to Him, “From those of another country.” Then Jesus said, “Then their own people do not pay taxes.
40017027	But so we will not make them to be troubled, go down to the lake and throw in a hook. Take the first fish that comes up. In its mouth you will find a piece of money. Take that and pay the tax for Me and yourself.”
40018001	At that time the followers came to Jesus. They said, “Who is the greatest in the holy nation of heaven?”
40018002	Jesus took a little child and put him among them.
40018003	He said, “For sure, I tell you, unless you have a change of heart and become like a little child, you will not get into the holy nation of heaven.
40018004	Whoever is without pride as this little child is the greatest in the holy nation of heaven.
40018005	Whoever receives a little child because of Me receives Me.
40018006	But whoever is the reason for one of these little children who believe in Me to fall into sin, it would be better for him to have a large rock put around his neck and to be thrown into the sea.
40018007	“It is bad for the world because of that which makes people sin. Men will be tempted to sin. But it is bad for the one who is the reason for someone to sin.
40018008	If your hand or your foot is the reason you sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to go into life without a hand or a foot, than to have two hands or two feet and to be thrown into the fire of hell.
40018009	If your eye is the reason you sin, take it out and throw it away. It is better for you to go into life with one eye, than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.
40018010	Be sure you do not hate one of these little children. I tell you, they have angels who are always looking into the face of My Father in heaven.
40018011	“For the Son of Man has come to save that which was lost.
40018012	What do you think about this? A man has one hundred sheep and one of them is lost. Will he not leave the ninety-nine and go to the mountains to look for that one lost sheep?
40018013	If he finds it, for sure, I tell you, he will have more joy over that one, than over the ninety-nine that were not lost.
40018014	I tell you, My Father in heaven does not want one of these little children to be lost.
40018015	“If your brother sins against you, go and tell him what he did without other people hearing it. If he listens to you, you have won your brother back again.
40018016	But if he will not listen to you, take one or two other people with you. Every word may be remembered by the two or three who heard.
40018017	If he will not listen to them, tell the trouble to the church. If he does not listen to the church, think of him as a person who is as bad as one who does not know God and a person who gathers taxes.
40018018	“For sure, I tell you, whatever you do not allow on earth will not have been allowed in heaven. Whatever you allow on earth will have been allowed in heaven.
40018019	Again I tell you this: If two of you agree on earth about anything you pray for, it will be done for you by My Father in heaven.
40018020	For where two or three are gathered together in My name, there I am with them.”
