40018021	Then Peter came to Jesus and said, “Lord, how many times may my brother sin against me and I forgive him, up to seven times?”
40018022	Jesus said to him, “I tell you, not seven times but seventy times seven!
40018023	“The holy nation of heaven is like a king who wanted to find out how much money his servants owed him.
40018024	As he began, one of the servants was brought to him who owed him very much money.
40018025	He could pay nothing that he owed. So the king spoke the word that he and his wife and his children and all that he had should be sold to pay what he owed.
40018026	The servant got down on his face in front of the king. He said, ‘Give me time, and I will pay you all the money.’
40018027	Then the king took pity on his servant and let him go. He told him he did not have to pay the money back.
40018028	“But that servant went out and found one of the other servants who owed him very little money. He took hold of his neck and said, ‘Pay me the money you owe me!’
40018029	The other servant got down at his feet and said, ‘Give me time, and I will pay you all the money.’
40018030	But he would not. He had him put in prison until he could pay the money.
40018031	“When his other servants saw what had happened, they were very sorry. They came and told the king all that was done.
40018032	Then the king called for the first one. He said, ‘You bad servant! I forgave you. I said that you would not have to pay back any of the money you owed me because you asked me.
40018033	Should you not have had pity on the other servant, even as I had pity on you?’
40018034	The king was very angry. He handed him over to men who would beat and hurt him until he paid all the money he owed.
40018035	So will My Father in heaven do to you, if each one of you does not forgive his brother from his heart.”
40019001	When Jesus had finished talking, He went from the country of Galilee. He came to the part of the country of Judea which is on the other side of the Jordan River.
40019002	Many people followed Him and He healed them there.
40019003	The proud religious law-keepers came to Jesus. They tried to trap Him by saying, “Does the Law say a man can divorce his wife for any reason?”
40019004	He said to them, “Have you not read that He Who made them in the first place made them man and woman?
40019005	It says, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and his mother and will live with his wife. The two will become one.’
40019006	So they are no longer two but one. Let no man divide what God has put together.”
40019007	The proud religious law-keepers said to Jesus, “Then why did the Law of Moses allow a man to divorce his wife if he put it down in writing and gave it to her?”
40019008	Jesus said to them, “Because of your hard hearts Moses allowed you to divorce your wives. It was not like that from the beginning.
40019009	And I say to you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sex sins, and marries another, is guilty of sex sins in marriage. Whoever marries her that is divorced is guilty of sex sins in marriage.”
40019010	His followers said to Him, “If that is the way of a man with his wife, it is better not to be married.”
40019011	But Jesus said to them, “Not all men are able to do this, but only those to whom it has been given.
40019012	For there are some men who from birth will never be able to have children. There are some men who have been made so by men. There are some men who have had themselves made that way because of the holy nation of heaven. The one who is able to do this, let him do it.”
40019013	Then little children were brought to Him that He might put His hands on them and pray for them. The followers spoke sharp words to them.
40019014	But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to Me. Do not stop them. The holy nation of heaven is made up of ones like these.”
40019015	He put His hands on them and went away.
40019016	A man came to Jesus and asked, “Good Teacher, what good work must I do to have life that lasts forever?”
40019017	Jesus said to him, “Why are you asking Me about what is good? There is only One Who is good. If you want to have life that lasts forever, you must obey the Laws.”
40019018	The man said to Him, “What kind of laws?” Jesus said, “You must not kill another person. You must not be guilty of sex sins. You must not steal. You must not lie.
40019019	Show respect to your father and your mother. And love your neighbor as you love yourself.”
40019020	The young man said to Jesus, “I have obeyed all these Laws. What more should I do?”
40019021	Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go and sell everything you have and give the money to poor people. Then you will have riches in heaven. Come and follow Me.”
40019022	When the young man heard these words, he went away sad for he had many riches.
40019023	Jesus said to His followers, “For sure, I tell you, it will be hard for a rich man to get into the holy nation of heaven.
40019024	Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to get into the holy nation of heaven.”
40019025	When His followers heard this, they could not understand it. They said, “Then who can be saved from the punishment of sin?”
40019026	Jesus looked at them and said, “This cannot be done by men. But with God all things can be done.”
40019027	Then Peter said to Him, “We have given up everything and have followed You. Then what will we have?”
40019028	Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, when all the earth will be new and the Son of Man will sit on His throne in His shining-greatness, you who have followed Me will also sit on twelve thrones, and judge the twelve family groups of the Jewish nation.
40019029	Everyone who has given up houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands because of Me, will get a hundred times more. And you will get life that lasts forever.
40019030	Many who are first will be last. Many who are last will be first.
40020001	“For the holy nation of heaven is like the owner of a grape-field. He went out early in the morning to hire workmen to work in his grape-field.
40020002	He promised to give them a day’s pay and then sent them to his grape-field.
40020003	Later in the morning he went to the center of the town where people gather. He saw men standing there doing nothing.
40020004	He said to them, ‘You go to my grape-field and work also. Whatever is right, I will pay you.’ And they went.
40020005	Again he went out about noon and at three o’clock and did the same thing.
40020006	About five o’clock he went out and still found others doing nothing. He asked them, ‘Why do you stand here all day and do nothing?’
40020007	They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us.’ He said, ‘Go to my grape-field and work. Whatever is right, I will pay you.’
40020008	“When evening came, the owner of the grape-field said to the boss of the workmen, ‘Call the workmen. Give them their pay. Start with the last ones hired and go on to the first ones hired.’
40020009	The workmen who had been hired at five o’clock came up. Each one of them got a day’s pay for his work.
40020010	When the workmen who had been hired the first thing in the morning came, they thought they would get more. But each one got a day’s pay.
40020011	After they received it, they talked against the owner.
40020012	They said, ‘The last workmen hired have only worked one hour. You have given to them the same as to us. We have worked hard through the heat of the day.’
40020013	But he said to one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Did you not agree with me when I promised to pay you a day’s pay?
40020014	Take your pay and go. I want to give the last ones hired the same as I have given you.
40020015	Do I not have the right to do what I want to do with my own money? Does your eye make you want more because I am good?’
40020016	So those who are last will be first and the first will be last.”
40020017	As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, He talked also to the twelve followers by the side of the road. He said,
40020018	“Listen! We are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the religious leaders and to the teachers of the Law. They will say that He must be put to death.
40020019	They will hand Him over to the people who do not know God. They will make fun of Him and will beat Him. They will nail Him to a cross. Three days later He will be raised to life.”
40020020	The mother of Zebedee’s children (James and John) came to Jesus with her sons. She got down on her knees before Jesus to ask something of Him.
40020021	He said to her, “What do you want?” She said, “Say that my two sons may sit, one at Your right side and one at Your left side, when You are King.”
40020022	Jesus said to her, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to take the suffering that I am about to take? (Are you able to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?)” They said, “Yes, we are able.”
40020023	He said to them, “You will suffer as I will suffer. But the places at My right side and at My left side are not Mine to give. Whoever My Father says will have those places.”
40020024	The other ten followers heard this. They were angry with the two brothers.
40020025	Jesus called them to Him and said, “You know how the kings of the nations show their power to the people. Important leaders use their power over the people.
40020026	It must not be that way with you. But whoever wants to be great among you, let him care for you.
40020027	Whoever wants to be first among you, let him be your servant.
40020028	For the Son of Man came not to be cared for. He came to care for others. He came to give His life so that many could be bought by His blood and made free from the punishment of sin.”
40020029	As they went away from the city of Jericho, many people followed Him.
40020030	Two blind men were sitting by the side of the road. They called out when they heard that Jesus was going by. They said, “Lord, take pity on us, Son of David!”
40020031	Many people spoke sharp words to them. They told the blind men not to call out. But they called all the more, “Lord! Take pity on us, Son of David!”
40020032	Jesus stopped and called them. He asked, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
40020033	The blind men said to Jesus, “Lord, we want our eyes opened!”
40020034	Jesus had loving-pity on them and put His hands on their eyes. At once they could see, and they followed Jesus.
40021001	They were near Jerusalem and had come to the town of Bethphage at the Mount of Olives. Jesus sent two followers on ahead.
40021002	He said to them, “Go to the town over there. You will find a donkey tied and her young with her. Let them loose and bring them to Me.
40021003	If anyone says something to you, say, ‘The Lord needs them.’ He will send them at once.”
40021004	It happened as the early preacher said it would happen, saying,
40021005	“Say to the people in Jerusalem, ‘See! Your King is coming to you. He is gentle. He is riding on a young donkey.’” (Zechariah 9:9; Isaiah 62:11)
40021006	The followers went and did as Jesus told them.

40021008	Many people put their coats down on the road. Other people cut branches from the trees and put them along the way.
40021009	The people who went in front and those who followed Jesus called out, “Greatest One! The Son of David! Great and honored is He Who comes in the name of the Lord! Greatest One in the highest heaven.”
40021010	When Jesus came into Jerusalem, all the people of the city were troubled. They said, “Who is this?”
40021011	Many people said, “This is Jesus, the One Who speaks for God from the town of Nazareth in the country of Galilee.”
40021012	Then Jesus went into the house of God and made all those leave who were buying and selling there. He turned over the tables of the men who changed money. He turned over the seats of those who sold doves.
40021013	He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house is to be called a house of prayer.’ You have made it a place of robbers.” (Isaiah 56:7; Jeremiah 7:11)
40021014	The blind and those who could not walk came to Jesus in the house of God and He healed them.
40021015	The religious leaders of the Jews and the teachers of the Law saw the great things He did. They heard the children calling in the house of God and saying, “Greatest One! Son of David!” The leaders were very angry.
40021016	They said to Jesus, “Do you hear what these children are saying?” Jesus said to them, “Yes, have you not read the writings, ‘Even little children and babies will honor Him’?”
40021017	Jesus left them and went out of the city to the town of Bethany. He stayed there that night.
40021018	In the morning as He was coming back to the city, He was hungry.
40021019	He saw a fig tree by the side of the road and went to it. There was nothing on it but leaves. He said to the tree, “No fruit will ever grow on you again.” At once the fig tree dried up.
40021020	The followers saw it and were surprised and wondered. They said, “How did the fig tree dry up so fast?”
40021021	Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you this: If you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only be able to do what was done to the fig tree. You will also be able to say to this mountain, ‘Move from here and be thrown into the sea,’ and it will be done.
40021022	All things you ask for in prayer, you will receive if you have faith.”
40021023	Jesus came into the house of God. The religious leaders and the other leaders of the people came up to Him as He was teaching. They said, “By what right and power are You doing these things? Who gave You the right and the power to do them?”
40021024	Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing also. If you tell Me, then I will tell you by what right and power I do these things.
40021025	Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men?” They thought among themselves, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ then He will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
40021026	But if we say, ‘From men,’ we are afraid of the people, because they all think John was one who spoke for God.”
40021027	They said to Jesus, “We do not know.” He said to them, “Then I will not tell you by what right and power I do these things.
40021028	“What do you think about this? There was a man who had two sons. He came to the first son and said, ‘My son, go to my grape-field and work today.’
40021029	He said, ‘I will go.’ But he did not go.
40021030	The father came to the second son and asked the same thing. The son said, ‘No, I will not go.’ Later he was sorry and went.
40021031	Which one of the two sons did what his father wanted?” They said to Jesus, “The second son.” Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you this: Tax-gatherers and women who sell the use of their bodies will get into the holy nation of heaven before you.
40021032	For John came to you preaching about being right with God. You did not believe him. But tax-gatherers and women who sell the use of their bodies did believe him. When you saw this, you were not sorry for your sins and did not turn from them and believe him.
40021033	“Listen to another picture-story. A man who owned land planted grapes in a field and put a fence around it. He made a place for making wine. He built a tower to look over the grape-field. He let farmers rent it and then he went into another country.
40021034	The time came for gathering the grapes. He sent his servants to the farmers to get the grapes.
40021035	The farmers took his servants and hit one. They killed another and threw stones at another.
40021036	Again he sent other servants. He sent more than the first time. The farmers did the same to those servants.
40021037	After this he sent his son to them. He said to himself, ‘They will respect my son.’
40021038	When the farmers saw the son, they said to themselves, ‘This is the one who will get everything when the owner dies. Let us kill him and we will get it all.’
40021039	They took him and threw him out of the grape-field and killed him.
40021040	When the owner of the grape-field comes, what will he do to those farmers?”
40021041	They said to Him, “He will put those bad men to death. Then he will rent the grape-field to other farmers who will give him the grapes when they are ready.”
40021042	Jesus said to them, “Have you not read in the Holy Writings, ‘The Stone that was put aside by the workmen has become the most important Stone in the building? The Lord has done this. We think it is great!’ (Psalm 118:22–23)
40021043	I say to you, because of this, the holy nation of God will be taken from you. It will be given to a nation that will give fruit.
40021044	Whoever falls on this Stone will be broken. And on the one it falls, it will make him like dust.”
40021045	When the religious leaders and the proud religious law-keepers heard this picture-story, they knew He spoke of them.
40021046	When they tried to put their hands on Him, they were afraid of the many people. The people thought He was One Who spoke for God.
40022001	Again Jesus spoke to them in picture-stories. He said,
40022002	“The holy nation of heaven is like a king who gave a wedding supper for his son.
40022003	He sent his servants to tell the people, who had been asked, to come to the supper. But the people did not want to come.
40022004	“He sent other servants, saying to them, ‘Tell those who have been asked to come, “See! My supper is ready. My cows and fat calves are killed. Everything is ready. Come to the wedding supper!” ’
40022005	But they did not listen and went on working. One went to his farm. Another went to his store.
40022006	The others took hold of his servants, and hurt them and killed them.
40022007	“When the king heard this, he was very angry. He sent his soldiers to put those to death who had killed his servants. He burned their city.
40022008	Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding supper is ready. Those who were asked to come to the supper were not good enough.
40022009	Go out into the roads and as many people as you can find, ask them to come to the wedding supper.’
40022010	“The servants went out into the roads and brought all they could find, both bad and good. The wedding supper room was full of people.
40022011	The king came in to see those who had come. He saw one man who did not have on wedding supper clothes.
40022012	He said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without wedding supper clothes?’ The man could not speak!
40022013	Then the king said to his servants, ‘Tie his hands and feet, and throw him out into the darkness. In that place there will be loud crying and grinding of teeth.’
40022014	For many are called but few are chosen.”
40022015	Then the proud religious law-keepers got together to think how they could trap Jesus in His talk.
40022016	They sent their followers to Jesus with some of King Herod’s men. They asked, “Teacher, we know that You are true. We know that You are teaching the truth about God. We know You are not afraid of what men think or say about You.
40022017	Tell us what You think of this. Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
40022018	Jesus knew their sinful thoughts and said, “You pretend to be someone you are not! Why do you try to trap Me?
40022019	Show Me a piece of money.” They brought Him a piece.
40022020	Jesus said to them, “Whose picture is this? Whose name is on it?”
40022021	They said to Him, “Caesar’s.” Then He said to them, “Pay to Caesar the things that belong to Caesar. Pay to God the things that belong to God.”
40022022	When they heard this, they were surprised and wondered about it. Then they went away from Him.
40022023	The same day some people from the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Jesus. They asked,
40022024	“Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man should die without having children, then his brother must marry his wife. He should have children for his brother.’ (Deuteronomy 25:5)
40022025	There were seven brothers with us. The first was married but died before he had any children. The second brother then married the first brother’s wife.
40022026	The second brother died and the same with the third and on to the seventh.
40022027	Then the woman died also.
40022028	When people are raised from the dead, whose wife will she be of the seven? They all had her for a wife.”
40022029	Jesus said to them, “You are wrong because you do not know the Holy Writings or the power of God.
40022030	After people are raised from the dead, they do not marry. They are like the angels in heaven.
40022031	Have you not read what God said to you about those who are raised from the dead? He said,
40022032	‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.’ He is not the God of the dead but of the living!” (Exodus 3:6)
40022033	When the people heard this, they were surprised and wondered about His teaching.
40022034	The proud religious law-keepers got together when they heard that the religious group of people who believe no one will be raised from the dead were not able to talk anymore to Jesus.
40022035	A proud religious law-keeper who knew the Law tried to trap Jesus. He said,
40022036	“Teacher, which one is the greatest of the Laws?”
40022037	Jesus said to him, “ ‘You must love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.’
40022038	This is the first and greatest of the Laws.
40022039	The second is like it, ‘You must love your neighbor as you love yourself.’
40022040	All the Laws and the writings of the early preachers depend on these two most important Laws.”
40022041	The proud religious law-keepers were gathered together. Then Jesus asked,
40022042	“What do you think about the Christ? Whose Son is He?” They said to Him, “The Son of David.”
40022043	Jesus said to them, “Then how is it that David, being led by the Holy Spirit, calls Him ‘Lord’? He said,
40022044	‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at My right side until I make those who hate You a place to rest Your feet.” ’(Psalm 110:1)
40022045	If David calls Him ‘Lord,’then how can He be the Son of David?”
40022046	No one could answer a word, and after that day no one asked Him anything.
40023001	Then Jesus talked to the many people and to His followers.
40023002	He said, “The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers have put themselves in Moses’ place as teachers.
40023003	Do what they tell you to do and keep on doing it. But do not follow what they do. They preach but do not obey their own preaching.
40023004	They make heavy loads and put them on the shoulders of men. But they will not help lift them with a finger.
40023005	Everything they do, they do to be seen of men. They have words from the Holy Writings written in large letters on their left arm and forehead and they make wide trimming for their clothes.
40023006	They like to have the important places at big suppers and the best seats in the Jewish places of worship.
40023007	They like to have people show respect to them as they stand in the center of town where people gather. The like to be called teacher.
40023008	“But you are not to be called teacher. There is only one Teacher, and all of you are brothers.
40023009	Do not call any man here on earth your father. There is only one Father and He is in heaven.
40023010	You are not to be called leader. There is only one Leader and He is Christ.
40023011	“He who is greatest among you will be the one to care for you.
40023012	The person who thinks he is important will find out how little he is worth. The person who is not trying to honor himself will be made important.
40023013	“It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers, you who pretend to be someone you are not! You keep men from going into the holy nation of heaven. You are not going in yourselves, and you do not allow those to go in who are about to go in.
40023014	It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers, you who pretend to be someone you are not! (You take houses from poor women whose husbands have died. Then you try to cover it up by making long prayers. You will be punished all the more because of this.)
40023015	It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers, you who pretend to be someone you are not! You go over land and sea to win one follower. When you have him, you make him twice as much a child of hell as you are.
40023016	“It is bad for you, blind leaders! You say, ‘Whoever makes a promise by the house of God, his promise is worth nothing. But whoever makes a promise by the gold of the house of God, then his promise has to be kept.’
40023017	You fools and blind men! Which is greater, the gold or the house of God that makes the gold holy?
40023018	You say, ‘Whoever will promise by the altar, his promise does not have to be kept. But whoever makes a promise by the gift on the altar, then his promise has to be kept.’
40023019	You fools and blind men! Which is greater, the gift, or the altar that makes the gift holy?
40023020	Whoever makes a promise by the altar, promises by it and by everything on it.
40023021	Whoever makes a promise by the house of God, promises by it and by Him Who is in it.
40023022	Whoever makes a promise by heaven, promises by the throne of God and by Him Who sits there.
40023023	“It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers, you who pretend to be someone you are not! You give one-tenth part of your spices, and have not done the most important things of the Law, such as thinking what is right and wrong, and having pity and faith. These you should have done and still have done the other things also.
40023024	You blind leaders, you take a small bug out of your cup but you swallow a camel!
40023025	“It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers, you who pretend to be someone you are not! You clean the outside of the cup and plate, but leave the inside full of strong bad desires and are not able to keep from doing sinful things.
40023026	You blind proud religious law-keepers! Clean the inside of the cup and plate, then the outside will be clean also.
40023027	“It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers, you who pretend to be someone you are not! You are like graves that have been made white and look beautiful on the outside. But inside you are full of the bones of dead men and of every sinful thing.
40023028	As men look at you, you seem to be good and right but inside you are full of sin. You pretend to be someone you are not.
40023029	“It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers, you who pretend to be someone you are not! You make buildings for the graves of the early preachers, and you make the graves beautiful of those who are right with God.
40023030	You say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our early fathers, we would not have helped kill the early preachers.’
40023031	In this way, you are showing that you are the sons of those who killed the early preachers.
40023032	You might as well finish what your early fathers did.
40023033	You snakes! You family of snakes! How can you be kept from hell?
40023034	“Because of this, I am going to keep on sending to you men who speak for God and wise men and teachers of the Law. Some of them you will kill and nail to a cross. Some of them you will beat in your places of worship. You will make it very hard for them as they go from city to city.
40023035	Because of this, you will be guilty of the blood of all those right with God on the earth. It will be from the blood of Abel who was right with God to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachias. He was the one you killed between the house of God and the altar.
40023036	For sure, I tell you, all these things will come on the people of this day.
40023037	“O Jerusalem, Jerusalem! You kill the men who speak for God and throw stones at those who were sent to you. How many times I wanted to gather your children around Me, as a chicken gathers her young ones under her wings. But you would not let Me.
40023038	See! Your house is empty.
40023039	I say to you, you will not see Me again until you will say, ‘Great is He Who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
40024001	Jesus went out of the house of God. On the way His followers came to Him to show Him the buildings of the house of God.
40024002	Jesus said to them, “Do you see all these things? For sure, I tell you, all these stones will be thrown down. Not one will be left standing on another.”
40024003	Jesus sat on the Mount of Olives. The followers came to Him when He was alone and said, “Tell us, when will this happen? What can we look for to show us of Your coming and of the end of the world?”
40024004	Jesus said to them, “Be careful that no one leads you the wrong way.
40024005	Many people will come using My name. They will say, ‘I am Christ.’ They will fool many people and will turn them to the wrong way.
40024006	You will hear of wars and lots of talk about wars, but do not be afraid. These things must happen, but it is not the end yet.
40024007	Nations will have wars with other nations. Countries will fight against countries. There will be no food for people. The earth will shake and break apart in different places.
40024008	These things are the beginning of sorrows and pains.
40024009	“Then they will hand you over to be hurt. They will kill you. You will be hated by all the world because of My name.
40024010	Many people will give up and turn away at this time. People will hand over each other. They will hate each other.
40024011	Many false religious teachers will come. They will fool many people and will turn them to the wrong way.
40024012	Because of people breaking the laws and sin being everywhere, the love in the hearts of many people will become cold.
40024013	But the one who stays true to the end will be saved.
40024014	“This Good News about the holy nation of God must be preached over all the earth. It must be told to all nations and then the end will come.
40024015	“You will see a sinful man-made god standing in the house of God in Jerusalem. It was spoken of by the early preacher Daniel. (Daniel 9:27; 12:11) The one who reads this should understand it.
40024016	Then those in the country of Judea should run to the mountains.
40024017	The man who is on the top of his house should not come down to take anything out of his house.
40024018	The man who is in the field should not go back to get his coat.
40024019	It will be hard for a woman who will soon be a mother. It will be hard for the ones feeding babies in those days!
40024020	Pray that you will not have to go in the winter or on the Day of Rest.
40024021	In those days there will be very much trouble and pain and sorrow. It has never been this bad from the beginning of the world and never will be again.
40024022	If the time had not been made short, no life would have been saved. Because of God’s people, the time will be made short.
40024023	“If anyone says to you, ‘See! Here is the Christ!’ or ‘There He is!’ do not believe it.
40024024	People who say they are Christ and false preachers will come. They will do special things for people to see. They will do great things, so that if it can be done, God’s people will be fooled to believe something wrong.
40024025	Listen! I have told you before it comes.
40024026	If they tell you, ‘See! He is in the desert,’ do not go to see. Or if they say, ‘See! He is in the inside room,’ do not believe them.
40024027	The Son of Man will come as fast as lightning shines across the sky from east to west.
40024028	Birds gather wherever there is a dead body.
40024029	“As soon as those days of trouble and pain and sorrow are over, the sun will get dark. The moon will not give light. The stars will fall from the sky. The powers in the heavens will be shaken.
40024030	Then something special will be seen in the sky telling of the Son of Man. All nations of the earth will have sorrow. They will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds of the sky with power and shining-greatness.
40024031	He will send His angels with the loud sound of a horn. They will gather God’s people together from the four winds. They will come from one end of the heavens to the other.
40024032	“Now learn something from the fig tree. When the branch begins to grow and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.
40024033	In the same way, when you see all these things happen, you know the Son of Man is near, even at the door.
40024034	For sure, I tell you, the people of this day will not pass away before all these things have happened.
40024035	“Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.
40024036	But no one knows the day or the hour. No! Not even the angels in heaven know. The Son does not know. Only the Father knows.
40024037	“When the Son of Man comes, it will be the same as when Noah lived.
40024038	In the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking. They were marrying and being given in marriage. This kept on until the day Noah went into the large boat.
40024039	They did not know what was happening until the flood came and the water carried them all away. It will be like this when the Son of Man comes.
40024040	“Two men will be working in a field. One will be taken and the other will be left.
40024041	Two women will be grinding grain. One will be taken and the other will be left.
40024042	“Because of this, watch! You do not know on what day your Lord is coming.
40024043	But understand this: If the owner of a house had known when the robber was coming, he would have watched. He would not have allowed his house to have been broken into.
40024044	You must be ready also. The Son of Man is coming at a time when you do not think He will come.
40024045	“Who is the faithful and wise servant whom his owner has made boss over the other servants? He is to have food ready for them at the right time.
40024046	That servant is happy who is doing what his owner wants him to do when he comes back.
40024047	For sure, I tell you, he will make him boss over all that he has.
40024048	But if that servant is bad, he will think, ‘The owner will not come soon.’
40024049	He will beat the others. He will eat and drink with those who are drunk.
40024050	The owner will come on a day and at an hour when the servant is not looking for him.
40024051	The owner will punish the servant and will give him his place with those who pretend to be someone they are not. There will be loud crying and grinding of teeth.
40025001	“At that time the holy nation of heaven will be like ten women who have never had men. They took their lamps and went out to meet the man soon to be married.
40025002	Five of them were wise and five were foolish.
40025003	The foolish women took their lamps but did not take oil with them.
40025004	The wise women took oil in a jar with their lamps.
40025005	They all went to sleep because the man to be married did not come for a long time.
40025006	“At twelve o’clock in the night there was a loud call, ‘See! The man soon to be married is coming! Go out to meet him!’
40025007	Then all the women got up and made their lamps brighter.
40025008	The foolish women said to the wise women, ‘Give us some of your oil because our lamps are going out.’
40025009	But the wise women said, ‘No! There will not be enough for us and you. Go to the store and buy oil for yourselves.’
40025010	While they were gone to buy oil, the man soon to be married came. Those who were ready went in with him to the marriage. The door was shut.
40025011	“Later the foolish women came. They said, ‘Sir, Sir, open the door for us!’
40025012	But he said to them, ‘For sure, I tell you, I do not know you!’
40025013	So watch! You do not know what day or what hour the Son of Man is coming.
40025014	“For the holy nation of heaven is like a man who was going to a country far away. He called together the servants he owned and gave them his money to use.
40025015	He gave to one servant five pieces of money worth much. He gave to another servant two pieces of money worth much. He gave to another servant one piece of money worth much. He gave to each one as he was able to use it. Then he went on his trip.
40025016	The servant who had the five pieces of money went out to the stores and traded until he made five more pieces.
40025017	The servant who had two pieces of money did the same thing. He made two more pieces.
40025018	The servant who had received the one piece of money went and hid the money in a hole in the ground. He hid his owner’s money.
40025019	“After a long time the owner of those servants came back. He wanted to know what had been done with his money.
40025020	The one who had received the five pieces of money worth much came and handed him five pieces more. He said, ‘Sir, you gave me five pieces of money. See! I used it and made five more pieces.’
40025021	His owner said to him, ‘You have done well. You are a good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things. I will put many things in your care. Come and share my joy.’
40025022	The one who received two pieces of money worth much came also. He said, ‘Sir, you gave me two pieces of money. See! I used it and made two more pieces.’
40025023	His owner said to him, ‘You have done well. You are a good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things. I will put many things in your care. Come and share my joy.’
40025024	The one who had received one piece of money worth much came. He said, ‘Sir, I know that you are a hard man. You gather grain where you have not planted. You take up where you have not spread out.
40025025	I was afraid and I hid your money in the ground. See! Here is your money.’
40025026	His owner said to him, ‘You bad and lazy servant. You knew that I gather grain where I have not planted. You knew that I take up where I have not spread out.
40025027	You should have taken my money to the bank. When I came back, I could have had my own money and what the bank paid for using it.
40025028	Take the one piece of money from him. Give it to the one who has ten pieces of money.’
40025029	For the man who has will have more given to him. He will have more than enough. The man who has nothing, even what he has will be taken away.
40025030	Throw the bad servant out into the darkness. There will be loud crying and grinding of teeth.
40025031	“When the Son of Man comes in His shining-greatness, He will sit down on His throne of greatness. All the angels will be with Him.
40025032	All the nations of the earth will be gathered before Him. He will divide them from each other as a shepherd divides the sheep from the goats.
40025033	He will put the sheep on His right side, but the goats He will put on His left side.
40025034	“Then the King will say to those on His right side, ‘Come, you who have been called by My Father. Come into the holy nation that has been made ready for you before the world was made.
40025035	For I was hungry and you gave Me food to eat. I was thirsty and you gave Me water to drink. I was a stranger and you gave Me a room.
40025036	I had no clothes and you gave Me clothes to wear. I was sick and you cared for Me. I was in prison and you came to see Me.’
40025037	“Then those that are right with God will say, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You? When did we see You thirsty and give You a drink?
40025038	When did we see You a stranger and give You a room? When did we see You had no clothes and we gave You clothes?
40025039	And when did we see You sick or in prison and we came to You?’
40025040	Then the King will say, ‘For sure, I tell you, because you did it to one of the least of My brothers, you have done it to Me.’
40025041	“Then the King will say to those on His left side, ‘Go away from Me! You are guilty! Go into the fire that lasts forever. It has been made ready for the devil and his angels.
40025042	For I was hungry but you did not give Me food to eat. I was thirsty but you did not give Me water to drink.
40025043	I was a stranger but you did not give Me a room. I had no clothes but you did not give Me clothes. I was sick and in prison but you did not come to see Me.’
40025044	“Then they will ask, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger? When did we see You without clothes or sick or in prison and did not care for You?’
40025045	Then He will say to them, ‘For sure, I tell you, because you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to Me.’
40025046	These will go to the place where they will be punished forever. But those right with God will have life that lasts forever.”
40026001	When Jesus had finished all this teaching, He said to His followers,
40026002	“You know that the special religious supper to remember how the Jews left Egypt is in two days. The Son of Man will be handed over to be nailed to a cross.”
40026003	The religious leaders and the leaders of the people gathered at the house of the head religious leader. His name was Caiaphas.
40026004	They talked together how they might trap Jesus and kill Him.
40026005	But they said, “This must not happen on the day of the special supper. The people would be against it. They would make much trouble.”
40026006	Jesus was in the town of Bethany in the house of Simon. Simon had a very bad skin disease.
40026007	A woman came with a jar of perfume. She had given much money for this. As Jesus ate, she poured the perfume on His head.
40026008	When the followers saw it, they were angry. They said, “Why was this wasted?
40026009	This perfume could have been sold for much money and given to poor people.”
40026010	Jesus knew what they were saying. He said to them, “Why are you giving this woman trouble? She has done a good thing to Me.
40026011	You will have poor people with you all the time. But you will not have Me with you all the time.
40026012	She put this perfume on My body to make it ready for the grave.
40026013	For sure, I tell you, wherever this Good News is preached in all the world, this woman will be remembered for what she has done.”
40026014	Judas Iscariot was one of the twelve followers. He went to the religious leaders of the Jews.
40026015	He said, “What will you pay me if I hand Jesus over to you?” They promised to pay him thirty pieces of silver.
40026016	From that time on Judas looked for a way to hand Jesus over to them.
40026017	On the first day of the supper of bread without yeast the followers came to Jesus. They said, “What place do You want us to make ready for You to eat the supper of the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt?”
40026018	He said, “Go into the city to a certain man and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near. I will eat the special supper at your house with My followers.” ’ ”
40026019	The followers did as Jesus told them. They made things ready for this special supper.
40026020	When evening came, Jesus sat with the twelve followers.
40026021	As they were eating, Jesus said, “For sure, I tell you, one of you will hand Me over.”
40026022	They were very sad. They said to Him one after the other, “Lord, is it I?”
40026023	He said, “The one who will hand Me over is the one who has just put his hand with Mine in the dish.
40026024	The Son of Man is going away as it is written of Him. It is bad for that man who hands the Son of Man over! It would have been better if he had not been born!”
40026025	Judas was the one who was handing Jesus over. He said, “Teacher, am I the one?” Jesus said to him, “You have said it.”
40026026	As they were eating, Jesus took a loaf of bread. He gave thanks and broke it in pieces. He gave it to His followers and said, “Take, eat, this is My body.”
40026027	Then He took the cup and gave thanks. He gave it to them and said, “You must all drink from it.
40026028	This is My blood of the New Way of Worship which is given for many. It is given so the sins of many can be forgiven.
40026029	I tell you that I will not drink of the fruit of the vine again until that day when I will drink it new with you in the holy nation of My Father.”
40026030	After they sang a song they went out to the Mount of Olives.
40026031	Jesus said to them, “All of you will be ashamed of Me and leave Me tonight. For it is written, ‘I will kill the shepherd and the sheep of the flock will be spread everywhere.’ (Zechariah 13:7)

40026033	Peter said to Jesus, “Even if all men give up and turn away because of You, I will never.”

40026035	Peter said to Him, “Even if I have to die with You, I will never say I do not know You.” And all the followers said the same thing.

40026038	Then He said to them, “My soul is very sad. My soul is so full of sorrow I am ready to die. You stay here and watch with Me.”
40026039	He went on a little farther and got down with His face on the ground. He prayed, “My Father, if it can be done, take away what is before Me. Even so, not what I want but what You want.”
40026040	Then He came to the followers and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “Were you not able to watch with Me one hour?
40026041	Watch and pray so that you will not be tempted. Man’s spirit is willing, but the body does not have the power to do it.”
40026042	He went away again the second time. He prayed, saying, “My Father, if this must happen to Me, may whatever You want be done.”
40026043	He came and found them asleep again. Their eyes were heavy.
40026044	He went away from them the third time and prayed the same prayer.
40026045	Then He came to His followers and asked them, “Are you still sleeping and getting your rest? As I speak, the time has come when the Son of Man will be handed over to sinners.
40026046	Get up and let us go. See! The man who will hand Me over is near.”
40026047	Judas, one of the twelve followers, came while Jesus was talking. He came with many others who had swords and sticks. They came from the religious leaders of the Jews and the leaders of the people.
40026048	The man who handed Jesus over gave the men something to look for. He said, “The One I kiss is the One you want. Take Him!”
40026049	At once Judas went up to Jesus and said, “Hello, Teacher,” and kissed Him.
40026050	Jesus said to him, “Friend, do what you came to do.” Then they came and put their hands on Jesus and took Him.
40026051	One of those with Jesus took his sword. He hit the servant who was owned by the religious leader and cut off his ear.
40026052	Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back where it belongs. Everyone who uses a sword will die with a sword.
40026053	Do you not think that I can pray to My Father? At once He would send Me more than 70,000 angels.
40026054	If I did, how could it happen as the Holy Writings said it would happen? It must be this way.”
40026055	Then Jesus said to the many people, “Have you come with swords and sticks to take Me as if I were a robber? I have been with you every day teaching in the house of God. You never put your hands on Me then.
40026056	But this has happened as the early preachers said in the Holy Writings it would happen.” Then all the followers left Him and ran away.
40026057	Those who had taken Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas. He was the head religious leader. The teachers of the Law and the other leaders were gathered there.
40026058	But Peter followed Him a long way behind while going to the house of the head religious leader. Then he went in and sat with the helpers to see what would happen.
40026059	The religious leaders and the other leaders and all the court were looking for false things to say against Jesus. They wanted some reason to kill Him.
40026060	They found none, but many came and told false things about Him. At last two came to the front.
40026061	They said, “This Man said, ‘I am able to destroy the house of God and build it up again in three days.’”
40026062	Then the head religious leader stood up. He said to Jesus, “Have You nothing to say? What about the things these men are saying against You?”
40026063	Jesus said nothing. Then the head religious leader said to Him, “In the name of the living God, I tell You to say the truth. Tell us if You are the Christ, the Son of God.”
40026064	Jesus said to him, “What you said is true. I say to you, from now on you will see the Son of Man seated on the right hand of the All-powerful God. You will see Him coming on the clouds of the sky.”
40026065	Then the head religious leader tore his clothes apart. He said, “He has spoken as if He were God! Do we need other people to speak against Him yet? You have heard Him speak as if He were God!
40026066	What do you think?” They said, “He is guilty of death!”
40026067	Then they spit on His face. They hit Him with their hands. Others beat Him.
40026068	They said, “Tell us, Christ, You Who can tell what is going to happen, who hit You?”
40026069	Peter sat outside in the yard. A young servant-girl came to him. She said, “You were also with Jesus Who is from the country of Galilee!”
40026070	But Peter lied in front of all of them, saying, “I do not know what you are talking about.”
40026071	After he had gone out, another young servant-girl saw him. She said to those standing around, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
40026072	Again he lied and swore, “I do not know this Man!”
40026073	After a little while some of the people standing around came up to Peter and said, “For sure, you are one of them. You talk like they do.”
40026074	Then he began to say bad words and swear. He said, “I do not know the Man!” At once a rooster crowed.
40026075	Peter remembered the words Jesus had said to him, “Before a rooster crows, you will say three times you do not know Me.” Peter went outside and cried with loud cries.
40027001	Early in the morning all the head religious leaders of the Jews and the leaders of the people gathered together and talked about how they could put Jesus to death.
40027002	They tied Him and took Him away. Then they handed Him over to Pilate who was the leader of the country.
40027003	Then Judas was sorry he had handed Jesus over when he saw that Jesus was going to be killed. He took back the thirty pieces of silver and gave it to the head religious leaders and the other leaders.
40027004	He said, “I have sinned because I handed over a Man Who has done no wrong.” And they said, “What is that to us? That is your own doing.”
40027005	He threw the money down in the house of God and went outside. Then he went away and killed himself by hanging from a rope.
40027006	The head religious leaders took the money. They said, “It is against the Law to put this money in the house of God. This money has bought blood.”
40027007	They talked about what to do with the money. Then they decided to buy land to bury strangers in.
40027008	Because of this, that land is called the Field of Blood to this day.
40027009	It happened as the early preacher Jeremiah said it would happen. He said, “And they took the thirty pieces of silver which was the price the Jews said they would pay for Him.
40027010	And they bought land to bury strangers in, as the Lord told me.” (Zechariah 11:12–13)
40027011	Then Jesus stood in front of the leader of the country. The leader asked Jesus, “Are You the King of the Jews?” Jesus said to him, “What you say is true.”
40027012	When the head religious leaders and the other leaders spoke against Him, He said nothing.
40027013	Then Pilate said to Him, “Do You not hear all these things they are saying against You?”
40027014	Jesus did not say a word. The leader was much surprised and wondered about it.
40027015	At the special supper each year the leader of the country would always let one person who was in prison go free. It would be the one the people wanted.
40027016	They had a man who was known by all the people whose name was Barabbas.
40027017	When they were gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to let go free? Should it be Barabbas or Jesus Who is called Christ?”
40027018	For the leader of the country knew the religious leaders had given Jesus over to him because they were jealous.
40027019	While Pilate was sitting in the place where he judges, his wife sent him this word, “Have nothing to do with that good Man. I have been troubled today in a dream about Him.”
40027020	The head religious leaders and the other leaders talked the many people into asking for Barabbas to go free and for Jesus to be put to death.
40027021	The leader of the country said to them, “Which one of the two do you want me to let go free?” They said, “Barabbas.”
40027022	Pilate said to them, “Then what am I to do with Jesus Who is called Christ?” They all said to him, “Nail Him to a cross!”
40027023	Then Pilate said, “Why, what bad thing has He done?” But they cried out all the more, “Nail Him to a cross!”
40027024	Pilate saw that he could do nothing. The people were making loud calls and there was much pushing around. He took water and washed his hands in front of the many people. He said, “I am not guilty of the blood of this good Man. This is your own doing.”
40027025	Then all the people said, “Let His blood be on us and on our children!”

40027027	Then the soldiers of Pilate took Jesus into a large room. A big group of soldiers gathered around Him.
40027028	They took off His clothes and put a purple coat on Him.
40027029	They put a crown of thorns on His head. They put a stick in His right hand. They got on their knees before Him and made fun of Him. They said, “Hello, King of the Jews!”
40027030	They spit on Him. They took a stick and hit Him on the head.
40027031	After they had made fun of Him, they took the coat off and put His own clothes on Him. Then they led Him away to be nailed to a cross.

40027033	They came to a place called Golgotha. This name means the place of a skull.

40027035	When they had nailed Him to the cross, they divided His clothes by drawing names. It happened as the early preacher said it would happen. He said, “They divided My clothes among them by drawing names to see who would get My coat.” (Psalm 22:18)
40027036	Then they sat down and watched Him.
40027037	Over His head they put in writing what they had against Him, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
40027038	They nailed two robbers to crosses beside Him. One was on His right side. The other was on His left side.
40027039	Those who walked by shook their heads and laughed at Him.
40027040	They said, “You are the One Who could destroy the house of God and build it up again in three days. Now save Yourself. If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross.”
40027041	The head religious leaders and the teachers of the Law and the other leaders made fun of Him also. They said,
40027042	“He saved others but He cannot save Himself. If He is the King of the Jews, let Him come down from the cross. Then we will believe in Him.
40027043	He trusts God. Let God save Him now, if God cares for Him. He has said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
40027044	And the robbers who were nailed to crosses beside Him made fun of Him the same way also.
40027045	From noon until three o’clock it was dark over all the land.

40027047	When some of those who stood by heard that, they said, “This Man is calling for Elijah.”

40027049	The others said, “Let Him alone. Let us see if Elijah will come and save Him.”

40027051	At once the curtain in the house of God was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook and the rocks fell apart.

40027054	The captain of the soldiers and those with him who were watching Jesus, saw all the things that were happening. They saw the earth shake and they were very much afraid. They said, “For sure, this Man was the Son of God.”

40027062	The next day, the day after Jesus was killed, the head religious leaders and the proud religious law-keepers gathered together in front of Pilate.

40027065	Pilate said to them, “Take the soldiers. Go and watch the grave.”

40028001	The Day of Rest was over. The sun was coming up on the first day of the week. Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the grave.

40028003	His face was bright like lightning. His clothes were white as snow.
40028004	The soldiers were shaking with fear and became as dead men.

40028007	Run fast and tell His followers that He is risen from the dead. He is going before you to the country of Galilee. You will see Him there as I have told you.”
