41001001	The Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God,
41001002	begins with the words of the early preachers: “Listen! I will send My helper to carry the news ahead of you. He will make the way ready.
41001003	His voice calls out in the desert, ‘Make the way ready for the Lord. Make the road straight for Him!’” (Isaiah 40:3)
41001004	John the Baptist preached in the desert. He preached that people should be baptized because they were sorry for their sins and had turned from them. And they would be forgiven.
41001005	People from over all the country of Judea and from Jerusalem came to him. They told of their sins and were baptized by John in the Jordan River.
41001006	John wore clothes made of hair from camels. He had a leather belt around him. His food was locusts and wild honey.
41001007	He preached, saying, “One is coming after me Who is greater than I. I am not good enough to get down and help Him take off His shoes.
41001008	I have baptized you with water. But He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
41001009	Jesus came to the Jordan River from the town of Nazareth in the country of Galilee. He was baptized by John.
41001010	As soon as Jesus came up out of the water, He saw heaven open up. The Holy Spirit came down on Him like a dove.
41001011	A voice came from heaven and said, “You are My much-loved Son. I am very happy with You.”
41001012	At once the Holy Spirit sent Jesus to a desert.
41001013	He was tempted by Satan for forty days there. He was with wild animals but angels took care of Him.
41001014	After John the Baptist was put in prison, Jesus came to the country of Galilee. He preached the Good News of God.
41001015	He said, “The time has come. The holy nation of God is near. Be sorry for your sins, turn from them, and believe the Good News.”
41001016	Jesus was walking by the Sea of Galilee. He saw Simon and his brother Andrew putting a net into the sea. They were fishermen.
41001017	Jesus said to them, “Follow Me. I will make you fish for men!”
41001018	At once they left their nets and followed Him.
41001019	Jesus went on a little farther. He saw James and his brother John who were sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat mending their nets.
41001020	Jesus called them and they left their father Zebedee. He was in the boat with men who were working for him.
41001021	Jesus and His followers went to the city of Capernaum on the Day of Rest. They went to the Jewish place of worship where Jesus taught the people.
41001022	The people were surprised and wondered about His teaching. He taught them as One Who had the right and the power to teach and not as the teachers of the Law.
41001023	There was a man in the Jewish place of worship who had a demon. The demon cried out,
41001024	“What do You want of us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know Who You are. You are the Holy One of God.”
41001025	Jesus spoke sharp words to the demon and said, “Do not talk! Come out of the man!”
41001026	The demon threw the man down and gave a loud cry. Then he came out of him.
41001027	The people were all surprised and wondered. They asked each other, “What is this? Is this a new teaching? He speaks with power even to the demons and they obey Him!”
41001028	At once the news about Jesus went through all the country around Galilee.
41001029	Jesus and His followers came out of the Jewish place of worship. Then they went to the house of Simon and Andrew. James and John went with them.
41001030	They told Jesus about Simon’s mother-in-law who was in bed, very sick.
41001031	He went and took her by the hand and raised her up. At once her sickness was gone. She got up and cared for them.
41001032	In the evening as the sun went down, the people took all who were sick to Jesus. They took those who had demons to Him.
41001033	All the town gathered at the door.
41001034	Jesus healed those who were sick of many kinds of diseases. He put out many demons. Jesus would not allow the demons to speak because they knew Who He was.
41001035	In the morning before the sun was up, Jesus went to a place where He could be alone. He prayed there.
41001036	Simon and the others looked for Jesus.
41001037	They found Him and said, “All the people are looking for You.”
41001038	Jesus said to the followers, “Let us go to the towns near here so I can preach there also. That is why I came.”
41001039	He went through Galilee. He preached in their places of worship and put out demons.
41001040	A man came to Jesus with a bad skin disease. This man got down on his knees and begged Jesus, saying, “If You want to, You can heal me.”
41001041	Jesus put His hand on him with loving-pity. He said, “I want to. Be healed.”
41001042	At once the disease was gone and the man was healed.
41001043	Jesus spoke strong words to the man before He sent him away.
41001044	He said to him, “Tell no one about this. Go and let the religious leader of the Jews see you. Give the gifts Moses has told you to give when a man is healed of a disease. Let the leaders know you have been healed.”
41001045	But the man went out and talked about it everywhere. After this Jesus could not go to any town if people knew He was there. He had to stay in the desert. People came to Him from everywhere.
41002001	After some days Jesus went back to the city of Capernaum. Then news got around that He was home.
41002002	Soon many people gathered there. There was no more room, not even at the door. He spoke the Word of God to them.
41002003	Four men came to Jesus carrying a man who could not move his body.
41002004	These men could not get near Jesus because of so many people. They made a hole in the roof of the house over where Jesus stood. Then they let down the bed with the sick man on it.
41002005	When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the sick man, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
41002006	Some teachers of the Law were sitting there. They thought to themselves,
41002007	“Why does this Man talk like this? He is speaking as if He is God! Who can forgive sins? Only One can forgive sins and that is God!”
41002008	At once Jesus knew the teachers of the Law were thinking this. He said to them, “Why do you think this in your hearts?
41002009	Which is easier to say to the sick man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, take your bed, and start to walk?’
41002010	I am doing this so you may know the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins.” He said to the sick man who could not move his body,
41002011	“I say to you, ‘Get up. Take your bed and go to your home.’ ”
41002012	At once the sick man got up and took his bed and went away. Everybody saw him. They were all surprised and wondered about it. They thanked God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
41002013	Jesus walked along the sea-shore again. Many people came together and He taught them.
41002014	He walked farther and saw Levi (Matthew) the son of Alphaeus. Levi was sitting at his work gathering taxes. Jesus said to him, “Follow Me.” Levi got up and followed Him.
41002015	Jesus ate in Levi’s house. Many men who gather taxes and others who were sinners came and sat down with Jesus and His followers. There were many following Him.
41002016	The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers saw Jesus eat with men who gather taxes and others who were sinners. They said to His followers, “Why does He eat and drink with men who gather taxes and with sinners?”
41002017	Jesus heard it and said to them, “People who are well do not need a doctor. Only those who are sick need a doctor. I have not come to call those who are right with God. I have come to call those who are sinners.”
41002018	The followers of John and the proud religious law-keepers were not eating food so they could pray better. Some people came to Jesus and said, “Why do the followers of John and the proud religious law-keepers go without food so they can pray better, but Your followers do not?”
41002019	Jesus said to them, “Can the friends at a wedding go without food when the man just married is with them? As long as they have him with them, they will not go without food.
41002020	The days will come when the man just married will be taken from them. Then they will not eat food so they can pray better.
41002021	No man sews a piece of new cloth on an old coat. If it comes off, it will make the hole bigger.
41002022	No man puts new wine into old skin bags. The skin would break and the wine would run out. The bags would be no good. New wine must be put into new skin bags.”
41002023	At that time Jesus walked through the grain-fields on the Day of Rest. As they went, His followers began to take some of the grain.
41002024	The proud religious law-keepers said to Jesus, “See! Why are they doing what the Law says should not be done on the Day of Rest?”
41002025	He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
41002026	He went into the house of God when Abiathar was head religious leader of the Jews. He ate the special bread used in the religious worship. The Law says only the Jewish religious leaders may eat that. David gave some to those who were with him also.”
41002027	Jesus said to them, “The Day of Rest was made for the good of man. Man was not made for the Day of Rest.
41002028	The Son of Man is Lord of the Day of Rest also.”
41003001	Jesus went into the Jewish place of worship again. A man was there with a dried-up hand.
41003002	The proud religious law-keepers watched Jesus to see if He would heal the man on the Day of Rest. They wanted to have something to say against Jesus.
41003003	Jesus said to the man with the dried-up hand, “Stand up.”
41003004	Then Jesus said to the proud religious law-keepers, “Does the Law say to do good on the Day of Rest or to do bad, to save life or to kill?” But they said nothing.
41003005	Jesus looked around at them with anger. He was sad because of their hard hearts. Then He said to the man, “Put out your hand.” He put it out and his hand was healed. It was as good as the other.
41003006	The proud religious law-keepers went out and made plans with the followers of King Herod how they might kill Jesus.
41003007	Jesus went with His followers to the sea. Many people followed Him from the countries of Galilee and Judea.
41003008	They followed from Jerusalem and from the country of Idumea. They came from the other side of the Jordan River and from the cities of Tyre and Sidon. Many people heard all that Jesus was doing and came to Him.
41003009	He told His followers to have a small boat ready for Him because so many people might push Him down.
41003010	He had healed so many that the sick people were pushing in on Him. They were trying to put their hands on Him.
41003011	When demons saw Him, they got down at His feet and cried out, “You are the Son of God!”
41003012	He spoke strong words that the demons should tell no one Who He was.
41003013	He went up on a mountain and called those He wanted. They followed Him.
41003014	He picked out twelve followers to be with Him so He might send them out to preach.
41003015	They would have the right and the power to heal diseases and to put out demons.
41003016	Jesus gave Simon another name, Peter.
41003017	James and John were brothers. They were the sons of Zebedee. He named them Boanerges, which means, The Sons of Thunder.
41003018	The others were Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Canaanite,
41003019	and Judas Iscariot. Judas was the one who handed Jesus over to be killed.
41003020	When Jesus came into a house, many people gathered around Him again. Jesus and His followers could not even eat.
41003021	When His family heard of it, they went to take Him. They said, “He must be crazy.”
41003022	Teachers of the Law came down from Jerusalem. They said, “Jesus has Satan in Him. This Man puts out demons by the king of demons.”
41003023	Jesus called them to Him and spoke to them in picture-stories. He said, “How can the devil put out the devil?
41003024	A nation cannot last if it is divided against itself.
41003025	A family cannot last if it is divided against itself.
41003026	If the devil fights against himself and is divided, he cannot last. He will come to an end.
41003027	No man can go into a strong man’s house and take away his things, unless he ties up the strong man first. Only then can he take things from his house.
41003028	For sure, I tell you, all sins will be forgiven people, and bad things they speak against God.
41003029	But if anyone speaks bad things against the Holy Spirit, he will never be forgiven. He is guilty of a sin that lasts forever.”
41003030	Jesus told them this because they said, “He has a demon.”
41003031	Then His mother and brothers came and stood outside. They sent for Jesus.
41003032	Many people were sitting around Him. They said, “See! Your mother and brothers are outside looking for You.”
41003033	He said to them, “Who is My mother or My brothers?”
41003034	He turned to those sitting around Him and said, “See! My mother and My brothers!
41003035	Whoever does what My Father wants is My brother and My sister and My mother.”
41004001	Jesus began to teach by the sea-shore again. Many people gathered around Him. There were so many He had to get into a boat and sit down. The people were on the shore.
41004002	He taught them many things by using picture-stories. As He taught, He said,
41004003	“Listen! A man went out to plant seed.
41004004	As he planted the seed, some fell by the side of the road. Birds came and ate them.
41004005	Some seed fell among rocks. It came up at once because there was so little ground.
41004006	But it dried up when the sun was high in the sky because it had no root.
41004007	Some seed fell among thorns. The thorns grew and did not give the seed room to grow. This seed gave no grain.
41004008	Some seed fell on good ground. It came up and grew and gave much grain. Some gave thirty times as much grain. Some gave sixty times as much grain. Some gave one hundred times as much grain.”
41004009	He said to them, “You have ears, then listen!”
41004010	Those who were with Jesus and the twelve followers came to Him when He was alone. They asked about the picture-story.
41004011	He said to them, “You were given the secrets about the holy nation of God. Everything is told in picture-stories to those who are outside the holy nation of God.
41004012	They see, but do not know what it means. They hear, but do not understand. If they did, they might turn to God and have their sins forgiven.” (Isaiah 6:9–10)
41004013	Jesus said to them, “Do you not understand this picture-story? Then how will you understand any of the picture-stories?
41004014	What the man plants is the Word of God.
41004015	Those by the side of the road are the ones who hear the Word. As soon as they hear it, the devil comes and takes away the Word that is planted in their hearts.
41004016	The seed that fell among rocks is like people who receive the Word with joy when they hear it.
41004017	Their roots are not deep so they live only a short time. When sorrow and trouble come because of the Word, they give up and fall away.
41004018	The seed that was planted among thorns is like some people who listen to the Word.
41004019	But the cares of this life let thorns come up. A love for riches and always wanting other things let thorns grow. These things do not give the Word room to grow so it does not give grain.
41004020	The seed that fell on good ground is like people who hear the Word and understand it. They give much grain. Some give thirty times as much grain. Some give sixty times as much grain. Some give one hundred times as much grain.”
41004021	He said to them, “Is a lamp to be put under a pail or under a bed? Should it not be put on a lamp-stand?
41004022	Everything that is hidden will be brought into the light. Everything that is a secret will be made known.
41004023	You have ears, then listen!”
41004024	Jesus said to them, “Be careful what you listen to. The same amount you give will be given to you, and even more.
41004025	He who has, to him will be given. To him who does not have, even the little he has will be taken from him.”
41004026	He said, “The holy nation of God is like a man who plants seed in the ground.
41004027	He goes to sleep every night and gets up every day. The seed grows, but he does not know how.
41004028	The earth gives fruit by itself. The leaf comes first and then the young grain can be seen. And last, the grain is ready to gather.
41004029	As soon as the grain is ready, he cuts it. The time of gathering the grain has come.”
41004030	Jesus said, “In what way can we show what the holy nation of God is like? Or what picture-story can we use to help you understand?
41004031	It is like a grain of mustard seed that is planted in the ground. It is the smallest of all seeds.
41004032	After it is put in the ground, it grows and becomes the largest of the spices. It puts out long branches so birds of the sky can live in it.”
41004033	As they were able to understand, He spoke the Word to them by using many picture-stories.
41004034	Jesus helped His followers understand everything when He was alone with them.
41004035	It was evening of that same day. Jesus said to them, “Let us go over to the other side.”
41004036	After sending the people away, they took Jesus with them in a boat. It was the same boat He used when He taught them. Other little boats went along with them.
41004037	A bad wind storm came up. The waves were coming over the side of the boat. It was filling up with water.
41004038	Jesus was in the back part of the boat sleeping on a pillow. They woke Him up, crying out, “Teacher, do You not care that we are about to die?”
41004039	He got up and spoke sharp words to the wind. He said to the sea, “Be quiet! Be still.” At once the wind stopped blowing. There were no more waves.
41004040	He said to His followers, “Why are you so full of fear? Do you not have faith?”
41004041	They were very much afraid and said to each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and waves obey Him!”
41005001	Jesus and His followers came to the other side of the sea to the country of the Gerasenes.
41005002	He got out of the boat. At once a man came to Him from among the graves. This man had a demon.
41005003	He lived among the graves. No man could tie him, even with chains.
41005004	Many times he had been tied with chains on his feet. He had broken the chains as well as the irons from his hands and legs. No man was strong enough to keep him tied.
41005005	Night and day he was among the graves and in the mountains. He would cry out and cut himself with stones.
41005006	When the man with the demon saw Jesus a long way off, he ran and worshiped Him.
41005007	The man spoke with a loud voice and said, “What do You want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I ask You, in the name of God, do not hurt me!”
41005008	At the same time, Jesus was saying, “Come out of the man, you demon!”
41005009	Jesus asked the demon, “What is your name?” He said, “My name is Many, for there are many of us.”
41005010	The demons asked Jesus not to send them out of the country.
41005011	There were many pigs feeding on the mountainside.
41005012	The demons asked Him saying, “Send us to the pigs that we may go into them.”
41005013	Then Jesus let them do what they wanted to do. So they went into the pigs. The pigs ran fast down the side of the mountain and into the sea and died. There were about 2,000.
41005014	The men who cared for the pigs ran fast to the town and out to the country telling what had been done. People came to see what had happened.
41005015	They came to Jesus and saw the man who had had the demons. He was sitting with clothes on and in his right mind. The men were afraid.
41005016	Those who had seen it told what had happened to the man who had had the demons. They told what had happened to the pigs.
41005017	Then they asked Jesus to leave their country.
41005018	Jesus got into the boat. The man who had had the demons asked to go with Him.
41005019	Jesus would not let him go but said to him, “Go home to your own people. Tell them what great things the Lord has done for you. Tell them how He had pity on you.”
41005020	The man went his way and told everyone in the land of Decapolis what great things Jesus had done for him. All the people were surprised and wondered.
41005021	Then Jesus went by boat over to the other side of the sea. Many people gathered around Him. He stayed by the seashore.
41005022	Jairus was one of the leaders of the Jewish place of worship. As Jairus came to Jesus, he got down at His feet.
41005023	He cried out to Jesus and said, “My little daughter is almost dead. Come and put Your hand on her that she may be healed and live.”
41005024	Jesus went with him. Many people followed and pushed around Jesus.
41005025	A woman had been sick for twelve years with a flow of blood.
41005026	She had suffered much because of having many doctors. She had spent all the money she had. She had received no help, but became worse.
41005027	She heard about Jesus and went among the people who were following Him. She touched His coat.
41005028	For she said to herself, “If I can only touch His coat, I will be healed.”
41005029	At once the flow of blood stopped. She felt in her body that she was healed of her sickness.
41005030	At the same time Jesus knew that power had gone from Him. He turned and said to the people following Him, “Who touched My coat?”
41005031	His followers said to Him, “You see the many people pushing on every side. Why do You ask, ‘Who touched My coat?’ ”
41005032	He looked around to see who had done it.
41005033	The woman was filled with fear when she knew what had happened to her. She came and got down before Jesus and told Him the truth.
41005034	He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be free from your sickness.”
41005035	While Jesus spoke, men came from the house of the leader of the place of worship. They said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher anymore?”
41005036	Jesus heard this. He said to the leader of the Jewish place of worship, “Do not be afraid, just believe.”
41005037	He allowed no one to go with Him but Peter and James and John, the brother of James.
41005038	They came to the house where the leader of the place of worship lived. Jesus found many people making much noise and crying.
41005039	He went in and asked them, “Why is there so much noise and crying? The girl is not dead. She is sleeping.”
41005040	They laughed at Jesus. But He sent them all out of the room. Then He took the girl’s father and mother and those who were with Him. They went into the room where the girl was.
41005041	He took the girl by the hand and said, “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”
41005042	At once the girl got up and walked. She was twelve years old. They were very much surprised and wondered about it.
41005043	He spoke sharp words to them that they should not tell anyone. He told them to give her something to eat.
41006001	Jesus went from the house of Jairus and came to His home town. His followers came after Him.
41006002	On the Day of Rest He began to teach in the Jewish place of worship. Many people heard Him. They were surprised and wondered, saying, “Where did this Man get all this? What wisdom is this that has been given to Him? How can He do these powerful works with His hands?
41006003	Is He not a Man Who makes things from wood? Is He not the Son of Mary and the brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? Do not His sisters live here with us?” The people were ashamed of Him and turned away from Him.
41006004	Jesus said to them, “One who speaks for God is respected everywhere but in his own country and among his own family and in his own house.”
41006005	So Jesus could do no powerful works there. But He did put His hands on a few sick people and healed them.
41006006	He wondered because they had no faith. But He went around to the towns and taught as He went.
41006007	Jesus called the twelve followers to Him and began to send them out two by two. He gave them power over demons.
41006008	He told them to take nothing along with them but a walking stick. They were not to take a bag or food or money in their belts.
41006009	They were to wear shoes. They were not to take two coats.
41006010	He said to them, “Whatever house you go into, stay there until you leave that town.
41006011	Whoever does not take you in or listen to you, when you leave there, shake the dust off your feet. By doing that, you will speak against them. For sure, I tell you, it will be easier for the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day men stand before God and are judged than for that city.”
41006012	Then they left. They preached that men should be sorry for their sins and turn from them.
41006013	They put out many demons. They poured oil on many people that were sick and healed them.
41006014	King Herod heard about Jesus because everyone was talking about Him. Some people said, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead. That is why he is doing such powerful works.”
41006015	Other people said, “He is Elijah.” Others said, “He is one who speaks for God like one of the early preachers.”
41006016	When Herod heard this, he said, “It is John the Baptist, whose head I cut off. He has been raised from the dead.”
41006017	For Herod had sent men to take John and put him into prison. He did this because of his wife, Herodias. She had been the wife of his brother Philip.
41006018	John the Baptist had said to Herod, “It is wrong for you to have your brother’s wife.”
41006019	Herodias became angry with him. She wanted to have John the Baptist killed but she could not.
41006020	Herod was afraid of John. He knew he was a good man and right with God, and he kept John from being hurt or killed. He liked to listen to John preach. But when he did, he became troubled.
41006021	Then Herodias found a way to have John killed. Herod gave a big supper on his birthday. He asked the leaders of the country and army captains and the leaders of Galilee to come.
41006022	The daughter of Herodias came in and danced before them. This made Herod and his friends happy. The king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you want and I will give it to you.”
41006023	Then he made a promise to her, “Whatever you ask for, I will give it to you. I will give you even half of my nation.”
41006024	She went to her mother and asked, “What should I ask for?” The mother answered, “I want the head of John the Baptist.”
41006025	At once the girl went to Herod. She said, “I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a plate now.”
41006026	Herod was very sorry. He had to do it because of his promise and because of those who ate with him.
41006027	At once he sent one of his soldiers and told him to bring the head of John the Baptist. The soldier went to the prison and cut off John’s head.
41006028	He took John’s head in on a plate and gave it to the girl. The girl gave it to her mother.
41006029	John’s followers heard this. They went and took his body and buried it.
41006030	The followers of Jesus came back to Him. They told Jesus all they had done and taught.
41006031	He said to them, “Come away from the people. Be by yourselves and rest.” There were many people coming and going. They had had no time even to eat.
41006032	They went by themselves in a boat to a desert.
41006033	Many people saw them leave and knew who they were. People ran fast from all the cities and got there first.
41006034	When Jesus got out of the boat, He saw many people gathered together. He had loving-pity for them. They were like sheep without a shepherd. He began to teach them many things.
41006035	The day was almost gone. The followers of Jesus came to Him. They said, “This is a desert. It is getting late.
41006036	Tell the people to go to the towns and villages and buy food for themselves.”
41006037	He said to them, “Give them something to eat.” They said to Him, “Are we to go and buy many loaves of bread and give it to them?”
41006038	He said to them, “How many loaves of bread do you have here? Go and see.” When they knew, they said, “Five loaves of bread and two fish.”
41006039	Then He told them to have all the people sit down together in groups on the green grass.
41006040	They sat down in groups of fifty people and in groups of one hundred people.
41006041	Jesus took the five loaves of bread and two fish. He looked up to heaven and gave thanks. He broke the loaves in pieces and gave them to the followers to set before the people. He divided the two fish among them all.
41006042	They all ate and were filled.
41006043	After that the followers picked up twelve baskets full of pieces of bread and fish.
41006044	About five thousand men ate the bread.
41006045	At once Jesus had His followers get into the boat and go ahead of Him to the other side to the town of Bethsaida. He sent the people away.
41006046	When they were all gone, He went up to the mountain to pray.
41006047	It was evening. The boat was half-way across the sea. Jesus was alone on the land.
41006048	He saw His followers were in trouble. The wind was against them. They were working very hard rowing the boat. About three o’clock in the morning Jesus came to them walking on the sea. He would have gone past them.
41006049	When the followers saw Him walking on the water, they thought it was a spirit and cried out with fear.
41006050	For they all saw Him and were afraid. At once Jesus talked to them. He said, “Take hope. It is I, do not be afraid.”
41006051	He came over to them and got into the boat. The wind stopped. They were very much surprised and wondered about it.
41006052	They had not learned what they should have learned from the loaves because their hearts were hard.
41006053	Then they crossed the sea and came to the land of Gennesaret and went to shore.
41006054	When Jesus got out of the boat, the people knew Him at once.
41006055	They ran through all the country bringing people who were sick on their beds to Jesus.
41006056	Wherever He went, they would lay the sick people in the streets in the center of town where people gather. They begged Him that they might touch the bottom of His coat. Everyone who did was healed. This happened in the towns and in the cities and in the country where He went.
41007001	The proud religious law-keepers and some of the teachers of the Law had come from Jerusalem. They gathered around Jesus.
41007002	They had seen some of His followers eat bread without washing their hands.
41007003	The proud religious law-keepers and all the Jews never eat until they wash their hands. They keep the teaching that was given to them by their early fathers.
41007004	When they come from the stores, they never eat until they wash. There are many other teachings they keep. Some are the washing of cups and pots and pans in a special way.
41007005	Then the proud religious law-keepers and the teachers of the Law asked Jesus, “Why do Your followers not obey the teaching given to them by their early fathers? They eat bread without washing their hands.”
41007006	He said to them, “Isaiah told about you who pretend to be someone you are not. Isaiah wrote, ‘These people honor Me with their lips, but their hearts are far from Me.
41007007	Their worship of Me is worth nothing. They teach what men say must be done.’ (Isaiah 29:13)
41007008	You put away the Laws of God and obey the laws made by men.”
41007009	Jesus said to them, “You put away the Laws of God but keep your own teaching.
41007010	Moses said, ‘Respect your father and mother.’ (Exodus 20:12) ‘He who curses his father and mother will be put to death!’ (Exodus 21:17)
41007011	But you say that it is right if a man does not help his father and mother because he says he has given to God what he could have given to them.
41007012	You are not making him do anything for his father and mother.
41007013	You are putting away the Word of God to keep your own teaching. You are doing many things like this.”
41007014	Jesus called the people to Him again. He said, “Listen to Me, all of you, and understand this.
41007015	It is not what goes into a man’s mouth from the outside that makes his mind and heart sinful. It is what comes out from the inside that makes him sinful.
41007016	You have ears, then listen!”
41007017	He went into the house away from all the people. His followers began to ask about the picture-story.
41007018	He said to them, “Do you not understand yet? Do you not understand that whatever goes into a man cannot make him sinful?
41007019	It does not go into his heart, but into his stomach and then on out of his body.” In this way, He was saying that all food is clean.
41007020	He said, “Whatever comes out of a man is what makes the man sinful.
41007021	From the inside, out of the heart of men come bad thoughts, sex sins of a married person, sex sins of a person not married, killing other people,
41007022	stealing, wanting something that belongs to someone else, doing wrong, lying, having a desire for sex sins, having a mind that is always looking for sin, speaking against God, thinking you are better than you are and doing foolish things.
41007023	All these bad things come from the inside and make the man sinful.”
41007024	Jesus went from their towns and cities to the cities of Tyre and Sidon. He went into a house and wanted to stay there without people knowing where He was. But He could not hide Himself.
41007025	A woman who had a daughter with a demon heard of Him. She came and got down at His feet.
41007026	The woman was not a Jew. She was from the country of Syrophenicia. She asked Jesus if He would put the demon out of her daughter.
41007027	Jesus said to her, “Let the children have what they want first. It is wrong to take children’s food and throw it to the dogs.”
41007028	She said to Him, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the pieces that fall from the children’s table.”
41007029	He said to her, “Because of what you have said, go your way. The demon is gone out of your daughter.”
41007030	So she went to her house and found the demon was gone and her daughter was lying on the bed.
41007031	Then Jesus left the cities of Tyre and Sidon. He came back to the Sea of Galilee by way of the land of Decapolis.
41007032	They took a man to Him who could not hear or speak well. They asked Jesus to put His hand on him.
41007033	Jesus took him away from the other people. He put His fingers into the man’s ears. He spit and put His finger on the man’s tongue.
41007034	Then Jesus looked up to heaven and breathed deep within. He said to the man, “Be opened!”
41007035	At once his ears were opened. His tongue was made loose and he spoke as other people.
41007036	Then Jesus told them they should tell no one. The more He told them this, the more they told what He had done.
41007037	They were very much surprised and wondered about it. They said, “He has done all things well. He makes those who could not hear so they can hear. He makes those who could not speak so they can speak.”
41008001	In those days many people were gathered together. They had nothing to eat. Jesus called His followers to Him and said,
41008002	“I pity these people because they have been with Me three days and have nothing to eat.
41008003	If I send them home without food, they may be too weak as they go. Many of them have come a long way.”
41008004	His followers said to Him, “Where can anyone get enough bread for them here in this desert?”
41008005	He asked them, “How many loaves of bread do you have?” They said, “Seven.”
41008006	Then He told the people to sit down on the ground. Jesus took the seven loaves of bread and gave thanks to God. He broke the loaves and gave them to His followers to give to the people. The followers gave the bread to them.
41008007	They had a few small fish also. He gave thanks to God and told the followers to give the fish to them.
41008008	They all ate and were filled. They picked up seven baskets full of pieces of bread and fish after the people were finished eating.

41008011	The proud religious law-keepers came and began to ask Him for something special to see from heaven. They wanted to trap Jesus.
41008012	He breathed deep within and said, “Why do the people of this day look for something special to see? For sure, I tell you, the people of this day will have nothing special to see from heaven.”
41008013	Then He left them. He got in the boat and went to the other side of the sea.
41008014	The followers had forgotten to take bread, only one loaf was in the boat.
41008015	He said to them, “Look out! Have nothing to do with the yeast of the proud religious law-keepers and of Herod.”
41008016	They talked about it among themselves. They said, “He said this because we forgot to bring bread.”
41008017	Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said to them, “Why are you talking among yourselves about forgetting to bring bread? Do you not understand? Is it not plain to you? Are your hearts still hard?
41008018	You have eyes, do you not see? You have ears, do you not hear? Do you not remember?
41008019	When I divided the five loaves of bread among the five thousand, how many baskets full of pieces did you pick up?” They said, “Twelve.”
41008020	“When I divided the seven loaves of bread among the four thousand, how many baskets full of pieces did you pick up?” They said, “Seven.”
41008021	Then He asked, “Why do you not understand yet?”
41008022	Then they came to the town of Bethsaida. Some people brought a blind man to Jesus. They asked if He would touch him.
41008023	He took the blind man by the hand out of town. Then He spit on the eyes of the blind man and put His hands on him. He asked, “Do you see anything?”
41008024	The blind man looked up and said, “I see some men. They look like trees, walking.”
41008025	Jesus put His hands on the man’s eyes again and told him to look up. Then he was healed and saw everything well.
41008026	Jesus sent him to his home and said, “Do not go into the town, or tell it to anyone there.”
41008027	Jesus and His followers went from there to the towns of Caesarea Philippi. As they went, He asked His followers, “Who do people say that I am?”
41008028	They answered, “Some say John the Baptist and some say Elijah and others say one of the early preachers.”
41008029	He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter said, “You are the Christ.”
41008030	He told them with strong words that they should tell no one about Him.
41008031	He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things. He told them that the leaders and the religious leaders of the Jews and the teachers of the Law would have nothing to do with Him. He told them He would be killed and three days later He would be raised from the dead.
41008032	He had said this in plain words. Peter took Him away from the others and began to speak sharp words to Him.
41008033	Jesus turned around. He looked at His followers and spoke sharp words to Peter. He said, “Get behind Me, Satan! Your thoughts are not thoughts from God but from men.”
41008034	Jesus called the people and His followers to Him. He said to them, “If anyone wants to be My follower, he must give up himself and his own desires. He must take up his cross and follow Me.
41008035	If anyone wants to keep his own life safe, he will lose it. If anyone gives up his life because of Me and because of the Good News, he will save it.
41008036	For what does a man have if he gets all the world and loses his own soul?
41008037	What can a man give to buy back his soul?
41008038	Whoever is ashamed of Me and My Words among the sinful people of this day, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when He comes in the shining-greatness of His Father and His holy angels.”
41009001	Jesus said to them, “For sure I tell you, some standing here will not die until they see the holy nation of God come with power!”
41009002	Six days later Jesus took Peter and James and John with Him. He led them up to a high mountain by themselves. Jesus was changed as they looked at Him.
41009003	His clothes did shine. They were as white as snow. No one on earth could clean them so white.
41009004	Moses and Elijah were seen talking to Jesus.
41009005	Peter said to Jesus, “Teacher, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three tents to worship in. One will be for You and one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
41009006	Peter did not know what to say. They were very much afraid.
41009007	A cloud came over them and a voice from the cloud said, “This is My much-loved Son. Listen to Him.”
41009008	At once they looked around but saw no one there but Jesus.
41009009	They came down from the mountain. Then Jesus said with strong words that they should tell no one what they had seen. They should wait until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
41009010	So they kept those words to themselves, talking to each other about what He meant by being raised from the dead.
41009011	They asked Jesus, “Why do the teachers of the Law say that Elijah must come first?”
41009012	He said to them, “For sure, Elijah will come first and get things ready. Is it not written that the Son of Man must suffer many things and that men will have nothing to do with Him? (Isaiah 53:3)
41009013	But I say to you, Elijah has already come. They did to him whatever they wanted to do. It is written that they would.”
41009014	When Jesus came back to His followers, He saw many people standing around them. The teachers of the Law were arguing with them.
41009015	The people saw Jesus and were surprised and ran to greet Him.
41009016	Jesus asked the teachers of the Law, “What are you arguing about with them?”
41009017	One of the people said, “Teacher, I brought my son to You. He has a demon in him and cannot talk.
41009018	Wherever the demon takes him, it throws him down. Spit runs from his mouth. He grinds his teeth. He is getting weaker. I asked Your followers to put the demon out but they could not.”
41009019	He said, “You people of this day have no faith. How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring the boy to Me.”
41009020	They brought the boy to Jesus. The demon saw Jesus and at once held the boy in his power. The boy fell to the ground with spit running from his mouth.
41009021	Jesus asked the boy’s father, “How long has he been like this?” The father said, “From the time he was a child.
41009022	Many times it throws him into the fire and into the water to kill him. If You can do anything to help us, take pity on us!”
41009023	Jesus said to him, “Why do you ask Me that? The one who has faith can do all things.”
41009024	At once the father cried out. He said with tears in his eyes, “Lord, I have faith. Help my weak faith to be stronger!”
41009025	Jesus saw that many people were gathering together in a hurry. He spoke sharp words to the demon. He said, “Demon! You who cannot speak or hear, I say to you, come out of him! Do not ever go into him again.”
41009026	The demon gave a cry. It threw the boy down and came out of him. The boy was so much like a dead man that people said, “He is dead!”
41009027	But Jesus took him by the hand and helped him and he stood up.
41009028	When Jesus went into the house, His followers asked Him when He was alone, “Why could we not put out the demon?”
41009029	He said to them, “The only way this kind of demon is put out is by prayer and by going without food so you can pray better.”
41009030	From there Jesus and His followers went through the country of Galilee. He did not want anyone to know where He was.
41009031	He taught His followers, saying, “The Son of Man will be handed over to men. They will kill Him. Three days after He is killed, He will be raised from the dead.”
41009032	They did not understand what He said and were afraid to ask Him.
41009033	They came to the city of Capernaum and were in the house. Jesus asked His followers, “What were you arguing about along the road?”
41009034	They did not answer. They had been arguing along the road about who was the greatest.
41009035	Jesus sat down and called the followers to Him. He said, “If anyone wants to be first, he must be last of all. He will be the one to care for all.”
41009036	Jesus took a child and stood it among them. Then He took the child up in His arms and said to the followers,
41009037	“Whoever receives one of these little children in My name, receives Me. Whoever will receive Me, receives not Me, but Him Who sent Me.”
41009038	John said to Him, “Teacher, we saw someone putting out demons in Your name. We told him to stop because he was not following us.”
41009039	Jesus said, “Do not stop him. No one who does a powerful work in My name can say anything bad about Me soon after.
41009040	The person who is not against us is for us.
41009041	For sure, I tell you, whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in My name because you belong to Christ will not lose his reward from God.
41009042	Whoever is the reason for one of these little ones who believes in Me to sin, it would be better for him to have a large stone put around his neck and to be thrown into the sea.
41009043	If your hand is the reason you fall into sin, cut it off. It is better to go into life without a hand, than to have two hands and go into the fire of hell that cannot be put out.
41009044	There is where their worm never dies and the fire cannot be put out.
41009045	If your foot is the reason you fall into sin, cut it off. It is better to go into life with only one foot, than to have two feet and go into the fire of hell that cannot be put out.
41009046	There is where their worm never dies and the fire cannot be put out.
41009047	If your eye is the reason you fall into sin, take it out. It is better to go into the holy nation of God with only one eye, than to have two eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.
41009048	There is where their worm never dies and the fire is never put out.
41009049	“Everyone will be made cleaner and stronger with fire.
41009050	Salt is good. But if salt loses its taste, how can it be made to taste like salt again? Have salt in yourselves and be at peace with each other.”
41010001	Jesus went away from the city of Capernaum. He came to the country of Judea and to the other side of the Jordan River. Again the people gathered around Him. He began to teach them as He had been doing.
41010002	The proud religious law-keepers came to Him. They tried to trap Him and asked, “Does the Law say a man can divorce his wife?”
41010003	He said to them, “What did the Law of Moses say?”
41010004	They said, “Moses allowed a man to divorce his wife, if he put it in writing and gave it to her.”
41010005	Jesus said to them, “Because of your hard hearts, Moses gave you this Law.
41010006	From the beginning of the world, God made them man and woman.
41010007	Because of this, a man is to leave his father and mother and is to live with his wife.
41010008	The two will become one. So they are no longer two, but one.
41010009	Let no man divide what God has put together.”
41010010	In the house the followers asked Jesus about this again.
41010011	He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another is not faithful to her and is guilty of a sex sin.
41010012	If a woman divorces her husband and marries another, she is not faithful to her husband and is guilty of a sex sin.”
41010013	They brought little children to Jesus that He might put His hand on them. The followers spoke sharp words to those who brought them.
41010014	Jesus saw this and was angry with the followers. He said, “Let the little children come to Me. Do not stop them. The holy nation of God is made up of ones like these.
41010015	For sure, I tell you, whoever does not receive the holy nation of God as a little child does not go into it.”
41010016	He took the children in His arms. He put His hands on them and prayed that good would come to them.
41010017	Jesus was going on His way. A man ran to Him and got down on his knees. He said, “Good Teacher, what must I do to have life that lasts forever?”
41010018	Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? There is only One Who is good. That is God.
41010019	You know the Laws, ‘Do not be guilty of sex sins in marriage. Do not kill another person. Do not take things from people in wrong ways. Do not steal. Do not lie. Respect your father and mother.’ ”
41010020	The man said to Jesus, “Teacher, I have obeyed all these Laws since I was a boy.”
41010021	Jesus looked at him with love and said, “There is one thing for you to do yet. Go and sell everything you have and give the money to poor people. You will have riches in heaven. Then come and follow Me.”
41010022	When the man heard these words, he was sad. He walked away with sorrow because he had many riches here on earth.
41010023	Jesus looked around Him. He said to His followers, “How hard it is for rich people to get into the holy nation of God!”
41010024	The followers were surprised and wondered about His words. But Jesus said to them again, “Children! How hard it is for those who put their trust in riches to get into the holy nation of God!
41010025	It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to go to heaven.”
41010026	They were very surprised and wondered, saying to themselves, “Then who can be saved from the punishment of sin?”
41010027	Jesus looked at them and said, “This cannot be done by men but God can do anything.”
41010028	Then Peter began to say to Him, “We have given up everything we had and have followed You.”
41010029	Jesus said, “For sure, I tell you, there are those who have given up houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands because of Me, and the Good News.
41010030	They will get back one hundred times as much now at this time in houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands. Along with this, they will have very much trouble. And they will have life that lasts forever in the world to come.
41010031	Many who are first will be last. Many who are last will be first.”
41010032	They were on their way to Jerusalem. Jesus walked in front of them. Those who followed were surprised and afraid. Then Jesus took the twelve followers by themselves. He told them what would happen to Him.
41010033	He said, “Listen, we are going to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the religious leaders of the Jews and to the teachers of the Law. They will say that He must be put to death. They will hand Him over to the people who are not Jews.
41010034	They will make fun of Him and will beat Him. They will spit on Him and will kill Him. But three days later He will be raised from the dead.”
41010035	James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus. They said, “Teacher, we would like to have You do for us whatever we ask You.”
41010036	He said to them, “What would you like to have Me do for you?”
41010037	They said to Him, “Let one of us sit by Your right side and the other by Your left side when You receive Your great honor in heaven.”
41010038	Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you ask. Can you take the suffering I am about to take? Can you be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
41010039	They said to Him, “Yes, we can.” Jesus said to them, “You will, for sure, suffer the way I will suffer. You will be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with.
41010040	But to sit on My right side or on My left side is not for Me to give. It will be given to those for whom it has been made ready.”
41010041	The other ten followers heard it. They were angry with James and John.
41010042	Jesus called them to Him and said, “You know that those who are made leaders over the nations show their power to the people. Important leaders use their power over the people.
41010043	It must not be that way with you. Whoever wants to be great among you, let him care for you.
41010044	Whoever wants to be first among you, must be the one who is owned and cares for all.
41010045	For the Son of Man did not come to be cared for. He came to care for others. He came to give His life so that many could be bought by His blood and be made free from sin.”
41010046	Then they came to the city of Jericho. When He was leaving the city with His followers and many people, a blind man was sitting by the road. He was asking people for food or money as they passed by. His name was Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus.
41010047	He heard that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by. He began to speak with a loud voice, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, take pity on me!”
41010048	Many people spoke sharp words to the blind man telling him not to call out like that. But he spoke all the more. He said, “Son of David, take pity on me.”
41010049	Jesus stopped and told them to call the blind man. They called to him and said, “Take hope! Stand up, He is calling for you!”
41010050	As he jumped up, he threw off his coat and came to Jesus.
41010051	Jesus said to him, “What do you want Me to do for you?” The blind man said to Him, “Lord, I want to see!”
41010052	Jesus said, “Go! Your faith has healed you.” At once he could see and he followed Jesus down the road.
41011001	Jesus and His followers were near Jerusalem at the Mount of Olives. They were in the towns of Bethphage and Bethany. Jesus sent two of His followers on ahead.
41011002	He said to them, “Go into the town over there. As soon as you get there, you will find a young donkey tied. No man has ever sat on it. Let the donkey loose and bring it here.
41011003	If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing that?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it. He will send it back again soon.’”
41011004	The two followers went on their way. They found the young donkey tied by the door where two streets crossed. They took the rope off its neck.
41011005	Some men were standing there. They said to the two followers, “Why are you taking the rope off that young donkey?”
41011006	The two followers told them what Jesus had said and the men let them take the donkey.
41011007	They brought it to Jesus and put their coats over it. Jesus sat on the donkey.
41011008	Many people put their clothes down on the road. Others cut branches off the trees and put them down on the road.
41011009	Those who went in front and those who followed spoke with loud voices, “Greatest One! Great and honored is He Who comes in the name of the Lord!
41011010	Great is the coming holy nation of our father David. It will come in the name of the Lord, Greatest One in the highest heaven.”
41011011	Jesus came to Jerusalem and went into the house of God. He looked around at everything. Then He went with the twelve followers to the town of Bethany because it was late.
41011012	They came from Bethany the next morning. Jesus was hungry.
41011013	Along the road He saw a fig tree with leaves on it. He went over to see if it had any fruit. He saw nothing but leaves. It was not the right time for figs.
41011014	Jesus said to the tree, “Let no one ever again eat fruit from you.” His followers heard Him say it.
41011015	Then they came to Jerusalem. Jesus went into the house of God. He began to make the people leave who were selling and buying in the house of God. He turned over the tables of the men who changed money. He turned over the seats of those who sold doves.
41011016	He would not allow anyone to carry a pot or pan through the house of God.
41011017	He taught them saying, “Is it not written, ‘My house is to be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? (Isaiah 56:7; Jeremiah 7:11) You have made it a place of robbers.”
41011018	The teachers of the Law and the religious leaders of the Jews heard it. They tried to find some way to put Jesus to death. But they were afraid of Him because all the people were surprised and wondered about His teaching.
41011019	When evening came, Jesus and His followers went out of the city.
41011020	In the morning they passed by the fig tree. They saw it was dried up from the roots.
41011021	Peter remembered what had happened the day before and said to Jesus, “Teacher, see! The fig tree which You spoke to has dried up!”
41011022	Jesus said to them, “Have faith in God.
41011023	For sure, I tell you, a person may say to this mountain, ‘Move from here into the sea.’ And if he does not doubt, but believes that what he says will be done, it will happen.
41011024	Because of this, I say to you, whatever you ask for when you pray, have faith that you will receive it. Then you will get it.
41011025	When you stand to pray, if you have anything against anyone, forgive him. Then your Father in heaven will forgive your sins also.
41011026	If you do not forgive them their sins, your Father in heaven will not forgive your sins.”
41011027	They came again to Jerusalem. Jesus was walking around in the house of God. The religious leaders and the teachers of the Law and other leaders came to Him.
41011028	They asked, “How do You have the right and the power to do these things? Who gave You the right and the power to do them?”
41011029	Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing also. If you tell Me, then I will tell you by what right and power I do these things.
41011030	Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men? Tell Me.”
41011031	They talked among themselves. They said, “If we say from heaven, He will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
41011032	But how can we say, ‘From men’?” They were afraid of the people because everyone believed that John was one who spoke for God.
41011033	So they said, “We do not know.” Then Jesus said, “Then I will not tell you by what right and power I do these things.”
41012001	Jesus began to teach them by using picture-stories, saying, “There was a man who planted grapes in a field. He put a fence around it and made a place for making wine. He built a tower to look over the field. Then he let farmers rent it and went into another country.
41012002	“The time came for gathering the grapes. He sent his servant to the farmers to get some of the grapes.
41012003	The farmers took him and beat him. They sent him back with nothing.
41012004	The owner sent another servant. The farmers threw stones at him and hit him on the head and did other bad things to him.
41012005	Again the owner sent another servant. The farmers killed that one. Many other servants were sent. They beat some and they killed others.
41012006	“He had a much-loved son to send yet. So last of all he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
41012007	The farmers said to themselves, ‘This is the one who will get everything when the owner dies. Let us kill him and we will get everything.’
41012008	They took him and killed him. They threw his body outside the field.
41012009	What will the owner of the field do? He will come and kill the farmers. He will give the field to other farmers.
41012010	“Have you not read what the Holy Writings say? ‘The Stone that was put aside by the workmen has become the most important Stone in the corner of the building.
41012011	The Lord has done this. It is great in our eyes.’ ” (Psalm 118:22–23)
41012012	The leaders wanted to take Him but they were afraid of the people. They knew He had told the picture-story against them. They left Him and went away.
41012013	Some of the proud religious law-keepers and Herod’s men were sent to trap Jesus in His talk.
41012014	They came to Him and said, “Teacher, we know You are true. We know You are not afraid of what men think or say about You. You teach the way of God in truth. Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?
41012015	Should we pay or not pay?” Jesus knew how they pretended to be someone they were not. He said to them, “Why do you try to trap Me? Bring Me a small piece of money so I may look at it.”
41012016	They brought Him one. He asked them, “Whose picture is this? Whose name is on it?” They answered, “Caesar’s.”
41012017	Then Jesus said to them, “Pay to Caesar the things that belong to Caesar. Pay to God the things that belong to God.” They were surprised and wondered at Him.
41012018	Some people from the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Jesus. They asked Him,
41012019	“Teacher, Moses gave us a Law. It said, ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves his wife behind, but no children, then his brother should marry his wife and raise children for his brother.’ (Deuteronomy 25:5)
41012020	There were seven brothers. The first was married. He died before he had any children.
41012021	The second married her and died. He had no children. The same happened with the third.
41012022	All seven had her for a wife. All died without children. Last of all the woman died.
41012023	When people are raised from the dead, whose wife will she be? All seven had her for a wife.”
41012024	Jesus said to them, “Is this not the reason you are wrong, because you do not know the Holy Writings or the power of God?
41012025	When people are raised from the dead, they do not marry and are not given in marriage. They are like angels in heaven.
41012026	As for the dead being raised, have you not read in the book of Moses how God spoke to him in the burning bush? He said, ‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.’ (Exodus 3:2–6)
41012027	He is not the God of the dead, He is the God of the living. So you are very much wrong.”
41012028	Then one of the teachers of the Law heard them arguing. He thought Jesus had spoken well. He asked Him, “Which Law is the greatest of all?”
41012029	Jesus said to him, “The greatest Law is this, ‘Listen, Jewish people, The Lord our God is one Lord!
41012030	You must love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’ (Deuteronomy 6:4–5) This is the first Law.
41012031	“The second Law is this: ‘You must love your neighbor as yourself.’ (Leviticus 19:18) No other Law is greater than these.”
41012032	Then the teacher of the Law said, “Teacher, You have told the truth. There is one God. There is no other God but Him.
41012033	A man should love Him with all his heart and with all his understanding. He should love Him with all his soul and with all his strength and love his neighbor as himself. This is more important than to bring animals to be burned on the altar or to give God other gifts on the altar in worship.”
41012034	Jesus saw he had spoken with understanding. He said to him, “You are not far from the holy nation of God.” After that no one thought they could ask Him anything.
41012035	Jesus was in the house of God teaching. He asked, “How do the teachers of the Law say that Christ is the Son of David?
41012036	For David himself, led by the Holy Spirit, said, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, sit at my right side until I make those who hate You a place to rest Your feet.’ (Psalm 110:1)
41012037	David himself calls Him Lord. Then how can He be his son?” Many people were glad to hear Him.
41012038	Jesus taught them, saying, “Look out for the teachers of the Law. They like to walk around in long coats. They like to have the respect of men as they stand in the center of town where people gather.
41012039	They like to have the important seats in the places of worship and the important places at big suppers.
41012040	They take houses from poor women whose husbands have died. They cover up the bad they do by saying long prayers. They will be punished all the more.”
41012041	Jesus sat near the money box in the house of God. He watched the people putting in money. Many of them were rich and gave much money.
41012042	A poor woman whose husband had died came by and gave two very small pieces of money.
41012043	Jesus called His followers to Him. He said, “For sure, I tell you, this poor woman whose husband has died has given more money than all the others.
41012044	They all gave of that which was more than they needed for their own living. She is poor and yet she gave all she had, even what she needed for her own living.”
41013001	Jesus went out of the house of God. One of His followers said to Him, “Teacher, look at the big stones and these great buildings!”
41013002	Jesus said, “Do you see these great buildings? All these stones will be thrown down. Not one will be left standing on another.”
41013003	Jesus sat down on the Mount of Olives at a place where He could see the house of God. Peter and James and John and Andrew came to Him. They asked without anyone else hearing,
41013004	“Tell us when this will be. What are we to look for when these things are to happen?”
41013005	Jesus began to say to them, “Be careful that no one leads you the wrong way.
41013006	Many people will come using My name. They will say, ‘I am Christ.’ They will turn many to the wrong way.
41013007	When you hear of wars and much talk about wars, do not be surprised. These things have to happen. But the end is not yet.
41013008	Nations will have wars with other nations. Countries will fight against countries. The earth will shake and break apart in different places. There will be no food for people. There will be much trouble. These things are the beginning of much sorrow and pain.
41013009	“Watch out for yourselves. They will take you to the courts. In the places of worship they will beat you. You will be taken in front of rulers and in front of kings because of Me. You will be there to tell them about Me.
41013010	The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.
41013011	“When you are put into their hands, do not be afraid of what you are to say or how you are to say it. Whatever is given to you to say at that time, say it. It will not be you who speaks, but the Holy Spirit.
41013012	A brother will hand over a brother to death. A father will hand over his son. Children will turn against their parents and have them put to death.
41013013	You will be hated by all people because of Me. But he who stays true to the end will be saved.
41013014	“You will see a very sinful man-made god standing in the house of God where it has no right to stand. Then those in the country of Judea should run to the mountains. It was spoken of by the early preacher Daniel. (Daniel 9:27; 12:11) The one who reads this should understand.
41013015	He that is on the top of the house should not take the time to get anything out of his house.
41013016	He that is in the field should not go back to get his coat.
41013017	It will be hard for women who will soon be mothers. It will be hard for those feeding babies in those days!
41013018	Pray that it will not be during the winter.
41013019	In those days there will be much trouble and pain and sorrow. It has never been this bad from the beginning of time and never will be again.
41013020	If the Lord had not made those days short, no life would have been saved. Because of God’s people whom He has chosen, He made the days short.
41013021	“If anyone says to you, ‘See! Here is the Christ,’ or, ‘There He is!’ do not believe it.
41013022	Some will come who will say they are Christ. False preachers will come. These people will do special things for people to see. They will do surprising things, so that if it can be, God’s people will be led to believe something wrong.
41013023	See! I have told you about these things before they happen.
41013024	“After those days of much trouble and pain and sorrow are over, the sun will get dark. The moon will not give light.
41013025	The stars will fall from the sky. The powers in the heavens will be shaken.
41013026	Then they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and shining-greatness.
41013027	He will send His angels. They will gather together God’s people from the four winds. They will come from one end of the earth to the other end of heaven.
41013028	“Now learn something from the fig tree. When the branch begins to grow and puts out its leaves, you know summer is near.
41013029	In the same way, when you see all these things happen, you know the Son of Man is near. He is even at the door.
41013030	For sure, I tell you, the people of this day will not pass away before all these things have happened.
41013031	“Heaven and earth will pass away, but My Words will not pass away.
41013032	But no one knows the day or the hour. No! Not even the angels in heaven know. The Son does not know. Only the Father knows.
41013033	“Be careful! Watch and pray. You do not know when it will happen.
41013034	The coming of the Son of Man is as a man who went from his house to a far country. He gave each one of his servants some work to do. He told the one standing at the door to watch.
41013035	In the same way, you are to watch also! You do not know when the Owner of the house will be coming. It may be in the evening or in the night or when the sun comes up or in the morning.
41013036	He may come when you are not looking for Him and find you sleeping.
41013037	What I say to you, I say to all. Watch!”
41014001	It was now two days before the supper of the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt and the supper of bread without yeast. The religious leaders and the teachers of the Law tried to trap Jesus. They tried to take Him so they could put Him to death.
41014002	These men said, “This must not happen on the day of the special supper. The people would be against it and make much trouble.”
41014003	Jesus was in the town of Bethany eating in the house of Simon. Simon was a man with a very bad skin disease. A woman came with a jar of special perfume. She had given much money for this. She broke the jar and poured the special perfume on the head of Jesus.
41014004	Some of them were angry. They said, “Why was this special perfume wasted?
41014005	This perfume could have been sold for much money and given to poor people.” They spoke against her.
41014006	Jesus said, “Let her alone. Why are you giving her trouble? She has done a good thing to Me.
41014007	You will have poor people with you all the time. Whenever you want, you can do something good for them. You will not have Me all the time.
41014008	She did what she could. She put this perfume on My body to make Me ready for the grave.
41014009	For sure, I tell you, wherever this Good News is preached in all the world, this woman will be remembered for what she has done.”
41014010	Judas Iscariot was one of the twelve followers. He went to the head religious leaders of the Jews to talk about how he might hand Jesus over to them.
41014011	When the leaders heard it, they were glad. They promised to give Judas money. Then he looked for a way to hand Jesus over.
41014012	The first day of the supper of bread without yeast was the day to kill an animal. It was for the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. His followers said to Jesus, “What place do You want us to make ready for You to eat this special supper?”
41014013	Jesus sent two of His followers on ahead and said to them, “Go into the city. There a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
41014014	He will go into a house. You say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher asks, “Where is the room you keep for friends, where I can eat this special supper with My followers?” ’
41014015	He will take you to a large room on the second floor with everything in it. Make it ready for us.”
41014016	The followers went from there and came into the city. They found everything as Jesus had said. They made things ready for the special supper.
41014017	In the evening He came with the twelve followers.
41014018	They sat at the table and ate. Jesus said, “For sure, I tell you, one of you will hand Me over to be killed. He is eating with Me.”
41014019	They were very sad. They said to Him one after the other, “Is it I?”
41014020	He said to them, “It is one of the twelve followers. It is the one who is putting his hand with mine into the same dish.
41014021	The Son of Man is going away as it is written of Him. But it will be bad for that man who hands the Son of Man over to be killed! It would have been better if he had not been born!”
41014022	As they were eating, Jesus took a loaf of bread. He gave thanks and broke it in pieces. He gave it to them and said, “Take, eat, this is My body.”
41014023	Then He took the cup and gave thanks. He gave it to them and they all drank from it.
41014024	He said to them, “This is My blood of the New Way of Worship which is given for many.
41014025	For sure, I tell you, that I will not drink of the fruit oft he vine until that day when I drink it new in the holy nation of God.”
41014026	After they sang a song, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
41014027	Jesus said to them, “All of you will be ashamed of Me and leave Me tonight. For it is written, ‘I will kill the shepherd and the sheep of the flock will spread everywhere.’ (Zechariah 13:7)
41014028	After I am raised from the dead, I will go before you into the country of Galilee.”
41014029	Peter said to Him, “Even if all men are ashamed of You and leave You, I never will.”
41014030	Jesus said to him, “For sure, I tell you, that today, even tonight, before a rooster crows two times, you will say three times you do not know Me.”
41014031	Peter spoke with strong words, “Even if I have to die with You, I will never say that I do not know You.” All the followers said the same thing.
41014032	They came to a place called Gethsemane. Jesus said to His followers, “You sit here while I pray.”
41014033	He took Peter and James and John with Him. He began to have much sorrow and a heavy heart.
41014034	He said to them, “My soul is very sad. My soul is so full of sorrow I am ready to die. You stay here and watch.”
41014035	He went a little farther and got down with His face on the ground. He prayed that this time of suffering might pass from Him if it could.
41014036	He said, “Father, You can do all things. Take away what must happen to Me. Even so, not what I want, but what You want.”
41014037	Then Jesus came to the followers and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Were you not able to watch one hour?
41014038	Watch and pray so that you will not be tempted. Man’s spirit wants to do this, but the body does not have the power to do it.”
41014039	Again Jesus went away and prayed saying the same words.
41014040	He came back and found them sleeping again. Their eyes were heavy. They did not know what to say to Him.
41014041	He came the third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? It is enough! Listen, the time has come when the Son of Man will be handed over to sinners.
41014042	Get up and let us go. See! The man who will hand Me over to the head religious leader is near.”
41014043	At once, while Jesus was talking, Judas came. He was one of the twelve followers. He came with many other men who had swords and sticks. They came from the head religious leaders of the Jews and the teachers of the Law and the leaders of the people.
41014044	The man who was going to hand Jesus over gave the men something to look for. He said, “The Man I kiss is the One. Take hold of Him and take Him away.”
41014045	At once Judas went straight to Jesus and said, “Teacher!” and kissed Him.
41014046	Then they put their hands on Him and took Him.
41014047	One of the followers of Jesus who stood watching took his sword. He hit the servant owned by the head religious leader and cut off his ear.
41014048	Jesus said to them, “Have you come with swords and sticks to take Me as if I were a robber?
41014049	I have been with you every day teaching in the house of God. You never took hold of Me. But this has happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen.”
41014050	Then all His followers left Him and ran away.
41014051	A young man was following Him with only a piece of cloth around his body. They put their hands on the young man.
41014052	Leaving the cloth behind, he ran away with no clothes on.
41014053	They led Jesus away to the head religious leader. All the religious leaders and other leaders and the teachers of the Law were gathered there.
41014054	But Peter followed a long way behind as they went to the house of the head religious leader. He sat with the helpers and got warm by the fire.
41014055	The religious leaders and all the court were looking for something against Jesus. They wanted to find something so they could kill Him. But they could find nothing.
41014056	Many came and told false things about Him, but their words did not agree.
41014057	Some got up and said false things against Him. They said,
41014058	“We have heard Him say, ‘I will destroy the house of God that was made with hands. In three days I will build another that is not made with hands.’”
41014059	Even these who spoke against Him were not able to agree.
41014060	The head religious leader stood up in front of the people. He asked Jesus, “Have You nothing to say? What about the things these men are saying against You?”
41014061	Jesus said nothing. Again the head religious leader asked Him, “Are You the Christ, the Son of the Holy One?”
41014062	Jesus said, “I am! And you will see the Son of Man seated on the right side of the All-powerful God. You will see Him coming again in the clouds of the sky.”
41014063	Then the head religious leader tore his clothes apart. He said, “Do we need other people to speak against Him?
41014064	You have heard Him speak as if He were God! What do you think?” They all said He was guilty of death.
41014065	Some began to spit on Him. They covered Jesus’ face, and they hit Him. They said, “Tell us what is going to happen.” Soldiers hit Him with their hands.
41014066	Peter was outside in the yard. One of the servant-girls of the head religious leader came.
41014067	She saw Peter getting warm. She looked at him and said, “You were with Jesus of Nazareth.”
41014068	Peter lied, saying, “I do not know Jesus and do not understand what you are talking about.” As he went out, a rooster crowed.
41014069	The servant-girl saw him again. She said to the people standing around, “This man is one of them.”
41014070	He lied again saying that he did not know Jesus. Later, those who stood around said to Peter again, “For sure you are one of them. You are from the country of Galilee. You talk like they do.”
41014071	He began to say strong words and to swear. He said, “I do not know the Man you are talking about!”
41014072	At once a rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered what Jesus had said to him, “Before a rooster crows two times, you will say three times you do not know Me.” When he thought about it, he cried.
41015001	Early in the morning the head religious leaders of the Jews and other leaders and the teachers of the Law and all the court gathered together to talk about Jesus. Then they tied up Jesus and led Him away. They handed Him over to Pilate.
41015002	Pilate asked Jesus, “Are You the King of the Jews?” He said to Pilate, “What you say is true.”
41015003	The religious leaders spoke many things against Him. Jesus did not say a word.
41015004	Pilate asked Him again, “Have You nothing to say? Listen to the things they are saying against You!”
41015005	Jesus did not say a word. Pilate was much surprised and wondered about it.
41015006	Each year at the special supper Pilate would let one person who was in prison go free. It would be the one the people asked for.
41015007	The name of one of those in prison was Barabbas. He, together with others, had killed people while working against the leaders of the country.
41015008	All the people went to Pilate and asked him to do as he had done before.
41015009	Pilate said, “Do you want me to let the King of the Jews go free?”
41015010	He knew the religious leaders had handed Jesus over to him because they were jealous.
41015011	The religious leaders talked the people into thinking that Pilate should let Barabbas go free.
41015012	Pilate said to them again, “What do you want me to do with the Man you call the King of the Jews?”
41015013	They spoke with loud voices again, “Nail Him to a cross.”
41015014	Then Pilate said to them, “Why? What bad thing has He done?” They spoke with loud voices all the more, “Nail Him to a cross!”
