41015015	Pilate wanted to please the people. He gave Barabbas to them and had Jesus beaten. Then he handed Him over to be nailed to a cross.
41015016	The soldiers led Jesus away to a large room in the court. They called all the soldiers together.
41015017	The soldiers put a purple coat on Him. They put a crown of thorns on His head,
41015018	and said to Him, “Hello, King of the Jews!”
41015019	They hit Him on the head with a stick and spit on Him. They got down on their knees and worshiped Him.
41015020	After they had made fun of Him, they took the purple coat off of Him and put His own clothes back on Him. Then they led Him away to be nailed to a cross.
41015021	They came to a man called Simon who was coming from the country of Cyrene. He was the father of Alexander and Rufus. They made Simon carry the cross of Jesus.
41015022	They led Jesus to a place called Golgotha. This name means the place of the skull.
41015023	They gave Him wine with something in it to take away the pain, but He would not drink it.
41015024	When they had nailed Jesus to the cross, they divided His clothes by drawing names to see what each man should take.
41015025	It was about nine o’clock in the morning when they nailed Him to the cross.
41015026	Over Jesus’ head they put in writing what they had against Him, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
41015027	They nailed two robbers on crosses beside Jesus. One was on His right side and the other was on His left side.
41015028	It happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen, “They thought of Him as One Who broke the Law.” (Isaiah 53:12)
41015029	Those who walked by shook their heads and laughed at Jesus. They said, “You were the One Who could destroy the house of God and build it again in three days.
41015030	Save Yourself and come down from the cross.”
41015031	The head religious leaders and the teachers of the Law made fun of Him also. They said to each other, “He saved others but He cannot save Himself.
41015032	Let Christ, the King of the Jews, come down from the cross. We want to see it and then we will believe.” Those who were on the crosses beside Jesus spoke bad things to Him.
41015033	From noon until three o’clock it was dark over all the land.
41015034	At three o’clock Jesus cried with a loud voice, “My God, My God, why have You left Me alone?”
41015035	When some of those who stood by heard that, they said, “Listen! He is calling for Elijah.”
41015036	One of them ran and took a sponge and filled it with sour wine. He put it on a stick and gave it to Him to drink. He said, “Let Him alone. Let us see if Elijah will come and take Him down.”
41015037	Then Jesus gave a loud cry. He gave up His spirit and died.
41015038	The curtain in the house of God was torn in two from top to bottom.
41015039	The captain of the soldiers was looking at Jesus when He cried out. He saw Him die and said, “For sure, this Man was the Son of God.”
41015040	Women were looking on from far away. Among them was Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of the younger James and of Joses, and Salome.
41015041	These cared for Him when He was in the country of Galilee. There were many other women there who had followed Him to Jerusalem.
41015042	It was the day to get ready for the Day of Rest and it was now evening.
41015043	Joseph, who was from the city of Arimathea, was an important man in the court. He was looking for the holy nation of God. Without being afraid, he went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
41015044	Pilate was surprised and wondered if Jesus was dead so soon. He called the captain of the soldiers and asked if Jesus was already dead.
41015045	After the captain said that Jesus was dead, Pilate let Joseph take the body.
41015046	Joseph took the body of Jesus down from the cross. He put the linen cloth he had bought around the body. Then he laid the body in a grave which had been cut out in the side of a rock. He pushed a stone over to cover the door of the grave.
41015047	Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where He was laid.
41016001	The Day of Rest was over. Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices. They wanted to put the spices on Jesus’ body.
41016002	Very early in the morning on the first day of the week, they came to the grave. The sun had come up.
41016003	They said to themselves, “Who will roll the stone away from the door of the grave for us?”
41016004	But when they looked, they saw the very large stone had been rolled away.
41016005	They went into the grave. There they saw a young man with a long white coat sitting on the right side. They were afraid.
41016006	He said, “Do not be afraid. You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth Who was nailed to a cross. He is risen! He is not here! See, here is the place where they laid Him.
41016007	Go and tell His followers and Peter that He is going ahead of you into Galilee. You will see Him there as He told you.”
41016008	They ran from the grave shaking and were surprised. They did not say anything to anyone because they were afraid.
41016009	(It was early on the first day of the week when Jesus was raised from the dead. Mary Magdalene saw Him first. He had put seven demons out of her.
41016010	She went and told His followers. They were crying because of much sorrow.
41016011	But they did not believe her when she said she had seen Him alive.
41016012	After that He was seen again by two of His followers as they walked into the country. He did not look like He had looked before to these two people.
41016013	They went and told it to the others. The others did not believe them.
41016014	Later He was seen by the eleven followers as they were eating. He spoke to them with sharp words because they did not believe and their hearts were hard. And they did not believe the others who had seen Him since He had been raised from the dead.
41016015	He said to them, “You are to go to all the world and preach the Good News to every person.
41016016	He who puts his trust in Me and is baptized will be saved from the punishment of sin. But he who does not put his trust in Me is guilty and will be punished forever.
41016017	These special powerful works will be done by those who have put their trust in Me. In My name they will put out demons. They will speak with languages they have never learned.
41016018	They will pick up snakes. If they drink any poison, it will not hurt them. They will put their hands on the sick and they will be healed.”
41016019	After Jesus had talked to them, He was taken up into heaven. He sat down on the right side of God.
41016020	The followers went from there and preached everywhere. The Lord worked with them. The Lord showed that the Word of God was true by the special works they had power to do.)
42001001	Many people have written about the things that have happened among us.
42001002	Those who saw everything from the first and helped teach the Good News have passed these things on to us.
42001003	Dear Theophilus, I have looked with care into these things from the beginning. I have decided it would be good to write them to you one after the other the way they happened.
42001004	Then you can be sure you know the truth about the things you have been taught.
42001005	When Herod was king of the country of Judea, there was a Jewish religious leader named Zacharias. He worked for Abijah. His wife was of the family group of Aaron. Her name was Elizabeth.
42001006	They were right with God and obeyed the Jewish Law and did what the Lord said to do.
42001007	They had no children because Elizabeth was not able to have a child. Both of them were older people.
42001008	Zacharias was doing his work as a religious leader for God.
42001009	The religious leaders were given certain kinds of work to do. Zacharias was chosen to go to the house of God to burn special perfume.
42001010	Many people stood outside praying during the time the special perfume was burning.
42001011	Zacharias saw an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar where the special perfume was burning.
42001012	When he saw the angel, Zacharias was troubled and afraid.
42001013	The angel said to him, “Zacharias, do not be afraid. Your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will give birth to a son. You are to name him John.
42001014	You will be glad and have much joy. Many people will be happy because he is born.
42001015	He will be great in the sight of the Lord and will never drink wine or any strong drink. Even from his birth, he will be filled with the Holy Spirit.
42001016	Many of the Jews will be turned to the Lord their God by him.
42001017	He will be the one to go in the spirit and power of Elijah before Christ comes. He will turn the hearts of the fathers back to their children. He will teach those who do not obey to be right with God. He will get people ready for the Lord.” (Malachi 4:5–6)
42001018	Zacharias said to the angel, “How can I know this for sure? I am old and my wife is old also.”
42001019	The angel said to him, “My name is Gabriel. I stand near God. He sent me to talk to you and bring to you this good news.
42001020	See! You will not be able to talk until the day this happens. It is because you did not believe my words. What I said will happen at the right time.”
42001021	The people outside were waiting. They were surprised and wondered why Zacharias stayed so long in the house of God.
42001022	When he came out, he could not talk to them. They knew he had seen something special from God while he was in the house of God. He tried to talk to them with his hands but could say nothing.
42001023	When his days of working in the house of God were over, he went to his home.
42001024	Some time later Elizabeth knew she was to become a mother. She kept herself hidden for five months. She said,
42001025	“This is what the Lord has done for me. He has looked on me and has taken away my shame from among men.”
42001026	Six months after Elizabeth knew she was to become a mother, Gabriel was sent from God to Nazareth. Nazareth was a town in the country of Galilee.
42001027	He went to a woman who had never had a man. Her name was Mary. She was promised in marriage to a man named Joseph. Joseph was of the family of David.
42001028	The angel came to her and said, “You are honored very much. You are a favored woman. The Lord is with you. You are chosen from among many women.”
42001029	When she saw the angel, she was troubled at his words. She thought about what had been said.
42001030	The angel said to her, “Mary, do not be afraid. You have found favor with God.
42001031	See! You are to become a mother and have a Son. You are to give Him the name Jesus.
42001032	He will be great. He will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give Him the place where His early father David sat.
42001033	He will be King over the family of Jacob forever and His nation will have no end.”
42001034	Mary said to the angel, “How will this happen? I have never had a man.”
42001035	The angel said to her, “The Holy Spirit will come on you. The power of the Most High will cover you. The holy Child you give birth to will be called the Son of God.
42001036	“See, your cousin Elizabeth, as old as she is, is going to give birth to a child. She was not able to have children before, but now she is in her sixth month.
42001037	For God can do all things.”
42001038	Then Mary said, “I am willing to be used of the Lord. Let it happen to me as you have said.” Then the angel went away from her.
42001039	At once Mary went from there to a town in the hill country of Judea.
42001040	She went to the house of Zacharias to see Elizabeth.
42001041	When Elizabeth heard Mary speak, the baby moved in her body. At the same time Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
42001042	Elizabeth spoke in a loud voice, “You are honored among women! Your Child is honored!
42001043	Why has this happened to me? Why has the mother of my Lord come to me?
42001044	As soon as I heard your voice, the baby in my body moved for joy.
42001045	You are happy because you believed. Everything will happen as the Lord told you it would happen.”
42001046	Then Mary said, “My heart sings with thanks for my Lord.
42001047	And my spirit is happy in God, the One Who saves from the punishment of sin.
42001048	The Lord has looked on me, His servant-girl and one who is not important. But from now on all people will honor me.
42001049	He Who is powerful has done great things for me. His name is holy.
42001050	The loving-kindness of the Lord is given to the people of all times who honor Him.
42001051	He has done powerful works with His arm. He has divided from each other those who have pride in their hearts.
42001052	He has taken rulers down from their thrones. He has put those who are in a place that is not important to a place that is important.
42001053	He has filled those who are hungry with good things. He has sent the rich people away with nothing.
42001054	He has helped Israel His servant. This was done to remember His loving-kindness.
42001055	He promised He would do this to our early fathers and to Abraham and to his family forever.”
42001056	Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months. Then she went to her own home.
42001057	When the time came, Elizabeth gave birth to a son.
42001058	Her neighbors and family heard how the Lord had shown loving-kindness to her. They were happy for her.
42001059	On the eighth day they did the religious act of the Jews on the child. They named him Zacharias, after his father.
42001060	But his mother said, “No! His name is John.”
42001061	They said to her, “No one in your family has that name.”
42001062	Then they talked to his father with their hands to find out what he would name the child.
42001063	He asked for something to write on. He wrote, “His name is John.” They were all surprised and wondered about it.
42001064	Zacharias was able to talk from that time on and he gave thanks to God.
42001065	All those who lived near them were afraid. The news of what had happened was told through all the hill country of Judea.
42001066	And all who heard those words remembered them and said, “What is this child going to be?” For the hand of the Lord was on him.
42001067	Zacharias, the father of John, was filled with the Holy Spirit. He told what was going to happen, saying,
42001068	“Let us thank the Lord God of Israel. He has bought His people and made them free.
42001069	He has raised up from the family of David One Who saves people from the punishment of their sins.
42001070	His holy early preachers told us this long ago.
42001071	God told us that we should be saved from those who hate us and from all those who work against us.
42001072	He would show loving-kindness to our early fathers. He would remember His holy promise.
42001073	God promised this to our early father Abraham.
42001074	He promised that we would be saved from those who hate us and that we might worship Him without being afraid.
42001075	We can be holy and right with God all the days of our life.
42001076	“And you, my son, will be the one who speaks for the Most High. For you will go before the Lord to make the way ready for Him.
42001077	You will tell His people how to be saved from the punishment of sin by being forgiven of their sins.
42001078	Because the heart of our God is full of loving-kindness for us, a light from heaven will shine on us.
42001079	It will give light to those who live in darkness and are under the shadow of death. It will lead our feet in the way of peace.”
42001080	The child grew and became strong in spirit. He lived in a desert until the day he started to preach to the Jews.
42002001	In those days Caesar Augustus sent out word that the name of every person in the Roman nation must be written in the books of the nation.
42002002	This first writing took place while Quirinius was ruler of Syria.
42002003	So all the people went to their own cities to have their names written in the books of the nation.
42002004	Joseph went up from the town of Nazareth in the country of Galilee to the town of Bethlehem. It was known as the city of David. He went there because he was from the family of David.
42002005	Joseph went to have his and Mary’s names written in the books of the nation. Mary was his promised wife and soon to become a mother.
42002006	While they were there in Bethlehem, the time came for Mary to give birth to her baby.
42002007	Her first son was born. She put cloth around Him and laid Him in a place where cattle are fed. There was no room for them in the place where people stay for the night.
42002008	In the same country there were shepherds in the fields. They were watching their flocks of sheep at night.
42002009	The angel of the Lord came to them. The shining-greatness of the Lord shone around them. They were very much afraid.
42002010	The angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. See! I bring you good news of great joy which is for all people.
42002011	Today, One Who saves from the punishment of sin has been born in the city of David. He is Christ the Lord.
42002012	There will be something special for you to see. This is the way you will know Him. You will find the Baby with cloth around Him, lying in a place where cattle are fed.”
42002013	At once many angels from heaven were seen, along with the angel, giving thanks to God. They were saying,
42002014	“Greatness and honor to our God in the highest heaven and peace on earth among men who please Him.”
42002015	The angels went from the shepherds back to heaven. The shepherds said to each other, “Let us go now to Bethlehem and see what has happened. The Lord has told us about this.”
42002016	They went fast and found Mary and Joseph. They found the Baby lying in a place where cattle are fed.
42002017	When they saw the Child, they told what the angel said about Him.
42002018	All who heard it were surprised at what the shepherds told them.
42002019	But Mary hid all these words in her heart. She thought about them much.
42002020	The shepherds went back full of joy. They thanked God for all they had heard and seen. It happened as the angel had told them.
42002021	When eight days were over, they did the religious act of becoming a Jew on the Child. He was named Jesus. This name was given to Him by the angel when Mary was told He was to be born.
42002022	When the days were over for her to be made pure as it was written in the Law of Moses, they took Jesus to Jerusalem to give Him to the Lord.
42002023	It is written in the Law of the Lord, “The first-born male born of a woman will be called holy to the Lord.”
42002024	They were to give a gift of two turtledoves or two young birds on the altar in worship to the Lord. This was written in the Law of the Lord.
42002025	There was a man in Jerusalem by the name of Simeon. He was a good man and very religious. He was looking for the time when the Jewish nation would be saved. The Holy Spirit was on him.
42002026	The Holy Spirit made it known to Simeon that he would not die before he had seen God’s Chosen One.
42002027	He came to the house of God being led by the Holy Spirit. The parents took Jesus to the house of God. They came to do what the Law said must be done.
42002028	Then Simeon took Jesus in his arms. He gave honor to Him and thanked God, saying,
42002029	“Lord, now let me die in peace, as You have said.
42002030	My eyes have seen the One Who will save men from the punishment of their sins.
42002031	You have made Him ready in the sight of all nations.
42002032	He will be a light to shine on the people who are not Jews. He will be the shining-greatness of Your people the Jews.”
42002033	Joseph and the mother of Jesus were surprised and wondered about these words which were said about Jesus.
42002034	Simeon honored them and said to Mary the mother of Jesus, “See! This Child will make many people fall and many people rise in the Jewish nation. He will be spoken against.
42002035	A sword will cut through your soul. By this the thoughts of many hearts will be understood.”
42002036	Anna was a woman who spoke God’s Word. She was the daughter of Phanuel of the family group of Asher. Anna was many years old. She had lived with her husband seven years after she was married.
42002037	Her husband had died and she had lived without a husband eighty-four years. Yet she did not go away from the house of God. She served God day and night, praying and going without food so she could pray better.
42002038	At that time she came and gave thanks to God. She told the people in Jerusalem about Jesus. They were looking for the One to save them from the punishment of their sins and to set them free.
42002039	When Joseph and Mary had done everything the Law said to do, they went back to Nazareth in Galilee.
42002040	The Child grew and became strong in spirit. He was filled with wisdom and the loving-favor of God was on Him.
42002041	His parents went to Jerusalem every year for the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
42002042	When He was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem as they had done before.
42002043	When the days of the special supper were over, they started back to their town. But the boy Jesus was still in Jerusalem. His parents did not know it.
42002044	They thought Jesus was with the others of the group. They walked for one day. Then they looked for Him among their family and friends.
42002045	When they could not find Jesus, they turned back to Jerusalem to look for Him.
42002046	Three days later they found Him in the house of God. He was sitting among the teachers. He was hearing what they said and asking questions.
42002047	All those who heard Him were surprised and wondered about His understanding and at what He said.
42002048	When His parents saw Him, they were surprised. His mother said to Him, “My Son, why have You done this to us? See! Your father and I have had much sorrow looking for You.”
42002049	He said to them, “Why were you looking for Me? Do you not know that I must be in My Father’s house?”
42002050	They did not understand the things He said to them.
42002051	He went with them to Nazareth and obeyed them. But His mother kept all these words in her heart.
42002052	Jesus grew strong in mind and body. He grew in favor with God and men.
42003001	Tiberius Caesar had been ruler for fifteen years. Pontius Pilate was ruler of the country of Judea. Herod was the ruler of the country of Galilee. His brother Philip was the ruler of the countries of Ituraea and Trachonitis. Lysanias was the ruler of the country of Abilene.
42003002	Annas and Caiaphas were the head religious leaders. The Word of God came to John the Baptist, the son of Zacharias. John was in the desert.
42003003	He went into all the country around the Jordan River. He preached that people should be baptized because they were sorry for their sins and had turned from them, and they would be forgiven.
42003004	The early preacher Isaiah wrote these words: “His voice calls out in the desert. ‘Make the way ready for the Lord. Make the road straight for Him!
42003005	Every valley will be filled and every mountain and hill will be brought down. The turns in the road will be made straight and the rough places will be made smooth.
42003006	And all men will see God saving people from the punishment of their sins.’” (Isaiah 40:3–5)
42003007	John said to the people who came to be baptized by him, “You family of snakes! Who told you how to keep from the anger of God that is coming?
42003008	Do something to let me see that you have turned from your sins. Do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’I tell you, God can make children for Abraham out of these stones.
42003009	Even now the ax is on the root of the trees. Every tree that does not give good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
42003010	The people asked him, “Then what should we do?”
42003011	He answered them, “If you have two coats, give one to him who has none. If you have food, you must share some.”
42003012	Tax-gatherers came to be baptized also. They asked him, “Teacher, what are we to do?”
42003013	He said to them, “Do not take more money from people than you should.”
42003014	Also soldiers asked him, “What are we to do?” He answered them, “Take no money from anyone by using your own strength. Do not lie about anyone. Be happy with the pay you get.”
42003015	The people were looking for something to happen. They were thinking in their hearts about John the Baptist. They wondered if he might be the Christ.
42003016	But John said to all of them, “I baptize you with water. There is One coming Who is greater than I. I am not good enough to get down and help Him take off His shoes. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
42003017	He comes ready to clean the grain. He will gather the grain and clean it all. He will put the clean grain into a building. But He will burn that which is no good with a fire that cannot be put out.”
42003018	John spoke much more as he preached the Good News to the people.
42003019	He had also spoken sharp words to Herod the ruler because of Herodias. She was his brother Philip’s wife. And John spoke to Herod about all the wrongs he had done.
42003020	To all these, Herod added another sin by putting John in prison.
42003021	When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized also. As He prayed, the heaven opened.
42003022	The Holy Spirit came down on Him in a body like a dove. A voice came from heaven and said, “You are My much-loved Son. I am very happy with You.”
42003023	Jesus was about thirty years old when He began His work. People thought Jesus was the son of Joseph, the son of Heli.
42003024	Heli was the son of Matthat. Matthat was the son of Levi. Levi was the son of Melchi. Melchi was the son of Jannai. Jannai was the son of Joseph.
42003025	Joseph was the son of Mattathias. Mattathias was the son of Amos. Amos was the son of Nahum. Nahum was the son of Esli. Esli was the son of Naggai.
42003026	Naggai was the son of Maath. Maath was the son of Mattathias. Mattathias was the son of Semein. Semein was the son of Josech. Josech was the son of Juda.
42003027	Juda was the son of Johanan. Johanan was the son of Rhesa. Rhesa was the son of Zerub babel. Zerubbabel was the son of Salathiel. Salathiel was the son of Neri.
42003028	Neri was the son of Melchi. Melchi was the son of Addi. Addi was the son of Cosam. Cosam was the son of Elmadam. Elmadam was the son of Er.
42003029	Er was the son of Joshua. Joshua was the son of Eliezer. Eliezer was the son of Jorim. Jorim was the son of Matthat. Matthat was the son of Levi.
42003030	Levi was the son of Simeon. Simeon was the son of Judah. Judah was the son of Joseph. Joseph was the son of Janam. Janam was the son of Eliakim.
42003031	Eliakim was the son of Melea. Melea was the son of Menna. Menna was the son of Mattatha. Mattatha was the son of Nathan. Nathan was the son of David.
42003032	David was the son of Jesse. Jesse was the son of Obed. Obed was the son of Boaz. Boaz was the son of Salmon. Salmon was the son of Nahshon.
42003033	Nahshon was the son of Amminadab. Amminadab was the son of Admin. Admin was the son of Ram. Ram was the son of Hezron. Hezron was the son of Perez. Perez was the son of Judah.
42003034	Judah was the son of Jacob. Jacob was the son of Isaac. Isaac was the son of Abraham. Abraham was the son of Terah. Terah was the son of Nahor.
42003035	Nahor was the son of Serug. Serug was the son of Ragau. Ragau was the son of Peleg. Peleg was the son of Eber. Eber was the son of Shelah.
42003036	Shelah was the son of Cainan. Cainan was the son of Arphaxad. Arphaxad was the son of Shem. Shem was the son of Noah. Noah was the son of Lamech.
42003037	Lamech was the son of Methuselah. Methuselah was the son of Enoch. Enoch was the son of Jared. Jared was the son of Mahalaleel. Mahaleel was the son of Cainan.
42003038	Cainan was the son of Enos. Enos was the son of Seth. Seth was the son of Adam. Adam was the son of God.
42004001	Jesus was full of the Holy Spirit when He returned from the Jordan River. Then He was led by the Holy Spirit to a desert.
42004002	He was tempted by the devil for forty days and He ate nothing during that time. After that He was hungry.
42004003	The devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, tell this stone to be made into bread.”
42004004	Jesus said to him, “It is written, ‘Man is not to live by bread alone.’” (Deuteronomy 8:3)
42004005	The devil took Jesus up on a high mountain. He had Jesus look at all the nations of the world at one time.
42004006	The devil said to Jesus, “I will give You all this power and greatness. It has been given to me. I can give it to anyone I want to.
42004007	If You will worship me, all this will be Yours.”
42004008	Jesus said to the devil, “Get behind Me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You must worship the Lord your God. You must obey Him only.’ ” (Deuteronomy 6:13)
42004009	Then the devil took Jesus up to Jerusalem. He had Jesus stand on the highest part of the house of God. The devil said to Jesus, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here.
42004010	For it is written, ‘He has told His angels to care for You and to keep You.
42004011	In their hands they will hold You up. Then Your foot will not hit against a stone.’ ” (Psalm 91:11–12)
42004012	Jesus said to the devil, “It is written, ‘You must not tempt the Lord your God.’ ” (Deuteronomy 6:16)
42004013	When the devil finished tempting Jesus in every way, he went away from Jesus for awhile.
42004014	Jesus went back to Galilee in the power of the Holy Spirit. People talked about Him so much that He was well-known through all the country.
42004015	Jesus taught in their places of worship and was honored by all people.
42004016	Jesus came to Nazareth where He had grown up. As He had done before, He went into the Jewish place of worship on the Day of Rest. Then He stood up to read.
42004017	Someone handed Him the book of the early preacher Isaiah. He opened it and found the place where it was written,
42004018	“The Spirit of the Lord is on Me. He has put His hand on Me to preach the Good News to poor people. He has sent Me to heal those with a sad heart. He has sent Me to tell those who are being held that they can go free. He has sent Me to make the blind to see and to free those who are held because of trouble.
42004019	He sent Me to tell of the time when men can receive favor with the Lord.” (Isaiah 61:1–2)
42004020	Jesus closed the book. Then He gave it back to the leader and sat down. All those in the Jewish place of worship kept their eyes on Him.
42004021	Then He began to say to them, “The Holy Writings you have just heard have been completed today.”
42004022	They all spoke well of Jesus and agreed with the words He spoke. They said, “Is not this the son of Joseph?”
42004023	He said to them, “I wonder if you will tell this old saying to Me, ‘Doctor, heal Yourself. What You did in the city of Capernaum, do in Your own country!’ ”
42004024	He said, “A man who speaks for God is not respected in his own country.
42004025	It is true that there were many women whose husbands had died in the Jewish land when Elijah lived. For three and a half years there was no rain and there was very little food in the land.
42004026	Elijah was sent to none of them, but he was sent to a woman in the city of Zarephath in the land of Sidon. This woman’s husband had died.
42004027	There were many people in the Jewish land who had a bad skin disease when the early preacher Elisha lived. None of them was healed. But Naaman from the country of Syria was healed.”
42004028	All those in the Jewish place of worship were angry when they heard His words.
42004029	They got up and took Jesus out of town to the top of a high hill. They wanted to throw Him over the side.
42004030	But Jesus got away from among them and went on His way.
42004031	Jesus went down to Capernaum in Galilee. He taught them on the Days of Rest.
42004032	The people were surprised and wondered about His teaching. His words had power.
42004033	A man in the Jewish place of worship had a demon. He cried with a loud voice,
42004034	“What do You want of us, Jesus of Nazareth? I know Who You are. You are the Holy One of God.”
42004035	Jesus spoke sharp words to the demon and said, “Do not talk! Come out of him!” When the demon had thrown the man down, he came out without hurting the man.
42004036	The people were all surprised. They asked each other, “What kind of word is this? He speaks to the demons with power and they come out!”
42004037	The news about Jesus went through all the country.
42004038	Jesus went away from the Jewish place of worship and went into Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was in bed, very sick. They asked Jesus to help her.
42004039	He stood by her and told the disease to leave. It went from her. At once she got up and cared for them.
42004040	As the sun went down, the people took all that were sick with many kinds of diseases to Jesus. He put His hands on all of them and they were healed.
42004041	Also demons came out of many people. The demons cried out and said, “You are Christ, the Son of God.” Jesus spoke strong words to them and would not let them speak. They knew He was the Christ.
42004042	In the morning He went out to a desert. The people looked for Him. When they found Him, they were trying to keep Him from going away from them.
42004043	He said to them, “I must preach about the holy nation of God in other cities also. This is why I was sent.”
42004044	And He kept on preaching in the Jewish places of worship in Galilee.
42005001	While Jesus was standing by the lake of Gennesaret, many people pushed to get near Him. They wanted to hear the Word of God.
42005002	Jesus saw two boats on the shore. The fishermen were not there because they were washing their nets.
42005003	Jesus got into a boat which belonged to Simon. Jesus asked him to push it out a little way from land. Then He sat down and taught the people from the boat.
42005004	When He had finished speaking, He said to Simon, “Push out into the deep water. Let down your nets for some fish.”
42005005	Simon said to Him, “Teacher, we have worked all night and we have caught nothing. But because You told me to, I will let the net down.”
42005006	When they had done this, they caught so many fish, their net started to break.
42005007	They called to their friends working in the other boat to come and help them. They came and both boats were so full of fish they began to sink.
42005008	When Simon Peter saw it, he got down at the feet of Jesus. He said, “Go away from me, Lord, because I am a sinful man.”
42005009	He and all those with him were surprised and wondered about the many fish.
42005010	James and John, the sons of Zebedee, were surprised also. They were working together with Simon. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid. From now on you will fish for men.”
42005011	When they came to land with their boats, they left everything and followed Jesus.
42005012	While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came to Him with a bad skin disease over all his body. When he saw Jesus, he got down on his face before Him. He begged Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can heal me.”
42005013	Jesus put His hand on him and said, “I will, be healed.” At once the disease went away from him.
42005014	Then Jesus told him to tell no one. He said, “Go and let the religious leader of the Jews see you. Give the gift on the altar in worship that Moses told you to give when a man is healed of a disease. This will show the leaders you have been healed.”
42005015	The news about Jesus went out all the more. Many people came to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases.
42005016	Then He went away by Himself to pray in a desert.
42005017	On one of the days while Jesus was teaching, some proud religious law-keepers and teachers of the Law were sitting by Him. They had come from every town in the countries of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was there to heal them.
42005018	Some men took a man who was not able to move his body to Jesus. He was carried on a bed. They looked for a way to take the man into the house where Jesus was.
42005019	But they could not find a way to take him in because of so many people. They made a hole in the roof over where Jesus stood. Then they let the bed with the sick man on it down before Jesus.
42005020	When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the man, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
42005021	The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers thought to themselves, “Who is this Man Who speaks as if He is God? Who can forgive sins but God only?”
42005022	Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said to them, “Why do you think this way in your hearts?
42005023	Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or, ‘Get up and walk’?
42005024	“So that you may know the Son of Man has the right and the power on earth to forgive sins,” He said to the man who could not move his body, “I say to you, get up. Take your bed and go to your home.”
42005025	At once the sick man got up in front of them. He took his bed and went to his home thanking God.
42005026	All those who were there were surprised and gave thanks to God, saying, “We have seen very special things today.”
42005027	After this Jesus went out and saw a man who gathered taxes. His name was Levi (Matthew). Levi was sitting at his work. Jesus said to him, “Follow Me.”
42005028	Levi got up, left everything and followed Jesus.
42005029	Levi made a big supper for Jesus in his house. Many men who gathered taxes and other people sat down with them.
42005030	The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers talked against the followers of Jesus. They said, “Why do You eat and drink with men who gather taxes and with sinners?”
42005031	Jesus said to them, “People who are well do not need a doctor. Only those who are sick need a doctor.
42005032	I have not come to call good people. I have come to call sinners to be sorry for their sins and to turn from them.”
42005033	They asked Jesus, “Why do the followers of John and of the proud religious law-keepers go without food so they can pray better, but Your followers keep on eating and drinking?”
42005034	Jesus answered them, “Can the friends at a wedding be sorry when the man just married is with them?
42005035	The days will come when the man just married will be taken from them. Then they will not eat food so they can pray better in those days.”
42005036	Then Jesus told them a picture-story. He said, “No one sews a piece of cloth from a new coat on an old coat. If he does, the new coat will have a hole. The new piece and the old coat will not be the same.
42005037	No man puts new wine into old skin bags. If they did, the skins would break and the wine would run out. The bags would be no good.
42005038	New wine must be put into new bags and both are kept safe.
42005039	No one wants new wine after drinking old wine. He says, ‘The old wine is better.’”
42006001	On the next Day of Rest Jesus was walking through the grain-fields. His followers picked grain. They rubbed it in their hands and ate it.
42006002	Some of the proud religious law-keepers said to them, “Why are you doing what the Law says should not be done on the Day of Rest?”
42006003	Jesus answered them, “Have you not read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
42006004	He went into the house of God and ate the special bread used in the religious worship. He gave some to those who were with him also. The Law says only the religious leaders may eat that bread.
42006005	The Son of Man is Lord of the Day of Rest also.”
42006006	On another Day of Rest Jesus went into the Jewish place of worship and taught. A man with a dried-up hand was there.
42006007	The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers watched to see if He would heal on the Day of Rest. They wanted to have something to say against Him.
42006008	Jesus knew what they were thinking. He said to the man with the dried-up hand, “Stand up and come here.” The man stood up and went to Jesus.
42006009	Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing. Does the Law say to do good on the Day of Rest or to do bad? To save life or to kill?”
42006010	Jesus looked around at them all and said to the man, “Put out your hand.” He put it out and his hand was healed. It was as good as his other hand.
42006011	The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers were filled with anger. They talked with each other about what they might do to Jesus.
42006012	One day Jesus went up on a mountain to pray. He prayed all night to God.
42006013	In the morning He called His followers to Him. He chose twelve of them and called them.
42006014	There were Simon, whom He also named Peter, and his brother Andrew. There were James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,
42006015	Matthew and Thomas. There were James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon the Canaanite.
42006016	There were Judas, who was the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot who would hand Jesus over to be killed.
42006017	Then Jesus came down and stood on a plain with many of His followers. Many people came from the country of Judea and from Jerusalem and from the cities of Tyre and Sidon. They came to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases.
42006018	Those who were troubled with demons came and were healed.
42006019	All the people tried to put their hands on Jesus. Power came from Him and He healed them all.
42006020	He looked at His followers and said, “Those of you who are poor are happy, because the holy nation of God is yours.
42006021	Those of you who are hungry now are happy, because you will be filled. Those of you who have sorrow now are happy, because you will laugh.
42006022	You are happy when men hate you and do not want you around and put shame on you because you trust in Me.
42006023	Be glad in that day. Be full of joy for your reward is much in heaven. Their fathers did these things to the early preachers.
42006024	“It is bad for you who are rich. You are receiving all that you will get.
42006025	It is bad for you who are full. You will be hungry. It is bad for you who laugh now. You will have sorrow and you will cry.
42006026	It is bad for you when everyone speaks well of you. In the same way, their fathers spoke well of the false teachers.
42006027	“I say to you who hear Me, love those who work against you. Do good to those who hate you.
42006028	Respect and give thanks for those who try to bring bad to you. Pray for those who make it very hard for you.
42006029	Whoever hits you on one side of the face, turn so he can hit the other side also. Whoever takes your coat, give him your shirt also.
42006030	Give to any person who asks you for something. If a person takes something from you, do not ask for it back.
42006031	Do for other people what you would like to have them do for you.
42006032	“If you love those who love you, what pay can you expect from that? Sinners also love those who love them.
42006033	If you do good to those who do good to you, what pay can you expect from that? Sinners also do good to those who do good to them.
42006034	If you let people use your things and expect to get something back, what pay can you expect from that? Even sinners let sinners use things and they expect to get something back.
42006035	But love those who hate you. Do good to them. Let them use your things and do not expect something back. Your reward will be much. You will be the children of the Most High. He is kind to those who are not thankful and to those who are full of sin.
42006036	“You must have loving-kindness just as your Father has loving-kindness.
42006037	Do not say what is wrong in other people’s lives. Then other people will not say what is wrong in your life. Do not say someone is guilty. Then other people will not say you are guilty. Forgive other people and other people will forgive you.
42006038	“Give, and it will be given to you. You will have more than enough. It can be pushed down and shaken together and it will still run over as it is given to you. The way you give to others is the way you will receive in return.”
42006039	Jesus used a picture-story as He spoke to them. He said, “Can one blind man lead another blind man? Will they not fall into the ditch together?
42006040	The follower is not more important than his teacher. But everyone who learns well will be like his teacher.
42006041	“Why do you look at the small piece of wood in your brother’s eye and do not see the big piece of wood in your own eye?
42006042	How can you say to your brother, ‘Let me take that small piece of wood out of your eye,’ when you do not see the big piece of wood in your own eye? You pretend to be someone you are not. First, take the big piece of wood out of your own eye. Then you can see better to take the small piece of wood out of your brother’s eye.
42006043	“A good tree cannot have bad fruit. A bad tree cannot have good fruit.
42006044	For every tree is known by its own fruit. Men do not gather figs from thorns. They do not gather grapes from thistles.
42006045	Good comes from a good man because of the riches he has in his heart. Sin comes from a sinful man because of the sin he has in his heart. The mouth speaks of what the heart is full of.
42006046	“And why do you call Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ but do not do what I say?
42006047	Whoever comes to Me and hears and does what I say, I will show you who he is like.
42006048	He is like a man who built a house. He dug deep to put the building on rock. When the water came up and the river beat against the house, the building could not be shaken because it was built on rock.
42006049	But he who hears and does not do what I say, is like a man who built a house on nothing but earth. The water beat against the house. At once it fell and was destroyed.”
42007001	When Jesus had finished teaching the people, He went back to Capernaum.
42007002	A captain of the army had a servant whom he thought much of. This servant was very sick and was about to die.
42007003	When the captain heard of Jesus, he sent some Jewish leaders to Him. They were to ask if He would come and heal this servant.
42007004	They came to Jesus and begged Him, saying, “The man is respected and should have this done for him.
42007005	He loves our nation and has built our Jewish place of worship.”
42007006	Jesus went with them. When He was not far from the house, the captain told some friends to tell this to Jesus, “Lord, do not take the time to come to my house, because I am not good enough.
42007007	And I am not good enough to come to You. But just say the word and my servant will be healed.
42007008	For I am a man who works for someone else also, and I have soldiers who work for me. I say to this man, ‘Go!’ and he goes. I say to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes. I say to my workman, ‘Do this!’and he does it.”
42007009	Jesus was surprised when He heard this. He turned to the people following Him and said, “I tell you, I have not found so much faith even in the Jewish nation.”
42007010	Those who had been sent went back to the captain’s house and found the servant well again.
42007011	The next day Jesus went to a city called Nain. His followers and many other people went with Him.
42007012	When they came near the city gate, a dead man was being carried out. He was the only son of a woman whose husband had died. Many people of the city were with her.
42007013	When the Lord saw her, He had loving-pity for her and said, “Do not cry.”
42007014	He went and put His hand on the box in which the dead man was carried. The men who were carrying it, stopped. Jesus said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”
42007015	The man who was dead sat up and began to talk. Then Jesus gave him to his mother.
42007016	Everyone was afraid and they gave thanks to God. They said, “A great Man Who speaks for God has come among us! God has cared for His people!”
42007017	The news about Jesus went through all the country of Judea and over all the land.
42007018	The followers of John the Baptist told him about all these things.
42007019	John called two of his followers and sent them to Jesus to ask, “Are You the One Who is to come? Or are we to look for another?”
42007020	The men came to Jesus and said, “John the Baptist sent us to ask You, ‘Are You the One Who is to come? Or are we to look for another?’”
42007021	At that time Jesus was healing many people of all kinds of sickness and disease and was putting out demons. Many that were blind were able to see.
42007022	Jesus said to John’s followers, “Go back to John the Baptist and tell him what you have seen and heard. Tell him the blind are made to see. Those who could not walk, are walking. Those with a bad skin disease are healed. Those who could not hear, are hearing. The dead are raised to life and poor people have the Good News preached to them.
42007023	The person who is not ashamed of Me and does not turn away from Me is happy.”
42007024	As John’s followers were going away, Jesus began to tell the people about John the Baptist. He said, “Why did you go out to the desert? Did you go out to see a small tree moving in the wind?
42007025	What did you go out to see? A man dressed in good clothes? Those who are dressed in good clothes are in the houses of kings.
42007026	But what did you go to see? One who speaks for God? Yes, I tell you, he is more than one who speaks for God.
42007027	This is the man the Holy Writings spoke of when they said, ‘See! I will send My helper to carry news ahead of You. He will make Your way ready for You!’ (Malachi 3:1; Isaiah 40:3)
42007028	“I tell you, of those born of women, there is no one greater than John the Baptist. The least in the holy nation of God is greater than he.”
42007029	All the people who heard Jesus and those who gathered taxes showed they knew God was right and were baptized by John.
42007030	But the proud religious law-keepers and the men who knew the Law would not listen. They would not be baptized by John and they did not receive what God had for them.
42007031	Then the Lord said, “What are the people of this day like?
42007032	They are like children playing in front of stores. They call to their friends, ‘We have played music for you, but you did not dance. We have had sorrow for you, but you did not have sorrow.’
42007033	John the Baptist did not come eating bread or drinking wine and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
42007034	The Son of Man came eating and drinking and you say, ‘See! He likes food and wine. He is a friend of men who gather taxes and of sinners!’
42007035	Wisdom is shown to be right by those who are wise.”
42007036	One of the proud religious law-keepers wanted Jesus to eat with him. Jesus went to his house and sat down to eat.
42007037	There was a woman in the city who was a sinner. She knew Jesus was eating in the house of the proud religious law-keeper. She brought a jar of special perfume.
42007038	Then she stood behind Him by His feet and cried. Her tears wet His feet and she dried them with her hair. She kissed His feet and put the special perfume on them.
42007039	The proud religious law-keeper who had asked Jesus to eat with him saw this. He said to himself, “If this Man were One Who speaks for God, He would know who and what kind of a woman put her hands on Him. She is a sinner.”
42007040	Jesus said to him, “I have something to say to you, Simon.” And Simon said, “Teacher, say it.”
42007041	“There were two men who owed a certain man some money. The one man owed 500 pieces of silver money. The other man owed 50 pieces of silver money.
42007042	Neither one of them had any money, so he told them they did not have to pay him back. Tell Me, which one would love him the most?”
42007043	Simon said, “I think it would be the one who owed the most.” And Jesus said to him, “You have said the right thing.”
42007044	He turned to the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I came into your house and you gave Me no water to wash My feet. She washed My feet with her tears and dried them with the hairs of her head.
42007045	You gave me no kiss, but this woman has kissed my feet from the time I came in.
42007046	You did not put even oil on My head but this woman has put special perfume on My feet.
42007047	I tell you, her many sins are forgiven because she loves much. But the one who has been forgiven little, loves little.”
42007048	Then He said to the woman, “Your sins are forgiven.”
42007049	Those who were eating with Him began to say to themselves, “Who is this Man Who even forgives sins?”
42007050	He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you from the punishment of sin. Go in peace.”
42008001	After this Jesus went to all the cities and towns preaching and telling the Good News about the holy nation of God. The twelve followers were with Him.
42008002	Some women who had been healed of demons and diseases were with Him. Mary Magdalene, who had had seven demons put out of her, was one of them.
42008003	Joanna, the wife of Chuza who was one of Herod’s helpers, was another one. Susanna and many others also cared for Jesus by using what they had.
42008004	Many people came together from every town to Jesus. He told them a picture-story.
42008005	“A man went out to plant seed. As he planted the seed, some fell by the side of the road. It was walked on and birds came and ate it.
42008006	Some seed fell between rocks. As soon as it started to grow, it dried up because it had no water.
42008007	Some seed fell among thorns. The thorns grew and did not give the seed room to grow.
42008008	Some seed fell on good ground. It grew and gave one hundred times as much grain.” When Jesus had finished saying this, He cried out, “You have ears, then listen!”
42008009	His followers asked Him what this picture-story meant.
42008010	Jesus said, “You were given the secrets about the holy nation of God. Others are told picture-stories. As they look, they do not see. As they hear, they do not understand.
42008011	“This is what the picture-story means. The seed is the Word of God.
42008012	Those by the side of the road hear the Word. Then the devil comes and takes the Word from their hearts. He does not want them to believe and be saved from the punishment of sin.
42008013	Those which fell among rocks are those who when they hear the Word receive it with joy. These have no root. For awhile they believe, but when they are tempted they give up.
42008014	Those which fell among thorns hear the Word but go their own way. The cares of this life let the thorns grow. A love for money lets the thorns grow also. And the fun of this life lets the thorns grow. Their grain never becomes full-grown.
42008015	But those which fell on good ground have heard the Word. They keep it in a good and true heart and they keep on giving good grain.
42008016	“No man lights a lamp and puts it under a pail or under a bed. He puts it on a lamp-stand so all who come into the room may see it.
42008017	Nothing is secret but what will be known. Anything that is hidden will be brought into the light.
42008018	Be careful how you listen! Whoever has, to him will be given. Whoever does not have, even the little he has will be taken from him.”
42008019	The mother of Jesus and His brothers came to Him. They could not get near Him because of so many people.
42008020	Someone said to Jesus, “Your mother and brothers are standing outside. They want to see You.”
42008021	Jesus said to them, “My mother and brothers are these who hear the Word of God and do it.”
42008022	On one of those days Jesus and His followers got into a boat. Jesus said to them, “Let us go over to the other side of the lake.” Then they pushed out into the water.
42008023	As they were going, Jesus fell asleep. A wind storm came over the lake. The boat was filling with water and they were in danger.
42008024	The followers came to awake Jesus. They said, “Teacher! Teacher! We are going to die!” Then Jesus got up and spoke sharp words to the wind and the high waves. The wind stopped blowing and there were no more waves.
42008025	He said to them, “Where is your faith?” The followers were surprised and afraid. They said to each other, “What kind of a man is He? He speaks to the wind and the waves and they obey Him.”
42008026	They came to the land of the Gadarenes, which is on the other side of the country of Galilee.
42008027	As Jesus stepped out on land, a man met Him who had come from the city. This man had demons in him. For a long time he had worn no clothes. He did not live in a house, but lived among the graves.
42008028	When he saw Jesus, he got down before Him and cried with a loud voice, “What do You want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High? I beg of You not to hurt me!”
42008029	For Jesus had spoken to the demon to come out of the man. Many times the demon had taken hold of him. The man had to be tied with chains. But he would break the chains and be taken by the demon into the desert.
42008030	Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” And the demon answered, “Many,” because many demons had gone into him.
42008031	The demons asked Jesus not to send them to the hole without a bottom in the earth.
42008032	There were many pigs feeding on the side of the mountain. The demons begged Jesus to let them go into the pigs. Jesus said they could.
42008033	The demons came out of the man and went into the pigs. Then the many pigs ran down the side of the mountain into the water and died.
42008034	The men who cared for the pigs ran fast and told what had happened in the town and in the country.
42008035	People came to see what had happened. They came to Jesus and saw the man from whom the demons had been sent. He was sitting at the feet of Jesus with clothes on and had the right use of his mind. The people were afraid.
42008036	Those who had seen it told how the man who had had the demons was healed.
42008037	Then all the people of the country of the Gadarenes begged Jesus to go away from them. They were very much afraid. Jesus got into the boat and went back to the other side.
42008038	The man out of whom the demons had gone begged to go with Jesus. But Jesus sent him away and said,
42008039	“Go back to your house and tell everything God has done for you.” He went back and told all the people of the city what great things Jesus had done for him.
42008040	Many people were glad to see Jesus when He got back. They were waiting for Him.
42008041	A man named Jairus was a leader of the Jewish place of worship. As he came to Jesus, he got down at His feet. He asked Jesus if He would come to his house.
42008042	He had only one daughter and she was dying. This girl was about twelve years old. As Jesus went, the people pushed Him from every side.
42008043	A woman had been sick for twelve years with a flow of blood. (She had spent all the money she had on doctors.) But she could not be healed by anyone.
42008044	She came behind Jesus and touched the bottom of His coat. At once the flow of blood stopped.
42008045	Jesus said, “Who touched Me?” Everyone said that they had not touched Him. Peter said, “Teacher, so many people are pushing You from every side and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’ ”
42008046	Then Jesus said, “Someone touched Me because I know power has gone from Me.”
42008047	When the woman saw she could not hide it, she came shaking. She got down before Jesus. Then she told Jesus in front of all the people why she had touched Him. She told how she was healed at once.
42008048	Jesus said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace.”
42008049	While Jesus was yet talking, a man came from the house of the leader of the place of worship. This man said to Jairus, “Your daughter is dead. Do not make the Teacher use anymore of His time.”
42008050	Jesus heard it and said to Jairus, “Do not be afraid, only believe. She will be made well.”
42008051	Jesus went into the house. He let only Peter and James and John and the father and mother of the girl go in with Him.
42008052	Everyone was crying and full of sorrow because of her. Jesus said, “Do not cry. She is not dead, but is sleeping.”
42008053	Then they laughed at Jesus because they knew she was dead.
42008054	Jesus sent them all out. He took the girl by the hand and said, “Child, get up!”
42008055	Her spirit came back and she got up at once. Jesus told them to bring her food.
42008056	Her parents were surprised and wondered about it. Then Jesus told them they should tell no one what had happened.
42009001	Jesus called His twelve followers to Him. He gave them the right and the power over all demons and to heal diseases.
42009002	He sent them to preach about the holy nation of God and to heal the sick.
42009003	Then He said to them, “Take nothing along for the trip. Do not take a walking stick or a bag or bread or money. Do not take two coats.
42009004	Whatever house you go into, stay there until you are ready to go on.
42009005	If anyone will not take you in, as you leave that city, shake its dust off your feet. That will speak against them.”
42009006	They went out, going from town to town. They preached the Good News and healed the sick everywhere.
42009007	Now Herod the leader heard of all that had been done by Jesus. He was troubled because some people said that John the Baptist had been raised from the dead.
42009008	Some people said that Elijah had come back. Others thought one of the early preachers had been raised from the dead.
42009009	Then Herod said, “I had John’s head cut off. But who is this Man that I hear these things about?” He wanted to see Jesus.
42009010	The twelve followers came back. They told Jesus what they had done. Jesus took them to a desert near the town of Bethsaida. There they could be alone.
42009011	When the people knew where Jesus was, they followed Him. Jesus was happy to see them and talked to them about the holy nation of God. He healed all who were sick.
42009012	When the day was about over, the twelve followers came to Jesus. They said, “Send these many people away so they can go to the towns and country near here. There they can find a place to sleep and get food. We are here in a desert.”
42009013	But Jesus said to them, “Give them something to eat.” They said, “We have only five loaves of bread and two fish. Are we to go and buy food for all these people?”
42009014	There were about five thousand men. Jesus said to His followers, “Have them sit down in groups of fifty people.”
42009015	They did as He told them. They made all of the people sit down.
42009016	As Jesus took the five loaves of bread and two fish, He looked up to heaven and gave thanks. He broke them in pieces and gave them to His followers to give to the people.
42009017	They all ate and were filled. They picked up twelve baskets full of pieces of bread and fish after the people finished eating.
42009018	While Jesus was praying alone, His followers were with Him. Jesus asked them, “Who do people say that I am?”
42009019	They said, “John the Baptist, but some say Elijah. Others say that one of the early preachers has been raised from the dead.”
42009020	Jesus said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter said, “You are the Christ of God.”
42009021	Then Jesus spoke to them and told them to tell no one.
42009022	He said, “The Son of Man must suffer many things. The leaders and the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law will have nothing to do with Him. He must be killed and be raised from the dead three days later.”
42009023	Then Jesus said to them all, “If anyone wants to follow Me, he must give up himself and his own desires. He must take up his cross everyday and follow Me.
42009024	If anyone wants to keep his own life safe, he must lose it. If anyone gives up his life because of Me, he will save it.
42009025	For what does a man have if he gets all the world and loses or gives up his life?
42009026	Whoever is ashamed of Me and My Words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when He comes in His own shining-greatness and of the Father’s and of the holy angels.
42009027	I tell you the truth, some standing here will not die until they see the holy nation of God.”
42009028	About eight days after Jesus had said these things, He took Peter and James and John with Him. They went up on a mountain to pray.
42009029	As Jesus prayed, He was changed in looks before them. His clothes became white and shining bright.
42009030	Two men talked with Jesus. They were Moses and Elijah.
42009031	They looked like the shining-greatness of heaven as they talked about His death in Jerusalem which was soon to happen.
42009032	But Peter and those with him had gone to sleep. When they woke up, they saw His shining-greatness and the two men who stood with Him.
42009033	As the two men went from Jesus, Peter said to Him, “Teacher, it is good for us to be here. Let us build three tents to worship in. One will be for You. One will be for Moses. One will be for Elijah.” He did not know what he was saying.
42009034	While he was talking, a cloud came over them. They were afraid as the cloud came in around them.
42009035	A voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My Son, the One I have chosen. Listen to Him!”
42009036	When the voice was gone, Jesus was standing there alone. From that time on, they kept these things to themselves. They told no one what they had seen.
42009037	The next day they came down from the mountain and many people met Jesus.
42009038	A man from among the people cried out, “Teacher, I beg of You to look at my son. He is my only child.
42009039	See, a demon takes him and makes him cry out. It takes hold of him and makes him shake. Spit runs from his mouth. He has marks on his body from being hurt. The demon does not want to go from him.
42009040	I begged Your followers to put the demon out, but they could not.”
42009041	Then Jesus said, “You people of this day do not have faith. You turn from what is right! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring your son to Me.”
42009042	While the boy was coming, the demon threw him down and made him lose the use of his mind for awhile. Jesus spoke sharp words to the demon. He healed the child and gave him back to his father.
42009043	They were all surprised at the great power of God. They all were thinking about the special things Jesus had done. And Jesus said to His followers,
42009044	“Remember these words. For the Son of Man will be given over into the hands of men.”
42009045	They did not understand these words because it was hidden from them. They did not know what Jesus meant and were afraid to ask Him.
42009046	The followers argued among themselves about which of them would be the greatest.
42009047	Jesus knew what they were thinking. He put a child beside Him.
42009048	He said to the followers, “Whoever receives this child in My name, receives Me. Whoever receives Me, receives Him Who sent Me. The one who is least among you is the one who is great.”
42009049	John said, “Teacher, we saw someone putting out demons in Your name. We told him to stop because he was not following us.”
42009050	Jesus said to him, “Do not stop him. He who is not against us is for us.”
42009051	It was about time for Jesus to be taken up into heaven. He turned toward Jerusalem and was sure that nothing would stop Him from going.
42009052	He sent men on ahead of Him. They came to a town in Samaria. There they got things ready for Jesus.
42009053	The people did not want Him there because they knew He was on His way to Jerusalem.
42009054	James and John, His followers, saw this. They said, “Lord, do You want us to speak so fire will come down from heaven and burn them up as Elijah did?”
42009055	Jesus turned and spoke sharp words to them. (He said, “You do not know what kind of spirit you have.
42009056	The Son of Man did not come to destroy men’s lives. He came to save them from the punishment of sin.” They went on their way to another town.)
42009057	As they were going on their way, a man said to Jesus, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”
42009058	Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes. Birds of the sky have nests. The Son of Man has no place to put His head.”
42009059	He said to another, “Follow Me.” But the man said, “Lord, let me go first and bury my father.”
42009060	Jesus said to him, “Let the people who are dead bury their own dead. You go and preach about the holy nation of God.”
42009061	And another one said, “Lord, I will follow You, but first let me go and say good-bye to those at home.”
42009062	Jesus said to him, “Anyone who puts his hand on a plow and looks back at the things behind is of no use in the holy nation of God.”
42010001	After this the Lord chose seventy others. He sent them out two together to every city and place where He would be going later.
42010002	Jesus said to them, “There is much grain ready to gather. But the workmen are few. Pray then to the Lord Who is the Owner of the grain-fields that He will send workmen to gather His grain.
42010003	Go on your way. Listen! I send you out like lambs among wolves.
42010004	Take no money. Do not take a bag or shoes. Speak to no one along the way.
42010005	When you go into a house, say that you hope peace will come to them.
42010006	If a man who loves peace lives there, your good wishes will come to him. If your good wishes are not received, they will come back to you.
42010007	Stay in the same house. Eat and drink what they give you. The workman should have his thanks. Do not move from house to house.
42010008	“Whenever a city receives you, eat the things that are put before you there.
42010009	Heal the sick. Say to them, ‘The holy nation of God is near.’
42010010	Whatever city does not receive you, go into its streets and say,
42010011	‘Even the dust of your city that is on our feet we are cleaning off against you. But understand this, the holy nation of God has come near you!’
42010012	I tell you, on the day men stand before God, it will be easier for the city of Sodom than for that city.
42010013	“It is bad for you, city of Chorazin! It is bad for you, town of Bethsaida! For if the powerful works which were done in you had been done in the cities of Tyre and Sidon they would have turned from their sins long ago. They would have shown their sorrow by putting on clothes made from hair and would have sat in ashes.
42010014	It will be better for Tyre and Sidon on the day men stand before God and be told they are guilty than for you.
42010015	And you, Capernaum, are you to be lifted up into heaven? You will be taken down to hell.
42010016	Whoever listens to you, listens to Me. Whoever has nothing to do with you, has nothing to do with Me. Whoever has nothing to do with Me, has nothing to do with the One Who sent Me.”
42010017	The seventy came back full of joy. They said, “Lord, even the demons obeyed us when we used Your name.”
42010018	Jesus said to them, “I saw Satan fall from heaven like lightning.
42010019	Listen! I have given you power to walk on snakes. I have given you power over small animals with a sting of poison. I have given you power over all the power of the one who works against you. Nothing will hurt you.
42010020	Even so, you should not be happy because the demons obey you but be happy because your names are written in heaven.”
42010021	At this time Jesus was full of the joy of the Holy Spirit. He said, “I thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth. You have kept these things hidden from the wise and from those who have much learning. You have shown them to little children. Yes, Father, it was what you wanted done.
42010022	“Everything has been given to Me by My Father. No one knows the Son but the Father. No one knows the Father but the Son and the Son makes the Father known to those He chooses.”
42010023	Then He turned to His followers and said without anyone else hearing, “Happy are those who see what you see!
42010024	I tell you, many early preachers and kings have wanted to see the things you are seeing, but they did not see them. They have wanted to hear the things you are hearing, but they did not hear them.”
42010025	A man stood up who knew the Law and tried to trap Jesus. He said, “Teacher, what must I do to have life that lasts forever?”
42010026	Jesus said to him, “What is written in the Law? What does the Law say?”
42010027	The man said, “You must love the Lord your God with all your heart. You must love Him with all your soul. You must love Him with all your strength. You must love Him with all your mind. You must love your neighbor as you love yourself.”
42010028	Jesus said to him, “You have said the right thing. Do this and you will have life.”
42010029	The man tried to make himself look good. He asked Jesus, “Who is my neighbor?”
42010030	Jesus said, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to the city of Jericho. Robbers came out after him. They took his clothes off and beat him. Then they went away, leaving him almost dead.
42010031	A religious leader was walking down that road and saw the man. But he went by on the other side.
42010032	In the same way, a man from the family group of Levi was walking down that road. When he saw the man was hurt, he came near to him but kept on going on the other side of the road.
42010033	Then a man from the country of Samaria came by. He went up to the man. As he saw him, he had loving-pity on him.
42010034	He got down and put oil and wine on the places where he was hurt and put cloth around them. Then the man from Samaria put this man on his own donkey. He took him to a place where people stay for the night and cared for him.
42010035	The next day the man from Samaria was ready to leave. He gave the owner of that place two pieces of money to care for him. He said to him, ‘Take care of this man. If you use more than this, I will give it to you when I come again.’
42010036	“Which of these three do you think was a neighbor to the man who was beaten by the robbers?”
42010037	The man who knew the Law said, “The one who showed loving-pity on him.” Then Jesus said, “Go and do the same.”
42010038	As they went on their way, they came to a town where a woman named Martha lived. She cared for Jesus in her home.
42010039	Martha had a sister named Mary. Mary sat at the feet of Jesus and listened to all He said.
42010040	Martha was working hard getting the supper ready. She came to Jesus and said, “Do You see that my sister is not helping me? Tell her to help me.”
42010041	Jesus said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things.
42010042	Only a few things are important, even just one. Mary has chosen the good thing. It will not be taken away from her.”
42011001	Jesus had been praying. One of His followers said to Him, “Lord, teach us to pray as John the Baptist taught his followers.”
42011002	Jesus said to them, “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, Your name is holy. May Your holy nation come. What You want done, may it be done on earth as it is in heaven.
42011003	Give us the bread we need everyday.
42011004	Forgive us our sins, as we forgive those who sin against us. Do not let us be tempted.’”
42011005	Jesus said to them, “If one of you has a friend and goes to him in the night and says, ‘Friend, give me three loaves of bread,
42011006	for a friend of mine is on a trip and has stopped at my house. I have no food to give him.’
42011007	The man inside the house will say, ‘Do not trouble me. The door is shut. My children and I are in bed. I cannot get up and give you bread.’
42011008	I say to you, he may not get up and give him bread because he is a friend. Yet, if he keeps on asking, he will get up and give him as much as he needs.
42011009	I say to you, ask, and what you ask for will be given to you. Look, and what you are looking for you will find. Knock, and the door you are knocking on will be opened to you.
42011010	For everyone who asks, will receive what he asks for. Everyone who looks, will find what he is looking for. Everyone who knocks, will have the door opened to him.
42011011	“Would any of you fathers give your son a stone if he asked for bread? Or would you give a snake if he asked for a fish?
42011012	Or if he asked for an egg, would you give him a small animal with a sting of poison?
42011013	You are sinful and you know how to give good things to your children. How much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him?”
42011014	Jesus was putting a demon out of a man who could not speak. When the demon was gone, the man could speak. All the people were surprised and wondered about it.
42011015	Some of them said, “He puts out demons through Satan, the king of demons.”
42011016	Others tried to trap Jesus. They asked for something special to see from heaven.
42011017	But He knew their thoughts and said to them, “Every nation divided into groups that fight each other will be destroyed. Every family divided into groups that fight each other will not stand.
42011018	If Satan is divided against himself, how will his nation stand? And yet you say I put out demons through Satan!
42011019	If I put out demons through Satan, by whose help do your sons put them out? Your own sons will say if you are guilty or not.
42011020	But if I put out demons by the power of God, then the holy nation of God has come to you.
42011021	“When a strong man watches his house and is ready to fight, his things are safe.
42011022	When a stronger man comes along, he wins the fight. He takes away all the things to fight with that the man of the house had put his trust in. Then the stronger man takes anything he wants from the house.
42011023	Whoever is not with Me is against Me. Whoever does not gather with Me is sending them everywhere.
42011024	“When a demon is gone out of a man, it goes through dry places to find rest. If it finds none, it says, ‘I will go back to my house I came from.’
42011025	When the demon comes back, it finds the house cleaned and looking good.
42011026	Then the demon goes out and comes back bringing seven demons worse than itself. They go in and live there. In the end that man is worse than at the first.”
42011027	As Jesus was talking, a woman of the group said with a loud voice, “The woman is happy who gave You birth and who fed You.”
42011028	But He said, “Yes, but those who hear the Word of God and obey it are happy.”
42011029	When the people were gathered near Jesus, He said, “The people of this day are sinful. They are looking for something special to see. They will get nothing special to see, except what Jonah the early preacher did.
42011030	As Jonah was something special to the people of the city of Nineveh, the Son of Man will be to the people of this day also.
42011031	The queen of the south will stand up on the day men stand before God. She will say the people of this day are guilty because she came from the ends of the earth to listen to the wise sayings of Solomon. And look, Someone greater than Solomon is here!
42011032	The men of Nineveh will stand up on the day men stand before God. They will say the people of this day are guilty because the men of Nineveh were sorry for their sins and turned from them when Jonah preached. And look, Someone greater than Jonah is here!
42011033	“No man lights a lamp and then hides it under a pail. He puts the light on a lamp-stand so those who come in can see it.
42011034	The eye is the light of the body. When your eye is good, your whole body is full of light. When your eye is sinful, your whole body is full of darkness.
42011035	Be careful that the light in you is not dark.
42011036	If your whole body is full of light, with no dark part, then it will shine. It will be as a lamp that gives light.”
42011037	As Jesus was talking, a proud religious law-keeper asked Him to eat with him. Jesus went to the man’s house and took His place at the table.
42011038	The proud religious law-keeper was surprised and wondered why Jesus had not washed before He ate.
