42011039	But the Lord said to him, “You proud religious law-keepers make the outside of the cup and plate clean, but inside you are full of stealing and sinning.
42011040	You are foolish. Did not He that made the outside make the inside also?
42011041	Give yourself as a gift and then you will be clean.
42011042	“It is bad for you, proud religious law-keepers! You give one-tenth part of your spices. But you give no thought to what is right and to the love of God. You should do both of these.
42011043	“It is bad for you, proud religious law-keepers! For you like to have the important seats in the places of worship. You like to have people speak good-sounding words to you as you are in the center of town where people gather.
42011044	It is bad for you, teachers of the Law and proud religious law-keepers and you who pretend to be someone you are not! For you are like graves that are hidden. Men walk on graves without knowing they are there.”
42011045	One of the men who knew the Law said to Jesus, “Teacher, You are making us look bad when You speak like this.”
42011046	Jesus said, “It is bad for you also, you men who know the Law! For you put heavy loads on the shoulders of men. But you will not even put your finger on one of these loads to help them.
42011047	It is bad for you! For you make beautiful buildings for the graves of the early preachers your fathers killed.
42011048	You are saying what your fathers did was good, because they killed the early preachers and you are making their graves.
42011049	“For this reason the wisdom of God has said, ‘I will send them early preachers and missionaries. Some they will kill and some they will make it very hard for.’
42011050	The blood of all the early preachers from the beginning of the world is on the people of this day.
42011051	It will be from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zacharias, the one who died between the altar and the house of God. For sure, I tell you, the people of this day will be guilty for this.
42011052	“It is bad for you men who know the Law! For you have locked the door to the house of learning. You are not going in yourselves and you do not allow those to go in who are about to go in.”
42011053	As Jesus went away from there, the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers were very angry and tried to make Him say many things.
42011054	They planned against Jesus and tried to trap Him with something He might say.
42012001	At that time thousands of people gathered together. There were so many that they walked on each other. Jesus spoke to His twelve followers first, saying, “Look out! Have nothing to do with the yeast of the proud religious law-keepers which is pretending to be something it is not.
42012002	For there is nothing covered up that will not be seen. There is nothing hidden that will not be known.
42012003	What you have said in the dark will be heard in the light. What you have said in a low voice in a closed room will be spoken with a loud voice from the top of houses.
42012004	“I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body and then can do no more.
42012005	I will tell you the one to be afraid of. Be afraid of Him Who has power to put you into hell after He has killed you. Yes, I say to you, be afraid of Him!
42012006	“Are not five small birds sold for two small pieces of money? God does not forget even one of the birds.
42012007	God knows how many hairs you have on your head. Do not be afraid. You are worth more than many small birds.
42012008	“Also, I tell you, everyone who makes Me known to men, the Son of Man will make him known to the angels of God.
42012009	But whoever acts as if he does not know Me and does not make Me known to men, he will not be spoken of to the angels of God.
42012010	“Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven. Whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
42012011	When they take you to the places of worship and to the courts and to the leaders of the country, do not be worried about what you should say or how to say it.
42012012	The Holy Spirit will tell you what you should say at that time.”
42012013	One of the people said to Jesus, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the riches that our father left us.”
42012014	Jesus said to him, “Friend, who has told Me to say who should get what?”
42012015	Then Jesus said to them all, “Watch yourselves! Keep from wanting all kinds of things you should not have. A man’s life is not made up of things, even if he has many riches.”
42012016	Then He told them a picture-story, saying, “The fields of a rich man gave much grain.
42012017	The rich man thought to himself, ‘What will I do? I have no place to put the grain.’
42012018	Then he said, ‘I know what I will do. I will take down my grain building and I will build a bigger one. I will put all my grain and other things I own into it.
42012019	And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many good things put away in your building. It will be all you need for many years to come. Now rest and eat and drink and have lots of fun.” ’
42012020	But God said to him, ‘You fool! Tonight your soul will be taken from you. Then who will have all the things you have put away?’
42012021	It is the same with a man who puts away riches for himself and does not have the riches of God.”
42012022	Jesus said to His followers, “Because of this, I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you are going to eat. Do not worry about your body, what you are going to wear.
42012023	Life is worth more than food. The body is worth more than clothes.
42012024	Look at the birds. They do not plant seeds. They do not gather grain. They have no grain buildings for keeping grain. Yet God feeds them. Are you not worth more than the birds?
42012025	“Which of you can make yourself a little taller by worrying?
42012026	If you cannot do that which is so little, why do you worry about other things?
42012027	Think how the flowers grow. They do not work or make cloth. Yet, I tell you, that King Solomon in all his greatness was not dressed as well as one of these flowers.
42012028	God puts these clothes on the grass of the field. The grass is in the field today and put into the fire tomorrow. How much more would He want to give you clothing? You have so little faith!
42012029	Do not give so much thought to what you will eat or drink. Do not be worried about it.
42012030	For all the nations of the world go after these things. Your Father knows you need these things.
42012031	Instead, go after the holy nation of God. Then all these other things will be given to you.
42012032	Do not be afraid, little flock. Your Father wants to give you the holy nation of God.
42012033	Sell what you have and give the money to poor people. Have money-bags for yourselves that will never wear out. These money-bags are riches in heaven that will always be there. No robber can take them and no bugs can eat them there.
42012034	Your heart will be wherever your riches are.
42012035	“Be ready and dressed. Have your lights burning.
42012036	Be like men who are waiting for their owner to come home from a wedding supper. When he comes and knocks on the door, they will open it for him at once.
42012037	Those servants are happy when their owner finds them watching when he comes. For sure, I tell you, he will be dressed and ready to care for them. He will have them seated at the table.
42012038	The owner might come late at night or early in the morning. Those servants are happy if their owner finds them watching whenever he comes.
42012039	But understand this, that if the owner of a house had known when the robber was coming, he would have been watching. He would not have allowed his house to be broken into.
42012040	You must be ready also. The Son of Man is coming at a time when you do not think He will come.”
42012041	Peter said, “Lord, are You telling this picture-story to us or to all the people?”
42012042	The Lord said, “Who is the faithful and wise servant his owner made boss over the others? He is the one who is to have food ready at the right time.
42012043	That servant is happy who is doing his work when the owner comes.
42012044	For sure, I tell you, he will make him boss over all he has.
42012045	“But what if that servant says to himself, ‘The owner will not be coming soon,’ and then beats the other servants and eats and drinks and gets drunk?
42012046	The owner of that servant will come on a day and at an hour when he is not looking for him. He will cut him in pieces and will put him with those who do not believe.
42012047	“The servant who knew what the owner wanted done, but did not get ready for him, or did not do what he wanted done, will be beaten many times.
42012048	But the servant who did not know what his owner wanted done, but did things that would be reason to be beaten, will be beaten only a few times. The man who receives much will have to give much. If much is given to a man to take care of, men will expect to get more from him.
42012049	“I have come to bring fire down to the earth. I wish it were already started!
42012050	I have a baptism to go through. How troubled I am until it is over!
42012051	Do you think I came to bring peace on the earth? I tell you, no! I came to divide.
42012052	From now on there will be five in one house divided. Three will be against two and two will be against three.
42012053	The father will be against the son. The son will be against the father. The mother will be against the daughter. The daughter will be against the mother. The mother-in-law will be against the daughter-in-law. The daughter-in-law will be against the mother-in-law.”
42012054	Then Jesus also said to the people, “When you see a cloud coming in the west, you say at once, ‘It is going to rain.’ And it does.
42012055	When you see the wind blow from the south, you say, ‘It will be a hot day.’ And it is.
42012056	You who pretend to be someone you are not, you know all about the sky and the earth. But why do you not know what is happening these days?
42012057	Why do you not know for yourselves what is right?
42012058	When a person says you are wrong and takes you to court, try to make it right with him as you go, or he will take you to the head of the court. Then he will take you to the police and you will be put in prison.
42012059	I tell you, you will not be let out of prison until you have paid the last piece of money of the fine.”
42013001	At this time some people came to Jesus. They told Him that Pilate had killed some people from the country of Galilee. It was while they were giving gifts of animals on the altar in worship to God.
42013002	Pilate put their blood together with the blood of the animals. Jesus said to them, “What about these people from Galilee? Were they worse sinners than all the other people from Galilee because they suffered these things?
42013003	No, I tell you. But unless you are sorry for your sins and turn from them, you too will all die.
42013004	What about those eighteen men who were killed when the high building in Siloam fell on them? Do you think they were the worst sinners living in Jerusalem?
42013005	No, I tell you. But unless you are sorry for your sins and turn from them, you too will all die.”
42013006	Then He told them this picture-story: “A man had a fig tree in his grape-field. He looked for fruit on it but found none.
42013007	He said to his servant, ‘See! For three years I have been coming here looking for fruit on this fig tree. I never find any. Cut it down. Why does it even waste the ground?’
42013008	The servant said, ‘Sir! Leave it here one more year. I will dig around it and put plant food on it.
42013009	It may be that it will give fruit next year. If it does not, then cut it down.’”
42013010	Jesus was teaching in one of the Jewish places of worship on the Day of Rest.
42013011	A woman was there who had suffered for eighteen years because of a demon. She was not able to stand up straight.
42013012	Jesus saw her and said, “Woman, you are now free from your trouble!”
42013013	Then He put His hand on her. At once she stood up straight and gave thanks to God.
42013014	The leader of the Jewish place of worship was angry because Jesus healed on the Day of Rest. The leader said to the people, “There are six days in which work should be done. Come on those days and get healed. Do not come to be healed on the Day of Rest.”
42013015	The Lord said to him, “You pretend to be someone you are not! Do not each of you let his cow or his donkey out and lead them to water on the Day of Rest?
42013016	Should not this Jewish woman be made free from this trouble on the Day of Rest? She has been chained by Satan for eighteen years.”
42013017	When He said this, all those who were against Him were ashamed. All the many people were glad for the great things being done by Him.
42013018	Then Jesus asked, “What is the holy nation of God like? What can I use to show you?
42013019	It is like a mustard seed which a man took and planted in his field. It grew and became a tree. The birds of the sky stayed in its branches.”
42013020	Again Jesus said, “What can I use to show you what the holy nation of God is like?
42013021	It is like yeast that a woman put into three pails of flour until it was all full of yeast.”
42013022	Jesus taught the people as He went through the cities and towns on His way to Jerusalem.
42013023	Someone asked Jesus, “Lord, will only a few people be saved from the punishment of sin?” Jesus said to them,
42013024	“Work hard to go in through the narrow door. I tell you, many will try to go in but will not be able to go in.
42013025	The owner of the house will get up and shut the door. You who are on the outside will knock on the door and say, ‘Lord, let us in.’Then He will say, ‘I do not know you.’
42013026	Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with You when You taught in our streets.’
42013027	But He will say, ‘I tell you, I do not know you. Go away from Me. You are sinful.’
42013028	“There will be loud crying and grinding of teeth when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the early preachers in the holy nation of God, but you will be put out.
42013029	Those who sit at the table in the holy nation of God will come from the east and west and from the north and south.
42013030	Listen! Some are last who will be first. Some are first who will be last.”
42013031	That same day some of the proud religious law-keepers came to Jesus. They said, “Go away from here! Herod wants to kill You.”
42013032	Jesus said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘See. I put out demons and heal the sick. I will do these things today and tomorrow. And the third day My work will be finished.’
42013033	But I must go on My way today and tomorrow and the day after. One who speaks for God cannot die except at Jerusalem.
42013034	“Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you kill the early preachers and throw stones on those sent to you. How many times I wanted to gather your children around me, as a bird gathers her young under her wings, but you would not let Me.
42013035	See! Your house is empty. And I tell you, you will not see Me again until the time comes when you will say, ‘Great and honored is the One Who comes in the name of the Lord.’”
42014001	On the Day of Rest Jesus went into the house of one of the leaders of the proud religious law-keepers to eat. They all watched Jesus to see what He would do.
42014002	A man who had very large arms and legs because of a sickness was put before Jesus.
42014003	Jesus asked the teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers, “Does the Law say it is right to heal on the Day of Rest, or not?”
42014004	They did not answer. Jesus took hold of the man and healed him and sent him away.
42014005	Then Jesus said to the leaders, “If one of you had a cow or donkey that fell into a hole, would you not go at once and pull it out on the Day of Rest?”
42014006	And they were not able to answer His questions.
42014007	Jesus had been watching those who were asked to come to supper. They were all trying to get the important seats. He told them a picture-story, saying,
42014008	“When you are asked by someone to a wedding supper, do not take the important seat. Someone more important than you may have been asked to come also.
42014009	The one who asked both of you to come may say to you, ‘The important seat is for this man.’ Then you will be ashamed as you take the last place.
42014010	But when you are asked to come to the table, sit down on the last seat. Then the one who asked you may come and say to you, ‘Friend, go to a more important place.’ Then you will be shown respect in front of all who are at the table with you.
42014011	Whoever makes himself look more important than he is will find out how little he is worth. Whoever does not try to honor himself will be made important.”
42014012	Then Jesus said to the man who asked Him to eat in his house, “When you have a supper, do not ask your friends or your brothers or your family or your rich neighbors. They will ask you to come to their place for a supper. That way you will be paid back for what you have done.
42014013	When you have a supper, ask poor people. Ask those who cannot walk and those who are blind.
42014014	You will be happy if you do this. They cannot pay you back. You will get your pay when the people who are right with God are raised from the dead.”
42014015	When one of those eating at the table with Jesus heard this, he said, “Everyone is happy who will eat in the holy nation of God.”
42014016	Then Jesus said to the leader of the proud religious law-keepers, “There was a man who was giving a big supper. He asked many people to come to eat.
42014017	When it was about time to eat, he sent one of the servants he owned to tell those he had asked, saying, ‘Come, everything is ready now.’
42014018	They all gave different reasons why they could not come. The first said, ‘I have bought some land and I must go and see it. Do not expect me to come.’
42014019	Another one said, ‘I have bought ten cows to use for working in my fields. I must go and try them out. Do not expect me to come.’
42014020	And another one said, ‘I have just been married and I cannot come.’
42014021	“The servant went back to his owner and told him these things. Then his owner became angry. He said to his servant, ‘Hurry into the streets and narrow roads of the city and bring poor people here. Bring those whose bodies are diseased. Bring those who cannot walk and those who are blind.’
42014022	The servant came back and said, ‘Sir, what you told me to do has been done. But there are still some empty places.’
42014023	Then the owner said to his servant, ‘Go out along the roads leading away from the city and into the fields. Tell them they must come. Do this so my house will be filled.
42014024	I tell you, not one of those I had asked will eat of my supper.’”
42014025	Many people followed Jesus. Then He turned around and said to them,
42014026	“If any man comes to Me and does not have much more love for Me than for his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, and even his own life, he cannot be My follower.
42014027	If he does not carry his cross and follow Me, he cannot be My follower.
42014028	“If one of you wanted to build a large building, you would sit down first and think of how much money it would take to build it. You would see if you had enough money to finish it,
42014029	or when the base of the building is finished, you might see that you do not have enough money to finish it. Then all who would see it would make fun of you.
42014030	They would say, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish.’
42014031	“What if a king is going to war with another king? Will he not sit down first and decide if he is able to go with 10,000 men against the other king who is coming with 20,000 men?
42014032	Or, he will send a soldier to the other king while he is still a long way off. He will ask what can be done to have peace.
42014033	In the same way, whoever does not give up all that he has, cannot be My follower.
42014034	“Salt is good. But if salt has lost its taste, how can it be made to taste like salt again?
42014035	It is no good for the field or the waste place. Men throw it away. You have ears, then listen!”
42015001	All the tax-gatherers and sinners were coming to hear Jesus.
42015002	The proud religious law-keepers and the teachers of the Law began to speak against Him. They said, “This man receives sinners and eats with them.”
42015003	Then Jesus told them a picture-story, saying,
42015004	“What if one of you had one hundred sheep and you lost one of them? Would you not leave the ninety-nine in the country and go back and look for the one which was lost until you find it?
42015005	When you find it, you are happy as you carry it back on your shoulders.
42015006	Then you would go to your house and call your friends and neighbors. You would say to them, ‘Be happy with me because I have found my sheep that was lost.’
42015007	I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven because of one sinner who is sorry for his sins and turns from them, than for ninety-nine people right with God who do not have sins to be sorry for.
42015008	“What if a woman has ten silver pieces of money and loses one of them? Does she not light a lamp and sweep the floor and look until she finds it?
42015009	When she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together. She says to them, ‘Be happy with me. I have found the piece of money I had lost.’
42015010	I tell you, it is the same way among the angels of God. If one sinner is sorry for his sins and turns from them, the angels are very happy.”
42015011	And Jesus said, “There was a man who had two sons.
42015012	The younger son said to his father, ‘Father, let me have the part of the family riches that will be coming to me.’ Then the father divided all that he owned between his two sons.
42015013	Soon after that the younger son took all that had been given to him and went to another country far away. There he spent all he had on wild and foolish living.
42015014	When all his money was spent, he was hungry. There was no food in the land.
42015015	He went to work for a man in this far away country. His work was to feed pigs.
42015016	He was so hungry he was ready to eat the outside part of the ears of the corn the pigs ate because no one gave him anything.
42015017	“He began to think about what he had done. He said to himself, ‘My father pays many men who work for him. They have all the food they want and more than enough. I am about dead because I am so hungry.
42015018	I will get up and go to my father. I will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you.
42015019	I am not good enough to be called your son. But may I be as one of the workmen you pay to work?” ’
42015020	“The son got up and went to his father. While he was yet a long way off, his father saw him. The father was full of loving-pity for him. He ran and threw his arms around him and kissed him.
42015021	The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am not good enough to be called your son.’
42015022	But the father said to the workmen he owned, ‘Hurry! Get the best coat and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet.
42015023	Bring the calf that is fat and kill it. Let us eat and be glad.
42015024	For my son was dead and now he is alive again. He was lost and now he is found. Let us eat and have a good time.’
42015025	“The older son was out in the field. As he was coming near the house, he heard music and dancing.
42015026	He called one of the servants and asked what was happening.
42015027	The servant answered, ‘Your brother has come back and your father has killed the fat calf. Your brother is in the house and is well.’
42015028	The older brother was angry and would not go into the house. His father went outside and asked him to come in.
42015029	The older son said to his father, ‘All these many years I have served you. I have always obeyed what you said. But you never gave me a young goat so I could have a supper and a good time with my friends.
42015030	But as soon as this son of yours came back, you killed the fat calf. And yet he wasted your money with bad women.’
42015031	“The father said to him, ‘My son, you are with me all the time. All that I have is yours.
42015032	It is right and good that we should have a good time and be glad. Your brother was dead and now he is alive again. He was lost and now he is found.’ ”
42016001	Jesus said to His followers, “There was a rich man who put a boss over his houses and lands. Someone told him that his boss was not using his riches in a right way.
42016002	The rich man sent for the boss and said, ‘What is this I hear about you? Tell me what you have done with my things. You are not to be the boss of my houses and lands anymore.’
42016003	“The boss said to himself, ‘What will I do now? The owner of the houses and lands is taking my work away from me. I cannot dig in the ground for a living. I am too proud to ask for help.
42016004	I know what I will do. I will make it so that when I lose this work I will be able to go to the homes of my friends.’
42016005	“He sent for the people who owed the rich man. He asked the first one, ‘How much do you owe the owner?’
42016006	The first man said, ‘One hundred barrels of oil.’The boss said to him, ‘Take your bill. Sit down at once and change it to fifty.’
42016007	He asked another one, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘One hundred bags of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill and change it to eighty.’
42016008	Then the rich man said that this sinful boss had been wise to plan for himself for the days ahead. For the people of the world are wiser in their day than the children of light.
42016009	“I tell you, make friends for yourselves by using the riches of the world that are so often used in wrong ways. So when riches are a thing of the past, friends may receive you into a home that will be forever.
42016010	He that is faithful with little things is faithful with big things also. He that is not honest with little things is not honest with big things.
42016011	If you have not been faithful with riches of this world, who will trust you with true riches?
42016012	If you have not been faithful in that which belongs to another person, who will give you things to have as your own?
42016013	No servant can have two bosses. He will hate the one and love the other. Or, he will be faithful to one and not faithful to the other. You cannot be faithful to God and to riches at the same time.”
42016014	The proud religious law-keepers heard all these things. They loved money so they made fun of Jesus.
42016015	Jesus said to them, “You are the kind of people who make yourselves look good before other people. God knows your hearts. What men think is good is hated in the eyes of God.
42016016	Until John came, you had the writings of the Law and of the early preachers. From that time until now the Good News of the holy nation of God has been preached. Everyone is pushing his way in.
42016017	But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one small part of a word in the Law to be of no more use.
42016018	“Whoever divorces his wife and marries another woman is not faithful in marriage and is guilty of sex sins.
42016019	“There was a rich man who dressed in purple linen clothes everyday. He lived like a king would live with the best of food.
42016020	There was a poor man named Lazarus who had many bad sores. He was put by the door of the rich man.
42016021	He wanted the pieces of food that fell from the table of the rich man. Even dogs came and licked his sores.
42016022	“The poor man who asked for food died. He was taken by the angels into the arms of Abraham. The rich man died also and was buried.
42016023	In hell the rich man was in much pain. He looked up and saw Abraham far away and Lazarus beside him.
42016024	He cried out and said, ‘Father Abraham, take pity on me. Send Lazarus. Let him put the end of his finger in water and cool my tongue. I am in much pain in this fire.’
42016025	Abraham said, ‘My son, do not forget that when you were living you had your good things. Lazarus had bad things. Now he is well cared for. You are in pain.
42016026	And more than all this, there is a big deep place between us. No one from here can go there even if he wanted to go. No one can come from there.’
42016027	“Then the rich man said, ‘Father, then I beg you to send Lazarus to my father’s house.
42016028	I have five brothers. Let him tell them of these things, or they will come to this place of much pain also.’
42016029	Abraham said, ‘They have the Writings of Moses and of the early preachers. Let them hear what they say.’
42016030	But the rich man said, ‘No, Father Abraham. If someone goes to them from the dead, they will be sorry for their sins and turn from them.’
42016031	Abraham said to him, ‘If they do not listen to Moses and to the early preachers, they will not listen even if someone is raised from the dead.’ ”
42017001	Jesus said to His followers, “Forsure, things will come that will make people sin. But it is bad for the person who makes someone else sin.
42017002	It would be better for him to have a large rock put around his neck and be thrown into the sea, than that he should cause one of these little ones to sin.
42017003	“Watch yourselves! If your brother sins, speak sharp words to him. If he is sorry and turns from his sin, forgive him.
42017004	What if he sins against you seven times in one day? If he comes to you and says he is sorry and turns from his sin, forgive him.”
42017005	The followers said to the Lord, “Give us more faith.”
42017006	The Lord said, “If your faith was as a mustard seed, you could say to this tree, ‘Be pulled out of the ground and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
42017007	“What if you owned a servant who was working in the field or taking care of sheep? Would you say to him when he came in from his work, ‘Come and sit down to eat?’
42017008	No, instead you would say, ‘Get my supper ready. Dress yourself and care for me until I am through eating and drinking. Then you can eat and drink.’
42017009	Does the servant get thanks for doing what he was told to do? I am sure he does not.
42017010	It is the same with you also. When you do everything you have been told to do, you must say, ‘We are not any special servants. We have done only what we should have done.’”
42017011	Jesus went on His way to Jerusalem. He was passing between the countries of Samaria and Galilee.
42017012	As He was going into one of the towns, ten men with a bad skin disease came to Him. They stood a little way off.
42017013	They called to Him, “Jesus! Teacher! Take pity on us!”
42017014	When Jesus saw them, He said, “Go and show yourselves to the religious leaders.” As they went, they were healed.
42017015	One of them turned back when he saw he was healed. He thanked God with a loud voice.
42017016	He got down on his face at the feet of Jesus and thanked Him. He was from the country of Samaria.
42017017	Jesus asked, “Were there not ten men who were healed? Where are the other nine?
42017018	Is this stranger from another country the only one who turned back to give thanks to God?”
42017019	Then Jesus said to him, “Get up and go on your way. Your trust in God has healed you.”
42017020	The proud religious law-keepers asked when the holy nation of God would come. Jesus said to them, “The holy nation of God is not coming in such a way that can be seen with the eyes.
42017021	It will not be said, ‘See, here it is!’ or, ‘There it is!’ For the holy nation of God is in you.”
42017022	Jesus said to His followers, “The time will come when you will wish you could see the Son of Man for one day. But you will not be able to.
42017023	They will say to you, ‘He is here,’ or, ‘He is there,’ but do not follow them.
42017024	When the Son of Man comes, He will be as lightning that shines from one part of the sky to the other.
42017025	But before that, He must suffer many hard things. The people of this day will have nothing to do with Him.
42017026	“As it was in the time of Noah, so will it be when the Son of Man comes back.
42017027	People ate and drank. They married and were given in marriage. They did these things until the day Noah went into the large boat. Then the flood came and killed all the people on earth.
42017028	It was the same in the time of Lot. People ate and drank. They bought and sold. They planted and built.
42017029	But the day Lot left the city of Sodom, fire and sulphur came down from heaven like rain. It killed all the people of Sodom.
42017030	“It will be the same on the day when the Son of Man comes again.
42017031	In that day the man who is on top of a house should not come down to take his things out of the house. In the same way, the man who is in the field should not go back to his house.
42017032	Remember Lot’s wife!
42017033	“He who wants to keep his life will have it taken away from him. He who loses his life will have it given back to him.
42017034	I tell you, on that night there will be two men in the same bed. One of them will be taken. The other will be left.
42017035	Two women will be grinding grain together. One of them will be taken. The other will be left.
42017036	Two men will be working in a field. One will be taken. The other will be left.”
42017037	Then they asked Jesus, “Where will this happen?” He said to them, “Birds also gather where there is a dead body.”
42018001	Jesus told them a picture-story to show that men should always pray and not give up.
42018002	He said, “There was a man in one of the cities who was head of the court. His work was to say if a person was guilty or not. This man was not afraid of God. He did not respect any man.
42018003	In that city there was a woman whose husband had died. She kept coming to him and saying, ‘Help me! There is someone who is working against me.’
42018004	For awhile he would not help her. Then he began to think, ‘I am not afraid of God and I do not respect any man.
42018005	But I will see that this woman whose husband has died gets her rights because I get tired of her coming all the time.’ ”
42018006	Then the Lord said, “Listen to the words of the sinful man who is head of the court.
42018007	Will not God make the things that are right come to His chosen people who cry day and night to Him? Will He wait a long time to help them?
42018008	I tell you, He will be quick to help them. But when the Son of Man comes, will He find faith on the earth?”
42018009	Jesus told another picture-story to some people who trusted in themselves and thought they were right with God. These people did not think well of other men.
42018010	Jesus said, “Two men went up to the house of God to pray. One of them was a proud religious law-keeper. The other was a man who gathered taxes.
42018011	The proud religious law-keeper stood and prayed to himself like this, ‘God, I thank You that I am not like other men. I am not like those who steal. I am not like those who do things that are wrong. I am not like those who do sex sins. I am not even like this tax-gatherer.
42018012	I go without food two times a week so I can pray better. I give one-tenth part of the money I earn.’
42018013	But the man who gathered taxes stood a long way off. He would not even lift his eyes to heaven. But he hit himself on his chest and said, ‘God, have pity on me! I am a sinner!’
42018014	I tell you, this man went back to his house forgiven, and not the other man. For whoever makes himself look more important than he is will find out how little he is worth. Whoever does not try to honor himself will be made important.”
42018015	People took their little children to Jesus so He could put His hand on them. When His followers saw it, they spoke sharp words to the people.
42018016	Jesus called the followers to Him and said, “Let the little children come to Me. Do not try to stop them. The holy nation of God is made up of ones like these.
42018017	For sure, I tell you, whoever does not receive the holy nation of God as a child will not go into the holy nation.”
42018018	A leader of the people asked Jesus, “Good Teacher, what must I do to have life that lasts forever?”
42018019	Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? There is only One Who is good. That is God.
42018020	You know the Laws. You must not do any sex sins. You must not kill another person. You must not steal. You must not tell a lie about someone else. Respect your father and your mother.”
42018021	The leader said, “I have obeyed all these Laws since I was a boy.”
42018022	When Jesus heard this, He said to the leader of the people, “There is still one thing you need to do. Sell everything you have. Give the money to poor people. Then you will have riches in heaven. Come and follow Me.”
42018023	When the leader heard this, he was very sad because he had many riches.
42018024	When Jesus saw that he was very sad, He said, “It is hard for those with riches to go into the holy nation of God!
42018025	It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to go into the holy nation of God.”
42018026	Those who heard this, said, “Then who can be saved from the punishment of sin?”
42018027	Jesus said, “God can do things men cannot do.”
42018028	Then Peter said, “See, we have left everything and have followed You.”
42018029	Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, anyone who has left his house or parents or brothers or wife or children because of the holy nation of God
42018030	will receive much more now. In the time to come he will have life that lasts forever.”
42018031	Then Jesus took the twelve followers to one side and said, “See! We are going up to Jerusalem. All the things the early preachers wrote about the Son of Man are going to happen.
42018032	He will be given over to the people who are not Jews. He will be made fun of. He will be hurt. He will be spit on.
42018033	They will beat Him and kill Him. After three days He will be raised again.”
42018034	The followers did not understand these words. The meaning of these words was hidden from them. They did not know what He said.
42018035	Jesus was coming near Jericho. A blind man was sitting by the side of the road, begging.
42018036	He heard many people going by and asked what was happening.
42018037	They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was going by.
42018038	Then he cried out and said, “Jesus, Son of David, have pity on me.”
42018039	The people spoke sharp words to him and told him not to call out. But he cried out all the more, “Son of David, have pity on me.”
42018040	Jesus stopped and told the people to bring the blind man to Him. When the man was near, Jesus asked,
42018041	“What do you want Me to do for you?” He answered, “Lord, I want to see.”
42018042	Jesus said to him, “Then see! Your faith has healed you.”
42018043	At once he could see. He followed Jesus and gave thanks to God. All the people gave thanks to God when they saw it.
42019001	Jesus went on to the city of Jerichoand was passing through it.

42019003	Zaccheus wanted to see Jesus but he could not because so many people were there and he was a short man.

42019005	When Jesus came to the place, He looked up and saw Zaccheus. He said, “Zaccheus, come down at once. I must stay in your house today.”
42019006	At once he came down and was glad to have Jesus come to his house.
42019007	When the people saw it, they began to complain among themselves. They said, “He is going to stay with a man who is known to be a sinner.”

42019012	So Jesus said, “A leader of a country went to another country far away. A nation was to be given to him, then he would return home.
42019013	He called ten of the servants he owned. He gave them ten pieces of money and said to them, ‘Put this money to use until I return.’
42019014	But other men in his country hated him. They sent men after him to tell him they did not want him as their king.
42019015	After he had been given the other nation, he returned as king. He asked for his servants who had received the money to come to him. He wanted to know how much more they had after putting it to use.
42019016	The first one came and said, ‘Lord, the piece of money you gave me has made ten more pieces of money.’
42019017	He said to him, ‘You are a good servant. You have been faithful in using a little. Now you will be leader over ten cities.’
42019018	“The second man came to him and said, ‘Lord, the piece of money you gave me has made five more pieces of money.’
42019019	He said to him, ‘You are to be leader over five cities.’
42019020	“Another one came saying, ‘Lord, look! Here is your piece of money. I have kept it hid in a piece of cloth.
42019021	I was afraid of you. You are a hard man. You take what you have not put down. You gather where you have not planted.’

42019023	Why did you not put my money in the bank? Then when I came back I could have had my own money and what the bank paid for using it.’

42019025	And they said to him, ‘Lord, he already has ten pieces of money.’”

42019047	Jesus taught each day in the house of God. But the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law and other leaders of the people tried to think of some way they could kill Him.
42019048	They could not find a way because the people were always near Him listening to Him teach.
42020001	As He was teaching and preaching the Good News, the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law and the elders came.
42020002	They said to Him, “Tell us, by what right and power are You doing these things? Who gave You the right and the power?”
42020003	Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question also. You answer Me.
42020004	Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men?”
42020005	They said to themselves, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
42020006	But if we say, ‘From men,’ then all the people will throw stones at us because they believe John was one who spoke for God.”
42020007	They said that they did not know where John’s baptism came from.
42020008	Jesus said to them, “And I will not tell you where I get the right and the power to do these things.”
42020009	Jesus began to tell the people a picture-story, saying, “There was a man who planted a grape-field. He rented it to farmers. Then he went to a country far away for a long time.
42020010	At the time of gathering fruit he sent one of his servants to the farmers to get some of the fruit. But the farmers beat him and sent him away without fruit.
42020011	He sent another servant. The farmers beat him also. They made it very hard for him and sent him away without fruit.
42020012	He sent a third servant. They hurt him and threw him out of the grape-field.
42020013	“Then the owner of the grape-field said, ‘What should I do? I will send my much-loved son. They might respect him.’
42020014	The farmers saw the son. They said to themselves, ‘This is the one who will get everything when the owner dies. Let us kill him, and we will get everything.’
42020015	They put him out of the grape-field and killed him. Now what will the owner of the grape-field do to them?
42020016	He will come and kill those farmers. Then he will rent the grape-field to other farmers.” When they heard this, they said, “May this never be done!”
42020017	Jesus looked at them and said, “What does this writing mean, ‘The Stone that was put aside by the workmen has become the most important Stone in the building’? (Psalm 118:22)
42020018	Whoever falls on this Stone will be broken. And on the one it falls, it will make him like dust.” (Isaiah 8:14–15)
42020019	At this time the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law tried to take Jesus, but they were afraid of the people. These leaders knew Jesus had told this picture-story against them.
42020020	They watched Jesus and they sent men who pretended to be good people to watch Him. They wanted to trap Him in something He said. Then they could give Him over to the leader of the people who had the right and the power to say what to do with Him.
42020021	These men who were sent asked Jesus, “Teacher, we know what You say and teach is right. We know You do not show more respect to one person than to another. We know You teach the truth about God.
42020022	Is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
42020023	Jesus knew they were trying to trap Him. He said,
42020024	“Show Me a piece of money. Whose picture is this? Whose name is on it?” And they said, “Caesar’s.”
42020025	Jesus said to them, “Pay to Caesar the things that belong to Caesar. Pay to God the things that belong to God.”
42020026	They could find nothing wrong with what He taught. They were surprised and wondered about what He told the people, so they said nothing more.
42020027	Some people from the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Jesus. They asked Him,
42020028	“Teacher, Moses wrote to us in the Law, ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, then his brother must marry her. He should have children for his brother who died.’ (Deuteronomy 25:5)
42020029	There were seven brothers. The first had a wife but died without children.
42020030	The second brother took her for his wife. He died without children.
42020031	The third brother took her for his wife. In the same way all seven took her for a wife. They all died without children.
42020032	Then the woman died also.
42020033	When people are raised from the dead, whose wife will she be? All seven brothers had her for a wife.”
42020034	Jesus said to them, “People of this earth marry and are given in marriage.
42020035	But those who have the right to have that life and are raised from the dead do not marry and are not given in marriage.
42020036	They cannot die anymore. They are as the angels and are sons of God. They are children who have been raised from the dead.
42020037	As for the dead being raised, even Moses spoke of that when he told of the burning bush. There he calls the Lord, the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.
42020038	For He is not the God of the dead. He is the God of the living. All live for Him.”

42020043	until I make those who hate You a place to rest Your feet.” ’ (Psalm 110:1)
42020044	David calls Him, ‘Lord!’ Then how can He be his son?”

42020047	They take houses from poor women whose husbands have died. They cover up their actions by making long prayers. They will be punished all the more.”
42021001	Jesus looked up and saw rich men putting their money into the money box in the house of God.

42022037	I tell you, that what has been written about Me must happen. It says, ‘They thought of Him as One Who broke the Law.’ (Isaiah 53:12) What is told about Me must happen.”
42022038	They said, “Lord, look, we have two swords.” He answered, “That is enough.”
42022039	Jesus came out of the room. Then He went to the Mount of Olives as He had been doing. The followers went with Him.
42022040	When He got there, He said to them, “Pray that you will not be tempted.”
42022041	He walked away from them about as far as a stone can be thrown. There He got down with His face on the ground and prayed.
42022042	He said, “Father, if it can be done, take away what must happen to Me. Even so, not what I want, but what You want.”
42022043	An angel from heaven came and gave Him strength.
42022044	His heart was much troubled and He prayed all the more. Water ran from His face like blood and fell to the ground.
42022045	When Jesus got up after praying, He went back to the followers. He found them sleeping because of so much sorrow.
42022046	He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray that you will not be tempted.”
42022047	While Jesus was speaking, Judas came walking ahead of many people. He was one of the twelve followers. He came near to Jesus to kiss Him.
42022048	But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you handing over the Son of Man with a kiss?”
42022049	Those around Jesus saw what was going to happen and asked, “Lord, should we fight with our swords?”
42022050	One of them hit a servant who was owned by the head religious leader and cut off his right ear.
42022051	Jesus said, “Stop! This is enough.” And He put His hand on his ear and healed him.
42022052	Jesus said to the religious leaders and the leaders of the house of God and the other leaders who came to Him, “Have you come with swords and sticks to take Me, as if I were a robber?
42022053	While I was with you everyday in the house of God, you never took hold of Me. But now is the time you are to come and you have come in the dark.”
42022054	Then they led Jesus away to the house of the head religious leader. Peter followed a long way behind Him.
42022055	They built a fire in the yard and sat down. Peter sat down with them.
42022056	One of the servant-girls saw Peter as he sat by the fire and looked right at him. She said, “This man was with Jesus also.”
42022057	Peter lied and said, “Woman, I do not know Him.”
42022058	After awhile another person saw him and said, “You are one of them also.” Peter said, “No, sir, I am not.”
42022059	About an hour later another person said the same thing, “For sure, this man was with Jesus also because he is from Galilee.”
42022060	But Peter said, “Sir, I do not know what you are saying.” And at once, while he was talking, a rooster crowed.
42022061	The Lord turned and looked at Peter. He remembered the Lord had said, “Before a rooster crows, you will say three times that you do not know Me.”
42022062	Peter went outside and cried with a troubled heart.
42022063	Those who watched Jesus so He could not get away made fun of Him and beat Him.
42022064	They covered His eyes with a cloth and asked Him, “Tell us who hit You!”
42022065	They said many other bad things against Jesus.
42022066	When it was morning the leaders of the people and the religious leaders and the teachers of the Law got together. They took Jesus to the court of the religious leader. They said,
42022067	“Tell us if you are the Christ.” He said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe Me.
42022068	If I ask you something, you will not tell Me.
42022069	From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the All-powerful God.”
42022070	They all said, “Then are You the Son of God?” He said, “You say that I am.”
42022071	Then they said, “What other word do we need against Him? We have heard Him say this with His own mouth.”
42023001	Then all the many people got up and took Jesus to Pilate.
42023002	They began to tell things against Him, saying, “We have found this Man leading the people of our nation in a wrong way. He has been telling them not to pay taxes to Caesar. He has been saying He is Christ, a King.”
42023003	Pilate asked Jesus, “Are You the King of the Jews?” He said, “What you said is true.”
42023004	Then Pilate said to the religious leaders and to the people, “I find nothing wrong in this Man.”
42023005	They became more angry. They said, “He makes trouble among the people. He has been teaching over all the country of Judea, starting in Galilee and now here.”
42023006	When Pilate heard the word, Galilee, he asked, “Is the Man from Galilee?”
42023007	As soon as Pilate knew Jesus belonged in the country where Herod was king, he sent Him to Herod. Herod was in Jerusalem at that time also.
42023008	Herod was very glad when he saw Jesus because he had wanted to see Him for a long time. He had heard many things about Him and had hoped to see Him do some powerful work.
42023009	Herod talked to Jesus and asked many things. But Jesus said nothing.
42023010	The religious leaders and the teachers of the Law were standing there. They said many false things against Him.
42023011	Then Herod and his soldiers were very bad to Jesus and made fun of Him. They put a beautiful coat on Him and sent Him back to Pilate.
42023012	That day Pilate and Herod became friends. Before that they had worked against each other.
42023013	Pilate called the religious leaders and the leaders of the people and the people together.
42023014	He said to them, “You brought this Man to me as one that leads the people in the wrong way. I have asked Him about these things in front of you. I do not find Him guilty of the things you say against Him.
42023015	Herod found nothing wrong with Him because he sent Him back to us. There is no reason to have Him put to death.
42023016	I will punish Him and let Him go free.”
42023017	Every year at the time of the special supper, Pilate would let one person who was in prison go free.
42023018	They all cried out together with a loud voice, “Take this Man away! Let Barabbas go free.”
42023019	Barabbas had killed some people and had made trouble against the leaders of the country. He had been put in prison.
42023020	Pilate wanted to let Jesus go free so he talked to them again.
42023021	But they cried out, “Nail Him to a cross! Nail Him to a cross!”
42023022	Pilate said to them the third time, “Why, what bad thing has He done? I have found no reason to put Him to death. I will punish Him and let Him go free.”
42023023	But they kept on crying out with loud voices saying that He must be nailed to a cross. Their loud voices got what they wanted.
42023024	Then Pilate said that it should be done as they wanted.
42023025	Pilate let the man go free who had made trouble against the leaders of the country and who had killed people. He gave Jesus over to them to do with as they wanted.
42023026	They led Jesus away. A man named Simon was coming in from the country of Cyrene and they made him carry the cross following behind Jesus.
42023027	Many people followed Jesus. There were women who cried and had sorrow for Him.
42023028	Jesus turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem do not cry for Me. Cry for yourselves and your children.
42023029	Listen! The days are coming when they will say, ‘Those who have never had children are happy. Those whose bodies have never given birth are happy. Those who have never fed babies are happy.’
42023030	They will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us.’ They will say to the hills, ‘Cover us.’
42023031	If they do these things to a green tree, what will they do when it is dry?”
42023032	Two other men were led away with Jesus to be put to death also. These men had done things making them guilty of death.
42023033	When they came to the place called Calvary, they nailed Jesus to a cross. The other two men were nailed to crosses also. One was on the right side of Jesus and the other was on His left side.
42023034	Then Jesus said, “Father, forgive them. They do not know what they are doing.” And they divided His clothes by drawing names.
42023035	The people stood around looking on. The leaders were there with them making fun of Jesus. They said, “He saved others, let Him save Himself if He is the Christ, the Chosen One of God!”
42023036	The soldiers made fun of Him also. They put sour wine before Him.
42023037	They said, “If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself.”
42023038	These words were written in the Greek and Latin and Hebrew languages above His head: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
42023039	One of the men who was guilty of death who was on a cross beside Jesus spoke bad words to Him. He said, “If You are the Christ, save Yourself and us.”
42023040	But the other man on a cross spoke sharp words to the one who made fun of Jesus. He said, “Are you not afraid of God? You are also guilty and will be punished.
42023041	We are suffering and we should, because of the wrong we have done. But this Man has done nothing wrong.”
42023042	And he said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when You come into Your holy nation.”
42023043	Jesus said to him, “For sure, I tell you, today you will be with Me in Paradise.”
42023044	It was dark over all the earth from noon until three o’clock.
42023045	The sun did not shine. In the house of God the curtain was torn in two pieces.
42023046	Then Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Father, into Your hands I give My spirit.” When He said this, He died.
42023047	When the soldier saw what had happened, he thanked God. He said, “For sure, He was a good man.”
42023048	All the many people who came together to see the things that were done, went away beating themselves on their chests.
42023049	All His friends and the women who had come with Him from Galilee stood a long way off watching these things.
42023050	There was a man named Joseph who belonged to the court. He was a good man and one who did right.
42023051	This man did not agree with what the court did. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews. He was looking for the holy nation of God to come.
42023052	Joseph went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
42023053	Then he took it down and put it in linen cloth. It was laid in a grave which had been cut out in the side of a rock. This grave had never been used.
42023054	It was time to get ready for the Day of Rest which was about to begin.
42023055	The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed behind. They saw the grave and how His body was laid.
42023056	They went back and got some spices and perfumes ready. But they rested on the Day of Rest as the Law said to do.
42024001	Early in the morning on the first day of the week, the women went to the grave taking the spices they had made ready.
42024002	They found the stone had been pushed away from the grave.
42024003	They went in but they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
42024004	While they wondered about what had happened, they saw two men standing by them in shining clothes.
42024005	They were very much afraid and got down with their faces to the ground. The men said to them, “Why do you look for the living One among those who are dead?
42024006	He is not here. He is risen. Do you not remember what He said to you when He was yet in Galilee?
42024007	He said, ‘The Son of Man must be given over into the hands of sinful men. He must be nailed to a cross. He will rise again three days later.’ ”
42024008	They remembered what He had said.
42024009	When they came back from the grave, they told all these things to the eleven followers and to all the others.
42024010	They were Mary Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother of James. Other women who were with them told these things to the followers also.
42024011	Their words sounded like foolish talk. The followers did not believe them.
42024012	But Peter got up and ran to the grave. He got down to look in and saw only the linen clothes. Then he went away, surprised about what had happened.
42024013	That same day two of His followers were going to the town of Emmaus. It was about a two-hour walk from Jerusalem.
42024014	They talked of all these things that had happened.
42024015	While they were talking together, Jesus Himself came and walked along with them.
42024016	Something kept their eyes from seeing Who He was.
42024017	He said to them, “What are you talking about as you walk?” They stood still and looked sad.
42024018	One of them, whose name was Cleopas, said to Him, “Are you the only one visiting Jerusalem who has not heard of the things that have happened here these days?”
42024019	Jesus said to them, “What things?” They answered, “The things about Jesus of Nazareth. He was the great One Who spoke for God. He did powerful works and spoke powerful words in the sight of God and the people.
42024020	And the religious leaders and the leaders of the people gave Him over to be killed and nailed Him to a cross.
42024021	We were hoping He was the One Who was going to make the Jewish people free. But it was three days ago when these things happened.
42024022	“Some of the women of our group have surprised us and made us wonder. They went to the grave early this morning.
42024023	They did not find His body. They came back saying they had seen angels in a special dream who said that He was alive.
42024024	Some of those who were with us went to the grave and found it as the women had said. But they did not see Him.”
42024025	Then Jesus said to them, “You foolish men. How slow you are to believe what the early preachers have said.
42024026	Did not Christ have to go through these hard things to come into His shining-greatness?”
42024027	Jesus kept on telling them what Moses and all the early preachers had said about Him in the Holy Writings.
42024028	When they came to the town where they were going, Jesus acted as if He were going farther.
42024029	But they said to Him, “Stay with us. It will soon be evening. The day is about over.” He went in to stay with them.
42024030	As He sat at the table with them, He took the bread and gave thanks and broke it. Then He gave it to them.
42024031	And their eyes were opened and they knew Him. Then He left them and could not be seen.
42024032	They said to each other, “Were not our hearts filled with joy when He talked to us on the road about what the Holy Writings said?”
42024033	Then they got up at once and went back to Jerusalem. They found the eleven followers together and others with them.
42024034	They said, “For sure the Lord is risen and was seen by Simon.”
42024035	Then they told what had happened on the road and how they came to know Him when He broke the bread.
42024036	As they talked, Jesus Himself stood among them. He said, “May you have peace.”
42024037	But they were afraid and full of fear. They thought they saw a spirit.
42024038	Jesus said to them, “Why are you afraid? Why do you have doubts in your hearts?
42024039	Look at My hands and My feet. See! It is I, Myself! Touch Me and see for yourself. A spirit does not have flesh and bones as I have.”
42024040	When Jesus had said this, He showed them His hands and feet.
42024041	They still wondered. It was hard for them to believe it and yet it made them happy. Then He said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
42024042	They gave Jesus a piece of fish that had been cooked and some honey.
42024043	He took it and ate it in front of them.
42024044	Jesus said to them, “These are the things I told you while I was yet with you. All things written about Me in the Law of Moses and in the Books of the early preachers and in the Psalms must happen as they said they would happen.”
42024045	Then He opened their minds to understand the Holy Writings.
42024046	He said to them, “It is written that Christ should suffer and be raised from the dead after three days.
42024047	It must be preached that men must be sorry for their sins and turn from them. Then they will be forgiven. This must be preached in His name to all nations beginning in Jerusalem.
42024048	You are to tell what you have seen.
42024049	See! I will send you what My Father promised. But you are to stay in Jerusalem until you have received power from above.”
42024050	Jesus led them out as far as Bethany. Then He lifted up His hands and prayed that good would come to them.
42024051	And while He was praying that good would come to them, He went from them (and was taken up to heaven and
42024052	they worshiped Him). Then they went back to Jerusalem with great joy.
42024053	They spent all their time in the house of God honoring and giving thanks to God.
43001001	The Word (Christ) was in the beginning. The Word was with God. The Word was God.
43001002	He was with God in the beginning.
43001003	He made all things. Nothing was made without Him making it.
43001004	Life began by Him. His Life was the Light for men.
43001005	The Light shines in the darkness. The darkness has never been able to put out the Light.
43001006	There was a man sent from God whose name was John.
43001007	He came to tell what he knew about the Light so that all men might believe through him.
43001008	John was not the Light, but he was sent to tell about the Light.
43001009	This true Light, coming into the world, gives light to every man.
43001010	He came into the world. The world was made by Him, but it did not know Him.
43001011	He came to His own, but His own did not receive Him.
43001012	He gave the right and the power to become children of God to those who received Him. He gave this to those who put their trust in His name.
43001013	These children of God were not born of blood and of flesh and of man’s desires, but they were born of God.
43001014	Christ became human flesh and lived among us. We saw His shining-greatness. This greatness is given only to a much-loved Son from His Father. He was full of loving-favor and truth.
43001015	John told about Christ and said, “I have been telling you about this One. I said, ‘He is coming after me. He is more important than I because He lived before me.’”
43001016	From Him Who has so much we have all received loving-favor, one loving-favor after another.
43001017	The Law was given through Moses, but loving-favor and truth came through Jesus Christ.
43001018	The much-loved Son is beside the Father. No man has ever seen God. But Christ has made God known to us.
43001019	The Jews sent their religious leaders and men from the family group of Levi to ask John, “Who are you?”
43001020	He told them without holding back any words, “I am not the Christ!”
43001021	They asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not!” Then they asked, “Are you the special One Who was to come to speak for God?” John said, “No.”
43001022	Then they asked him, “Who are you? We must tell those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
43001023	John said, “I am the voice of one crying in the desert. ‘Make the road straight for the Lord,’ as the early preacher Isaiah said.” (Isaiah 40:3)
43001024	Those who had been sent were from the proud religious law-keepers.
43001025	They asked John again, “Then why do you baptize if you are not the Christ or Elijah or that special One Who was to come to speak for God?”
43001026	John answered, “I baptize with water. But there is One standing among you Whom you do not know.
43001027	He is the One Who is coming after me. I am not good enough to get down and help Him take off His shoes.”
43001028	All this happened when John was baptizing in the town of Bethany. He was on the other side of the Jordan River.
43001029	The next day John the Baptist saw Jesus coming to him. He said, “See! The Lamb of God Who takes away the sin of the world!
43001030	I have been talking about Him. I said, ‘One is coming after me Who is more important than I, because He lived before I was born.’
43001031	I did not know who He was, but I have come to baptize with water so the Jews might know about Him.”
43001032	Then John said, “I saw the Holy Spirit come down on Jesus as a dove from heaven. The Holy Spirit stayed on Him.
43001033	I did not know Him then. But God sent me to baptize with water. God said to me, ‘The Holy Spirit will come down and stay on Him. He is the One Who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
43001034	I saw this happen. I am now saying that Jesus is the Son of God.”
43001035	The next day John the Baptist was standing with two of his own followers.
43001036	Jesus walked by. John looked at Him and said, “See! The Lamb of God.”
43001037	John’s two followers heard him say this and followed Jesus.
43001038	Jesus turned around and saw them following. He said to them, “What are you looking for?” They answered, “Teacher, where are you staying?”
43001039	He said to them, “Come and see.” They followed Him and saw where He lived. They stayed with Him that day. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon.
43001040	Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, was one of the two who had heard John’s words and had followed Jesus.
43001041	The first thing he did was to find his brother Simon. He said to him, “We have found the Christ!”
43001042	Andrew took Simon to Jesus. When Jesus saw Simon, He said, “You are Simon, the son of John. Your name will be Cephas.” The name Cephas means Peter, or a rock.
43001043	The next day Jesus wanted to go to the country of Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow Me.”
43001044	Philip was from the town of Bethsaida. Andrew and Peter were from this town also.
43001045	Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found the One Moses wrote about in the Law. He is the One the early preachers wrote about. He is Jesus of Nazareth, the Son of Joseph.”
43001046	Nathanael said, “Can anything good come out of the town of Nazareth?” Philip said, “Come and see.”
43001047	Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him and said, “See! There is a true Jew. There is nothing false in him.”
43001048	Nathanael said to Jesus, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered him, “Before Philip talked to you, I saw you under the fig tree.”
43001049	Nathanael said to Him, “Teacher, You are the Son of God. You are the King of the Jews.”
43001050	Jesus said to him, “Do you believe because I said I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than that.
43001051	For sure, I tell you, you will see heaven opened and God’s angels going up and coming and down on the Son of Man.”
43002001	Three days later there was a wedding in the town of Cana in the country of Galilee. The mother of Jesus was there.
43002002	Jesus and His followers were asked to come to the wedding.
43002003	When the wine was all gone, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no more wine.”
43002004	Jesus said to her, “Woman, what is that to you and to Me? It is not time for Me to work yet.”
43002005	His mother said to the helpers, “Do whatever He says.”
43002006	Six stone water jars were there. Each one held about one-half barrel of water. These water jars were used in the Jewish worship of washing.
43002007	Jesus said to the helpers, “Fill the jars with water.” They filled them to the top.
43002008	Then He said, “Take some out and give it to the head man who is caring for the people.” They took some to him.
43002009	The head man tasted the water that had become wine. He did not know where it came from but the helpers who took it to him knew. He called the man who had just been married.
43002010	The head man said to him, “Everyone puts out his best wine first. After people have had much to drink, he puts out the wine that is not so good. You have kept the good wine until now!”
43002011	This was the first powerful work Jesus did. It was done in Cana of Galilee where He showed His power. His followers put their trust in Him.
43002012	After this He went down to the city of Capernaum. His mother and brothers and followers went with Him. They stayed there a few days.
43002013	It was time for the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
43002014	He went into the house of God and found cattle and sheep and doves being sold. Men were sitting there changing money.
43002015	Jesus made a whip of small ropes. He used it to make them all leave the house of God along with the sheep and cattle. He pushed their money off the tables and turned the tables over.
43002016	He said to those who sold doves, “Take these things out of here! You must not make My Father’s house a place for buying and selling!”
43002017	Then His followers remembered that it was written in the Holy Writings, “I am jealous for the honor of Your house.” (Psalm 69:9)
43002018	Then the Jews asked Him, “What can You do to show us You have the right and the power to do these things?”
43002019	Jesus answered them, “Destroy this house of God and in three days I will build it again.”
43002020	Then the Jews said, “It took forty-six years to build this house of God. Will You build it up in three days?”
43002021	Jesus was speaking of His body as the house of God.
43002022	After Jesus had been raised from the dead, His followers remembered He said this. They believed the Holy Writings and what He had said.
43002023	Jesus was in Jerusalem at the time of the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Many people put their trust in Him when they saw the powerful works He did.
43002024	But Jesus did not trust them because He knew all men.
43002025	He did not need anyone to tell Him about man. He knew what was in man.
43003001	There was a man named Nicodemus. He was a proud religious law-keeper and a leader of the Jews.
43003002	He came to Jesus at night and said, “Teacher, we know You have come from God to teach us. No one can do these powerful works You do unless God is with Him.”
43003003	Jesus said to him, “For sure, I tell you, unless a man is born again, he cannot see the holy nation of God.”
43003004	Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? How can he get into his mother’s body and be born the second time?”
43003005	Jesus answered, “For sure, I tell you, unless a man is born of water and of the Spirit of God, he cannot get into the holy nation of God.
43003006	Whatever is born of the flesh is flesh. Whatever is born of the Spirit is spirit.
43003007	“Do not be surprised that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’
43003008	The wind blows where it wants to and you hear its sound. You do not know where it comes from or where it goes. It is the same with everyone who is born of the Spirit of God.”
43003009	Nicodemus said to Him, “How can this be?”
43003010	Jesus said, “Are you a teacher among the Jews and do not know these things?
43003011	For sure, I tell you, We are talking about things We know. We tell of what We have seen. Yet you do not take Our words to be true.
43003012	I tell you about things of the earth and you do not believe them. How will you believe if I tell you things about heaven?
43003013	“No one has gone up into heaven except the One Who came down from heaven. That One is the Son of Man Who is in heaven.
43003014	As Moses lifted up the snake in the desert, so the Son of Man must be lifted up.
43003015	Then whoever puts his trust in Him will have life that lasts forever.
43003016	For God so loved the world that He gave His only Son. Whoever puts his trust in God’s Son will not be lost but will have life that lasts forever.
43003017	For God did not send His Son into the world to say it is guilty. He sent His Son so the world might be saved from the punishment of sin by Him.
43003018	Whoever puts his trust in His Son is not guilty. Whoever does not put his trust in Him is guilty already. It is because he does not put his trust in the name of the only Son of God.
43003019	“The Light has come into the world. And the Light is the test by which men are guilty or not. People love darkness more than the Light because the things they do are sinful.
43003020	Everyone who sins hates the Light. He stays away from the Light because his sin would be found out.
43003021	The man who does what is right comes to the Light. What he does will be seen because he has done what God wanted him to do.”
43003022	After this, Jesus and His followers came into the country of Judea. He stayed with them there and baptized people.
43003023	John was baptizing in the town of Aenon near Salim. There was much water there and people were coming to be baptized.
43003024	John had not been put in prison yet.
43003025	Then some of the followers of John and a Jew started to argue about the religious washing of the Jewish worship.
43003026	They came to John and said to him, “Teacher, the One with you on the other side of the Jordan River is baptizing also. He is the One you told of. Everyone is going to Him.”
43003027	John said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.
43003028	You heard the words that I said, ‘I am not the Christ, but I have been sent before Him.’
43003029	The man who has just been married has the bride. The friend of the man just married stands at his side and listens to him. He has joy when he hears the voice of the man just married. I am full of this joy.
43003030	He must become more important. I must become less important.
43003031	“He Who comes from above is above all. He who comes from the earth is of the earth and speaks of the earth. He Who comes from heaven is above all.
43003032	He tells of what He has seen and heard. But no one believes what He says.
43003033	Whoever receives His words proves that God is true.
43003034	He was sent by God and He speaks God’s Word. God gives Him all of His Spirit.
43003035	The Father loves the Son and has given all things into His hand.
43003036	He who puts his trust in the Son has life that lasts forever. He who does not put his trust in the Son will not have life, but the anger of God is on him.”
43004001	Jesus knew the proud religious law-keepers had heard He was making and baptizing more followers than John.
43004002	Jesus did not baptize anyone Himself but His followers did.
43004003	Then Jesus went from the country of Judea to the country of Galilee.
43004004	He had to go through the country of Samaria.
43004005	So He came to a town in Samaria called Sycar. It was near the piece of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
43004006	Jacob’s well was there. Jesus was tired from traveling so He sat down just as He was by the well. It was about noon.
43004007	A woman of Samaria came to get water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.”
43004008	His followers had gone to the town to buy food.
43004009	The woman of Samaria said to Him, “You are a Jew. I am of Samaria. Why do You ask me for a drink when the Jews have nothing to do with the people of Samaria?”
43004010	Jesus said to her, “You do not know what God has to give. You do not know Who said to you, ‘Give Me a drink.’ If you knew, you would have asked Him. He would have given you living water.”
43004011	The woman said to Him, “Sir, the well is deep. You have nothing to get water with. Where will You get the living water?
43004012	Are You greater than our early father Jacob? He gave us the well. He and his children and his cattle drank from it.”
43004013	Jesus said to her, “Whoever drinks this water will be thirsty again.
43004014	Whoever drinks the water that I will give him will never be thirsty. The water that I will give him will become in him a well of life that lasts forever.”
43004015	The woman said, “Sir, give me this water so I will never be thirsty. Then I will not have to come all this way for water.”
43004016	Jesus said to her, “Go call your husband and come back.”
43004017	The woman said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said, “You told the truth when you said, ‘I have no husband.’
43004018	You have had five husbands. The one you have now is not your husband. You told the truth.”
43004019	The woman said to Him, “Sir, I think You are a person Who speaks for God.
43004020	Our early fathers worshiped on this mountain. You Jews say Jerusalem is the place where men should worship.”
43004021	Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me. The time is coming when you will not worship the Father on this mountain or in Jerusalem.
43004022	You people do not know what you worship. We Jews know what we worship. It is through the Jews that men are saved from the punishment of their sins.
43004023	The time is coming, yes, it is here now, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and in truth. The Father wants that kind of worshipers.
43004024	God is Spirit. Those who worship Him must worship Him in spirit and in truth.”
43004025	The woman said to Him, “I know the Jews are looking for One Who is coming. He is called the Christ. When He comes, He will tell us everything.”
43004026	Jesus said to her, “I am the Christ, the One talking with you!”
43004027	Right then the followers came back and were surprised and wondered about finding Him talking with a woman. But no one said, “What do You want?” or, “Why are You talking with her?”
43004028	The woman left her water jar and went into the town. She said to the men,
43004029	“Come and see a Man Who told me everything I ever did! Can this be the Christ?”
43004030	They went out of town and came to Him.
43004031	During this time His followers were saying to Him, “Teacher, eat something.”
43004032	He said, “I have food to eat that you do not know of.”
43004033	The followers said to each other, “Has someone taken food to Him?”
43004034	Jesus said, “My food is to do what God wants Me to do and to finish His work.
