43004035	Do you not say, ‘It is four months yet until the time to gather grain’? Listen! I say to you, open your eyes and look at the fields. They are white now and waiting for the grain to be gathered in.
43004036	The one who gathers gets his pay. He gathers fruit that lasts forever. The one who plants and the one who gathers will have joy together.
43004037	These words are true, ‘One man plants and another man gathers.’
43004038	I sent you to gather where you have not planted. Others have planted and you have come along to gather in their fruit.”
43004039	Many people in that town of Samaria believed in Jesus because of what the woman said about Him. She said, “He told me everything I ever did.”
43004040	So the people of Samaria came to Him. They asked Him to stay with them. Jesus stayed there two days.
43004041	Many more people believed because of what He said.
43004042	They said to the woman, “Now we believe! It is no longer because of what you said about Jesus but we have heard Him ourselves. We know, for sure, that He is the Christ, the One Who saves men of this world from the punishment of their sins.”
43004043	Two days later He went from there and came to the country of Galilee.
43004044	Jesus Himself said that no one who speaks for God is respected in his own country.
43004045	When He came to Galilee, the people there were glad. They had seen all the things He did in Jerusalem. It was at the time of the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. They had been there also.
43004046	Jesus came again to the town of Cana of Galilee where He had made water into wine. A man who worked with the king had a son who was sick in the city of Capernaum.
43004047	This man went to Jesus. He had heard that Jesus had come from the country of Judea to Galilee. The man asked Jesus if He would go to Capernaum and heal his son who was dying.
43004048	Then Jesus said to him, “Unless you see special things and powerful works done, you will not believe.”
43004049	The man said to Him, “Sir, come with me before my son dies.”
43004050	Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your son will live.” The man put his trust in what Jesus said and left.
43004051	As he was on his way home, his servants met him. They said to him, “Your son is living!”
43004052	He asked them what time his boy began to get well. They said to him, “Yesterday at one o’clock the sickness left.”
43004053	The father knew it was the time Jesus had said to him, “Your son will live.” He and everyone in his house put their trust in Jesus.
43004054	This was the second powerful work that Jesus did after He came from the country of Judea to the country of Galilee.
43005001	Some time later, there was a religious gathering of the Jews. Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
43005002	In Jerusalem there is a pool with five porches called Bethesda near the sheep gate.
43005003	Inside these porches lay many sick people. Some were blind. Some could not walk. Some could not move their bodies.
43005004	(An angel of the Lord came at certain times and made the water move. All of them were waiting for it to move. Whoever got in the water first after it was moving was healed of whatever sickness he had.)
43005005	A man was there who had been sick for thirty-eight years.
43005006	Jesus saw him lying there and knew the man had been sick a long time. Jesus said to him, “Would you like to be healed?”
43005007	The sick man said, “Sir, I have no one to put me in the pool when the water is moving. While I am coming, another one gets in first.”
43005008	Jesus said to him, “Get up! Pick up your bed and walk.”
43005009	At once the man was healed and picked up his bed and walked. This happened on the Day of Rest.
43005010	The Jews said to the man who had been healed, “This is the Day of Rest. It is against the Law for you to carry your bed.”
43005011	He said to them, “The Man Who healed me said to me, ‘Pick up your bed and walk.’
43005012	Then the Jews asked him, “What man said to you, ‘Pick up your bed and walk’?”
43005013	The man who had been healed did not know Who He was. Jesus had gone away while many people were there.
43005014	Later Jesus found the man who had been healed in the house of God. He said to him, “Listen! You have been healed. Stop sinning or something worse will come to you.”
43005015	The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus Who had healed him.
43005016	Because Jesus did these things on the Day of Rest, the Jews made it very hard for Him.
43005017	Jesus said to them, “My Father is still working all the time so I am working also.”
43005018	The Jews tried all the more to kill Him, not only because He had worked on the Day of Rest, but because He had also called God His Own Father. This made Him the same as God.
43005019	Then Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, the Son can do nothing by Himself. He does what He sees the Father doing. Whatever the Father does, the Son does also.
43005020	The Father loves the Son and shows the Son everything He does. The Father will show Him greater works than these. They will surprise you.
43005021	The Father raises up the dead and makes them live. The Son also gives life to anyone He chooses.
43005022	The Father does not say who is guilty. He gives this to the Son to do.
43005023	He does this so that all people will honor the Son as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father Who sent Him.
43005024	“For sure, I tell you, anyone who hears My Word and puts his trust in Him Who sent Me has life that lasts forever. He will not be guilty. He has already passed from death into life.
43005025	“For sure, I tell you, the time is coming. Yes, the time is here when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God. Those who hear will live.
43005026	The Father has life in Himself. He has given power to the Son to have life in Himself.
43005027	God has given Him the right and the power to say if people are guilty, because He is the Son of Man.
43005028	Do not be surprised at this. The time is coming when all who are in their graves will hear His voice.
43005029	They will come out. Those who have done good will be raised again and will have new life. Those who have been sinful will be raised again and will be told they are guilty and will be punished.
43005030	“I can do nothing by Myself. I say who is guilty only as My Father tells Me. That way, what I say is right, because I am not trying to do what I want to do. I am doing what the Father, Who sent Me, wants Me to do.
43005031	If I tell about Myself, My words are worth nothing.
43005032	There is another One Who tells about Me. I know the words He says about Me are true.
43005033	“You sent to John the Baptist and he told you the truth.
43005034	I do not need words from men to say I am right. I say this that you might be saved from the punishment of sin.
43005035	John the Baptist was a burning and shining light. You were willing for awhile to be glad in his light.
43005036	I have something greater than John which tells of Me. I am doing works the Father has given Me to do and they are proving that the Father has sent Me.
43005037	The Father has told of Me and has sent Me. You have never heard His voice. You have never seen Him.
43005038	You do not have His Word living in your hearts because you do not put your trust in the One He sent.
43005039	“You do read the Holy Writings. You think you have life that lasts forever just because you read them. They do tell of Me.
43005040	But you do not want to come to Me so you might have life.
43005041	I do not take any honor from men.
43005042	I know you and you do not have the love of God in your hearts.
43005043	I have come in the name of My Father. You do not receive Me. If another person comes in his own name, you will receive him.
43005044	How can you believe when you are always wanting honor from each other? And yet you do not look for the honor that comes from the only God.
43005045	“Do not think that I will tell the Father you are guilty. The one who says you are guilty is Moses. You trust him.
43005046	If you had believed Moses, you would believe Me. For Moses wrote about Me.
43005047	If you do not believe what he wrote, how will you believe My Words?”
43006001	After this Jesus went over to the other side of the Sea of Galilee. It is sometimes called Tiberias.
43006002	Many people followed Him. They saw the powerful works He did on those who were sick.
43006003	Jesus went up on a mountain and sat down with His followers.
43006004	The special religious supper to remember how the Jews left Egypt was soon.
43006005	Jesus looked up and saw many people coming to Him. He said to Philip, “Where can we buy bread to feed these people?”
43006006	He said this to see what Philip would say. Jesus knew what He would do.
43006007	Philip said to Him, “The money we have is not enough to buy bread to give each one a little.”
43006008	One of His followers was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother. He said to Jesus,
43006009	“There is a boy here who has five loaves of barley bread and two small fish. What is that for so many people?”
43006010	Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” There was much grass in that place. About five thousand men sat down.
43006011	Jesus took the loaves and gave thanks. Then He gave the bread to those who were sitting down. The fish were given out the same way. The people had as much as they wanted.
43006012	When they were filled, Jesus said to His followers, “Gather up the pieces that are left. None will be wasted.”
43006013	The followers gathered the pieces together. Twelve baskets were filled with pieces of barley bread. These were left after all the people had eaten.
43006014	The people saw the powerful work Jesus had done. They said, “It is true! This is the One Who speaks for God Who is to come into the world.”
43006015	Jesus knew they were about to come and take Him to make Him king, so He went to the mountain by Himself.
43006016	When evening had come, His followers went down to the lake.
43006017	They got into a boat and started to cross the lake to go to the city of Capernaum. By this time it was dark. Jesus had not come back to them yet.
43006018	A strong wind was making high waves on the lake.
43006019	They were about half-way across the lake when they saw Jesus walking on the water. As He got near the boat, they were afraid.
43006020	But Jesus called to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid.”
43006021	They were glad to take Him into the boat. At once they got to the other side where they wanted to go.
43006022	The next day the people on the other side of the lake saw no other boat there but the one His followers had been in. The people knew Jesus had not gone with His followers in the boat because they had gone alone.
43006023	There were other boats from Tiberias that had come near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
43006024	The people saw that Jesus and His followers were not there. They got into boats and went to Capernaum looking for Jesus.
43006025	The people found Him on the other side of the lake. They said to Him, “Teacher, when did You come here?”
43006026	Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, you are not looking for Me because of the powerful works. You are looking for Me because you ate bread and were filled.
43006027	Do not work for food that does not last. Work for food that lasts forever. The Son of Man will give you that kind of food. God the Father has shown He will do this.”
43006028	Then the people said to Him, “What are the works God wants us to do?”
43006029	Jesus said to them, “This is the work of God, that you put your trust in the One He has sent.”
43006030	They said to Him, “Can You show us some powerful work? Then we can see it and believe You. What will You do?
43006031	Our early fathers ate bread that came from heaven in the desert. This happened as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’ ” (Exodus 16:15)
43006032	Then Jesus said to the people, “For sure, I tell you, it was not Moses who gave you bread from heaven. My Father gives you the true Bread from heaven.
43006033	The Bread of God is He Who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
43006034	They said to Him, “Sir, give us this Bread all the time.”
43006035	Jesus said to them, “I am the Bread of Life. He who comes to Me will never be hungry. He who puts his trust in Me will never be thirsty.
43006036	I said to you that you have seen Me and yet you do not put your trust in Me.
43006037	All whom My Father has given to Me will come to Me. I will never turn away anyone who comes to Me.
43006038	I came down from heaven. I did not come to do what I wanted to do. I came to do what My Father wanted Me to do. He is the One Who sent Me.
43006039	“The Father sent Me. He did not want Me to lose any of all those He gave Me. He wants Me to raise them to life on the last day.
43006040	He wants everyone who sees the Son to put his trust in Him and have life that lasts forever. I will raise that one up on the last day.”
43006041	The Jews talked among themselves against Him. They did not like it because He said, “I am the Bread that came down from heaven.”
43006042	They asked each other, “Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph? We know His father and mother. How can He say, ‘I came down from heaven’?”
43006043	Jesus said to them, “Do not talk among yourselves against Me.
43006044	The Father sent Me. No man can come to Me unless the Father gives him the desire to come to Me. Then I will raise him to life on the last day.
43006045	The early preachers wrote, ‘They will all be taught of God.’ (Isaiah 54:13) Everyone who listens to the Father and learns from Him comes to Me.
43006046	No one has seen the Father. I am the only One Who has seen Him.
43006047	For sure, I tell you, he who puts his trust in Me has life that lasts forever.
43006048	I am the Bread of Life.
43006049	Your early fathers ate bread that came from heaven in the desert. They died.
43006050	But this is the Bread that comes down from heaven. The one who eats it never dies.
43006051	I am the Living Bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats this Bread, he will live forever. The Bread which I will give is My flesh. I will give this for the life of the world.”
43006052	The Jews argued among themselves, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”
43006053	Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you do not have life in you.
43006054	Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has life that lasts forever. I will raise him up on the last day.
43006055	My flesh is true food and My blood is true drink.
43006056	Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood lives in Me and I live in him.
43006057	The living Father sent Me and I live because of Him. In the same way, the one who eats Me will live because of Me.
43006058	I am this Bread that came down from heaven. It is not like the bread that your early fathers ate and they died. Whoever eats this Bread will live forever.”
43006059	Jesus said these things in the Jewish place of worship while He was teaching in the city of Capernaum.
43006060	After hearing this, many of His followers said, “This teaching is too hard! Who can listen to it?”
43006061	Jesus knew His followers talked against what He had said. He said to them, “Does this trouble you?
43006062	Then what would you say if you saw the Son of Man going up where He was before?
43006063	It is the Spirit that gives life. The flesh is of no help. The words I speak to you are spirit and life.
43006064	But some of you do not believe.” Jesus knew from the beginning who would not put their trust in Him. He knew who would hand Him over to the leaders of the country.
43006065	He said, “That is why I told you no one can come to Me unless the Father allows it.”
43006066	From that time on, many of His followers turned back to their old ways of living. They would not go along with Him after that.
43006067	Then Jesus said to the twelve followers, “Will you leave Me also?”
43006068	Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, who else can we go to? You have words that give life that lasts forever.
43006069	We believe and know You are the Christ. You are the Son of the Living God.”
43006070	Jesus said to them, “I chose you twelve as My followers. And one of you is a devil.”
43006071	He was speaking of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, who was one of the twelve followers. He was ready to hand Jesus over to the leaders of the country.
43007001	Jesus did not stay in the country of Judea because of the Jews were trying to kill Him. After this He went from place to place in the country of Galilee.
43007002	A religious gathering of the Jews was near. This gathering was called the Supper of Tents.
43007003	The brothers of Jesus said to Him, “Leave here and go to the country of Judea. Let Your followers there see the things You do.
43007004	If a person wants others to know what he is doing, he does things to be seen. Since You are doing such things, show Yourself to the world.”
43007005	Not even His brothers were putting their trust in Him.
43007006	Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come. But any time is good for you.
43007007	The world cannot hate you but it hates Me. I speak against the world because of its sinful works.
43007008	You go to the religious gathering. I am not going yet. My time has not yet come.”
43007009	Jesus told His brothers this and then stayed in Galilee.
43007010	His brothers went to the religious gathering. He went later by Himself so He would not be seen there.
43007011	At the religious gathering the Jews were looking for Jesus. They were saying, “Where is He?”
43007012	There was much talk among the people about Him. Some said, “He is a good Man.” Others said, “No, He leads the people in the wrong way.”
43007013	No one spoke about Him in front of other people. They were afraid of the Jews.
43007014	The religious gathering was half over when Jesus went to the house of God and taught.
43007015	The Jews were surprised and wondered, saying, “How can this Man know so much when He has never been to school?”
43007016	Jesus said to them, “What I teach is not Mine. It is from God Who sent Me.
43007017	If anyone will do what God wants, he will know if My teaching is from God, or if I am speaking of Myself.
43007018	The man who speaks of himself is looking for greatness for himself. But He Who is looking for the greatness of the One Who sent Him is true. There is nothing false in Him.
43007019	Did not Moses give you the Law? And yet not one of you keeps the Law. Why do you try to kill me?”
43007020	The people said, “You have a demon in You. Who is trying to kill You?”
43007021	Jesus said to them, “I did one work and you are surprised.
43007022	Moses gave you the religious act of becoming a Jew. (Yet it was not from Moses but from the early fathers.) You do this religious act on a man on the Day of Rest.
43007023	Now if you can do that, why are you angry with Me for healing a man on the Day of Rest?
43007024	Do not say a person is guilty by what you see. Be sure you know when you say what is right or wrong.”
43007025	Some of the people of Jerusalem said, “Is not this the Man the Jews want to kill?
43007026	But see! This Man is speaking out in the open. They are saying nothing to Him. Do the leaders know this is the true Christ?
43007027	We know where this Man came from. When the Christ comes, no one will know where He comes from.”
43007028	Then Jesus spoke with a loud voice as He taught in the house of God. He said, “You know Me. You know where I came from. I have not come on My own. The One Who sent Me is true but you do not know Him.
43007029	I know Him because I am from Him and He sent Me.”
43007030	Then they wanted to take Jesus but no one put his hands on Him. His time had not yet come.
43007031	Many of the people believed in Him. They said, “When Christ comes, will He do more powerful works than this Man?”
43007032	The proud religious law-keepers heard the people talking about Jesus. The religious leaders of the Jews and the proud religious law-keepers sent soldiers to take Him.
43007033	Jesus said to them, “I will be with you a little while yet. Then I will go back to Him Who sent Me.
43007034	You will look for Me but you will not find Me. Where I go, you cannot come.”
43007035	The Jews said to themselves, “Where can He go that we will not find Him? Will He go to our people who live among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
43007036	What does He mean when He says, ‘You will look for Me but you will not find Me, and where I go, you cannot come’?”
43007037	It was the last and great day of the religious gathering. Jesus stood up and spoke with a loud voice, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to Me and drink.
43007038	The Holy Writings say that rivers of living water will flow from the heart of the one who puts his trust in Me.”
43007039	Jesus said this about the Holy Spirit Who would come to those who put their trust in Him. The Holy Spirit had not yet been given. Jesus had not yet been raised to the place of honor.
43007040	When many of the people heard His words, they said, “For sure, this is the One Who speaks for God.”
43007041	Others said, “He is the Christ!” Some said, “The Christ would not come from the country of Galilee, would He?
43007042	Do not the Holy Writings say that the Christ will come from the family of David? Will He not come from the town of Bethlehem where David lived?”
43007043	The people were divided in what they thought about Him.
43007044	Some of them wanted to take Him. But no one put their hands on Him.
43007045	The soldiers came back to the religious leaders of the Jews and to the proud religious law-keepers. They said to the soldiers, “Why did you not bring Him?”
43007046	The soldiers answered, “No man has ever spoken like this Man speaks.”
43007047	The proud religious law-keepers said, “Have you been led the wrong way also?
43007048	Has anyone of the leaders or anyone from our group believed in Him?
43007049	As for all these people, they do not know the Law. They are guilty and will be punished by God.”
43007050	(Nicodemus was one of the proud religious law-keepers. He had come to Jesus at another time.) Nicodemus said to them,
43007051	“Our Law does not say a man is guilty before he has been in court and before we know what he has done.”
43007052	They said to him, “Are you from Galilee also? Look into the Word of God yourself. You will see that no one who speaks for God comes from Galilee.”
43007053	Then everyone went home.
43008001	(Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
43008002	Early in the morning He went back to the house of God and all the people came to Him. He sat down and taught them.
43008003	The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers came to Him. They brought a woman who had been caught doing a sex sin. They made her stand in front of them all.
43008004	Then they said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the act of doing a sex sin.
43008005	Moses told us in the Law to throw stones and kill a woman like this. What do You say about it?”
43008006	They were trying to set a trap to find something against Him. Jesus got down and began to write in the dust with His finger.
43008007	They kept on asking Him. Then He stood up and said, “Anyone of you who is without sin can throw the first stone at her.”
43008008	Again He got down and wrote in the dust.
43008009	When they heard what He said, they went away one by one, beginning with the older ones until they were all gone. Then Jesus was left alone with the woman.
43008010	Jesus stood up and said to her, “Woman, where are those who spoke against you? Has no man said you are guilty?”
43008011	She said, “No one, Sir.” Jesus said to her, “Neither do I say you are guilty. Go on your way and do not sin again.”)
43008012	Jesus spoke to all the people, saying, “I am the Light of the world. Anyone who follows Me will not walk in darkness. He will have the Light of Life.”
43008013	The proud religious law-keepers said to Him, “You are talking about Yourself. What You say about Yourself is not true.”
43008014	Jesus said, “Even if I speak of Myself, what I am saying is true. I know where I came from and where I am going. You do not know where I came from or where I am going.
43008015	You say as a man would say if people are guilty or not guilty. I am not saying anyone is guilty.
43008016	But even if I did, it would be true. I am not alone. The Father Who sent Me is with Me.
43008017	It is written in your Law that when two men agree about something, it proves it is true. (Deuteronomy 19:15)
43008018	I speak for Myself and the Father Who sent Me speaks for Me.”
43008019	The proud religious law-keepers asked Him, “Where is Your Father?” Jesus said, “You do not know Me or My Father. If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also.”
43008020	Jesus spoke these words near the money box while He taught in the house of God. No one put his hands on Jesus because His time had not yet come.
43008021	Jesus spoke to the Jews again, saying, “I am going away. You will look for Me but you will die in your sins. Where I am going, you cannot come.”
43008022	The Jews said, “Will He kill Himself because He said, ‘Where I am going you cannot come’?”
43008023	He answered them, “You are from below. I am from above. You are of this world. I am not of this world.
43008024	That is why I said that you will die in your sins. If you do not believe that I am the Christ, you will die in your sins.”
43008025	Then they said to Him, “Who are You?” Jesus answered, “The answer is the same as I told you from the beginning.
43008026	I have much to say about you. I must say if you are guilty. But He Who sent Me is true. I tell the world the things I have heard from Him.”
43008027	They did not understand that Jesus was speaking to them about the Father.
43008028	Jesus said to them, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, you will know that I am the Christ. I do nothing of Myself. I say these things as My Father has taught Me.
43008029	He that sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone. I always do what He wants Me to do.”
43008030	As Jesus said these things, many people put their trust in Him.
43008031	He said to the Jews who believed, “If you keep and obey My Word, then you are My followers for sure.
43008032	You will know the truth and the truth will make you free.”
43008033	They said to Jesus, “We are children of Abraham. We have never been servants to anyone. What do you mean when You say, ‘You will be free’?”
43008034	Jesus answered them, “For sure, I tell you, everyone who sins is the servant of sin because sin has a hold on him.
43008035	And the servant does not belong in the house. The son belongs in the house.
43008036	So if the Son makes you free, you will be free for sure.
43008037	“I know that you are the children of Abraham. But you want to kill Me because My Word is not in your hearts.
43008038	I speak of what I saw when I was with My Father. You do what you have seen your father do.”
43008039	They said to Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said, “If you were children of Abraham, you would do what he did.
43008040	I am a Man Who has told you the truth as I heard it from God. Now you are trying to kill Me. Abraham never did anything like that.
43008041	You are doing the works of your father.” They said to Him, “We were born of parents who were faithful in marriage. We have one Father. He is God.”
43008042	Jesus said to them, “If God were your father, you would love Me. I came from God. I did not come on My own, but God sent Me.
43008043	Why do you not understand what I say? It is because you do not want to hear My teaching.
43008044	The devil is your father. You are from him. You want to do the sinful things your father, the devil, wants you to do. He has been a killer from the beginning. The devil has nothing to do with the truth. There is no truth in him. It is expected of the devil to lie, for he is a liar and the father of lies.
43008045	I tell you the truth and that is why you do not put your trust in Me.
43008046	Which one of you can say I am guilty of sin? If I tell you the truth, why do you not believe Me?
43008047	Whoever is born of God listens to God’s Word. You do not hear His Word because you are not born of God.”
43008048	The Jews said to Jesus, “Are we not right when we say You are from the country of Samaria, and You have a demon?”
43008049	Jesus said, “No, I do not have a demon. I honor My Father. You do not honor Me.
43008050	I am not looking for honor for Myself. There is One Who is looking for it. He says what is right from wrong.
43008051	For sure, I tell you, if anyone keeps My Word, that one will never die.”
43008052	Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know You have a demon. Abraham died. The early preachers died. You say, ‘If anyone keeps My Word, that one will never die.’
43008053	Are you greater than our father Abraham? He died and the early preachers died. Who do You think You are?”
43008054	Jesus said, “If I honor Myself, My honor would be worth nothing. My Father honors Me. You say He is your God.
43008055	You have never known Him, but I know Him. If I said I did not know Him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know the Father and obey His Word.
43008056	Your father Abraham was glad that he was to see My coming. He saw it and was happy.”
43008057	The Jews said to Jesus, “You are not even fifty years old. How could you have seen Abraham?”
43008058	Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, before Abraham was born, I was and am and always will be!”
43008059	Then they picked up stones to throw at Him. Jesus hid Himself and left the house of God.
43009001	As Jesus went on His way, He saw a man who had been born blind.
43009002	His followers asked Him, “Teacher, whose sin made this man to be born blind? Was it the sin of this man or the sin of his parents?”
43009003	Jesus answered, “The sin of this man or the sin of his parents did not make him to be born blind. He was born blind so the work of God would be seen in him.
43009004	We must keep on doing the work of Him Who sent Me while it is day. Night is coming when no man can work.
43009005	While I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.”
43009006	After Jesus had said this, He spit on the ground. He mixed it with dust and put that mud on the eyes of the blind man.
43009007	Then Jesus said to him, “Go and wash in the pool of Siloam.” (Siloam means Sent.) The man went away and washed. When he came back, he could see.
43009008	Neighbors and others had seen him begging. They said, “Is not this the man who sat and begged?”
43009009	Some said, “This is the one.” Others said, “No, but he looks like him.” But the man who had been blind said, “I am the man.”
43009010	They said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
43009011	He answered, “A Man called Jesus made mud and put it on my eyes. Then He said to me, ‘Go and wash in the pool of Siloam.’I went and washed and I can see.”
43009012	Then they asked him, “Where is He?” He answered, “I do not know.”
43009013	They took the man who had been born blind to the proud religious law-keepers.
43009014	It was the Day of Rest when Jesus had made mud and opened his eyes.
43009015	Again the proud religious law-keepers asked the man who had been born blind how he had been made to see. He answered them, “Jesus put mud on my eyes. I washed and now I see!”
43009016	Some of the proud religious law-keepers said, “The Man Who did this is not from God because He worked on the Day of Rest.” Others said, “How can a sinful man do powerful works?” They could not agree about Jesus.
43009017	They spoke again to the blind man, saying, “What do you say about Him since He opened your eyes?” He answered, “He is One Who speaks for God.”
43009018	The Jews did not believe this man had been blind and had been made to see. They called his parents
43009019	and asked them, “Is this your son? Do you say he was born blind? How does he see now?”
43009020	They answered, “We know this is our son and we know he was born blind.
43009021	But we do not know how it is that he can see now. We do not know who opened his eyes. He is old enough, ask him. He can tell you himself.”
43009022	His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jews. The Jews had talked among themselves. They had agreed that the person who said that Jesus was the Christ would be put out of the Jewish place of worship.
43009023	That is why his parents said, “He is old enough, ask him.”
43009024	The proud religious law-keepers asked the man again, who had been blind, to come. They said to him, “Give thanks to God. We know this man is a sinner.”
43009025	The man who had been blind said to them, “I do not know if He is a sinner or not. One thing I know. I was blind, but now I can see.”
43009026	They asked him again, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”
43009027	He answered, “I have told you already. You did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to become His followers also?”
43009028	The proud religious law-keepers became angry at him and said, “You are a follower of Jesus. We are followers of Moses.
43009029	We know God spoke to Moses. We do not know where this Man is from.”
43009030	The man said to them, “This is strange! You do not know where He came from and yet He opened my eyes.
43009031	We know that God does not listen to sinners. We know if anyone loves and worships God, and does what He wants, God listens to him.
43009032	From the beginning of the world no one has ever heard of anyone opening the eyes of a man born blind.
43009033	If this Man were not from God, He would not be able to do anything like this.”
43009034	They said to him, “You were born in sin. Are you trying to teach us?” Then they put him out of the place of worship.
43009035	Jesus heard that the proud religious law-keepers had put the man who had been healed out of the place of worship. He found the man and said to him, “Do you put your trust in the Son of God?”
43009036	He said, “Who is He, Sir? Tell me so that I can put my trust in Him.”
43009037	Jesus said to him, “You have seen Him. He is talking with you.”
43009038	He said, “I do put my trust in You, Lord.” Then he bowed down before Jesus and worshiped Him.
43009039	Jesus said, “I came into this world to say what is right from wrong. I came so those who do not see might see, and those who do see might be made blind.”
43009040	Some of the proud religious law-keepers who were with Him heard this. They said to Him, “Are we blind also?”
43009041	Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would not be guilty of sin. But because you say, ‘We see,’ you still are guilty of your sin.
43010001	“For sure, I tell you, the man who goes into the sheep-pen some other way than through the door is one who steals and robs.
43010002	The shepherd of the sheep goes in through the door.
43010003	The one who watches the door opens it for him. The sheep listen to the voice of the shepherd. He calls his own sheep by name and he leads them out.
43010004	When the shepherd walks ahead of them, they follow him because they know his voice.
43010005	They will not follow someone they do not know because they do not know his voice. They will run away from him.”
43010006	Jesus told this picture-story to them. Yet they did not understand what He said.
43010007	Again Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, I am the Door of the sheep.
43010008	All others who came ahead of Me are men who steal and rob. The sheep did not obey them.
43010009	I am the Door. Anyone who goes in through Me will be saved from the punishment of sin. He will go in and out and find food.
43010010	The robber comes only to steal and to kill and to destroy. I came so they might have life, a great full life.
43010011	“I am the Good Shepherd. The Good Shepherd gives His life for the sheep.
43010012	One who is hired to watch the sheep is not the shepherd. He does not own the sheep. He sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep. He runs away while the wolf gets the sheep and makes them run everywhere.
43010013	The hired man runs away because he is hired. He does not care about the sheep.
43010014	“I am the Good Shepherd. I know My sheep and My sheep know Me.
43010015	I know My Father as My Father knows Me. I give My life for the sheep.
43010016	I have other sheep which are not from this sheep-pen. I must bring them also. They will listen to My voice. Then there will be one flock with one shepherd.
43010017	“For this reason My Father loves Me. It is because I give My life that I might take it back again.
43010018	No one takes my life from Me. I give it by Myself. I have the right and the power to take it back again. My Father has given Me this right and power.”
43010019	Because of what He said, the Jews did not agree in their thinking.
43010020	Many of them said, “He has a demon and is crazy. Why listen to Him?”
43010021	Others said, “A man who has a demon does not talk this way. Can a demon open the eyes of a blind man?”
43010022	It was time for the religious gathering of remembering how the house of God was opened in Jerusalem.
43010023	It was winter and Jesus was there. He was walking in Solomon’s porch in the house of God.
43010024	The Jews gathered around Him. They said, “How long are You going to keep us in doubt? If You are the Christ, tell us.”
43010025	Jesus answered, “I told you and you do not believe. The works I do in My Father’s name speak of Me.
43010026	You do not believe because you are not My sheep.
43010027	My sheep hear My voice and I know them. They follow Me.
43010028	I give them life that lasts forever. They will never be punished. No one is able to take them out of My hand.
43010029	My Father Who gave them to Me is greater than all. No one is able to take them out of My Father’s hand.
43010030	My Father and I are one!”
43010031	Again the Jews picked up stones to throw at Him.
43010032	Jesus said to them, “Many good things have I shown you from My Father. For which of these things are you going to throw stones at Me?”
43010033	They said, “We are not going to throw stones at You for any good work. It is because of the way You talk against God. It is because You make Yourself to be God when You are only a man.”
43010034	Jesus said to them, “Is it not written in your Law, ‘I said, you are gods’? (Psalm 82:6)
43010035	The Holy Writings were given to them and God called them gods. (The Word of God cannot be put aside.)
43010036	But God has set Me apart for Himself. He sent Me into the world. Then how can you say that I am speaking against God because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
43010037	If I am not doing the works of My Father, do not believe Me.
43010038	But if I do them, even if you do not believe Me, believe the works that I do. Then you will know the Father is in Me and I am in Him.”
43010039	They tried again to take Him but He got out of their hands.
43010040	Jesus went away to the other side of the Jordan River to the place where John was baptizing people. Jesus stayed there.
43010041	Many people came to Him and said, “John did no powerful work, but what John said about this Man is true.”
43010042	Many people put their trust in Jesus there.
43011001	A man named Lazarus was sick. He lived in the town of Bethany with his sisters, Mary and Martha.
43011002	This was the Mary who put perfume on the Lord and dried His feet with her hair. It was her brother Lazarus who was sick.
43011003	The sisters sent word to Jesus, saying, “Lord, your friend is sick!”
43011004	When Jesus heard this, He said, “This sickness will not end in death. It has happened so that it will bring honor to God. And the Son of God will be honored by it also.”
43011005	Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
43011006	But when He heard that Lazarus was sick, He stayed where He was two more days.
43011007	Then He said to His followers, “Let us go into the country of Judea again.”
43011008	The followers said to Him, “Teacher, the Jews tried to throw stones at You to kill You not long ago. Are You going there again?”
43011009	Jesus said, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If a man walks during the day, he will not fall. He sees the light of this world.
43011010	If a man walks during the night, he will fall. The light is not in him.”
43011011	After Jesus had said this, He spoke again and said, “Our friend Lazarus is sleeping. I will go and wake him up.”
43011012	The followers said to Him, “If he is sleeping, he will get well.”
43011013	But Jesus meant Lazarus was dead. They thought He meant Lazarus was resting in sleep.
43011014	Then Jesus said to them, “Lazarus is dead.
43011015	Because of you I am glad I was not there so that you may believe. Come, let us go to him.”
43011016	Thomas, who was called the Twin, said to the other followers, “Let us go also so we may die with Jesus.”
43011017	When Jesus got there, He heard that Lazarus had been in the grave four days.
43011018	Bethany was about one-half hour walk from Jerusalem.
43011019	Many Jews had come to Martha and Mary to give words of comfort about their brother.
43011020	Martha heard that Jesus was coming and went to meet Him. Mary stayed in the house.
43011021	Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.
43011022	I know even now God will give You whatever You ask.”
43011023	Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
43011024	Martha said to Him, “I know that he will rise again when the dead are raised from the grave on the last day.”
43011025	Jesus said to her, “I am the One Who raises the dead and gives them life. Anyone who puts his trust in Me will live again, even if he dies.
43011026	Anyone who lives and has put his trust in Me will never die. Do you believe this?”
43011027	She answered, “Yes, Lord, I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God. You are the One Who was to come into the world.”
43011028	After Martha said this, she went and called her sister Mary. She said without anyone else hearing, “The Teacher is here and has sent for you.”
43011029	When Mary heard this, she got up and went to Him.
43011030	Jesus had not yet come into their town. He was still where Martha had met Him.
43011031	The Jews had been in the house comforting Mary. They saw her get up and hurry out. They followed her and said, “She is going to the grave to cry there.”
43011032	Mary went to the place where Jesus was. When she saw Him, she got down at His feet. She said to Him, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.”
43011033	Jesus saw her crying. The Jews who came with her were crying also. His heart was very sad and He was troubled.
43011034	He said, “Where did you lay Lazarus?” They said, “Lord, come and see.”
43011035	Then Jesus cried.
43011036	The Jews said, “See how much He loved Lazarus.”
43011037	Some of them said, “This Man opened the eyes of the blind man. Could He not have kept this man from dying?”
43011038	Jesus went to the grave with a sad heart. The grave was a hole in the side of a hill. A stone covered the door.
43011039	Jesus said, “Take the stone away.” The dead man’s sister, Martha, said to Him, “Lord, by now his body has a bad smell. He has been dead four days.”
43011040	Jesus said to her, “Did I not say that if you would believe, you would see the shining-greatness of God?”
43011041	They took the stone away. Jesus looked up and said, “Father, I thank You for hearing Me.
43011042	I know You always hear Me. But I have said this for the people standing here, so they may believe You have sent Me.”
43011043	When He had said this, He called with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
43011044	The man who had been dead came out. His hands and feet were tied in grave clothes. A white cloth was tied around his face. Jesus said to the people, “Take off the grave clothes and let him go!”
43011045	Many of the Jews who had come to visit Mary and had seen what Jesus had done put their trust in Him.
43011046	Some of them went to the proud religious law-keepers and told them what Jesus had done.
43011047	The religious leaders of the Jews and the proud religious law-keepers gathered a court together. They said, “What will we do? This Man is doing many powerful works.
43011048	If we let Him keep doing these things, all men will put their trust in Him. The Romans will come and take away the house of God and our nation.”
43011049	Caiaphas was the head religious leader that year. He said to them, “You know nothing about this.
43011050	Do you not see it is better for one man to die for the people than for the whole nation to be destroyed?”
43011051	Caiaphas did not think of these words himself. He spoke what God had said would happen. He was telling before it happened that Jesus must die for the nation.
43011052	He must die not only for the nation, but also to bring together into one group the children of God who were living in many places.
43011053	From that day on they talked together about how they might kill Jesus.
43011054	For this reason Jesus did not walk out in the open among the Jews. He went to a town called Ephraim. It was near a desert. He stayed there with His followers.
43011055	The special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt was soon. Many people from around the country came up to Jerusalem to go through the religious washing before the special supper.
43011056	They looked for Jesus. They stood together in the house of God and asked each other, “What do you think? Will He come to the special supper?”
43011057	The religious leaders of the Jews and the proud religious law-keepers had said that if any man knew where Jesus was, he should tell them. They wanted to take Him.
43012001	It was six days before the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Jesus came to Bethany where Lazarus lived. Jesus had raised Lazarus from the dead.
43012002	They made supper for Him. Martha put the food on the table. Lazarus was at the table with Him.
43012003	Mary took a jar of special perfume that cost much money and poured it on the feet of Jesus. She dried His feet with her hair. The house was filled with the smell of the special perfume.
43012004	Judas Iscariot was one of the followers. He was about to hand Jesus over to the leaders of the country. He said,
43012005	“Why was not this special perfume sold for much money and given to poor people?”
43012006	He did not say this because he cared for poor people. He said this because he was a robber. He carried the bag of money and would steal some of it for himself.
43012007	Jesus said, “Let her alone. She has kept it for the time when I will be buried.
43012008	You will always have poor people with you. You will not always have Me.”
43012009	Many Jews came to the place because they knew Jesus was there. They came not only to see Jesus, but to see Lazarus also. Jesus had raised Lazarus from the dead.
43012010	The religious leaders of the Jews talked together about having Lazarus killed also.
43012011	Because of Lazarus, many Jews were leaving their own religion. They were putting their trust in Jesus.
43012012	The next day many people were in Jerusalem for the religious gathering. They heard Jesus was coming.
43012013	They took branches of trees and went to meet Him. They spoke with a loud voice, “Greatest One! Great and honored is He Who comes in the name of the Lord, the King of the Jews!”
43012014	Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it. The Holy Writings say,
43012015	“Do not be afraid, people of Jerusalem. See! Your King comes sitting on a young donkey!” (Zechariah 9:9)
43012016	His followers did not understand what this meant at first. When Jesus had gone back to heaven to receive great honor, they remembered these things were written about Him. They remembered they had done this to Him.
43012017	The people who had been with Jesus when He had called Lazarus from the grave kept telling of this powerful work to others. They had seen Lazarus raised from the dead.
43012018	Because of this the people went to meet Jesus. They had heard He had done this powerful work.
43012019	The proud religious law-keepers said among themselves, “Look, we are losing followers. Everyone is following Jesus!”
43012020	Some Greek people had come to worship at the religious gathering. They were among the others who had come to worship.
43012021	These Greek people came to Philip. He was from the city of Bethsaida in the country of Galilee. They said to him, “Sir, we want to see Jesus!”
43012022	Philip went and told Andrew. Then Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
43012023	Jesus said to them, “The hour is near for the Son of Man to be taken to heaven to receive great honor.
43012024	For sure, I tell you, unless a seed falls into the ground and dies, it will only be a seed. If it dies, it will give much grain.
43012025	Anyone who loves his life will lose it. Anyone who hates his life in this world will keep it forever.
43012026	If anyone wants to serve Me, he must follow Me. So where I am, the one who wants to serve Me will be there also. If anyone serves Me, My Father will honor him.
43012027	“Now My soul is troubled. Should I say, ‘Father, save Me from this time of trouble and pain’? No, this is why I came to this time.
43012028	Father, honor Your name!” Then a voice from heaven came, saying, “I have already honored My name. I will honor it again!”
43012029	The people heard the voice. Some who stood there said, “It was thunder.” Others said, “An angel spoke to Him.”
43012030	Jesus said, “The voice did not come for Me, but it came to be a help to you.
43012031	“Now this world is being told it is guilty. Now the leader of this world will be thrown out.
43012032	And when I am lifted up from the earth, I will attract all people toward Me.”
43012033	He said this to tell the kind of death He was going to die.
43012034	The people said to Him, “The Law of Moses says that the Christ is to live forever. Why do you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”
43012035	Jesus said to them, “The Light will be with you for a little while yet. Go on your way while you have the Light so you will not be in the dark. When a man is walking in the dark, he does not know where he is going.
43012036	While you have the Light, put your trust in the Light. Then you will be the sons of the Light.” Jesus said these things and then went away. He hid Himself from them.
43012037	Jesus had done many powerful works in front of them, but they did not put their trust in Him.
43012038	This happened as the words of the early preacher Isaiah said it would happen. He had said, “Lord, has anyone believed our preaching? Has the Lord shown His power to anyone?”
43012039	The reason they could not believe is written again in Isaiah.
43012040	It says, “He has blinded their eyes and made their hearts hard. Then they would not see with their eyes. They would not understand with their heart. They would not turn to Me. I could not heal them.” (Isaiah 6:9–10)
43012041	This is what Isaiah said when he saw the shining-greatness of Jesus and spoke of Him.
43012042	Even among the leaders of the people there were many who believed in Jesus. But because of the proud religious law-keepers, they did not tell about it. If they had, they would have been put out of the Jewish place of worship.
43012043	They loved to have the respect from men more than honor from God.
43012044	Then Jesus spoke with a loud voice, “Anyone who puts his trust in Me, puts his trust not only in Me, but in Him Who sent Me.
43012045	Anyone who sees Me, sees Him Who sent Me.
43012046	I came to the world to be a Light. Anyone who puts his trust in Me will not be in darkness.
43012047	If anyone hears My Words but does not believe them, I do not say he is guilty. I did not come to say the world is guilty. I came to save the world from the punishment of sin.
43012048	Anyone who does not receive Me and does not receive My teaching has One Who will say he is guilty. The Word that I have spoken will say he is guilty on the last day.
43012049	I have not spoken by My own power. The Father Who sent Me has told Me what to say and speak.
43012050	I know that His Word is life that lasts forever. I speak the things the Father has told Me to speak.”
43013001	It was before the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Jesus knew the time had come for Him to leave this world and go to the Father. He had loved His own who were in the world. He loved them to the end.
43013002	He and His followers were having supper. Satan had put the thought into the heart of Judas Iscariot of handing Jesus over to the leaders of the country.
43013003	Jesus knew the Father had put everything into His hands. He knew He had come from God and was going back to God.
43013004	Jesus got up from the supper and took off His coat. He picked up a cloth and put it around Him.
43013005	Then He put water into a wash pan and began to wash the feet of His followers. He dried their feet with the cloth He had put around Himself.
43013006	Jesus came to Simon Peter. Peter said to Him, “Lord, are You going to wash my feet?”
43013007	Jesus answered him, “You do not understand now what I am doing but you will later.”
43013008	Peter said to Him, “I will never let You wash my feet.” Jesus said, “Unless I wash you, you will not be a part of Me.”
43013009	Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, do not wash only my feet, but wash my hands and my head also.”
43013010	Jesus said to him, “Anyone who has washed his body needs only to wash his feet. Then he is clean all over. You are all clean except one.”
43013011	Jesus knew who was going to hand Him over to the leaders. That is why He said, “You are all clean except one.”
43013012	Jesus washed their feet and put on His coat. Then He sat down again and said to them, “Do you understand what I have done to you?
43013013	You call Me Teacher and Lord. You are right because that is what I am.
43013014	I am your Teacher and Lord. I have washed your feet. You should wash each other’s feet also.
43013015	I have done this to show you what should be done. You should do as I have done to you.
43013016	For sure, I tell you, a workman who is owned by someone is not greater than his owner. One who is sent is not greater than the one who sent him.
43013017	If you know these things, you will be happy if you do them.
43013018	“I am not speaking about all of you. I know the ones I have chosen. What is written in the Holy Writings must happen. It says, ‘The man who eats bread with Me has turned against Me.’ (Psalm 41:9)
43013019	I tell you this now before it happens. After it happens, you will believe that I am Who I say I am, the Christ.
43013020	For sure, I tell you, he who receives the one I send out, receives Me. He who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.”
43013021	When Jesus had said this, He was troubled in heart. He told them in very plain words, saying, “For sure, I tell you, one of you is going to hand Me over to the leaders of the country.”
43013022	The followers began to look at each other. They did not know which one He was speaking of.
43013023	One follower, whom Jesus loved, was beside Jesus.
43013024	Simon Peter got this follower to look his way. He wanted him to ask Jesus which one He was speaking of.
43013025	While close beside Jesus, he asked, “Lord, who is it?”
43013026	Jesus answered, “It is the one I give this piece of bread to after I have put it in the dish.” Then He put the bread in the dish and gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
43013027	After Judas had eaten the piece of bread, Satan went into him. Jesus said to Judas, “What you are going to do, do in a hurry.”
43013028	No one at the supper knew why Jesus had said this to Judas.
43013029	They thought it was because Judas carried the bag of money, and Jesus had said that Judas should buy what they needed for the religious gathering. Or they thought Judas should give something to poor people.
43013030	As soon as Judas had taken the piece of bread, he went out. It was night.
43013031	After Judas went out, Jesus said, “The Son of Man is now honored and God has been honored in Him.
43013032	If God is honored in Him, God will also honor Him in Himself right now.
43013033	Little children, I will be with you only a little while. You will look for Me. I say to you what I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come!’
43013034	I give you a new Law. You are to love each other. You must love each other as I have loved you.
43013035	If you love each other, all men will know you are My followers.”
43013036	Simon Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus answered, “You cannot follow Me now where I am going. Later you will follow Me.”
43013037	Peter said to Jesus, “Why can I not follow You now? I will die for You.”
43013038	Jesus answered Peter, “Will you die for Me? For sure, I tell you, before a rooster crows, you will have said three times that you do not know Me.”
43014001	“Do not let your heart be troubled. You have put your trust in God, put your trust in Me also.
43014002	There are many rooms in My Father’s house. If it were not so, I would have told you. I am going away to make a place for you.
43014003	After I go and make a place for you, I will come back and take you with Me. Then you may be where I am.
43014004	You know where I am going and you know how to get there.”
43014005	Thomas said to Jesus, “Lord, we do not know where You are going. How can we know the way to get there?”
43014006	Jesus said, “I am the Way and the Truth and the Life. No one can go to the Father except by Me.
43014007	If you had known Me, you would know My Father also. From now on you know Him and have seen Him.”
43014008	Philip said to Jesus, “Lord, show us the Father. That is all we ask.”
43014009	Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you all this time and you do not know Me yet? Whoever has seen Me, has seen the Father. How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
43014010	Do you not believe that I am in the Father and that the Father is in Me? What I say to you, I do not say by My own power. The Father Who lives in Me does His work through Me.
43014011	“Believe Me that I am in the Father and that the Father is in Me. Or else believe Me because of the things I do.
43014012	For sure, I tell you, whoever puts his trust in Me can do the things I am doing. He will do even greater things than these because I am going to the Father.
43014013	Whatever you ask in My name, I will do it so the shining-greatness of the Father may be seen in the Son.
43014014	Yes, if you ask anything in My name, I will do it.
43014015	“If you love Me, you will do what I say.
43014016	Then I will ask My Father and He will give you another Helper. He will be with you forever.
43014017	He is the Spirit of Truth. The world cannot receive Him. It does not see Him or know Him. You know Him because He lives with you and will be in you.
43014018	“I will not leave you without help as children without parents. I will come to you.
43014019	In a little while the world will see Me no more. You will see Me. Because I live, you will live also.
43014020	When that day comes, you will know that I am in My Father. You will know that you are in Me. You will know that I am in you.
43014021	The one who loves Me is the one who has My teaching and obeys it. My Father will love whoever loves Me. I will love him and will show Myself to him.”
43014022	The other Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Why is it You are going to show Yourself to us followers and not to the world?”
43014023	Jesus said, “The one who loves Me will obey My teaching. My Father will love him. We will come to him and live with him.
43014024	The one who does not love Me does not obey My teaching. The teaching you are now hearing is not My teaching but it is from My Father Who sent Me.
43014025	“I have told you these things while I am still with you.
43014026	The Helper is the Holy Spirit. The Father will send Him in My place. He will teach you everything and help you remember everything I have told you.
43014027	“Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you. I do not give peace to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled or afraid.
43014028	You heard Me say that I am going away. But I am coming back to you. If you love Me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father. The Father is greater than I.
43014029	I have told you this before it happens. Then when it does happen, you will believe.
43014030	“I will not talk much more with you. The leader of this world is coming. He has no power over Me.
43014031	I am doing what the Father told Me to do so the world may know I love the Father. Come, let us be on our way.
43015001	“I am the true Vine. My Father is the One Who cares for the Vine.
43015002	He takes away any branch in Me that does not give fruit. Any branch that gives fruit, He cuts it back so it will give more fruit.
43015003	You are made clean by the words I have spoken to you.
43015004	Get your life from Me and I will live in you. No branch can give fruit by itself. It has to get life from the vine. You are able to give fruit only when you have life from Me.
43015005	I am the Vine and you are the branches. Get your life from Me. Then I will live in you and you will give much fruit. You can do nothing without Me.
43015006	“If anyone does not get his life from Me, he is cut off like a branch and dries up. Such branches are gathered and thrown into the fire and they are burned.
43015007	If you get your life from Me and My Words live in you, ask whatever you want. It will be done for you.
43015008	“When you give much fruit, My Father is honored. This shows you are My followers.
43015009	I have loved you just as My Father has loved Me. Stay in My love.
43015010	If you obey My teaching, you will live in My love. In this way, I have obeyed My Father’s teaching and live in His love.
43015011	I have told you these things so My joy may be in you and your joy may be full.
43015012	“This is what I tell you to do: Love each other just as I have loved you.
43015013	No one can have greater love than to give his life for his friends.
43015014	You are My friends if you do what I tell you.
43015015	I do not call you servants that I own anymore. A servant does not know what his owner is doing. I call you friends, because I have told you everything I have heard from My Father.
43015016	You have not chosen Me, I have chosen you. I have set you apart for the work of bringing in fruit. Your fruit should last. And whatever you ask the Father in My name, He will give it to you.
43015017	“This is what I tell you to do: Love each other.
43015018	If the world hates you, you know it hated Me before it hated you.
43015019	If you belonged to the world, the world would love you as its own. You do not belong to the world. I have chosen you out of the world and the world hates you.
43015020	Remember I said to you, ‘A servant is not greater than his owner.’ If they made it very hard for Me, they will make it very hard for you also. If they obeyed My teachings, they will obey your teachings also.
43015021	They will do all these things to you because you belong to Me. They do not know My Father Who sent Me.
43015022	“I have come and have spoken to them so they are guilty of sin. But now they have no reason to give for keeping their sin any longer.
43015023	Whoever hates Me, hates My Father also.
43015024	I have done things among them which no one else has done so they are guilty of sin. But now they have seen these things and have hated Me and My Father.
43015025	This happened as their Law said it would happen, ‘They hated Me without a reason.’
43015026	“The Helper (Holy Spirit) will tell about Me when He comes. I will send Him to you from the Father. He is the Spirit of Truth and comes from the Father.
43015027	You will also tell of Me because you have been with Me from the beginning.
43016001	“I have told you these things so you will not be ashamed of Me and leave Me.
43016002	They will put you out of the places of worship. The time will come when anyone who kills you will think he is helping God.
43016003	They will do these things to you because they do not know the Father or Me.
43016004	“When these things happen, you will remember I told you they would happen. That is why I am telling you about these things now. I did not tell you these things before, because I was with you.
43016005	But now I am going to Him Who sent Me. Yet none of you asks Me, ‘Where are You going?’
43016006	“Your hearts are full of sorrow because I am telling you these things.
43016007	I tell you the truth. It is better for you that I go away. If I do not go, the Helper will not come to you. If I go, I will send Him to you.
43016008	When the Helper comes, He will show the world the truth about sin. He will show the world about being right with God. And He will show the world what it is to be guilty.
43016009	He will show the world about sin, because they do not put their trust in Me.
43016010	He will show the world about being right with God, because I go to My Father and you will see Me no more.
43016011	He will show the world what it is to be guilty because the leader of this world (Satan) is guilty.
43016012	“I still have many things to say to you. You are not strong enough to understand them now.
43016013	The Holy Spirit is coming. He will lead you into all truth. He will not speak His Own words. He will speak what He hears. He will tell you of things to come.
43016014	He will honor Me. He will receive what is Mine and will tell it to you.
43016015	Everything the Father has is Mine. That is why I said to you, ‘He will receive what is Mine and will tell it to you.’
43016016	“In a little while you will not see Me. Then in a little while you will see Me again.”
43016017	Some of His followers said to each other, “What is He trying to tell us when He says, ‘In a little while you will not see Me, and in a little while you will see Me again,’ and ‘Because I go to My Father’?”
43016018	So they said, “What is He trying to tell us by saying, ‘A little while’? We do not know what He is talking about.”
43016019	Jesus knew they wanted to ask Him something. He said to them, “Are you asking each other why I said, ‘In a little while you will not see Me, and in a little while you will see Me again’?
43016020	For sure, I tell you, you will cry and have sorrow, but the world will have joy. You will have sorrow, but your sorrow will turn into joy.
43016021	When a woman gives birth to a child, she has sorrow because her time has come. After the child is born, she forgets her pain. She is full of joy because a child has been born into the world.
43016022	You are sad now. I will see you again and then your hearts will be full of joy. No one can take your joy from you.
43016023	“When the time comes that you see Me again, you will ask Me no question. For sure, I tell you, My Father will give you whatever you ask in My name.
43016024	Until now you have not asked for anything in My name. Ask and you will receive. Then your joy will be full.
43016025	“I have told you these things in picture-stories. The time is coming when I will not use picture-stories. I will talk about My Father in plain words.
43016026	In that day you will ask in My name. I will not ask the Father for you
43016027	because the Father loves you. He loves you because you love Me and believe that I came from the Father.
43016028	“I came from the Father and have come into the world. I am leaving the world and going to the Father.”
43016029	His followers said to Him, “Now You are talking in plain words. You are not using picture-stories.
43016030	Now we are sure You know everything. You do not need anyone to tell You anything. Because of this we believe that You came from God.”
43016031	Jesus said to them, “Do you believe now?
43016032	The time is coming, yes, it is already here when you will be going your own way. Everyone will go to his own house and leave Me alone. Yet I am not alone because the Father is with Me.
43016033	I have told you these things so you may have peace in Me. In the world you will have much trouble. But take hope! I have power over the world!”
43017001	When Jesus had said these things, He looked up to heaven and said, “Father, the time has come! Honor Your Son so Your Son may honor You.
43017002	You have given Him power over all men. He is to give life that lasts forever to all You have given to Him.
43017003	This is life that lasts forever. It is to know You, the only true God, and to know Jesus Christ Whom You have sent.
43017004	I honored You on earth. I did the work You gave Me to do.
43017005	Now, Father, honor Me with the honor I had with You before the world was made.
43017006	“I have made Your name known to the people You have given Me from the world. They were Yours but You gave them to Me. They have obeyed Your Word.
43017007	Now they know that everything You have given Me came from You.
43017008	I gave them the Word which You gave Me. They received it. They know I came from You and they believe You sent Me.
43017009	“I pray for them. I do not pray for the world. I pray for those You gave Me. They are Yours.
43017010	All that is Mine is Yours. All that is Yours is Mine. I have been honored through them.
43017011	I am no longer in the world. I am coming to You. But these are still in the world. Holy Father, keep those You have given to Me in the power of Your name. Then they will be one, even as We are One.
43017012	While I have been with them in the world, I have kept them in the power of Your name. I have kept watch over those You gave Me. Not one of them has been lost except the one who is going to be destroyed, which is the son of death. The Holy Writings said it would happen. (Psalm 41:9; John 6:70)
43017013	But now I come to You, Father. I say these things while I am in the world. In this way, My followers may have My joy in their hearts.
43017014	“I have given Your Word to My followers. The world hated them because they do not belong to the world, even as I do not belong to the world.
43017015	I do not ask You to take them out of the world. I ask You to keep them from the devil.
43017016	My followers do not belong to the world just as I do not belong to the world.
43017017	Make them holy for Yourself by the truth. Your Word is truth.
43017018	“As You sent Me into the world so I have sent them into the world also.
43017019	I set Myself apart to be holy for them. Then they may be made holy by the truth.
43017020	“I do not pray for these followers only. I pray for those who will put their trust in Me through the teaching they have heard.
43017021	May they all be as one, Father, as You are in Me and I am in You. May they belong to Us. Then the world will believe that You sent Me.
43017022	I gave them the honor You gave Me that they may be one as We are One.
43017023	I am in them and You are in Me so they may be one and be made perfect. Then the world may know that You sent Me and that You love them as You love Me.
43017024	“Father, I want My followers You gave Me to be with Me where I am. Then they may see My shining-greatness which You gave Me because You loved Me before the world was made.
43017025	Holy Father, the world has not known You. I have known You. These have known You sent Me.
43017026	I have made Your name known to them and will make it known. So then the love You have for Me may be in them and I may be in them.”
43018001	When Jesus had said these things, He went with His followers across the small river Kidron. He and His followers went to a garden there.
43018002	Judas, who was handing Him over to the leaders, knew the place also. Jesus and His followers had met there many times.
43018003	Judas led some soldiers and some men who had been sent by the head religious leaders of the Jews and the proud religious law-keepers to the garden. They carried lamps and sticks that were burning and swords.
43018004	Jesus knew what was going to happen to Him. He went out and asked them, “Who are you looking for?”
43018005	The soldiers answered Him, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus said, “I am Jesus.” Judas, who was handing Him over, was with them also.
43018006	When He said to them, “I am Jesus,” they stepped back and fell to the ground.
43018007	He asked them again, “Who are you looking for?” They said again, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
43018008	He said, “I have told you that I am Jesus. If you are looking for Me, let these men go their way.”
43018009	He said this so the words He spoke might happen, “I have not lost one of those You gave Me.”
43018010	Simon Peter had a sword. He took it and hit a servant who was owned by the head religious leader and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
43018011	Then Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword back where it belongs. Am I not to go through what My Father has given Me to go through?”
43018012	Then the soldiers and their captain and the men sent by the Jewish religious leaders took Jesus and tied Him.
43018013	They took Him to Annas first. He was the father-in-law of Caiaphas. Caiaphas was the head religious leader that year.
43018014	Caiaphas had talked to the Jews. He told them it would be a good thing if one man should die for the people.
43018015	Simon Peter and another follower came behind Jesus. This other follower was known to the head religious leader. He went with Jesus to the head religious leader’s house.
43018016	Peter stood outside at the gate. The other follower, who was known by the head religious leader, went out and talked to the servant-girl who watched the gate. Then he took Peter inside.
43018017	The servant-girl who watched the door said to Peter, “Are you not a follower of this Man?” He said, “I am not!”
43018018	The servants who were owned by someone and the soldiers had made a fire because it was cold. They were getting warm by the fire. Peter was standing with them getting warm.
43018019	The head religious leader of the Jews asked Jesus about His followers. He asked Jesus about His teaching.
43018020	Jesus said, “I have spoken very plain words to the world. I have always taught in the Jewish place of worship and in the house of God. It is where the Jews go all the time. My words have not been said in secret.
43018021	Why do you ask Me? Ask those who have heard what I said to them. They know what I said.”
43018022	Then one of the soldiers standing there hit Jesus with his hand. He said, “Is that how You talk to the head religious leaders?”
43018023	Jesus said, “If I said anything wrong, tell Me what was wrong. If I said what was right, why did you hit Me?”
43018024	Then Annas sent Jesus to Caiaphas, the head religious leader. Jesus was still tied up.
43018025	Simon Peter was standing there and getting warm. They said to him, “Are you not one of His followers also?” He lied and said he did not know Jesus and answered, “I am not!”
43018026	A servant who was owned by the head religious leader was there. He was of the family of the man whose ear Peter cut off. The man said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
43018027	Again Peter lied and said he did not know Jesus. At once a rooster crowed.
43018028	They led Jesus from Caiaphas into the court room. It was early in the morning. They did not go inside because their Law said if they did they would become dirty with sin. Then they would not be able to eat the religious supper to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
43018029	So Pilate came out to them. He asked, “What have you to say against the Man?”
43018030	The Jews said, “If He had not done wrong, we would not have brought Him to you.”
43018031	Then Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves and give Him a trial by your Law.” The Jews said to him, “It is against our Law to put anyone to death.”
43018032	This happened as Jesus said it would happen. He had told what kind of death He would die.
43018033	Then Pilate went back into the court room. He called for Jesus and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
43018034	Jesus said, “Do you ask Me this yourself, or did others say this to you about Me?”
43018035	Pilate said, “Do you think I am a Jew? Your own people and religious leaders have handed You over to me. What have You done?”
43018036	Jesus said, “My holy nation does not belong to this world. If My holy nation were of this world, My helpers would fight so I would not be handed over to the Jews. My holy nation is not of this world.”
43018037	Pilate said to Him, “So You are a King?” Jesus said, “You are right when you say that I am a King. I was born for this reason. I came into the world for this reason. I came to speak about the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears My voice.”
43018038	Pilate said to Jesus, “What is truth?” After Pilate said this, he went out again to the Jews. He said, “I do not find Him guilty.
43018039	But every year a man who is in prison is allowed to go free at the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Do you want the King of the Jews to go free?”
43018040	Then they spoke with loud voices, “Not this Man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.
43019001	Then Pilate took Jesus and had Him beaten.
43019002	The soldiers put a crown of thorns on His head. They put a purple coat on Him.
43019003	Then they said, “Hello, King of the Jews!” and hit Him with their hands.
43019004	Pilate went out again and said to the people, “See, I bring Him out to you so you will know I do not find Him guilty.”
43019005	Jesus came out. He had on the crown of thorns and a purple coat. Pilate said to the people, “See! This is the Man!”
43019006	The religious leaders and the soldiers saw Him. They spoke with loud voices, “Nail Him to a cross! Nail Him to a cross!” Pilate said, “Take Him yourselves and nail Him to a cross. As for me, I do not find Him guilty.”
43019007	The Jews said to Pilate, “We have a Law that says He should die because He has said He is the Son of God.”
43019008	When Pilate heard them say this, he was more afraid.
43019009	He went into the court room again. He said to Jesus, “Where do You come from?” Jesus did not say a word.
43019010	Pilate said, “Will You not speak to me? Do You not know that I have the right and the power to nail You to a cross? I have the right and the power to let You go free also.”
43019011	Jesus said, “You would not have any right or power over Me if it were not given you from above. For this reason the one who handed Me over to you has the worse sin.”
43019012	When Pilate heard this, he wanted to let Jesus go free. But the Jews kept saying, “If you let this Man go free, you are not a friend of Caesar! Whoever makes himself as a king is working against Caesar.”
43019013	When Pilate heard this, he had Jesus brought in front of him. Pilate sat down at the place where men stand in front of him if they are thought to be guilty. The place is called the Stone Floor.
43019014	It was the day to get ready for the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. It was about noon. Pilate said to the Jews, “See, your King!”
43019015	They spoke with a loud voice, “Take Him away! Nail Him to a cross!” Pilate said to them, “Do you want me to nail your King to a cross?” The head religious leaders said, “We have no king but Caesar!”
43019016	Then Pilate handed Him over to be nailed to a cross. They took Jesus and led Him away.
43019017	Jesus carried His own cross to a hill called the Place of the Skull.
43019018	There they nailed Him to the cross. With Him were two others. There was one on each side of Jesus.
43019019	Then Pilate put a writing on the cross which said, JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
43019020	This was read by many of the Jews. The place where Jesus was nailed to the cross was near the city. The writing was written in the Hebrew and the Latin and the Greek languages.
43019021	Then the head religious leaders of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews’! Write, ‘He said, I am the King of the Jews.’”
43019022	Pilate said, “What I have written is to stay just as it is!”
