43019023	The soldiers who nailed Jesus to the cross took His clothes and divided them in four parts, each soldier getting one part. But His coat which was not sewed was made in one piece.
43019024	They said to each other, “Let us not cut it up. Let us draw names to see whose it should be.” This happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen, “They divided My clothes among them and they drew names for My coat.” (Psalm 22:18)
43019025	This is what the soldiers did. The mother of Jesus and her sister Mary, the wife of Cleophas, were standing near the cross. Mary Magdalene was there also.
43019026	Jesus saw His mother and the follower whom He loved standing near. He said to His mother, “Woman, look at your son.”
43019027	Then Jesus said to the follower, “Look at your mother.” From that time the follower took her to his own house.
43019028	Jesus knew that everything was now finished. Everything happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen. He said, “I am thirsty.” (Psalm 69:21)
43019029	There was a jar full of sour wine near. They filled a sponge and put it on a stick and put it to His mouth.
43019030	Jesus took the sour wine and said, “It is finished.” He put His head down and gave up His spirit and died.
43019031	This was the day before the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. The next day was the Day of Rest and the great day of the religious gathering. The Jews went to Pilate and asked to have the legs of the men broken. They wanted their bodies taken away so they would not be hanging on the crosses on the Day of Rest.
43019032	Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and of the other one who had been nailed to crosses beside Jesus.
43019033	They came to Jesus. They saw He was already dead so they did not break His legs.
43019034	But one of the soldiers pushed a spear into His side. Blood and water ran out.
43019035	The one who saw it is writing this and what he says is true. He knows he is telling the truth so you may believe.
43019036	These things happened as the Holy Writings said they would happen, “Not one of His bones will be broken.” (Exodus 12:46)
43019037	And in another place the Holy Writings say, “They will look at Him Whose side they cut.” (Zechariah 12:10)
43019038	Joseph was from the town of Arimathea. He was a follower of Jesus but was afraid of the Jews. So he worshiped without anyone knowing it. He asked Pilate if he could take away the body of Jesus. Pilate said he could. Then Joseph came and took it away.
43019039	Nicodemus came also. The first time he had come to Jesus had been at night. He brought with him a large box of spices.
43019040	Then they took the body of Jesus with the spices and put it in linen cloths. This was the way the Jews made a body ready for the grave.
43019041	There was a garden near the place where He had been nailed to the cross. In the garden there was a new grave in the side of the hill. No one had ever been laid there.
43019042	This place was near by. Because it was the day the Jews got ready for the special religious gathering, they laid Jesus in it.
43020001	It was the first day of the week. Mary Magdalene came to the grave early in the morning while it was still dark. She saw that the stone had been pushed away from the grave.
43020002	She ran to Simon Peter and the other follower whom Jesus loved. She said to them, “They have taken the Lord out of the grave. We do not know where they have put Him.”
43020003	Then Peter and the other follower went to the grave.
43020004	They ran but the other follower ran faster than Peter and came to the grave first.
43020005	He got down and looked in and saw the linen cloths but did not go in.
43020006	Then Simon Peter came and went into the grave. He saw the linen cloths lying there.
43020007	The white cloth that had been around the head of Jesus was not lying with the other linen cloths. It was rolled up and lying apart by itself.
43020008	Then the other follower, who had come first, went in also. He saw and believed.
43020009	They still did not understand what the Holy Writings meant when they said that He must rise again from the dead.
43020010	Then the followers went back again to their homes.
43020011	Mary stood outside the grave crying. As she cried, she got down and looked inside the grave.
43020012	She saw two angels dressed in white clothes. They were sitting where the body of Jesus had lain. One angel was where His head had lain and one angel was where His feet had lain.
43020013	They said to her, “Woman, why are you crying?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord. I do not know where they have put Him.”
43020014	After saying this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there. But she did not know that it was Jesus.
43020015	He said to her, “Woman, why are you crying? Who are you looking for?” She thought He was the man who cared for the garden. She said to Him, “Sir, if you have taken Jesus from here, tell me where you have put Him. I will take Him away.”
43020016	Jesus said to her, “Mary!” She turned around and said to Him, “Teacher!”
43020017	Jesus said to her, “Do not hold on to Me. I have not yet gone up to My Father. But go to My brothers. Tell them that I will go up to My Father and your Father, and to My God and your God!”
43020018	Mary Magdalene went and told the followers that she had seen the Lord. She told them the things He had said to her.
43020019	It was evening of the first day of the week. The followers had gathered together with the doors locked because they were afraid of the Jews. Jesus came and stood among them. He said, “May you have peace.”
43020020	When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. When the followers saw the Lord, they were filled with joy.
43020021	Then Jesus said to them again, “May you have peace. As the Father has sent Me, I also am sending you.”
43020022	When Jesus had said this, He breathed on them. He said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
43020023	If you say that people are free of sins, they are free of them. If you say that people are not free of sins, they still have them.”
43020024	Thomas was not with them when Jesus came. He was one of the twelve followers and was called the Twin.
43020025	The other followers told him, “We have seen the Lord!” He said to them, “I will not believe until I see the marks made by the nails in His hands. I will not believe until I put my finger into the marks of the nails. I will not believe until I put my hand into His side.”
43020026	Eight days later the followers were again inside a house. Thomas was with them. The doors were locked. Jesus came and stood among them. He said, “May you have peace!”
43020027	He said to Thomas, “Put your finger into My hands. Put your hand into My side. Do not doubt, believe!”
43020028	Thomas said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”
43020029	Jesus said to him, “Thomas, because you have seen Me, you believe. Those are happy who have never seen Me and yet believe!”
43020030	Jesus did many other powerful works in front of His followers. They are not written in this book.
43020031	But these are written so you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God. When you put your trust in Him, you will have life that lasts forever through His name.
43021001	After this, Jesus again showed Himself to His followers at the lake of Tiberias. It happened like this:
43021002	Simon Peter and Thomas who was called the Twin and Nathanael from the town of Cana in the country of Galilee and the sons of Zebedee and two other followers were all together.
43021003	Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” The others said, “We will go with you.” They went out and got into a boat. That night they caught no fish.
43021004	Early in the morning Jesus stood on the shore of the lake. The followers did not know it was Jesus.
43021005	Then Jesus said to them, “Children, do you have any fish?” They said, “No.”
43021006	He said to them, “Put your net over the right side of the boat. Then you will catch some fish.” They put out the net. They were not able to pull it in because it was so full of fish.
43021007	Then the follower whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Peter heard it was the Lord, he put on his fisherman’s coat. (He had taken it off.) Then he jumped into the water.
43021008	The other followers came in the boat. They were pulling the net with the fish. They were not far from land, only a little way out.
43021009	When they came to land they saw fish and bread on a fire.
43021010	Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish you have just caught.”
43021011	Simon Peter went out and pulled the net to land. There were 153 big fish. The net was not broken even with so many.
43021012	Jesus said to them, “Come and eat.” Not one of the followers would ask, “Who are You?” They knew it was the Lord.
43021013	Jesus came and took bread and fish and gave it to them.
43021014	This was the third time Jesus had shown Himself to His followers after He had risen from the dead.
43021015	When they were finished eating, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me more than these?” Peter answered Jesus, “Yes, Lord, You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My lambs.”
43021016	Jesus said to Peter the second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” He answered Jesus, “Yes, Lord, You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Take care of My sheep.”
43021017	Jesus said to Peter the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” Peter felt bad because Jesus asked him the third time, “Do you love Me?” He answered Jesus, “Lord, You know everything. You know I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.
43021018	For sure, I tell you, when you were young, you put on your belt and went wherever you wanted to go. When you get old, you will put out your hands and someone else will put on your belt and take you away where you do not want to go.”
43021019	He said this to tell Peter what kind of death he would die to honor God. After Jesus said this, He said to Peter, “Follow Me.”
43021020	Peter turned around. He saw the follower whom Jesus loved, following. This one had been beside Jesus at the supper. This is the one who had asked Jesus, “Lord, who will hand You over?”
43021021	Peter saw him and said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this one?”
43021022	Jesus said, “If I want this one to wait until I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”
43021023	So the news spread among the followers that this follower would not die. But Jesus did not say to him that he would not die. He said, “If I want him to wait until I come, what is that to you?”
43021024	This is the follower who is telling of these things and who has written them. We know that his word is true.
43021025	There are many other things which Jesus did also. If they were all written down, I do not think the world itself could hold the books that would be written.
44001001	Dear Theophilus, in my first writings I wrote about all the things Jesus did and taught from the beginning
44001002	until the day He went to heaven. He spoke to the missionaries through the Holy Spirit. He told those whom He had chosen what they should do.
44001003	After He had suffered much and then died, He showed Himself alive in many sure ways for forty days. He told them many things about the holy nation of God.
44001004	As they were gathered together with Him, He told them, “Do not leave Jerusalem. Wait for what the Father has promised. You heard Me speak of this.
44001005	For John the Baptist baptized with water but in a few days you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.”
44001006	Those who were with Him asked, “Lord, is this the time for You to give the nation back to the Jews?”
44001007	He said, “It is not for you to know the special days or the special times which the Father has put in His own power.
44001008	“But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes into your life. You will tell about Me in the city of Jerusalem and over all the countries of Judea and Samaria and to the ends of the earth.”
44001009	When Jesus had said this and while they were still looking at Him, He was taken up. A cloud carried Him away so they could not see Him.
44001010	They were still looking up to heaven, watching Him go. All at once two men dressed in white stood beside them.
44001011	They said, “You men of the country of Galilee, why do you stand looking up into heaven? This same Jesus Who was taken from you into heaven will return in the same way you saw Him go up into heaven.”
44001012	The followers went back to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives, which is close to Jerusalem.
44001013	When they came into the city, they went up to a room on the second floor where they stayed. The followers were Peter and John, James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Canaanite, and Judas the brother of James.
44001014	These all agreed as they prayed together. The women and Mary the mother of Jesus and His brothers were there.
44001015	On one of those days Peter got up in front of the followers. (There were about 120 people there.) He said,
44001016	“Men and brothers, it happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen which the Holy Spirit spoke through David. They told about Judas who would hand Jesus over to those who wanted to take Him.
44001017	Judas was one of our group and had a part in our work.
44001018	This man bought a field with the money he received for his sin. And falling down head first, his body broke open and his insides ran out.
44001019	All the people of Jerusalem knew about this. They called the place Field of Blood.
44001020	For it is written in the Book of Psalms, ‘Let his place of living be empty and let no one live there,’ and, ‘Let another person take over his work.’ (Psalm 69:25; 109:8)
44001021	“The man to take the place of Judas should be one of these men who walked along with us when the Lord Jesus was with us.
44001022	He must have been with Jesus from the day He was baptized by John to the day He was taken up from us. So one of these should be added to our group who will tell others that he saw Jesus raised from the dead.”
44001023	They brought two men in front of them. They were Joseph, also called Barsabbas Justus, and Matthias.
44001024	Then the followers prayed, saying, “Lord, You know the hearts of all men. Show us which of these two men You have chosen.
44001025	He is to take the place of Judas in this work and be a missionary. Judas lost his place and went where he belonged because of sin.”
44001026	Then they drew names and the name of Matthias was chosen. He became one with the eleven missionaries.
44002001	The followers of Jesus were all together in one place fifty days after the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
44002002	All at once there was a sound from heaven like a powerful wind. It filled the house where they were sitting.
44002003	Then they saw tongues which were divided that looked like fire. These came down on each one of them.
44002004	They were all filled with the Holy Spirit. Then they began to speak in other languages which the Holy Spirit made them able to speak.
44002005	There were many religious Jews staying in Jerusalem. They were from every country of the world.
44002006	When they heard this strange sound, they gathered together. They all listened! It was hard for them to believe they were hearing words in their own language.
44002007	They were surprised and wondered about it. They said to each other, “Are not these Galileans who are speaking?
44002008	How is it that each one of us can hear his own language?
44002009	We are Parthians and Medes, Elamites and from the countries of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and in the countries of Asia,
44002010	Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya near Cyrene. Some have come from the city of Rome. Some are Jews by birth and others have become Jews.
44002011	Some are also men of the countries of Crete and Arabia. They are speaking of the powerful works of God to all of us in our own language!”
44002012	They were all surprised and wondered about this. They said to each other, “What can this mean?”
44002013	But others laughed and made fun, saying, “These men are full of new wine.”
44002014	Then Peter stood up with the eleven missionaries and spoke with a loud voice, “Men of the country of Judea and all of you who are living in Jerusalem, I want you to know what is happening. So listen to what I am going to say.
44002015	These men are not drunk as you think. It is only nine o’clock in the morning.
44002016	The early preacher Joel said this would happen.
44002017	God says, ‘In the last days I will send My Spirit on all men. Then your sons and daughters will speak God’s Word. Your young men will see what God has given them to see. Your old men will dream dreams.
44002018	Yes, on those I own, both men and women, I will send My Spirit in those days. They will speak God’s Word.
44002019	I will show powerful works in the sky above. There will be things to see in the earth below like blood and fire and clouds of smoke.
44002020	The sun will turn dark and the moon will turn to blood before the day of the Lord. His coming will be a great and special day.
44002021	It will be that whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved from the punishment of sin.’ (Joel 2:28–32)
44002022	“Jewish men, listen to what I have to say! You knew Jesus of the town of Nazareth by the powerful works He did. God worked through Jesus while He was with you. You all know this.
44002023	Jesus was handed over to sinful men. God knew this and planned for it to happen. You had sinful men take Him and nail Him to a cross.
44002024	But God raised Him up. He allowed Him to be set free from the pain of death. Death could not hold its power over Him.
44002025	“David said this about Him, ‘I can see the Lord before me all the time. He is at my right side so that I do not need to be troubled.
44002026	I am glad and my tongue is full of joy. My body rests in hope.
44002027	You will not leave my soul in death. You will not allow Your Holy One to be destroyed.
44002028	You have shown me the ways of life. I will be full of joy when I see Your face.’ (Psalm 16)
44002029	“Brothers, I can tell you in plain words that our early father David not only died but was buried. We know where his grave is today.
44002030	He was one who spoke for God. He knew God had made a promise to him. From his family Christ would come and take His place as King.
44002031	He knew this before and spoke of Christ being raised from the dead. Christ’s soul would not be left in hell. His body would not be destroyed.
44002032	Jesus is this One! God has raised Him up and we have all seen Him.
44002033	“This Jesus has been lifted up to God’s right side. The Holy Spirit was promised by the Father. God has given Him to us. That is what you are seeing and hearing now!
44002034	It was not David who was taken up to heaven, because he said, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at My right side,
44002035	for those who hate You will be a place to rest Your feet.” ’ (Psalm 110:1)
44002036	The whole Jewish nation must know for sure that God has made this Jesus, both Lord and Christ. He is the One you nailed to a cross!”
44002037	When the Jews heard this, their hearts were troubled. They said to Peter and to the other missionaries, “Brothers, what should we do?”
44002038	Peter said to them, “Be sorry for your sins and turn from them and be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ, and your sins will be forgiven. You will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
44002039	This promise is to you and your children. It is to all people everywhere. It is to as many as the Lord our God will call.”
44002040	He said many other things. He helped them understand that they should keep themselves from the sinful people of this day.
44002041	Those who believed what he said were baptized. There were about 3,000 more followers added that day.
44002042	They were faithful in listening to the teaching of the missionaries. They worshiped and prayed and ate the Lord’s supper together.
44002043	Many powerful works were done by the missionaries. Surprise and fear came on them all.
44002044	All those who put their trust in Christ were together and shared what they owned.
44002045	As anyone had need, they sold what they owned and shared with everyone.
44002046	Day after day they went to the house of God together. In their houses they ate their food together. Their hearts were happy.
44002047	They gave thanks to God and all the people respected them. The Lord added to the group each day those who were being saved from the punishment of sin.
44003001	Peter and John were going to the house of God about three o’clock. It was the time for prayer.
44003002	Each day a certain man was carried to the Beautiful Gate of the house of God. This man had never been able to walk. He was there begging for money from those who were going in.
44003003	He asked Peter and John for money when he saw them going in.
44003004	Peter and John looked at him. Then Peter said, “Look at us!”
44003005	The man who could not walk looked at them. He thought he would get something from them.
44003006	Peter said, “I have no money, but what I have I will give you! In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!”
44003007	Peter took the man by the right hand and lifted him up. At once his feet and the bones in his legs became strong.
44003008	He jumped up on his feet and walked. Then he went into the house of God with them. He gave thanks to God as he walked.
44003009	All the people saw him walking and giving thanks to God.
44003010	They knew it was the man who had been sitting and begging at the Beautiful Gate. They were surprised he was walking.
44003011	The man who was healed held on to Peter and John. All the people who were surprised gathered together around them in a place called Solomon’s Porch.
44003012	When Peter saw this, he said to them, “Jewish men, why are you surprised at this? Why do you look at us as if we had made this man walk by our own power or holy lives?
44003013	The God of our fathers, the God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, has done this. He has honored His Son Jesus. He is the One you handed over to Pilate. You turned your backs on Him after Pilate had decided to let Him go free.
44003014	But you turned your backs against the Holy and Right One. Then you asked for a man who had killed someone to go free.
44003015	You killed the very One Who made all life. But God raised Him from the dead. We saw Him alive.
44003016	You see and know this man here. He has been made strong through faith in Jesus’ name. Yes, it is faith in Christ that has made this man well and strong. This man is standing here in front of you all.
44003017	“Brothers, I know you and your leaders did this without knowing what you were doing.
44003018	In this way, God did what He said He would do through all the early preachers. He said that Christ must suffer many hard things.
44003019	But you must be sorry for your sins and turn from them. You must turn to God and have your sins taken away. Then many times your soul will receive new strength from the Lord.
44003020	He will send Jesus back to the world. He is the Christ Who long ago was chosen for you.
44003021	But for awhile He must stay in heaven until the time when all things are made right. God said these things would happen through His holy early preachers.
44003022	“Moses said, ‘The Lord God will raise up from among your brothers One Who speaks for God, as He raised me. You must listen to everything He says.
44003023	Everyone among the people who will not listen to that One Who speaks for God will be put to death.’ (Deuteronomy 18:18–19)
44003024	All the early preachers who have spoken from Samuel until now have told of these days.
44003025	You are of the family of the early preachers and of the promise that God made with our early fathers. He said to Abraham, ‘All the families of the earth will receive God’s favor through your children.’
44003026	God has raised up His Son Jesus and has sent Him to you first to give God’s favor to each of you who will turn away from his sinful ways.”
44004001	The religious leaders and the leader of the house of God and some of the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Peter and John while they were talking to the people.
44004002	They were angry because Peter and John had been teaching the people and preaching that Jesus had been raised from the dead.
44004003	So they took them and put them in prison until the next day because it was evening.
44004004	But many of those who heard what Peter and John said put their trust in Christ. The group of followers was now about 5,000 men.
44004005	The next day the leaders of the court and the leaders of the people and the teachers of the Law came together in Jerusalem.
44004006	Annas the head religious leader was there. Caiaphas and John and Alexander were there also and all who were in the family of the head religious leader.
44004007	They put the missionaries in front of them and asked, “By what power or in whose name have you done this?”
44004008	Then Peter, having been filled with the Holy Spirit, said, “You who are leaders of the people,
44004009	are you asking us today about the good work we did to a man who needed help? Are you asking how he was healed?
44004010	You and all the Jews must know that it was by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, the One you nailed to a cross and God raised from the dead. It is through Him that this man stands in front of you well and strong.
44004011	Christ is the Stone that was put aside by you workmen. But He has become the most important Stone in the building. (Psalm 118:22)
44004012	There is no way to be saved from the punishment of sin through anyone else. For there is no other name under heaven given to men by which we can be saved.”
44004013	They were surprised and wondered how easy it was for Peter and John to speak. They could tell they were men who had not gone to school. But they knew they had been with Jesus.
44004014	They were not able to argue about what Peter and John had said because the man who had been healed was standing with them.
44004015	The religious leaders told Peter and John to leave the court so the leaders could talk together.
44004016	They said, “What should we do with these men? Everyone living in Jerusalem knows a powerful work has been done by them. We cannot say that it did not happen.
44004017	Let us tell them with strong words that they must not speak again to anyone in this name. This will keep the news from going out among the people.”
44004018	Then they called them in and told them they must not speak or teach anymore in the name of Jesus.
44004019	Peter and John said, “If it is right to listen to you more than to God, you decide about that.
44004020	For we must tell what we have seen and heard.”
44004021	After they had spoken more sharp words to them, they let them go. They could not beat them because the people were giving thanks to God for what had happened.
44004022	The man on whom this powerful work of healing had been done was more than forty years old.
44004023	As soon as the missionaries were free to go, they went back to their own group. They told them everything the religious leaders had said.
44004024	When they heard it, they all prayed to God, saying, “Lord God, You made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything that is in them.
44004025	You said through the Holy Spirit by the mouth of our father David, ‘Why are the nations so shaken up and the people planning foolish things?
44004026	The kings of the earth stood in a line ready to fight, and the leaders were all against the Lord and against His Christ.’ (Psalm 2:1–2)
44004027	You know that Herod and Pilate and the Jews and the people who are not Jews gathered together here against Jesus. He was Your Holy Son and the One You had chosen
44004028	to do everything You planned and said would happen.
44004029	And now, Lord, listen to their sharp words. Make it easy for your servants to preach Your Word with power.
44004030	May You heal and do powerful works and special things to see through the name of Jesus, Your Holy Son!”
44004031	When they had finished praying, the place where they were gathered was shaken. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit. It was easy for them to speak the Word of God.
44004032	The many followers acted and thought the same way. None of them said that any of their things were their own, but they shared all things.
44004033	The missionaries told with much power how Jesus was raised from the dead. God’s favor was on them all.
44004034	No one was in need. All who owned houses or pieces of land sold them and brought the money from what was sold.
44004035	They gave it to the missionaries. It was divided to each one as he had need.
44004036	Joseph was among them. The missionaries called him Barnabas. His name means Son of Comfort. He was from the family group of Levi and from the country of Cyprus.
44004037	He had some land which he sold and brought the money to the missionaries.
44005001	A man by the name of Ananias and his wife, Sapphira, sold some land.
44005002	He kept back part of the money for himself. His wife knew it also. The other part he took to the missionaries.
44005003	Peter said to Ananias, “Why did you let Satan fill your heart? He made you lie to the Holy Spirit. You kept back part of the money you got from your land.
44005004	Was not the land yours before you sold it? After it was sold, you could have done what you wanted to do with the money. Why did you allow your heart to do this? You have lied to God, not to men.”
44005005	When Ananias heard these words, he fell down dead. Much fear came on all those who heard what was done.
44005006	The young men got up and covered his body and carried him out and buried him.
44005007	About three hours later his wife came in. She did not know what had happened.
44005008	Peter said to her, “Tell me, did you sell the land for this amount of money?” She said, “Yes.”
44005009	Then Peter said to her, “How could you two have talked together about lying to the Holy Spirit? See! Those who buried your husband are standing at the door and they will carry you out also.”
44005010	At once she fell down at his feet and died. When the young men came in, they found that she was dead. They took her out and buried her beside her husband.
44005011	Much fear came on all the church and on all who heard it.
44005012	The missionaries did many powerful works among the people. They gathered together on Solomon’s Porch.
44005013	No one from outside their own group came in with them because they were afraid. But those outside the church had respect for the followers.
44005014	Many more men and women put their trust in Christ and were added to the group.
44005015	They brought the sick people and laid them on the streets hoping that if Peter walked by, his shadow would fall on some of them.
44005016	Many people went into Jerusalem from towns nearby. They took with them their sick people and all who were troubled with demons. All of them were healed.
44005017	The head religious leader heard this. Some of the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead also heard of the people being healed. They became very jealous.
44005018	They took hold of the missionaries and put them in prison.
44005019	An angel of the Lord opened the doors of the prison in the night and let them out. The angel said to them,
44005020	“Go, stand where you have been standing in the house of God. Keep on telling the people about this new life.”
44005021	When Peter and John heard this, they went in the house of God early in the morning and began to teach. When the head religious leader and those with him had come, they gathered the men of the court and the leaders of the Jews together. Then they sent to have the missionaries brought to them from the prison.
44005022	When the soldiers got there, they did not find them in prison. They went back and told the court.
44005023	The soldiers said, “We found the door of the prison locked and the soldiers watching the doors. When we opened the door, we found no one inside.”
44005024	When the religious leaders and the leader of the house of God heard this, they were much troubled as to what might happen.
44005025	Then someone came and told them, “The men you put in prison are now standing in the house of God and teaching the people.”
44005026	The leader of the house of God took his men and got them. They did not hurt the missionaries because they were afraid the people would throw stones at them.
44005027	They brought the missionaries in and made them stand in front of the court. The head religious leader said,
44005028	“We told you not to teach about Christ! See! You are spreading this teaching over all Jerusalem. Now you are making it look as if we are guilty of killing this Man.”
44005029	Then Peter and the missionaries said, “We must obey God instead of men!
44005030	The God of our early fathers raised up Jesus, the One you killed and nailed to a cross.
44005031	God raised this Man to His own right side as a leader and as the One Who saves from the punishment of sin. He makes it possible for the Jews to be sorry for their sins. Then they can turn from them and be forgiven.
44005032	We have seen these things and are telling about them. The Holy Spirit makes these things known also. God gives His Spirit to those who obey Him.”
44005033	The religious leaders became angry when they heard this. They planned to kill the missionaries.
44005034	Gamaliel was a man of the religious leaders’ court. He was a proud religious law-keeper and a teacher of the Law. He was respected by all the people. He stood up and said that the missionaries should be sent outside for a short time.
44005035	Then Gamaliel said to the court, “Jewish men, be careful what you plan to do with these men.
44005036	Remember that many years ago a man called Theudas made himself out to be someone great. He had about 400 followers. He was killed. His followers were divided and nothing came of his teaching.
44005037	After him, Judas of the country of Galilee gathered many followers. It was the time for every person to have his name written in the books of the nation. This Judas was killed also. All his followers were divided and went away.
44005038	I say to you now, stay away from these men and leave them alone. If this teaching and work is from men, it will come to nothing.
44005039	If it is from God, you will not be able to stop it. You may even find yourselves fighting against God.”
44005040	The court agreed with Gamaliel. So they called the missionaries in and beat them. They told them they must not speak in the name of Jesus. Then they were sent away.
44005041	So the missionaries went away from the court happy that they could suffer shame because of His Name.
44005042	Every day in the house of God and in the homes, they kept teaching and preaching about Jesus Christ.
44006001	In those days the group of followers was getting larger. Greek-speaking Jews in the group complained against the Jews living in the country around Jerusalem. The Greek-speaking Jews said that their women whose husbands had died were not taken care of when the food was given out each day.
44006002	So the twelve missionaries called a meeting of the many followers and said, “It is not right that we should give up preaching the Word of God to hand out food.
44006003	Brothers, choose from among you seven men who are respected and who are full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom. We will have them take care of this work.
44006004	Then we will use all of our time to pray and to teach the Word of God.”
44006005	These words pleased all of them. They chose Stephen who was a man full of faith and full of the Holy Spirit. They also chose Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas and Nicholas of Antioch who had become a Jew.
44006006	These men were taken to the missionaries. After praying, the missionaries laid their hands on them.
44006007	The Word of God spread further. The group of followers became much larger in Jerusalem. Many of the religious leaders believed in the faith of the Christians.
44006008	Stephen was a man full of faith and power. He did many great things among the people.
44006009	But some men came from their place of worship who were known as the Free people. They started to argue with Stephen. These men were from the countries of Cyrene and Alexandria and Cilicia and Asia.
44006010	Stephen spoke with wisdom and power given by the Holy Spirit. They were not able to say anything against what he said.
44006011	So they told other men to say, “We have heard him say things against Moses and God.”
44006012	In this way they got the people talking against Stephen. The leaders of the people and the teachers of the Law came and took him to the religious leaders’ court.
44006013	The people were told to lie and say, “This man keeps on talking against this place of worship and the Law of Moses.
44006014	We have heard him say, ‘Jesus of Nazareth is going to pull down this place. He is going to change what Moses taught us.’”
44006015	The men sitting in the religious leaders’ court were looking at Stephen. They all saw that his face looked like the face of an angel.
44007001	The head religious leader asked Stephen, “Are these things true?”
44007002	Stephen said, “My brothers and fathers, listen to me. The great God showed Himself to our early father Abraham while he lived in the country of Mesopotamia. This was before he moved to the country of Haran.
44007003	God said to him, ‘Leave your family and this land where you were born. Go to a land that I will show you.’
44007004	He went from the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Haran. After his father died, he came to this country where you now live.
44007005	God did not give him any land to own, not even enough to put his feet on. But He promised that the land would be his and his children’s after him. At that time he had no children.
44007006	This is what God said, ‘Your children’s children will be living in a strange land. They will live there 400 years. They will be made to work without pay and will suffer many hard things.
44007007	I will say to that nation that it is guilty for holding them and making them work without pay. After that they will go free. They will leave that country and worship Me in this place.’
44007008	“He made a promise with Abraham. It was kept by a religious act of becoming a Jew. Abraham had a son, Isaac. On the eighth day Abraham took Isaac and had this religious act done to him. Isaac was the father of Jacob. Jacob was the father of our twelve early fathers.
44007009	“The sons of Jacob sold Joseph to people from the country of Egypt because they were jealous of him. But God was with Joseph.
44007010	He helped him in all his troubles. He gave him wisdom and favor with Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. This king made Joseph leader over Egypt and over all the king’s house.
44007011	“The time came when there was no food to eat in all the land of Egypt and Canaan. The people suffered much. Our early fathers were not able to get food.
44007012	Then Jacob heard there was food in Egypt. He sent our early fathers there the first time.
44007013	“The second time they went to the country of Egypt, Joseph made himself known to his brothers. The family of Joseph became known to Pharaoh.
44007014	Joseph asked his father Jacob and all his family to come. There were seventy-five people in the family.
44007015	Jacob moved down to Egypt and died there. Our early fathers died there also.
44007016	They were brought back to the city of Shechem where they were buried. Abraham paid money for the grave from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.
44007017	“The promise God had given Abraham was about to happen. At this time many more of our people were in the country of Egypt.
44007018	Then another man became king in Egypt. He was a king who did not know Joseph.
44007019	He was hard on our people and nation. He worked against our early fathers. He made them put their babies outside so they would die.
44007020	“At that time Moses was born. He was beautiful in God’s sight. He was fed in his father’s house for three months.
44007021	Then he was put outside. Pharaoh’s daughter took him and cared for him as her own son.
44007022	Moses was taught in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. He became a powerful man in words and in the things he did.
44007023	When he was forty years old, he thought he should visit his brothers, the Jews.
44007024	He saw one of the Jews being hurt. Moses helped the Jew and killed the man from Egypt.
44007025	He thought his people would understand. He thought they knew God would let them go free by his help. But the people did not understand.
44007026	“The next day Moses came to some Jews who were fighting. He tried to get them to stop. Moses said to the Jews, ‘Sirs, you are brothers. Why do you hurt each other?’
44007027	One was beating his neighbor. He pushed Moses away and said, ‘Who made you a leader over us? Who said you could say who is guilty?
44007028	Do you want to kill me as you killed the man from Egypt yesterday?’
44007029	When Moses heard that, he went as fast as he could to the country of Midian where he was a stranger. While he was there, he became the father of two sons.
44007030	Forty years passed and Moses was near Mount Sinai where no people live. There he saw an angel in the fire of a burning bush.
44007031	He was surprised and wondered when he saw it. He went up close to see it better. Then he heard the voice of the Lord speak to him.
44007032	‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob.’ Moses shook! He was so afraid he did not look at the bush.
44007033	“Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take your shoes off your feet! The place where you are standing is holy ground.
44007034	I have seen My people suffer in the country of Egypt and I have heard their cries. I have come down to let them go free. So come now, I will send you back to Egypt.’
44007035	“The people had put Moses aside. They said, ‘Who made you a leader over us? Who said you are the one to say what is right or wrong?’ But God made this man a leader. Moses was the one who brought them out of the country of Egypt. This was done by the help of the angel who was in the burning bush.
44007036	This man led them. He did powerful works in Egypt and at the Red Sea. For forty years he led them in the desert.
44007037	“Moses said to the Jews, ‘God will give you one who speaks for Him like me from among your brothers.’
44007038	This is the man who was with the Jewish nation in the desert. The angel talked to him on Mount Sinai. Moses told it to our early fathers. He also received the living Words of God to give to us.
44007039	“Our early fathers would not listen to him. They did not obey him. In their hearts they wanted to go back to the country of Egypt.
44007040	They said to Aaron, ‘Make us gods to go before us. We do not know what has happened to this Moses who led us out of Egypt.’
44007041	“In those days they made a calf of gold. They put gifts down in front of their god in worship. They were happy with what they had made with their hands.
44007042	But God turned from them and let them worship the stars of heaven. This is written in the book of the early preachers, ‘Nation of Jews, was it to Me you gave gifts of sheep and cattle on the altar for forty years in the desert?
44007043	No, you set up the tent to worship the god of Molock and the star of your god Rompha. You made gods to worship them. I will carry you away to the other side of the country of Babylon.’ (Amos 5:25–27)
44007044	“Our early fathers had the tent to worship in. They used it in the desert. God told Moses to make it like the plan which he had seen.
44007045	This was received by our early fathers. They brought it here when they won the wars with the people who were not Jews. It was when Joshua was our leader. God made those people leave as our early fathers took the land. The tent was here until the time of David.
44007046	David pleased God and wanted to build a house for worship for the God of Jacob.
44007047	But Solomon was the one who built the house of God for Him.
44007048	But the Most High does not live in buildings made by hands. The early preacher said,
44007049	’Heaven is the place where I sit and the earth is the place where I rest My feet. What house will you build Me?’ says the Lord. ‘Or what is My place of rest?
44007050	Did not My hands make all these things?’ (Isaiah 66:1–2)
44007051	“You have hard hearts and ears that will not listen to me! You are always working against the Holy Spirit. Your early fathers did. You do too.
44007052	Which of the early preachers was not beaten and hurt by your early fathers? They killed those who told of the coming of the One Right with God. Now you have handed Him over and killed Him.
44007053	You had the Law given to you by angels. Yet you have not kept it.”
44007054	The Jews and religious leaders listened to Stephen. Then they became angry and began to grind their teeth at him.
44007055	He was filled with the Holy Spirit. As he looked up to heaven, he saw the shining-greatness of God and Jesus standing at the right side of God.
44007056	He said, “See! I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right side of God!”
44007057	They cried out with loud voices. They put their hands over their ears and they all pushed on him.
44007058	Then they took him out of the city and threw stones at him. The men who were throwing the stones laid their coats down in front of a young man named Saul.
44007059	While they threw stones at Stephen, he prayed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
44007060	After that he fell on his knees and cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” When he had said this, he died.
44008001	Saul thought it was all right that Stephen was killed. On that day people started to work very hard against the church in Jerusalem. All the followers, except the missionaries, were made to leave. They went to parts of the countries of Judea and Samaria.
44008002	Good men put Stephen in a grave. There was much sorrow because of him.
44008003	During this time Saul was making it very hard for the church. He went into every house of the followers of Jesus and took men and women and put them in prison.
44008004	Those who had been made to go to other places preached the Word as they went.
44008005	Philip went down to a city in Samaria and preached about Christ.
44008006	The people all listened to what Philip said. As they listened, they watched him do powerful works.
44008007	There were many people who had demons in their bodies. The demons cried with loud voices when they went out of the people. Many of the people could not move their bodies or arms and legs. They were all healed.
44008008	There was much joy in that city.
44008009	A man by the name of Simon had done witchcraft there. The people of Samaria were surprised at the things he did. He pretended that he was a great man.
44008010	All the people watched and listened to him. They said, “This man must be that great power of God.”
44008011	They kept running after him. For a long time he fooled them with his witchcraft.
44008012	Philip told the Good News of the holy nation of God and of Jesus Christ. Both men and women put their trust in Christ and were baptized.
44008013	Even Simon believed in Christ and was baptized. He went along with Philip everywhere. He was surprised when he saw the powerful works that were being done.
44008014	The missionaries in Jerusalem heard that the people of Samaria had received the Word of God. They sent Peter and John to them.
44008015	When Peter and John got there, they prayed that the new followers might receive the Holy Spirit.
44008016	He had not yet come on any of them. They had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
44008017	They laid their hands on them and the followers received the Holy Spirit.
44008018	When Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given when the missionaries laid their hands on the people, he wanted to give money to the missionaries.
44008019	He said, “Let me also have this power. Then I can give the Holy Spirit to anyone I lay my hands on.”
44008020	Peter said to him, “May your money be destroyed with you because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!
44008021	You have no part or place in this work. Your heart is not right in God’s sight.
44008022	You must be sorry for this sin of yours and turn from it. Pray to the Lord that He will forgive you for having such a thought in your heart.
44008023	I see that you are full of jealousy and chained by your sin.”
44008024	Simon said, “Pray to the Lord for me that nothing you have said will come to me.”
44008025	Peter and John went back to Jerusalem after telling what they had seen and heard. They had preached the Word of the Lord also. On the way they preached the Good News in many other towns in the country of Samaria.
44008026	An angel of the Lord spoke to Philip saying, “Get up and go south. Take the road that goes down from Jerusalem to the country of Gaza. It goes through the desert.”
44008027	Philip got up and went. A man from the country of Ethiopia had come to Jerusalem to worship. He had been made so he could not have children. He cared for all the riches that belonged to Candace who was Queen of Ethiopia.
44008028	As he was going back home, he was sitting in his wagon reading about the early preacher Isaiah.
44008029	The Holy Spirit said to Philip, “Go over to that wagon and get on it.”
44008030	Philip ran up to him. He saw that the man from Ethiopia was reading from the writings of the early preacher Isaiah and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”
44008031	The man from Ethiopia said, “How can I, unless someone teaches me?” Then he asked Philip to come up and sit beside him.
44008032	He was reading the part in the Holy Writings which says He was taken like a lamb to be put to death. A sheep does not make a sound while its wool is cut. So He made no sound.
44008033	No one listened to Him because of His shame. Who will tell the story of His day? For His life was taken away from the earth. (Isaiah 53:7–8)
44008034	The man from Ethiopia said to Philip, “Who is the early preacher talking about, himself, or someone else?”
44008035	So Philip started with this part of the Holy Writings and preached the Good News of Jesus to him.
44008036	As they went on their way, they came to some water. The man from Ethiopia said, “See! Here is water. What is to stop me from being baptized?”
44008037	(Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” The man said, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”)
44008038	He stopped the wagon. Then both Philip and the man from Ethiopia went down into the water and Philip baptized him.
44008039	When they came up out of the water, the Holy Spirit took Philip away. The man from Ethiopia did not see Philip again. He went on his way full of joy.
44008040	Philip found himself at the city of Azotus. Then Philip went through all the towns as far as the city of Caesarea preaching the Good News at each place.
44009001	Saul was still talking much about how he would like to kill the followers of the Lord. He went to the head religious leader.
44009002	He asked for letters to be written to the Jewish places of worship in the city of Damascus. The letters were to say that if he found any men or women following the Way of Christ he might bring them to Jerusalem in chains.
44009003	He went on his way until he came near Damascus. All at once he saw a light from heaven shining around him.
44009004	He fell to the ground. Then he heard a voice say, “Saul, Saul, why are you working so hard against Me?”
44009005	Saul answered, “Who are You, Lord?” He said, “I am Jesus, the One Whom you are working against. You hurt yourself by trying to hurt Me.”
44009006	Saul was shaken and surprised. Then he said, “What do You want me to do, Lord?” The Lord said to him, “Get up! Go into the city and you will be told what to do.”
44009007	Those with Saul were not able to say anything. They heard a voice but saw no one.
44009008	Saul got up from the ground. When he opened his eyes, he saw nothing. They took him by the hand and led him to Damascus.
44009009	He could not see for three days. During that time he did not eat or drink.
44009010	In Damascus there was a follower by the name of Ananias. The Lord showed him in a dream what He wanted him to see. He said, “Ananias!” And Ananias answered, “Yes, Lord, I am here.”
44009011	The Lord said, “Get up! Go over to Straight Street to Judas’s house and ask for a man from the city of Tarsus. His name is Saul. You will find him praying there.
44009012	Saul has seen a man called Ananias in a dream. He is to come and put his hands on Saul so he might see again.”
44009013	Ananias said, “But Lord, many people have told me about this man. He is the reason many of Your followers in Jerusalem have had to suffer much.
44009014	He came here with the right and the power from the head religious leaders to put everyone in chains who call on Your name.”
44009015	The Lord said to him, “Go! This man is the one I have chosen to carry My name among the people who are not Jews and to their kings and to Jews.
44009016	I will show him how much he will have to suffer because of Me.”
44009017	So Ananias went to that house. He put his hands on Saul and said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus has sent me to you. You saw the Lord along the road as you came here. The Lord has sent me so you might be able to see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
44009018	At once something like a covering fell from the eyes of Saul and he could see. He got up and was baptized.
44009019	After that he ate some food and received strength. For some days he stayed with the followers in Damascus.
44009020	At once Saul began to preach in the Jewish places of worship that Jesus is the Son of God.
44009021	All who heard him were surprised and wondered. They said, “This is the man who beat and killed the followers in Jerusalem. He came here to tie the followers in chains and take them to the head religious leaders.”
44009022	But Saul kept on growing in power. The Jews living in Damascus wondered about Saul’s preaching. He was proving that Jesus was the Christ.
44009023	After some days the Jews talked together and made plans how they might kill Saul.
44009024	He heard of their plans. Day and night they watched for him at the city gates to kill him.
44009025	So the followers helped him get away at night. They let him down over the wall in a basket.
44009026	When Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join the followers. But they were afraid of him. They did not believe he was a true follower of Jesus.
44009027	Then Barnabas took him to the missionaries. He told them that Saul had seen the Lord on the road. He told them also how the Lord had spoken to Saul and how he had preached without fear in Damascus in the name of Jesus.
44009028	After that he was with them going in and out of Jerusalem.
44009029	He preached without fear in the name of the Lord. He talked and argued with the Jews who spoke the Greek language. They kept trying to kill him.
44009030	When the followers heard this, they took him down to the city of Caesarea. From there they sent him to the city of Tarsus.
44009031	Then the church through all the countries of Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace for awhile. The church was made strong and it was given comfort by the Holy Spirit. It honored the Lord. More people were added to the church.
44009032	When Peter was visiting all parts of the country, he came to the faithful followers who were living in the city of Lydda.
44009033	A man there named Aeneas could not move his body. He had been in bed eight years.
44009034	Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and roll up your bed.” He got up at once.
44009035	All the people who lived in Lydda and in the city of Sharon saw Aeneas and they turned to the Lord.
44009036	A woman who was a follower lived in the city of Joppa. Her name was Tabitha, or Dorcas. She did many good things and many acts of kindness.
44009037	One day she became sick and died. After they had washed her body, they laid her in a room on the second floor.
44009038	The city of Lydda was near Joppa. The followers heard that Peter was at Lydda and sent two men to ask him to come at once.
44009039	Peter went back with them. When he came, they took him to the room. All the women whose husbands had died were standing around crying. They were showing the clothes Dorcas had made while she was with them.
44009040	Peter made them all leave the room. Then he got down on his knees and prayed. He turned to her body and said, “Tabitha, get up!” She opened her eyes and looked at Peter and sat up.
44009041	He took her by the hand and lifted her up. Then he called in the faithful followers and the women whose husbands had died. He gave her to them, a living person.
44009042	News of this went through all Joppa. Many people put their trust in the Lord.
44009043	After this, Peter stayed in Joppa many days in the house of Simon who worked with leather.
44010001	There was a man in the city of Caesarea by the name of Cornelius. He was a captain of an Italian group of the army.
44010002	He and his family were good people and honored God. He gave much money to the people and prayed always to God.
44010003	One afternoon about three o’clock he saw in a dream what God wanted him to see. An angel of God came to him and said, “Cornelius.”
44010004	He was afraid as he looked at the angel. He said, “What is it, Lord?” The angel said, “Your prayers and your gifts of money have gone up to God. He has remembered them.
44010005	Send some men to the city of Joppa and ask Simon Peter to come here.
44010006	He is living with Simon, the man who works with leather. His house is by the sea-shore. He will tell you what you must do.”
44010007	The angel left him. Then Cornelius called two of his servants and a religious soldier who took care of him.
44010008	He told what had happened. Then he sent them to Joppa.
44010009	The next day they went on their way. About noon they were coming near the town. At this time Peter went up on the roof to pray.
44010010	He became very hungry and wanted something to eat. While they were getting food ready to eat, he saw in a dream things God wanted him to see.
44010011	He saw heaven open up and something like a large linen cloth being let down to earth by the four corners.
44010012	On the cloth were all kinds of four-footed animals and snakes of the earth and birds of the sky.
44010013	A voice came to him, “Get up, Peter, kill something and eat it.”
44010014	Peter said, “No, Lord! I have never eaten anything that our Law says is unclean.”
44010015	The voice said the second time, “What God has made clean you must not say is unclean.”
44010016	This happened three times. Then it was taken back to heaven.
44010017	Peter thought about the meaning of the dream. The men that Cornelius had sent came. They were standing by the gate asking about Simon’s house.
44010018	They called to ask if Simon Peter was staying there.
44010019	Peter was still thinking about the dream when the Holy Spirit said to him, “See, three men are looking for you.
44010020	Get up. Go down and go with them. Do not doubt if you should go, because I sent them.”
44010021	Peter went down to the men who had been sent by Cornelius. He said, “I am the one you are looking for. Why have you come?”
44010022	They said, “Cornelius sent us. He is a captain and a good man and he honors God. The whole Jewish nation can say this is true. An angel from God told him to send for you. He asks you to come to his house. He wants to hear what you have to say.”
44010023	Peter asked them to come in and stay with him for the night. The next day he went with them. Some of the brothers from Joppa went along.
44010024	The next day they came to Caesarea. Cornelius was looking for them. He had gathered all his family and close friends at his house.
44010025	When Peter came, Cornelius got down at his feet and worshiped him.
44010026	But Peter raised him up and said, “Get up! I am just a man like you.”
44010027	As Peter spoke with Cornelius, he went into the house and found a large group of people gathered together.
44010028	Peter said to them, “You know it is against our Law for a Jew to visit a person of another nation. But God has shown me I should not say that any man is unclean.
44010029	For this reason I came as soon as you sent for me. But I want to ask you why you sent for me?”
44010030	Cornelius said, “Four days ago at three o’clock in the afternoon I was praying here in my house. All at once, I saw a man standing in front of me. He had on bright clothes.
44010031	He said to me, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayers and has remembered your gifts of love.
44010032	You must send to Joppa and ask Simon Peter to come here. He is staying at the house of Simon, the man who works with leather. His house is by the sea-shore.’
44010033	I sent for you at once. You have done well to come. We are all here and God is with us. We are ready to hear whatever the Lord has told you to say.”
44010034	Then Peter said, “I can see, for sure, that God does not respect one person more than another.
44010035	He is pleased with any man in any nation who honors Him and does what is right.
44010036	He has sent His Word to the Jews. He told them the Good News of peace through Jesus Christ. Jesus is Lord of All.
44010037	You know the story yourselves. It was told in all the country of Judea. It began in the country of Galilee after the preaching of John the Baptist.
44010038	God gave Jesus of Nazareth the Holy Spirit and power. He went around doing good and healing all who were troubled by the devil because God was with Him.
44010039	We have seen and heard everything He did in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem. And yet they killed Him by nailing Him to a cross.
44010040	God raised Him to life on the third day and made Him to be seen.
44010041	Not all the people saw Him but those who were chosen to see Him. We saw Him. We ate and drank with Him after He was raised from the dead.
44010042	He told us to preach to the people and tell them that God gave Christ the right to be the One Who says who is guilty of the living and the dead.
44010043	All the early preachers spoke of this. Everyone who puts his trust in Christ will have his sins forgiven through His name.”
44010044	While Peter was speaking, the Holy Spirit came on all who were hearing his words.
44010045	The Jewish followers who had come along with Peter were surprised and wondered because the gift of the Holy Spirit was also given to the people who were not Jews.
44010046	They heard them speak in special sounds and give thanks to God. Then Peter said,
44010047	“Will anyone say that these people may not be baptized? They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have.”
44010048	He gave the word that they should be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then they asked Peter to stay with them for some days.
44011001	The missionaries and followers who were in the country of Judea heard that the people who were not Jews also had received the Word of God.
44011002	When Peter went up to Jerusalem, the Jewish followers argued with him.
44011003	They said, “Why did you visit those people who are not Jews and eat with them?”
44011004	Then Peter began to tell all that had happened from the beginning to the end. He said,
44011005	“While I was praying in the city of Joppa, I saw in a dream something coming down from heaven. It was like a large linen cloth let down by the four corners until it came to me.
44011006	As I looked at it, I saw four-footed animals and snakes of the earth and birds of the sky.
44011007	I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter, kill something and eat it.’
44011008	But I said, ‘No, Lord! Nothing that is unclean has ever gone into my mouth.’
44011009	The voice from heaven said the second time, ‘What God has made clean you must not say is unclean.’
44011010	This happened three times and then it was taken up again to heaven.
44011011	“Three men had already come to the house where I was staying. They had been sent to me from the city of Caesarea.
44011012	The Holy Spirit told me to go with them and not doubt about going. These six men also went with me to this man’s house.
44011013	He told us how he had seen an angel in his own home. The angel had stood in front of him and said, ‘Send men to Joppa to ask for Simon Peter.
44011014	He will tell you and all your family how you can be saved from the punishment of sin.’
44011015	“As I began to talk to them, the Holy Spirit came down on them just as He did on us at the beginning.
44011016	Then I remembered the Lord had said, ‘John baptized with water but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
44011017	If God gave to them the same gift He gave to us after we put our trust in the Lord Jesus Christ, how could I stand against God?”
44011018	When they heard these words, they said nothing more. They thanked God, saying, “Then God has given life also to the people who are not Jews. They have this new life by being sorry for their sins and turning from them.”
44011019	Those who went different places because of the trouble that started over Stephen had gone as far as the cities of Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch. They had preached the Word, but only to the Jews.
44011020	Some of the men from Cyprus and Cyrene returned to Antioch. They preached the Good News of Jesus Christ to the Greek people there.
44011021	The Lord gave them power. Many people put their trust in the Lord and turned to Him.
44011022	The news of this came to the church in Jerusalem. They sent Barnabas to Antioch.
44011023	When he got there and saw how good God had been to them, he was full of joy. He told them to be true and faithful to the Lord.
44011024	Barnabas was a good man and full of the Holy Spirit and faith. And many people became followers of the Lord.
44011025	From there Barnabas went on to the city of Tarsus to look for Saul.
44011026	When he found Saul, he brought him back with him to Antioch. For a year they taught many people in the church. The followers were first called Christians in Antioch.
44011027	At that time some men who preached God’s Word came to Antioch and told what was going to happen. They were from Jerusalem.
44011028	One of them was Agabus. The Holy Spirit told him to stand up and speak. He told them there would be very little food to eat over all the world. This happened when Claudius was leader of the country.
44011029	The Christians agreed that each one should give what money he could to help the Christians living in Judea.
44011030	They did this and sent it to the church leaders with Barnabas and Saul.
44012001	At that time King Herod used his power to make it hard for the Christians in the church.
44012002	He killed James, the brother of John, with a sword.
44012003	When he saw that it made the Jews happy, he took hold of Peter also. This was during the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
44012004	Herod took Peter and put him in prison and had sixteen soldiers watch him. After the special religious gathering was over, he planned to bring Peter out to the people.
44012005	So Peter was held in prison. But the church kept praying to God for him.
44012006	The night before Herod was to bring him out for his trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers. He was tied with two chains. Soldiers stood by the door and watched the prison.
44012007	All at once an angel of the Lord was seen standing beside him. A light shone in the building. The angel hit Peter on the side and said, “Get up!” Then the chains fell off his hands.
44012008	The angel said, “Put on your belt and shoes!” He did. The angel said to Peter, “Put on your coat and follow me.”
44012009	Peter followed him out. He was not sure what was happening as the angel helped him. He thought it was a dream.
44012010	They passed one soldier, then another one. They came to the big iron door that leads to the city and it opened by itself and they went through. As soon as they had gone up one street, the angel left him.
44012011	As Peter began to see what was happening, he said to himself, “Now I am sure the Lord has sent His angel and has taken me out of the hands of Herod. He has taken me also from all the things the Jews wanted to do to me.”
44012012	After thinking about all this, he went to Mary’s house. She was the mother of John Mark. Many Christians were gathered there praying.
44012013	When Peter knocked at the gate, a girl named Rhoda went to see who it was.
44012014	She knew Peter’s voice, but in her joy she forgot to open the gate. She ran in and told them that Peter was standing outside the gate.
44012015	They said to her, “You are crazy.” But she said again that it was so. They kept saying, “It is his angel.”
44012016	Peter kept knocking. When they opened the gate and saw him, they were surprised and wondered about it.
44012017	He raised his hand and told them not to talk but to listen to him. He told them how the Lord had brought him out of prison. He said, “Tell all these things to James and to the other Christian brothers.” Then he went to another place.
44012018	In the morning the soldiers were very troubled about what had happened to Peter.
44012019	Herod looked for him but could not find him. He asked the soldiers who watched the prison about Peter. Herod said that the soldiers must be killed because Peter got away. Then Herod went down from the country of Judea to the city of Caesarea to stay for awhile.
44012020	Herod was very angry with the people of the cities of Tyre and Sidon. They went to him and asked for peace to be made between them and the king. They asked this because their country got food from the king’s country. The people made friends with Blastus, the king’s helper.
44012021	A day was set aside. On that day Herod put on purple clothes a king wears. He sat on his throne and spoke to the people.
44012022	They all started to speak with a loud voice, “This is the voice of a god, not of a man.”
44012023	The angel of the Lord knocked him down because he did not give honor to God. He was eaten by worms and died.
44012024	The Word of God was heard by many people and went into more places.
44012025	Saul and Barnabas went back to Jerusalem after they had finished their work. They took John Mark with them.
44013001	In the church in the city of Antioch there were preachers and teachers. They were Barnabas, Simeon Niger, Lucius of the country of Cyrene, Manaen of Herod’s family, and Saul.
44013002	While they were worshiping the Lord and eating no food so they could pray better, the Holy Spirit said, “Let Barnabas and Saul be given to Me for the work I have called them to.”
44013003	These preachers and teachers went without food during that time and prayed. Then they laid their hands on Barnabas and Saul and sent them away.
44013004	They were sent by the Holy Spirit to the city of Seleucia. From there they went by ship to the island of Cyprus.
44013005	When they went to shore at the city of Salamis, they preached the Word of God in the Jewish place of worship. John Mark was with them as their helper.
44013006	They went over Cyprus as far as the city of Paphos. While there, they found a Jew who did witchcraft. He was a false preacher named Barjesus.
44013007	Sergius Paulus was the leader of the country and a man who knew much. Barjesus was with Sergius Paulus. Sergius Paulus asked Barnabas and Saul to come to him so he might hear the Word of God.
44013008	But Elymas (as he called himself), the man who did witchcraft, worked against Barnabas and Saul. He tried to keep the leader of the country from putting his trust in the Lord.
44013009	Saul, whose other name was Paul, was full of the Holy Spirit. He looked at Elymas.
44013010	Then Saul said, “You false preacher and trouble-maker! You son of the devil! You hate what is right! Will you always be turning people from the right ways of the Lord?
44013011	And now look! The hand of the Lord is on you. You will become blind. For a time you will not be able to see the sun.” At once it became dark to Elymas, and he could not see. He asked people to take him by the hand to lead him from place to place.
44013012	The leader of the country put his trust in the Lord because he saw what had happened. He was surprised and wondered about the teaching of the Lord.
44013013	Paul and those with him went by ship from Paphos to the city of Perga in the country of Pamphylia. John Mark did not go with them but went back to Jerusalem.
44013014	From Perga they went on to the city of Antioch in the country of Pisidia. On the Day of Rest they went into the Jewish place of worship and sat down.
44013015	After the leaders had read from the Jewish Law and the writings of the early preachers, they sent to them saying, “Brothers, if you have any word of comfort and help for the people, say it now.”
44013016	Paul got up. He raised his hand and said, “Jewish men and you who honor God, listen!
44013017	The God of the Jews chose our early fathers and made them a great people during the time they lived in the land of Egypt. With a strong hand He took them out from there.
44013018	For about forty years He took care of them in the desert.
44013019	He destroyed the people of seven nations in the land of Canaan. Then He divided the land and gave it to them as their own.
44013020	For about 450 years He let them have special leaders. They had these leaders until the time of Samuel.
44013021	“Then they wanted a king. God gave them Saul who was the son of Kish from the family group of Benjamin. He was king forty years.
44013022	When God took Saul as king from them, He made David to be their king. He said, ‘David, Jesse’s son, will please My heart. He will do all I want done.’
44013023	“From this man’s family, God gave to the Jews the One Who saves from the punishment of sin as He had promised. He is Jesus.
44013024	Before Jesus came, John had preached to all the Jews that they should be baptized because they were sorry for their sins and turned from them.
44013025	When John was near the end of his work, he asked, ‘Who do you think I am? I am not the Christ. No, but He is coming later and I am not good enough to get down and help Him take off His shoes!’
44013026	“Men and brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and all of you who honor God, listen! This news of being able to be saved from the punishment of sin has been sent to you.
44013027	The people of Jerusalem and their leaders did not know Him. They did not understand the words from the early preachers. These words were read to them every Day of Rest. But they did the very thing the early preachers had said they would do by handing Him over to die.
44013028	They could find no reason that He should die, but they asked Pilate to have Him killed.
44013029	When everything was done that had been written about Him, they took Him down from the cross and laid Him in a grave.
44013030	But God raised Him from the dead.
44013031	For many days He was seen by those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem. These are the ones who tell the people about Him.
44013032	“We bring you the Good News about the promise made to our early fathers.
44013033	God has finished this for us who are their children. He did this by raising Jesus from the dead. It is written in the second Psalm, ‘You are My Son. Today I have become Your Father.’ (Psalm 2:7)
44013034	God proved that Jesus was His Son by raising Him from the dead. He will never die again. He has said, ‘I will complete the promises made to David.’ (Isaiah 55:3)
44013035	“In another Psalm He says, ‘You will not allow Your Holy One to go back to dust!’ (Psalm 16:10)
44013036	David was a good leader for the people of his day. He did what God wanted. Then he died and was put into a grave close to his father’s grave. His body went back to dust.
44013037	But God raised this One (Christ) to life. He did not go back to dust.
44013038	“Men and brothers, listen to this. You may be forgiven of your sins by this One I am telling you about.
44013039	Everyone who puts his trust in Christ will be made right with God. You will be made free from those things the Law of Moses could not make you free from.
44013040	But look out! The writings of the early preachers tell of many things that you do not want to happen to you.
44013041	‘Listen, you who doubt and laugh at the truth will die. I will do a work during your days. It will be a work that you will not believe even if someone tells you about it.’” (Habakkuk 1:5)
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas went out of the Jewish place of worship, the people asked them to talk about these things on the next Day of Rest.
44013043	The people went from the place of worship. Many Jews and others who had become Jews followed Paul and Barnabas as they talked to the Jews. They told them to keep on trusting in the loving-favor of God.
44013044	Almost all of the people of the town came to hear the Word of God on the next Day of Rest.
44013045	The Jews were filled with jealousy when they saw so many people. They spoke against the things Paul said by saying he was wrong. They also spoke against God.
44013046	Paul and Barnabas said to the people in plain words, “We must preach the Word of God to you first. But because you put it aside, you are not good enough for life that lasts forever. So we will go to the people who are not Jews.
44013047	The Lord gave us a work to do. He said, ‘You are to be a light to the people who are not Jews. You are to preach so that men over all the earth can be saved from the punishment of their sins.’ ” (Isaiah 49:6)
44013048	The people who were not Jews were glad when they heard this. They were thankful for the Word of God. Those who were chosen for life that lasts forever believed.
44013049	The Word of God was preached over all that land.
44013050	The Jews worked on the feelings of the women who were religious and respected. They worked on the leading men of the city also. They worked against Paul and Barnabas and made them leave their city.
44013051	But Paul and Barnabas shook the dust off from their feet against them and went to the city of Iconium.
44013052	The missionaries were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
44014001	In the city of Iconium, Paul and Barnabas went into the Jewish place of worship. They preached with power and many people became Christians. These people were Jews and Greeks.
44014002	But the Jews who did not want to believe worked against those who were not Jews. They made them turn against the Christians.
44014003	Paul and Barnabas stayed there a long time preaching with the strength the Lord gave. God helped them to do powerful works when they preached which showed He was with them.
44014004	The people of the city were divided. Some were on the side of the Jews. Some were on the side of the missionaries.
44014005	All the people and the leaders tried to hurt them and throw stones at them.
44014006	When Paul and Barnabas heard this, they got away and went to the cities of Lystra and Derbe in Lycaonia and to the country close by.
44014007	They stayed there and kept on preaching the Good News.
44014008	There was a man in Lystra who had never walked from the time he was born.
44014009	This man listened as Paul spoke. Paul watched him. He saw that the man believed he could be healed.
44014010	Calling to him with a loud voice, Paul said, “Stand up on your feet!” The man jumped up and walked around.
