44014011	The people saw what Paul did. They called with loud voices in the language of the people of Lycaonia, “The gods have become like men and have come down to us.”
44014012	They said that Barnabas was Jupiter. Paul was called Mercury because he spoke more than Barnabas.
44014013	The god of Jupiter was in a building near the gate leading into the city. The religious leader of that place brought cattle and flowers to the gate. He and many other people wanted to burn these as gifts in an act of worship to Paul and Barnabas.
44014014	When Paul and Barnabas heard this, they ran among the people. They tore their clothes and cried out,
44014015	“Why are you doing this? We are only men with feelings like yours. We preach the Good News that you should turn from these empty things to the living God. He made the heavens and the earth and the sea and everything in them.
44014016	Long ago He allowed all people to live the way they wanted to.
44014017	Even then God did not leave you without something to see of Him. He did good. He gave you rain from heaven and much food. He made you happy.”
44014018	Even with these words it was hard for Paul and Barnabas to keep the people from burning cattle in an act of worship to them.
44014019	By this time some Jews from the cities of Antioch and Iconium came. They turned the minds of the people against Paul and Barnabas and told them to throw stones at Paul. After they threw stones at him, they dragged him out of the city thinking he was dead.
44014020	As the Christians gathered around Paul, he got up and went back into the city. The next day he went with Barnabas to Derbe.
44014021	In that city they preached the Good News and taught many people. Then they returned to the cities of Lystra and Iconium and Antioch.
44014022	In each city they helped the Christians to be strong and true to the faith. They told them, “We must suffer many hard things to get into the holy nation of God.”
44014023	In every church they chose leaders for them. They went without food during that time so they could pray better. Paul and Barnabas prayed for the leaders, giving them over to the Lord in Whom they believed.
44014024	When they had gone through the city of Pisidia, they came to the city of Pamphylia.
44014025	Then they preached the Good News in the city of Perga. After this they went down to the city of Attalia.
44014026	From there they went by ship to Antioch where they had been given to the Lord for His work. The work of this trip was done.
44014027	When they got there, they called the church together. They told them everything God had done for them. They told how God had opened the door for the people who were not Jews to have faith.
44014028	They stayed there with the followers a long time.
44015001	Some men came down from the country of Judea and started to teach the Christians. They said, “Unless you go through the religious act of becoming a Jew as Moses taught, you cannot be saved from the punishment of sin.”
44015002	Paul and Barnabas argued with them. Then Paul and Barnabas and some other men were chosen to go up to Jerusalem. They were to talk to the missionaries and church leaders about this teaching.
44015003	The church sent them on their way. They went through the countries of Phoenicia and Samaria and told how those who were not Jews were turning to God. This made the Christians very happy.
44015004	When they got to Jerusalem, the church and the missionaries and the church leaders were glad to see them. Paul and Barnabas told them what God had done through them.
44015005	Some of the Christians there had been proud religious law-keepers. They got up and said, “Doing the religious act of becoming a Jew and keeping the Law of Moses are two things that must be done.”
44015006	The missionaries and church leaders got together to talk about this.
44015007	After a long time of much talking, Peter got up and said to them, “Brothers, you know in the early days God was pleased to use me to preach the Good News to the people who are not Jews so they might put their trust in Christ.
44015008	God knows the hearts of all men. He showed them they were to have His loving-favor by giving them the Holy Spirit the same as He gave to us.
44015009	He has made no difference between them and us. They had their hearts made clean when they put their trust in Him also.
44015010	Why do you test God by putting too heavy a load on the back of the followers? It was too heavy for our fathers or for us to carry.
44015011	We believe it is by the loving-favor of the Lord Jesus that we are saved. They are saved from the punishment of sin the same way.”
44015012	All those who were gathered together said nothing. They listened to Paul and Barnabas who told of the powerful works God had done through them among the people who are not Jews.
44015013	When they finished speaking, James said, “Brothers, listen to me.
44015014	Simon Peter has told how God first visited the people who are not Jews. He was getting a people for Himself.
44015015	This agrees with what the early preacher said,
44015016	’After this I will come back and build again the building of David that fell down. Yes, I will build it again from the stones that fell down. I will set it up again.
44015017	Then all the nations may look for the Lord, even all the people who are not Jews who are called by My name. The Lord said this. He does all these things.
44015018	God has made all His works known from the beginning of time.’ (Amos 9:11–12)
44015019	“So we should not trouble these people who are not Jews who are turning to God.
44015020	We should write to them that they should keep away from everything that is given to gods. They should keep away from sex sins and not eat blood or meat from animals that have been killed in ways against the Law.
44015021	For the Law of Moses has been read in every city from the early days. It has been read in the Jewish places of worship on every Day of Rest.”
44015022	Then the missionaries and the church leaders and the whole church chose some men from among them. They were to be sent to the city of Antioch with Paul and Barnabas. They chose Judas Barsabbas and Silas. These men were leaders among the Christians.
44015023	They sent them with this letter: “The missionaries and church leaders and Christians greet the brothers who are not Jews in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia.
44015024	We have heard that some from our group have troubled you and have put doubt in your minds. They said that you must go through the religious act of becoming a Jew and you must keep the Law of Moses. We did not tell them to say these things.
44015025	All of us have wanted to send men to you with our much-loved Paul and Barnabas.
44015026	Their lives have been in danger for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
44015027	So now we send Judas and Silas to you. They will tell you the same things.
44015028	It pleased the Holy Spirit and us to ask you to do nothing more than these things that have to be done.
44015029	You are to keep away from everything that is given to gods. Do not eat blood or meat from animals that have been killed in ways against the Law. Keep away from sex sins. If you keep yourselves free from these things you will do well. Good-bye.”
44015030	When the meeting was finished, they went to Antioch. As soon as they gathered the people together, they gave them the letter.
44015031	When they read it, they were glad for the comfort and strength it brought them.
44015032	Judas and Silas were preachers also. They preached to the Christians and helped them to become stronger in the faith.
44015033	They were there for some time. Then they were sent back in peace to the missionaries who had sent them.
44015034	But Silas thought he should stay there.
44015035	Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch. With the help of many others, they preached and taught the Word of God.
44015036	After awhile, Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us go back and visit the Christians in every city where we have preached the Word of God. Let us see how they are doing.”
44015037	Barnabas wanted to take John Mark with them.
44015038	Paul did not think it was good to take him because he had left them while they were in Pamphylia. He had not helped them in the work.
44015039	They argued so much that they left each other. Barnabas took John Mark with him and went by ship to the island of Cyprus.
44015040	Paul chose Silas. After the Christians asked for the Lord’s favor to be on Paul and Silas, they went on their way.
44015041	They went through Syria and Cilicia making the churches stronger in the faith.
44016001	Paul went down to the cities of Derbe and Lystra. There was a follower there named Timothy. His mother was a Jewish Christian and his father was a Greek.
44016002	The Christians in the city of Lystra and Iconium respected Timothy.
44016003	Paul wanted Timothy to go with him as a missionary. He took him and had Timothy go through the religious act of becoming a Jew because of the Jews who were in those places. Everyone knew his father was a Greek.
44016004	They went from city to city and told the Christians what the missionaries and the church leaders in Jerusalem had written for the Christians to do.
44016005	The churches were made stronger in the faith. More people were added each day.
44016006	They went through the countries of Phrygia and Galatia. The Holy Spirit kept them from preaching the Word of God in the countries of Asia.
44016007	When they came to the city of Mysia, they tried to go on to the city of Bithynia but the Holy Spirit would not let them go.
44016008	From Mysia they went down to the city of Troas.
44016009	That night Paul had a dream. A man was standing in front of him crying out, “Come over to the country of Macedonia and help us!”
44016010	After he had seen this, we agreed that God told us to go to Macedonia to tell them the Good News.
44016011	We took a ship from the city of Troas to the city of Samothracia. The next day we went to the city of Neapolis.
44016012	From there we went to the city of Philippi. This was an important city in Macedonia. It was ruled by the leaders of the country of Rome. We stayed here for some days.
44016013	On the Day of Rest we went outside the city to a place down by the river. We thought people would be gathering there for prayer. Some women came and we sat down and talked to them.
44016014	One of the women who listened sold purple cloth. She was from the city of Thyatira. Her name was Lydia and she was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to hear what Paul said.
44016015	When she and her family had been baptized, she said to us, “If you think I am faithful to the Lord, come and stay at my house.” She kept on asking. Then we went with her.
44016016	One day as we were going to the place to pray, we met a servant-girl who could tell what was going to happen in the future by a demon she had. Her owner made much money from her power.
44016017	She followed Paul and us crying out, “These are servants of the Highest God. They are telling you how to be saved from the punishment of sin.”
44016018	She did this many days. Paul was troubled. Then he turned and said to the demon in her, “In the name of Jesus Christ, I speak to you. Come out of her!” At once it left her.
44016019	The girl’s owners saw that they could not make money with her anymore. Then they took hold of Paul and Silas and dragged them to the leaders. This happened in the center of town where people gather.
44016020	After they brought them in front of the leaders, they said, “These men are Jews and are making a lot of trouble in our city.
44016021	They are teaching a religion that we Romans are not allowed to follow.”
44016022	Many people had gathered around Paul and Silas. They were calling out things against them. The leaders had the clothes of Paul and Silas taken off and had them beaten with sticks.
44016023	After they had hit them many times, they put Paul and Silas in prison. The soldiers told the man who watched the prison to be sure to keep them from getting away.
44016024	Because of this, they were put in the inside room of the prison and their feet were put in pieces of wood that held them.
44016025	About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing songs of thanks to God. The other men in prison were listening to them.
44016026	All at once the earth started to shake. The stones under the prison shook and the doors opened. The chains fell off from everyone.
44016027	The man who watched the prison woke up. He saw the prison doors wide open and thought the men in prison had gotten away. At once he pulled out his sword to kill himself.
44016028	But Paul called to him, “Do not hurt yourself. We are all here!”
44016029	The man who watched the prison called for a light. Then he ran in and got down in front of Paul and Silas. He was shaking with fear.
44016030	As he took them outside, he said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”
44016031	They said, “Put your trust in the Lord Jesus Christ and you and your family will be saved from the punishment of sin.”
44016032	Then Paul spoke the Word of God to him and his family.
44016033	It was late at night, but the man who watched the prison took Paul and Silas in and washed the places on their bodies where they were hurt. Right then he and his family were baptized.
44016034	He took Paul and Silas to his house and gave them food. He and all his family were full of joy for having put their trust in God.
44016035	When it was day, the leaders sent a soldier to say, “Let these men go free.”
44016036	The man who watched the prison told this to Paul. He said, “The leaders have sent word to let you go free. Come out now and go without any trouble.”
44016037	Paul said, “No! They have beaten us in front of many people without a trial. We are Roman citizens and they have put us in prison. Now do they think they can send us away without anyone knowing? No! They must come themselves and take us out.”
44016038	The soldiers told this to the leaders. Then the leaders were afraid when they heard that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens.
44016039	They went themselves and told Paul and Silas they were sorry. Then they took them out and asked them to leave their city.
44016040	Paul and Silas went to Lydia’s house after they left the prison. They met with the Christians and gave them comfort. Then they went away from the city.
44017001	After Paul and Silas had gone through the cities of Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to the city of Thessalonica. The Jews had a place of worship there.
44017002	Paul went in as he always did. They gathered together each Day of Rest for three weeks and he taught them from the Holy Writings.
44017003	He showed them that Christ had to suffer and rise again from the dead. He said, “I preach this Jesus to you. He is the Christ.”
44017004	Some of them put their trust in Christ and followed Paul and Silas. There were many Greek people and some leading women who honored God among those who had become Christians.
44017005	The Jews who did not put their trust in Christ became jealous. They took along some sinful men from the center of town where people gather and brought them out on the street. These angry men started all the people in the city to cry out with loud voices. They went to the house of Jason hoping to find Paul and Silas there and bring them out to the people.
44017006	But they did not find them there. Then they dragged Jason and some other Christians out in front of the leaders and cried out, “These men who have been making trouble over all the world have come here also.
44017007	And Jason has taken them in. They say there is another King called Jesus. They are working against the laws made by Caesar.”
44017008	When the people and city leaders heard this, they were troubled.
44017009	Then they made Jason and the others pay some money and let them go.
44017010	At once the Christians sent Paul and Silas away at night to the city of Berea. When they got there, they went to the Jewish place of worship.
44017011	These Jews were more willing to understand than those in the city of Thessalonica. They were very glad to hear the Word of God, and they looked into the Holy Writings to see if those things were true.
44017012	Many of them became Christians. Some of them were respected Greek women and men.
44017013	The Jews of Thessalonica heard that Paul was preaching the Word of God in Berea. They went there and worked against the missionaries by talking to the people.
44017014	At once the Christians sent Paul away to the sea-shore. But Silas and Timothy stayed there.
44017015	Those who took Paul brought him to the city of Athens. Paul sent word with them that Silas and Timothy should come to him as soon as they could. Then they left.
44017016	While Paul was waiting for Silas and Timothy in Athens, his spirit was troubled as he saw the whole city worshiping false gods.
44017017	He talked to the Jews and other people who were worshiping in the Jewish place of worship. Every day he talked with people who gathered in the center of town.
44017018	Some men from two different groups were arguing with Paul. The one group thought that men might as well get all the fun out of life that they can. The other group thought that wisdom alone makes men happy. Some of them said, “This man has lots of little things to talk about. They are not important. What is he trying to say?” Others said, “He preaches about strange gods.” It was because he preached of Jesus and of His being raised from the dead.
44017019	Then they took him to Mars’ Hill and said, “We want to hear of this new teaching of yours.
44017020	Some of the things you are telling us are strange to our ears. We want to know what these things mean.”
44017021	The people of Athens and those visiting from far countries used all their time in talking or hearing some new thing.
44017022	Then Paul stood up on Mars’ Hill and said, “Men of Athens, I see how very religious you are in every way.
44017023	As I was walking around and looking at the things you worship, I found an altar where you worship with the words written on it, TO THE GOD WHO IS NOT KNOWN. You are worshiping Him without knowing Him. He is the One I will tell you about.
44017024	“The God Who made the world and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth. He does not live in buildings made by hands.
44017025	No one needs to care for Him as if He needed anything. He is the One who gives life and breath and everything to everyone.
44017026	He made from one blood all nations who live on the earth. He set the times and places where they should live.
44017027	“They were to look for God. Then they might feel after Him and find Him because He is not far from each one of us.
44017028	It is in Him that we live and move and keep on living. Some of your own men have written, ‘We are God’s children.’
44017029	If we are God’s children, we should not think of Him as being like gold or silver or stone. Such gods made of gold or silver or stone are planned by men and are made by them.
44017030	“God did not remember these times when people did not know better. But now He tells all men everywhere to be sorry for their sins and to turn from them.
44017031	He has set a day when He will say in the right way if the people of the world are guilty. This will be done by Jesus Christ, the One He has chosen. God has proven this to all men by raising Jesus Christ from the dead.”
44017032	Some people laughed and made fun when they heard Paul speak of Christ being raised from the dead. Others said, “We want to listen to you again about this.”
44017033	So Paul went away from the people.
44017034	Some people followed him and became Christians. One was Dionysius, a leader in the city. A woman named Damaris believed. And there were others also.
44018001	After that Paul went from the city of Athens and came to the city of Corinth.
44018002	He met a Jew there named Aquila who was born in the country of Pontus. He had lived in the country of Italy a short time. His wife Priscilla was with him. Claudius, who was the leader of the country, had told all the Jews to leave Rome. Paul went to see Aquila and Priscilla.
44018003	They made tents for a living. Paul did the same kind of work so he stayed with them and they worked together.
44018004	Every Day of Rest he would go to the Jewish place of worship and teach both Jews and Greeks.
44018005	Silas and Timothy came down from the country of Macedonia. Then Paul used all his time preaching to the Jews. He taught that Jesus was the Christ.
44018006	But they worked against Paul and said bad things about him. He shook his clothes and said, “Whatever happens to you is your own doing. I am free from your guilt. From now on I will go to the people who are not Jews.”
44018007	Paul went from there and came to the house of a man named Titus Justus who worshiped God. His house was next to the Jewish place of worship.
44018008	Crispus was the leader of the Jewish place of worship. He and his family believed in the Lord. Many of the people of Corinth who heard Paul became Christians and were baptized.
44018009	Paul saw the Lord in a dream one night. He said to Paul, “Do not be afraid. Keep speaking. Do not close your mouth.
44018010	I am with you. No one will hurt you. I have many people in this city who belong to Me.”
44018011	For a year and a half Paul stayed there and taught them the Word of God.
44018012	Gallio was leader of the country of Greece. All the Jews worked against Paul and brought him in front of the court.
44018013	They said, “This man is trying to get people to worship God against the Law.”
44018014	Paul was ready to speak, but Gallio said to the Jews, “If this were something bad or a wrong-doing, I would listen to you.
44018015	But because it is about words and names and your own Law, you will have to take care of it yourselves. I do not want to judge who is right or wrong in things like this.”
44018016	And he sent them out of his court.
44018017	Then all the Greek people took Sosthenes, the leader of the Jewish place of worship, and beat him in front of the court. But Gallio did not let this trouble him.
44018018	Paul stayed in Corinth many days longer. Then he said good-bye and left the followers. He went by ship to the country of Syria with Priscilla and Aquila going with him. In the city of Cenchrea he had his hair cut short because of a promise he had made to God.
44018019	They came to the city of Ephesus. Priscilla and Aquila stayed there. Paul went to the Jewish place of worship and argued with the Jews.
44018020	They wanted him to stay longer but he would not.
44018021	As he left them, he said, (“I must go to the special supper at Jerusalem.) I will return again to you if God wants me to.” Then he got on a ship and left Ephesus.
44018022	He stopped in the city of Caesarea to greet the people in the church. Then he went down to the city of Antioch.
44018023	Paul stayed there for some time. Then he went from city to city through the countries of Galatia and Phrygia. In each place he helped the Christians become strong in the faith.
44018024	A Jew by the name of Apollos had come to Ephesus. He was from the city of Alexandria. He could talk to people about the Holy Writings very well.
44018025	He had been taught in the way of the Lord. And with a strong desire in his heart, he taught about Jesus. What he said was true, but he knew only about the baptism of John.
44018026	He began to speak without fear in the Jewish place of worship. Aquila and Priscilla heard him. They took him to their house and taught him much more about the things of God.
44018027	Apollos wanted to cross over to Greece. The Christians wrote a letter to the followers there asking them to be good to him. When he got there, he was much help to those who had put their trust in Christ.
44018028	In front of everyone he proved with great power that the Jews were wrong. He showed from the Holy Writings that Jesus was the Christ.
44019001	While Apollos was in the city of Corinth, Paul went through the hill country to get to the city of Ephesus. He found a few followers there.
44019002	He asked them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you put your trust in Christ?” They said, “No, we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”
44019003	He asked them, “How were you baptized?” They answered, “The way John baptized.”
44019004	Paul said, “John baptized those who were sorry for their sins and turned from them. He told the people to put their trust in Jesus Who was coming later.”
44019005	The people there were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus when they heard this.
44019006	When Paul laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them. They started to talk in special sounds and to speak God’s Word.
44019007	There were about twelve men.
44019008	For three months Paul went into the Jewish place of worship and spoke without fear. He taught them things about the holy nation of God.
44019009	Some let their hearts grow hard. They would not put their trust in Christ. These spoke against the Christian religion in front of other people. Then Paul took the followers away from the others. He taught them each day in the school of Tyrannus.
44019010	He did this for two years. All the Jews and the Greeks in the countries of Asia heard the Word of the Lord.
44019011	God used Paul to do powerful special works.
44019012	Pieces of cloth and parts of his clothes that had been next to his body were put on sick people. Then they were healed of their diseases and demons came out of them.
44019013	There were Jews who went from city to city trying to put demons out of people. Some of these tried to use the name of the Lord Jesus on those who had demons. They said, “I speak to you in the name of Jesus, the One Paul preaches about.”
44019014	A Jewish leader of the people by the name of Sceva had seven sons. These sons were trying to do this.
44019015	The demon said, “I know Jesus. I know about Paul. But who are you?”
44019016	Then the man with the demon jumped on the sons. He had power over them and beat them. They ran out of the house with no clothes on and they were hurt.
44019017	All the Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus heard about it. Because of this all the people became afraid. And the name of the Lord Jesus was held in great honor.
44019018	Many Christians came and told of the wrong things they were doing.
44019019	Many of those who did witchcraft gathered their books together and burned them in front of everyone. These books were worth 50,000 pieces of silver money.
44019020	The Word of the Lord became well-known.
44019021	After this, Paul thought he would go through the countries of Macedonia and Greece. Then he would go to Jerusalem. He said, “After I have been there, I must go to the city of Rome also.”
44019022	He sent two of his helpers, Timothy and Erastus, to Macedonia. Paul stayed in the countries of Asia awhile longer.
44019023	During that time there was much trouble about the Christians.
44019024	A man named Demetrius made small silver buildings for the worship of Diana. His workmen received much money for their work.
44019025	He called his workmen together and other men who made these small silver buildings. He said to them, “Men, you know we make much money from this work.
44019026	Now you hear that Paul has turned away many people in Ephesus as well as in Asia. He tells them that gods made with hands are not gods.
44019027	It could be that our work will not be respected. Not only that, the house of worship for the god of Diana will be worth nothing and her greatness will be destroyed. All the countries of Asia and the world worship her.”
44019028	They became angry when they heard this and cried out, “Great is Diana of Ephesus.”
44019029	The whole city was filled with loud cries. They caught Gaius and Aristarchus. These two men from Macedonia were with Paul. They gathered around them at the meeting place in the city.
44019030	Paul wanted to stand in front of all the people but his followers would not let him.
44019031	Some of the city leaders who were his friends told him not to go to the meeting.
44019032	All this time some were crying out one thing and some another. The meeting was all noise. Most of the people did not know why they had come together.
44019033	Then the Jews pushed Alexander to the front. Alexander held his hand up and was going to speak.
44019034	As soon as they saw he was a Jew, they cried out with a loud voice for two hours, “Great is Diana of Ephesus!”
44019035	One of the city leaders stopped the noise. He spoke, “Men of Ephesus, everyone knows our city is where the god of Diana is kept. That is the stone god that fell from the sky.
44019036	Everyone knows this is true, so you must not cry out or do anything foolish.
44019037	The men you brought here do not rob houses of worship or talk against our god.
44019038	If Demetrius and his workmen have something against anyone, we have special days for courts. Let them go to court.
44019039	If you want anything else, it should be done in another meeting.
44019040	We are in danger of being asked about this trouble today. There is no good reason we can give for this meeting.”
44019041	When he had said this, he told them to leave.
44020001	When the noise had come to an end, Paul called the followers to him. He spoke words of comfort and then said good-bye. He left to go to the country of Macedonia.
44020002	As he went through those parts of the country, he spoke words of comfort and help to the Christians. Then he went on to the country of Greece.
44020003	He stayed there three months. As he was about to get on a ship for the country of Syria, he learned that the Jews had made a plan to take him. He changed his plans and went back through Macedonia.
44020004	Some men were going along with him. They were Sopater of the city of Berea, Aristarchus and Secundus of the city of Thessalonica, Gaius of the city of Derbe, and Timothy and Tychicus and Trophimus of the countries of Asia.
44020005	They went on to the city of Troas and waited there for us.
44020006	After the supper of bread without yeast we got on a ship in the city of Philippi. We met these men at Troas. It took five days to get there and we stayed one week.
44020007	On the first day of the week we met together to eat the Lord’s supper. Paul talked to them. He thought he would leave the next day, so he kept on talking until twelve o’clock at night.
44020008	There were many lights in the room on the third floor where we had our meeting.
44020009	A young man named Eutychus sat in the window. As Paul kept on preaching, this man started to go to sleep. At last he went to sleep. He fell from the third floor to the ground and was picked up dead.
44020010	Paul went down and stood over him. Then he took him in his arms and said, “Do not be worried. He is alive!”
44020011	Paul went up again to the meeting and ate with them. He talked with them until the sun came up. Then he left.
44020012	They were happy they could take the young man home alive.
44020013	We went on ahead by ship to the city of Assos. There we were to pick up Paul. He had planned it that way. He wanted to walk by land that far.
44020014	We got to Assos and met him there. We picked him up and went on to the city of Mitylene.
44020015	The next day we went by ship to a place beside the island of Chios. The next day we crossed over to the island of Samos. Then the next day we came to the city of Miletus.
44020016	Paul planned to pass by the city of Ephesus so he would not lose more time in Asia. He wanted to be in Jerusalem if he could be on the day to remember how the Holy Spirit came on the church.
44020017	From Miletus he sent word to Ephesus. He asked the leaders of the church to come to him.
44020018	When they got there, he said to them, “From the first day that I came to Asia you have seen what my life has been like.
44020019	I worked for the Lord without pride. Because of the trouble the Jews gave me, I have had many tears.
44020020	I always told you everything that would be a help to you. I taught you in open meetings and from house to house.
44020021	I preached to the Jews and to the Greeks. I told them to turn from their sin to God and to put their trust in our Lord Jesus Christ.
44020022	“As you see, I am on my way to Jerusalem. The Holy Spirit makes me go. I do not know what will happen to me there.
44020023	But in every city I have been, the Holy Spirit tells me that trouble and chains will be waiting for me there.
44020024	But I am not worried about this. I do not think of my life as worth much, but I do want to finish the work the Lord Jesus gave me to do. My work is to preach the Good News of God’s loving-favor.
44020025	“All of you have heard me preach the Good News. I am sure that none of you will ever see my face again.
44020026	I tell you this day that I am clean and free from the blood of all men.
44020027	I told you all the truth about God.
44020028	Keep a careful watch over yourselves and over the church. The Holy Spirit has made you its leaders. Feed and care for the church of God. He bought it with His own blood.
44020029	“Yes, I know that when I am gone, hungry wolves will come in among you. They will try to destroy the church.
44020030	Also men from your own group will begin to teach things that are not true. They will get men to follow them.
44020031	I say again, keep watching! Remember that for three years I taught everyone of you night and day, even with tears.
44020032	“And now, my brothers, I give you over to God and to the word of His love. It is able to make you strong and to give you what you are to have, along with all those who are set apart for God.
44020033	I have not tried to get anyone’s money or clothes.
44020034	You all know that these hands worked for what I needed and for what those with me needed.
44020035	In every way I showed you that by working hard like this we can help those who are weak. We must remember what the Lord Jesus said, ‘We are more happy when we give than when we receive.’ ”
44020036	As he finished talking, he got down on his knees and prayed with them all.
44020037	They cried and put their arms around Paul and kissed him.
44020038	What made them sad most of all was he said that they would never see his face again. Then they went with him to the ship.
44021001	After we left them, we got on a ship and came straight down to the island of Cos. The next day we came to the island of Rhodes and from there to the city of Patara.
44021002	There we found a ship that was going over to the country of Phoenicia. We got on it and went along.
44021003	We saw the island of Cyprus to our left but went on to the country of Syria. We came to land at the city of Tyre. The ship was to leave its load of freight there.
44021004	We looked for the Christians and stayed with them seven days. The Christians had been told by the Holy Spirit to tell Paul not to go to Jerusalem.
44021005	When our time was up, we left there and went on our way. All of them with their wives and children went with us out of town. They got down on their knees on the shore and prayed.
44021006	After we said good-bye, we got on the ship and they went back to their houses.
44021007	The same ship took us from Tyre to the city of Ptolemais. We stayed with the Christians there one day.
44021008	The next day we left and came to the city of Caesarea. We went to the house of Philip and stayed with him. He was a preacher who goes from town to town and was one of the seven church leaders.
44021009	Philip had four daughters who were not married. They spoke the Word of God.
44021010	While we were there a few days, a man who speaks for God named Agabus came down from the country of Judea.
44021011	He came to see us. Then he took Paul’s belt and used it to tie his own feet and hands. He said, “This is what the Holy Spirit says, ‘The Jews at Jerusalem will tie the man who owns this belt. Then they will hand him over to the people who are not Jews.’ ”
44021012	When we heard this, we and all the people living there begged Paul not to go up to Jerusalem.
44021013	Then Paul said, “What do you mean by crying and breaking my heart? I am ready to be put in chains in Jerusalem. I am also ready to die for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
44021014	Paul would not listen to us. So we stopped begging him and said, “May whatever God wants be done.”
44021015	After this, we got ready and started up to Jerusalem.
44021016	Some of the followers in Caesarea went with us. They took us to Mnason’s house. He was one of the first followers from Cyprus. We stayed with him.
44021017	When we got to Jerusalem, the Christians were glad to see us.
44021018	The next day we went with Paul to see James. All the church leaders came also.
44021019	After saying hello to them, Paul told of what God had done through his work for the people who were not Jews.
44021020	When they heard this, they thanked the Lord. Then they said to him, “You see, brother, how many thousands of Christians there are among the Jews. They all obey the Law of Moses.
44021021	They have heard about you. They have heard you teach the Jews who live among people who are not Jews. They have heard you teach them to break away from the Law of Moses. They say you are telling them not to do the religious act of becoming a Jew and not to follow old religious ways of worship.
44021022	What should we do about it? They will hear that you have come.
44021023	You must do what we tell you. We have four men with us who have made a promise to God.
44021024	Take these four men and go through the religious worship of washing with them. You pay to have their hair cut off. Then everybody will know what they have heard about you is not true. They will know you are careful to obey the Law of Moses.
44021025	As for the people who are not Jews, we wrote to them. We said that they must keep away from everything that has been given to gods. They must not eat blood or meat from animals that have been killed in ways against the Law. They must keep away from sex sins.”
44021026	The next day Paul took the men. He went through the religious worship of washing with them. They went into the house of God to tell when their religious worship of washing would be finished. Then the gift for each one of them would be given as an act of worship.
44021027	The seven days were almost finished. Jews from the countries of Asia saw Paul in the house of God. They made the people turn against him. Then they took hold of him.
44021028	They cried out, “You who are Jews, help us! This is the man who is teaching against our people and our Law and this house of God. Also he has brought Greek people into the house of God. This has made this holy place unclean.”
44021029	They had seen him before in the city with Trophimus who was from the city of Ephesus. They thought Paul had brought him into the house of God also.
44021030	All the people in the city were crying out with loud voices. The people pushed and moved together. They took Paul and dragged him out of the house of God. Then the doors were shut.
44021031	They were getting ready to kill him. The captain of the soldiers heard there was trouble over all Jerusalem.
44021032	At once the captain called his soldiers and they ran down to the people. When the people saw the captain and his soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.
44021033	The captain came and took hold of Paul. He told his soldiers to tie Paul with two chains. Then he asked who he was and what he had done.
44021034	Some of the people called out one thing and some another. The captain was not able to find out what had happened. He told his men to take Paul into the soldiers’building.
44021035	The people cried out so loud and pushed so hard that Paul had to be carried up the steps by the soldiers.
44021036	All the people kept pushing and calling out, “Kill him!”
44021037	Paul was brought into the soldiers’ building. He said to the captain, “May I say something to you?” The captain said, “Can you speak the Greek language?
44021038	Are you not the man from the country of Egypt who made trouble against our country? That man led 4,000 fighting men into the desert.”
44021039	Paul said, “No! I am a Jew and a citizen of a large city. I am from Tarsus in the country of Cilicia. I ask you to let me speak to the people.”
44021040	The captain told Paul to speak. So Paul stood on the steps and held up his hand. When there was no more noise, he spoke to them in the language of the Jews.
44022001	Paul said, “Brothers and fathers, listen to what I have to say to you.”
44022002	When they heard him speak to them in their own language, they stopped making noise. Then he said,
44022003	“I am a Jew. I was born in the city of Tarsus in the country of Cilicia. When I was a young man, I lived here in Jerusalem. I went to Gamaliel’s school and learned all about the Law of our early fathers. I worked hard for God as you all do today.
44022004	“I worked hard and killed men and women who believed as I believe today. I put them in chains and sent them to prison.
44022005	The head religious leader and the leaders of the people can tell you this is true. I got letters from them to take to our Jewish brothers in the city of Damascus. I was going there to put the Christians in chains and bring them to Jerusalem where they would be beaten.
44022006	“I was near Damascus. All at once, about noon, I saw a bright light from heaven shining around me.
44022007	I fell to the ground. A voice said to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why do you work so hard against Me?’
44022008	I said, ‘Who are You, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, the One you are working against.’
44022009	Those who were with me saw the light. But they did not hear Him speaking to me.
44022010	I asked, ‘Lord, what should I do?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Get up! Go to Damascus. You will be told what to do there.’
44022011	“I could not see because of the bright light. Those who were with me had to lead me by the hand until we came to Damascus.
44022012	Ananias lived there. He obeyed the Law and was respected by all the Jews.
44022013	He came and stood near me and said, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight.’ At once I was able to see him.
44022014	Then Ananias said, ‘The God of our fathers chose you to know what He wants done. He chose you to see Jesus Christ, the One Right with God, and to hear His voice.
44022015	You are to tell all men what you have seen and heard.
44022016	What are you waiting for? Get up! Be baptized. Have your sins washed away by calling on His name.’
44022017	“I came back to Jerusalem. When I was praying in the house of God, I had a dream.
44022018	I saw Him as He said to me, ‘Get out of Jerusalem! They will not listen to you when you tell them about Me!’
44022019	I said, ‘Lord, they know I took Christians out of every Jewish place of worship. I had them beaten and put in prison.
44022020	Also when Stephen was killed, I stood there and watched them throw stones at him. Those who threw the stones had me watch their coats.’
44022021	The Lord said to me, ‘Go! I will send you far away to the people who are not Jews.’ ”
44022022	They listened to him until he said that. Then they all cried out with loud voices, “Kill him! Take such a man from the earth! He should not live!”
44022023	They kept on calling out. Then they pulled off their coats and threw dust in the air.
44022024	The captain told them to bring Paul into the soldiers’ building. He told his soldiers to find out from Paul, by beating him, why the people were crying out against him.
44022025	As they tied him up, Paul said to the soldier, “Does the law say that you can beat a Roman citizen when no one has said he is guilty?”
44022026	When the soldier heard this, he told it to the captain. He said, “Listen! What are you doing? This man is a Roman citizen.”
44022027	The captain came and asked Paul, “Tell me, are you a Roman citizen?” Paul said, “Yes!”
44022028	The captain said, “I had to pay a lot of money to be a citizen.” Paul said, “But I was born a Roman.”
44022029	Those who were going to beat him left him at once. The captain was also afraid when he heard that Paul was a Roman citizen because he had him tied.
44022030	The next day they took off the chains that were holding Paul. The captain wanted to know why the Jews wanted to kill him. So the captain told the head religious leaders to gather for their court. They brought Paul and put him in front of them.
44023001	Paul looked straight at the court and said, “Brother Jews, I have lived for God with a heart that has said I am not guilty to this day.”
44023002	Then Ananias, the head religious leader, told those standing near him to hit him on the mouth.
44023003	Paul said, “God will hit you, you white-washed wall! Do you sit there and say I am guilty by the Law when you break the Law by having me hit?”
44023004	Those standing near said, “Do you talk like that to God’s head religious leader?”
44023005	Paul said, “Brother Jews, I did not know that he was God’s head religious leader. I know the Holy Writings say, ‘You must not speak against the leader of your people.’ ” (Exodus 22:28)
44023006	Paul saw that part of the court was made up of the religious group who believe no one is raised from the dead. The other part were proud religious law-keepers. Then he cried out, “Brother Jews, I am a proud religious law-keeper and from a family of proud religious law-keepers. I have been brought in front of this court because of the hope of being raised from the dead.”
44023007	When they heard this, both religious groups started to argue and the people of the court were divided in what they thought.
44023008	The one religious group believes that no one is raised from the dead. Also, they do not believe in angels or spirits. But the other religious group, the proud religious law-keepers, believe that people are raised from the dead and that there are angels and spirits.
44023009	The court-room was filled with noise. Some of the teachers of the Law working with the proud religious law-keepers stood up and said, “We find nothing wrong with this man. What if an angel or spirit has spoken to him?”
44023010	They argued all the more. Then the captain was afraid they would pull Paul to pieces. He told his men to get Paul out of there and take him back to the soldiers’ building.
44023011	The next night the Lord came to Paul and said, “Paul, do not be afraid! You will tell about Me in the city of Rome the same as you have told about Me in Jerusalem.”
44023012	In the morning some of the Jews gathered together and made a plan to kill Paul. They promised each other that they would not eat or drink until they had killed him.
44023013	There were more than forty of them who had made this promise.
44023014	These people came to the head religious leader and to the leaders of the people and said, “We have made a promise not to eat any food until we have killed Paul.
44023015	We ask you and the court to have the captain bring Paul down to you tomorrow. It will look as if you want to ask him some things. Before he gets near you, we will be waiting to kill him.”
44023016	Paul’s nephew heard about the plan. He went to the soldiers’ building and told Paul.
44023017	Paul called one of the soldiers and said, “Take this young man to the captain. He has something to tell him.”
44023018	The soldiers brought the young man to the captain and said, “Paul asked me to bring this young man to you. He has something to tell you.”
44023019	The captain took him by the hand and they walked over where they could be alone. He said, “What is it that you have to tell me?”
44023020	The young man said, “The Jews have made a plan to ask you to bring Paul to the courtroom tomorrow. It would look as if they were going to ask him some things.
44023021	Do not let them talk you into it. More than forty men are waiting in secret to kill him. They have promised each other not to eat or drink anything until they have killed him. They are all waiting for you to say the word.”
44023022	The captain told the young man to go. He said, “Do not tell anyone you have told me this.”
44023023	Then the captain called two soldiers and said, “Get 200 men ready to go to the city of Caesarea by nine o’clock tonight. Also have seventy men ride on horses and 200 men carry spears.
44023024	Get horses ready for Paul to ride. Take him to Felix, the leader of the people.”
44023025	He wrote a letter which said,
44023026	“Claudius Lysias greets Felix, the best leader of the people.
44023027	This man Paul was taken by the Jews. He was about to be killed by them. But I came along with my soldiers and kept him from being killed. I did this when I learned that he was a Roman citizen.
44023028	I wanted to know what they had against him. So I took him to the religious leaders’ court.
44023029	I learned they were holding him because of something about their Law. There was no reason for him to be killed or to be put in prison.
44023030	I was told that the Jews had a plan to kill this man. At once I sent him to you. I told the Jews who wanted to kill him to tell you what they have against him. Good-bye.”
44023031	The soldiers took Paul as they were told. They brought him during the night to Antipatris.
44023032	The next day they went back to their building in Jerusalem. The men riding horses went on with Paul.
44023033	When they came to Caesarea, they gave the letter to the leader of the people. They also handed Paul over to him.
44023034	After he read the letter, he asked what part of the country Paul was from. He was told that Paul was from the city of Cilicia.
44023035	He said, “I will listen to all of this when the men come who want to kill you.” He had Paul kept in King Herod’s building.
44024001	Five days later Ananias came to the city of Caesarea. He was the head religious leader. Some other religious leaders and a man whose name was Tertullus came also. This man worked in courts and knew all about the laws. He told Felix what the Jews had against Paul.
44024002	They brought in Paul. Then Tertullus started to tell what the Jews had against him, saying, “Most respected Felix, because of you, we are living in peace. Wrong-doings have been made right in this nation.
44024003	In every way and in every place, we thank you for all of this.
44024004	We do not want to keep you here too long. I ask you to listen to our few words. You are known to be kind in this way.
44024005	We have found this man to be a trouble-maker among all the Jews in the world. He is a leader of a religious group called the Nazarenes.
44024006	He even tried to make the house of God unclean by taking people into it who were not Jews. But we took hold of him. (We could have said he was guilty by our Law.
44024007	But Lysias, the captain, came and took him out of our hands.
44024008	He told those who wanted to kill him to tell you what they had against him.) When you ask him about these things, you will be able to learn everything we have against him.”
44024009	The Jews agreed to what he said against Paul.
44024010	Then Felix, the leader of the people, told Paul to speak. Paul said, “I know that you have been a leader of this nation for many years. I am happy to be able to speak for myself.
44024011	Not more than twelve days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship. You can find out about this yourself.
44024012	I did not argue with anyone in the house of God or in the Jewish places of worship or in the city. I was not making trouble.
44024013	They cannot prove any of these things they say against me.
44024014	“I will say this, I worship the God of our fathers in the new Way. They say it is a false way. But I believe everything that has been written in the Law and by the early preachers.
44024015	I trust God for the same things they are looking for. I am looking for the dead to rise, both those right with God and the sinful.
44024016	I always try to live so my own heart tells me I am not guilty before God or man.
44024017	“After a few years I came to bring gifts of money to the people of my country (Jerusalem).
44024018	Some Jews from the countries of Asia found me in the house of God after I had gone through the worship of washing. There were no people around me and there was no noise or fighting.
44024019	They should be here if they have anything against me.
44024020	Or let these men tell what wrong they found in me as I stood in front of their court,
44024021	unless it was the words I cried out as I stood in front of them. I said, ‘I have been brought in front of this court because of the hope of being raised from the dead.’”
44024022	Felix knew about the Christian religion. He stopped the court, saying, “When Lysias the captain comes down, I will decide about this.”
44024023	He told the soldier to watch Paul, but to let him come and go as much as he wanted to. Paul’s friends were to be able to come and care for him.
44024024	Some days later Felix came again. His Jewish wife Drusilla was with him. He sent for Paul and heard him talk about faith in Christ Jesus.
44024025	Paul spoke about being right with God. He spoke about being the boss over our own desires. He spoke about standing before One Who will tell us if we are guilty. When Felix heard this, he became afraid and said, “Go now. I will send for you when it is a better time.”
44024026	He was hoping that Paul would give him money so he could go free. For that reason he kept sending for Paul and talking to him.
44024027	After two years Porcius Festus became leader of the people instead of Felix. Felix wanted to please the Jews so he kept Paul in prison.
44025001	Three days after Festus had become leader in the country, he went from the city of Caesarea to Jerusalem.
44025002	The head religious leaders and the leaders of the Jews told Festus what they had against Paul.
44025003	They asked Festus for a favor. They wanted Paul to be brought to Jerusalem because they had plans to kill him on the way.
44025004	Festus told them that Paul was to be kept in Caesarea and that he would be going there soon.
44025005	Festus said, “If Paul has done anything wrong, let your leaders go along with me and say what they have against him.”
44025006	After staying with them about ten days, Festus went down to Caesarea. The next day he sat in the courtroom and asked for Paul to be brought in.
44025007	Paul came into the courtroom. The Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him. They said many bad things against him. But they could not prove any of the things they said.
44025008	Paul spoke for himself, saying, “I have done nothing wrong against the Law of the Jews or against the house of God or against Caesar.”
44025009	Festus was hoping to get the respect of the Jews. He asked Paul, “Will you go to the court in Jerusalem and let me say if you are guilty or not about these things?”
44025010	Paul said, “I am standing in front of Caesar’s court where I should be told I am right or wrong. I have done no wrong to the Jews. You know that.
44025011	If I have done wrong and should die, I am not trying to keep from dying. But if these things they say against me are not true, no one can give me over to them. I ask to be taken to Caesar.”
44025012	Festus talked to the leaders of the court. Then he said to Paul, “You have asked to be taken to Caesar. You will go to him.”
44025013	After a few days, King Agrippa and his wife, Bernice, came down to Caesarea. They went to Festus to greet him.
44025014	They stayed there a few days. Festus told them about Paul. He said, “There is a man here who was left in prison by Felix.
44025015	When I was at Jerusalem, the head religious leaders and the leaders of the people told me about him and asked me to say that he is guilty.
44025016	I told them it was against the Roman law to hand over a man to be put to death before he stood face to face with those who had something against him and could speak for himself.
44025017	When they came here, I took my seat in the courtroom at once. I had the man brought in.
44025018	When the others spoke, they had nothing against him that I thought they had.
44025019	They did not agree with him about their own religion, and they argued about someone called Jesus. He had died but Paul kept saying He was alive.
44025020	I did not know what to do. Then I asked him if he would go on trial about these things at Jerusalem.
44025021	But Paul asked to go on trial in front of Caesar. I said that he should be kept in prison until he could be sent to Caesar.”
44025022	Agrippa said to Festus, “I would like to hear this man.” Festus said, “Tomorrow you will hear him.”
44025023	The next day Agrippa and Bernice came into the courtroom. They were dressed to show their greatness as king and queen. Army leaders and leading men of the city came in with them. Festus had Paul brought in.
44025024	Festus said, “King Agrippa and all of you who are here with us, you see this man. All of the Jews both here and at Jerusalem are saying that Paul should be put to death.
44025025	I have heard nothing against him that would be reason to put him to death. But he asked for a trial in front of Caesar. I have agreed to send Paul to him.
44025026	When I write to Caesar, I have nothing to say against him. For this reason, I brought him in front of you all and in front of you, King Agrippa. After we ask him questions, I may have something to write about.
44025027	It is foolish for me to send a man up for trial without writing what is against him.”
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul, “You may now speak for yourself.” Paul lifted his hand and started to talk,
44026002	“King Agrippa, the Jews have said many things against me. I am happy to be able to tell you my side of the story.
44026003	You know all about the Jewish ways and problems. So I ask you to listen to me until I have finished.
44026004	“All the Jews know about my life from the time I was a boy until now. I lived among my own people in Jerusalem.
44026005	If they would tell what they know, they would say that I lived the life of a proud religious law-keeper. I was in the group of proud religious law-keepers who tried to obey every law.
44026006	“And now I am on trial here because I trust the promise God made to our fathers.
44026007	This promise is what our twelve family groups of the Jewish nation hope to see happen. They worship God day and night. King Agrippa, it is because of this hope that they are saying things against me.
44026008	Why do you think it is hard to believe that God raises people from the dead?
44026009	“I used to think I should work hard against the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
44026010	I did that in Jerusalem. I put many of the followers in prison. The head religious leaders gave me the right and the power to do it. Then when the followers were killed, I said it was all right.
44026011	I beat them and tried to make them speak against God in all the Jewish places of worship. In my fight against them, I kept going after them even into cities in other countries.
44026012	“When I was going to Damascus to do this, I had the right and the power from the head religious leaders to make it hard for the followers.
44026013	I was on the road at noon. King Agrippa, I saw a light from heaven brighter than the sun. It was shining around me and the men with me.
44026014	We all fell to the ground. Then I heard a voice speaking to me in the Jewish language, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you working so hard against Me? You hurt yourself by trying to hurt Me.’
44026015	I said, ‘Who are You, Lord?’ And He said, ‘I am Jesus, the One you are working against.
44026016	Get up. Stand on your feet. I have chosen you to work for Me. You will tell what you have seen and you will say what I want you to say. This is the reason I have allowed you to see Me.
44026017	I will keep you safe from the Jews and from the people who are not Jews. I am sending you to these people.
44026018	You are to open their eyes. You are to turn them from darkness to light. You are to turn them from the power of Satan to the power of God. In this way, they may have their sins forgiven. They may have what is given to them, along with all those who are set apart for God by having faith in Me.’
44026019	“King Agrippa, I obeyed what I saw from heaven.
44026020	First I told what I saw to those in Damascus and then in Jerusalem. I told it through all the country of Judea. I even preached to the people who are not Jews that they should be sorry for their sins and turn from them to God. I told them they should do things to show they are sorry for their sins.
44026021	“That is why the Jews took hold of me in the house of God and tried to kill me.
44026022	God has helped me. To this day I have told these things to the people who are well-known and to those not known. I have told only what the early preachers and Moses said would happen.
44026023	It was that Christ must suffer and be the first to rise from the dead. He would give light to the Jews and to the other nations.”
44026024	As Paul was speaking for himself, Festus cried out in a loud voice, “Paul, you are crazy! All your learning keeps you from thinking right!”
44026025	Paul said, “Most respected Festus, I am not crazy. I am speaking the truth!
44026026	The king knows about all this. I am free to speak to him in plain words. Nothing I have said is new to him. These things happened where everyone saw them.
44026027	King Agrippa, do you believe the writings of the early preachers? I know that you believe them.”
44026028	Then Agrippa said to Paul, “In this short time you have almost proven to me that I should become a Christian!”
44026029	Paul said, “My prayer to God is that you and all who hear me today would be a Christian as I am, only not have these chains!”
44026030	King Agrippa and Festus and Bernice and those who sat with them got up.
44026031	As they left the courtroom, they said to each other, “This man has done nothing for which he should be kept in prison or be put to death.”
44026032	Agrippa told Festus, “This man could go free if he had not asked to be sent to Caesar.”
44027001	It was decided that we should go to the country of Italy by ship. Then they put Paul and some other men in chains. Julius, a captain of Caesar’s army, was to watch them.
44027002	We went on a ship that was from the city of Adramyttian. It was going to stop at the towns along the sea-shore of Asia. Aristarchus was with us. He was a man from the city of Thessalonica in the country of Macedonia.
44027003	The next day we stopped in the city of Sidon. Julius was kind to Paul. He let him visit friends who cared for him.
44027004	After leaving Sidon we were blown by the wind along the south side of the island of Cyprus. The wind was against us.
44027005	We crossed the sea along the countries of Cilicia and Pamphylia and got to the city of Myra in the country of Lycia.
44027006	The captain found a ship from the city of Alexandria that was going to the country of Italy. He put us on it.
44027007	For many days the ship did not move fast. It was hard to get to the city of Cnidus. The wind would not let us go on. So we went along the south shore of the island of Crete and passed the end of the island called Salome.
44027008	The wind was against us, and we did not sail very fast. Then we came to a place called Fair Havens. It was near the city of Lasea.
44027009	Much time had been lost. To keep going that late in the year would mean danger. Paul spoke with strong words,
44027010	“Sirs, it looks to me as if this ship and its freight will be lost. We are in danger of being lost also.”
44027011	The captain of the soldiers listened to what the captain of the ship said and not to what Paul said.
44027012	It was not a good place to spend the winter. Most of those on the ship wanted to go on and try to get to Phoenix. Crete was a good place to tie up the ship. They wanted to spend the winter there.
44027013	When a south wind started to blow, they thought their plan was right. They pulled up the anchor and went close to the shore of Crete.
44027014	Later a bad wind storm came down from the land. It was called a northeaster.
44027015	The ship was stopped by the wind. After awhile we gave up and let it go with the wind.
44027016	We went behind a small island called Claudia. It was hard work but we were able to make the ship’s boat safe.
44027017	They pulled it up and tied ropes around it and the ship. They were afraid of going on the Syrtis sands. So they took the sail down and let the ship go with the wind.
44027018	The storm was so bad the high waves were beating against the ship. The next day the men threw some of the freight over into the sea.
44027019	On the third day, with their own hands, they threw part of the sails and ropes into the sea.
44027020	We did not see the sun or stars for many days. A very bad storm kept beating against us. We lost all hope of being saved.
44027021	No one had eaten for a long time. Then Paul stood up and said to them, “Men, you should have listened to me and not left Crete. You would not have had this trouble and loss.
44027022	But now I want you to take hope. No one will lose his life. Only the ship will be lost.
44027023	I belong to God and I work for Him. Last night an angel of God stood by me
44027024	and said, ‘Do not be afraid, Paul. You must stand in front of Caesar. God has given you the lives of all the men on this ship.’
44027025	So take hope, men. I believe my God will do what He has told me.
44027026	But the ship will be lost on some island.”
44027027	It was now the fourteenth night. We were going with the wind on the Adriatic Sea. At midnight the sailors thought land was near.
44027028	They let down the lead weight and found the water was not very deep. After they had gone a little farther, they found there was not as much water.
44027029	They were afraid we might be thrown against the rocks on the shore. So they put out four anchors from the back of the ship. Then they waited for morning to come.
44027030	The sailors were thinking of leaving the ship. They let down a boat as if they were going to put out anchors from the front of the ship.
44027031	But Paul said to the captain and the soldiers, “These men must stay on the ship or you cannot be safe!”
44027032	Then the soldiers cut the ropes and let the boat fall into the sea.
44027033	Just before the light of day came, Paul told all of them to eat. He said, “Today is the fourteenth day you have not eaten.
44027034	You must eat. It will give you strength. Not one of you will lose a hair from your head.”
44027035	After he said this, he took some bread. He gave thanks to God in front of them all. He broke it in pieces and started to eat.
44027036	They all were comforted. Each one ate some food.
44027037	All together there were 276 of us on the ship.
44027038	After they had eaten, they threw the wheat into the sea so the ship would not be as heavy.
44027039	In the morning they could not see what land they were near. Later they could see a river. Near its mouth there was a shore of sand. They planned to run the ship onto the sand if they could.
44027040	The anchors were cut loose and left in the sea. Then they took the ropes off that were holding the rudder. When they put up the sail, the wind took the ship toward shore.
44027041	But the ship hit a place where the water was low. It was made from where two seas meet. The front of the ship did not move but the back part broke in pieces by the high waves.
44027042	The soldiers planned to kill the men in chains. They were afraid they would swim to shore and get away,
44027043	but the captain wanted to save Paul. He kept them from their plan. Calling out to those who could swim, he told them to jump into the sea and swim to shore.
44027044	The others should use wood or anything from the ship. In this way, they all got to shore without getting hurt.
44028001	After we were safe on the island, we knew that it was Malta.
44028002	The people on the island were very kind to us. It was raining and cold. They made a fire so we could get warm.
44028003	Paul had gathered some wood. As he laid it on the fire, a snake came out because of the heat. It held fast to Paul’s hand.
44028004	When the people of the island saw the snake holding to his hand, they said to each other, “This man is a killer. He was saved from the sea and yet it is not right for him to live.”
44028005	Paul shook off the snake into the fire. He was not hurt in any way.
44028006	The people waited. They thought his hand would get large and he would fall over dead. After watching for a long time, they saw nothing happen to him. Then they changed their minds and said that Paul was a god.
44028007	Publius was the head man of the island. He owned land around there. For three days he took us in and gave us everything we needed.
44028008	The father of Publius was sick with a stomach sickness. Paul went to see him. He prayed and laid his hands on him and the man was healed.
44028009	Because of this, other people of the island who were sick came to Paul and were healed.
44028010	They had great respect for us. When we got into a ship to leave, they gave us everything we needed.
44028011	We had stayed on the island three months. Then we left on a ship that had stayed there during the winter. It was from the city of Alexandria. This ship was called the Twin Brothers.
44028012	We came to Syracuse and stayed there three days.
44028013	From there we went by ship around to the city of Rhegium. After a day a south wind started to blow. On the second day we came to the city of Puteoli.
44028014	We found some Christians there, and they asked us to stay with them. We were there seven days and then went on to the city of Rome.
44028015	When the Christians heard of our coming, they came to meet us. They came as far as the town of Appius and to a place to stay called the Three Stores. When Paul saw them, he thanked God and took courage.
44028016	When we got to Rome, Paul was allowed to live where he wanted to. But a soldier was always by his side to watch him.
44028017	Three days later Paul asked the leaders of the Jews to come to him. When they had gathered together, he said, “Brothers, I have done nothing against our people or the way our early fathers lived. And yet, I was tied with chains in Jerusalem and handed over to the Romans.
44028018	I was put on trial, but they found no reason to put me to death. They would have let me go free.
44028019	But the Jews did not like this. So I had to ask to be sent to Caesar. It was not because I had anything against my people.
44028020	The reason I have asked you to come is to tell you this. It is because of the hope of the Jewish nation that I am tied in these chains.”
44028021	They said to Paul, “We have had no letters from Judea about you. No Jew who has come here has ever said anything bad about you.
44028022	We would like to hear from you what you believe. As for this new religion, all we know is that everyone is talking against it.”
44028023	They planned to meet him on a certain day. Many people came to the place where he stayed. He preached to them about the holy nation of God. He tried to get them to put their trust in Jesus Christ by preaching from the Law of Moses and from the writings of the early preachers. From morning until night he spoke to them.
44028024	Some of them believed his teaching. Others did not believe.
44028025	As they left, they did not agree with each other. Then Paul said, “The Holy Spirit spoke the truth to your early fathers through the early preacher Isaiah.
44028026	He said, ‘Go to these people and say, “You will hear and never understand, you will look and never see,
44028027	because these people have hearts that have become fat. They do not hear well with their ears. They have closed their eyes so their eyes do not see and their ears do not hear and their minds do not understand and they do not turn to Me and let Me heal them.” ’ (Isaiah 6:9–10)
44028028	“I want you to know that the Good News of God of knowing how to be saved from the punishment of sin has been sent to the people who are not Jews. And they will listen to it!”
44028029	After he had said these things, the Jews went away and argued with each other.
44028030	Paul paid money to live in a house by himself for two years. He was happy for all who came to see him.
44028031	He kept on preaching about the holy nation of God. He taught about the Lord Jesus Christ without fear. No one stopped him.
45001001	This letter is from Paul. I am a servant owned by Jesus Christ and a missionary chosen by God to preach His Good News.
45001002	The Good News was promised long ago by God’s early preachers in His Holy Writings.
45001003	It tells of His Son, our Lord Jesus Christ, Who was born as a person in the flesh through the family of King David.
45001004	The Holy Spirit proved by a powerful act that Jesus our Lord is the Son of God because He was raised from the dead.
45001005	Jesus has given us His loving-favor and has made us His missionaries. We are to preach to the people of all nations that they should obey Him and put their trust in Him.
45001006	You have been chosen to belong to Jesus Christ also.
45001007	So I write to all of you in the city of Rome. God loves you and has chosen you to be set apart for Himself. May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you His loving-favor and peace.
45001008	First of all, I keep thanking my God, through Jesus Christ, for all of you. This is because the whole world knows of your faith in Christ.
45001009	God knows how I work for Him. He knows how I preach with all my heart the Good News about His Son. He knows how I always pray for you.
45001010	I pray that I might be able to visit you, if God wants me to.
45001011	I want to see you so I can share some special gift of the Holy Spirit with you. It will make you strong.
45001012	Both of us need help. I can help make your faith strong and you can do the same for me. We need each other.
45001013	Christian brothers, many times I have wanted to visit you. Something has kept me from going until now. I have wanted to lead some of you to Christ also, as I have done in other places where they did not know God.
45001014	I must help the people who have had a chance to hear the Good News and those who have not. I must help those with much learning and those who have never learned from books.
45001015	So I want to preach the Good News to you who live in Rome also.
45001016	I am not ashamed of the Good News. It is the power of God. It is the way He saves men from the punishment of their sins if they put their trust in Him. It is for the Jew first and for all other people also.
45001017	The Good News tells us we are made right with God by faith in Him. Then, by faith we live that new life through Him. The Holy Writings say, “A man right with God lives by faith.” (Habakkuk 2:4)
45001018	We see the anger of God coming down from heaven against all the sins of men. These sinful men keep the truth from being known.
45001019	Men know about God. He has made it plain to them.
45001020	Men cannot say they do not know about God. From the beginning of the world, men could see what God is like through the things He has made. This shows His power that lasts forever. It shows that He is God.
45001021	They did know God, but they did not honor Him as God. They were not thankful to Him and thought only of foolish things. Their foolish minds became dark.
45001022	They said that they were wise, but they showed how foolish they were.
45001023	They gave honor to false gods that looked like people who can die and to birds and animals and snakes. This honor belongs to God Who can never die.
45001024	So God let them follow the desires of their sinful hearts. They did sinful things among themselves with their bodies.
45001025	They traded the truth of God for a lie. They worshiped and cared for what God made instead of worshiping the God Who made it. He is the One Who is to receive honor and thanks forever. Let it be so.
45001026	Because of this, God let them follow their sinful desires which lead to shame. Women used their bodies in ways God had not planned.
45001027	In the same way, men left the right use of women’s bodies. They did sex sins with other men. They received for themselves the punishment that was coming to them for their sin.
45001028	Because they would not keep God in their thoughts anymore, He gave them up. Their minds were sinful and they wanted only to do things they should not do.
45001029	They are full of everything that is sinful and want things that belong to others. They hate people and are jealous. They kill other people. They fight and lie. They do not like other people and talk against them.
45001030	They talk about people, and they hate God. They are filled with pride and tell of all the good they do. They think of new ways to sin. They do not obey their parents.
45001031	They are not able to understand. They do not do what they say they will do. They have no love and no loving-pity.
45001032	They know God has said that all who do such things should die. But they keep on doing these things and are happy when others do them also.
45002001	So you can say nothing because you are guilty when you say someone else is guilty. While you say someone is guilty, you are doing the same things he does.
45002002	We know that God will say those who do such things are guilty.
45002003	Do you think God will punish others for doing wrong and let you keep sinning?
45002004	Do you forget about His loving-kindness to you? Do you forget how long He is waiting for you? You know that God is kind. He is trying to get you to be sorry for your sins and turn from them.
45002005	Because you are not sorry for your sins and will not turn from them, you will be punished even more on the day of God’s anger. God will be right in saying you are guilty.
45002006	He will give to every man what he should get for the things he has done.
45002007	Those who keep on doing good and are looking for His greatness and honor will receive life that lasts forever.
45002008	Those who love only themselves and do not obey the truth, but do what is wrong, will be punished by God. His anger will be on them.
45002009	Every Jew and every person who is not a Jew who sins will suffer and have great sorrow.
45002010	But God will give His greatness and honor and peace to all those who obey the truth. Both Jews and those who are not Jews will receive this.
45002011	God does not show favor to one man more than to another.
45002012	Those who have sinned without having the Law will be lost without the Law being used. Those who have the Law and have sinned will be judged by the Law.
45002013	Just to hear the Law does not make a man right with God. The man right with God is the one who obeys the Law.
45002014	The people who are not Jews do not have the Law. When they do what the Law tells them to do, even if they do not have the Law, it shows they know what they should do.
45002015	They show that what the Law wants them to do is written in their hearts. Their own hearts tell them if they are guilty.
45002016	There will be a day when God will judge because He knows the secret thoughts of men. He will do this through Jesus Christ. This is part of the Good News I preach.
45002017	You are a Jew and think you are safe because of the Law. You tell others about how you know God.
45002018	You know what He wants you to do. You understand how the Law works. You know right from wrong.
45002019	You think you can lead a blind man. You think you can give light to those in darkness.
45002020	You think you can teach foolish people and children about God. You have in the Law the plan of truth and wisdom.
45002021	You teach others. Why do you not teach yourselves? You tell others not to steal. Do you steal?
45002022	You say that no one should do sex sins. Do you do sex sins? You hate false gods. Do you rob the houses where they are kept?
